jobTitle: Funeral Director Job in Waikato - SEEK
email: Mark Reinsfield, Location Manager, at: mreinsfield@jamesrhill.co.nz [link removed]
jobText: TXT/50650126.txt	§Funeral Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Funeral Director§§Advertiser: §InvoCare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§Funeral Director required for boutique funeral home§ §Are you great with people and do you have a positive can-do attitude?§Do you have great customer service skills that could be applied to our very unique and special industry?§Do you love your community and have great community connections?§Do you have excellent attention to detail?§Can you work proactively and productively in a small tight knit team?§ §These are the key attributes that make a great funeral director, if you have them we’d love to talk to you. We will provide full training, support and guidance to help establish you in what will be an extremely rewarding career where you will be able to make a valuable contribution to your local community.§As a Funeral Director you will support funeral operations by meeting with bereaved families to plan and arrange funerals. You will also be required to set up for funeral services at a variety of churches and chapels; drive the hearse, transfer and other vehicles; and support families throughout the arrangement process and on the funeral day. §NOTE: You will be required to work a 1 week in 5 after hours roster (this will be discussed fully during the interview process). §James R Hill Funeral Directors was established by James R. Hill in 1965 to provide a service for people in the Hamilton area. Our small but extremely dedicated team pride ourselves on being able to offer a full range of funeral services and providing personalised care which is friendly and above all sincere. Our strong reputation comes from our experienced funeral directors and support staff who are passionate and dedicated, to ensure families can have peace of mind at a very difficult time.§James R Hill Funeral Directors is an InvoCare New Zealand Ltd funeral home. InvoCare New Zealand Ltd is the largest provider of funeral services within New Zealand, with a comprehensive network of more than 20 funeral firms and associated businesses. By joining together, we are able to share professional development and industry knowledge, and set higher standards in the funeral profession nationwide.§ §Applications close on Friday 9 October and should be emailed to:§Mark Reinsfield, Location Manager, at: mreinsfield@jamesrhill.co.nz [link removed]§Our Location is: 717 Grey Street, Hamilton.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§

jobTitle: COMMUNITY FUNDRAISING COORDINATOR - 0.8FTE Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50601197.txt	§COMMUNITY FUNDRAISING COORDINATOR - 0.8FTE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§COMMUNITY FUNDRAISING COORDINATOR - 0.8FTE§§Advertiser: §Cranford Hospice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Fundraising§§§§§§COMMUNITY FUNDRAISING COORDINATOR§ §0.8FTE§ §SUMMARY§ § §New role within our small but dynamic Development & Engagement Team§ §Supportive work environment with professional development opportunities and a focus on wellness§ §Be part of a great team that supports the Hawke’s Bay community to care for those with a life limiting disease§ §THE ORGANISATION§ §Cranford Hospice Trust is focused on being leaders in specialist palliative care.  We are committed to providing person and whānau-centred care for the Hawke’s Bay community. We have an in-patient unit, community outreach services, bereavement and grief support.  The work is varied and offers the opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of patients, and their families and whānau. We have a team of around 75 paid employees and a volunteer army of around 400 across our Hastings base and the 3 retail charity shops.§ §THE OPPORTUNITY§ §Are you an enthusiastic and well-organised ‘people-person’ with proven relationship building and community engagement capabilities? Do you the ability to inspire people to support their local charity by fundraising for us?  And are you motivated by making a positive difference in the lives of people? If so, this role might be for you!§ §This role will be a key member of the Development & Engagement team that supports and delivers the organisation’s fundraising and communications strategy.  Each year the team needs to fundraise around $3 million and needs a proactive person to join them. This role will be focused on coordinating and implementing the community fundraising programme. Based in Hastings, the hospice is walking distance to the CBD with free street parking.§ §Duties include:§ § §Coordinate and implement the Community Fundraising programme, including the Annual Appeal, Trees of Remembrance, community fundraising events, collection boxes, regular giving and peer-to-peer fundraising campaigns)§ §Build relationships with and deliver presentations to community groups, schools, local businesses, volunteers and event participants§ §Supporting Cranford Hospice’s communications programme§ §Database administration and reporting§ §Role model for our values. § §Skills and experience § § §Ability to motive and inspire others§ §Experience and knowledge in fundraising or events§ §Proven ability to work under pressure and to deadlines§ §Ability to work to KPI’s and monthly fundraising targets§ §Digital literacy, preferably with knowledge in web applications and social media.§ §Flexibility to work varying hours and days to support events and functions as required  § §Organisational culture: take a look a couple of short You Tube clips to get a feel for us  § §https://youtu.be/ckigm4EZtv0§ §https://youtu.be/4-Xiuj56ZJ8§ §HOW TO APPLY§ §For an application pack please contact: §jackie.hollis@cranfordhospice.org.nz§ or phone 06-8787047 for more information.§ §Please include a current CV and cover letter detailing your skills and experience for this role. Applicants must be eligible to live and work in NZ and be able to successfully pass a Police Vetting Check.  § §Applications close: § 09 October 2020 at 4.00pm § § § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Community Connections Caseworker Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703594.txt	§Community Connections Caseworker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Connections Caseworker§§Advertiser: §Christchurch City Mission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§The Christchurch City Mission is a social service agency working with all members of the Canterbury community. People of all ages, races, religion and gender who have a need are treated with dignity and given a hand up and the help that they require.  With more than 100 full and part-time staff, plus approximately 200 volunteers, the Christchurch City Mission is a growing organisation, providing a range of essential services across the city and beyond.§ §Social Services at the Christchurch City Mission are responsive to the needs of our community, working alongside our whanau to provide and support through immediate needs, as well as providing support to enact a better future.  We provide emergency and transitional accommodation, social work, food support, financial advice, community connections, and learning and development programmes.§ §This is an exciting new opportunity to be a connector in our community.  Working alongside and collaboratively with whānau in the community, you’ll establish a framework and plan around their individual needs and goals, and will support them to achieve these goals.§ §You’ll build on your already great networks of local, regional and community services, and will have a great understanding of how they operate and the information and services that they provide.  Using this knowledge and network, you will work alongside whānau, enabling connections and facilitating access to the information and services to support them to achieve identified goals.§ §Our ideal appointee will likely have experience as a support worker, case worker, or counsellor, working alongside and supporting people who are on a journey of transition in their life.  You’ll either have, or will be working towards, qualifications in support work, mental health, or addiction.  You’ll be a superb networker and people connector, and will have sound applied knowledge of te Tiriti o Waitangi, Tikanga, and te reo Māori.  With a warm and welcoming positive personality, you’ll have safe boundaries, be solution focused, and will have boundless enthusiasm for making genuine and positive long-term change.§ §Applications close at 5pm on Friday 23 October 2020.  For further information and an application pack, please visit https://www.citymission.org.nz/who-we-are/vacancies/§§§§

jobTitle: Part-time Accommodation Worker Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701894.txt	§Part-time Accommodation Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Part-time Accommodation Worker§§Advertiser: §Christchurch City Mission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§The Christchurch City Mission provides free short-term emergency accommodation for homeless men and women and links them with medical support, social workers and accommodation assistance. § §We are seeking part-time Accommodation Workers to work in our Men's and Women’s Emergency Accommodation spaces.§ §Part-time Accommodation Workers typically have one or more permanent shifts each week/fortnight, as well as providing on-call relief for permanent staff for sick or annual leave.§ §You will take responsibility for the routine overnight functioning of either the Men’s or Women’s Emergency Accommodation space. This will include interviewing prospective clients, overseeing the evening meal preparation and clean-up and providing hospitality, support, guidance and referrals where appropriate. The service is open 365 days of the year, from 5.00pm until 8.30am.  Hours will vary, depending on staff absences with at least 8 hours guaranteed every week.  Night shifts are required.§ §Our ideal appointee would have a sense of justice and compassion, combined with the ability to be assertive and non-judgmental. This position requires someone that has demonstrated conflict resolution, behavioural management and negotiation skills. A great sense of humour and the ability to be able to relate to all walks of life is essential, as are strong connections to, and knowledge of, Christchurch’s social services.§ §To apply§, please visit:§ §https://www.citymission.org.nz/vacancies § §Applications close Friday 23 October at 5pm.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50693165.txt	§Community Support Facilitator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Support Facilitator§§Advertiser: §Progress to Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Progress to Health’s ultimate aim is to create communities without barriers by being flexible, inclusive, responsive and passionate with the services we offer.§  §Do you care about recovery-focussed mental health support for people? Then you might just be the person we are looking for.§  §Does the following make sense to you?§ § §Creating a level playing field§ §Being relationship based§ §Using the ‘lightest touch’§ §Contributing to community strengthening/manaakitanga§ §Being person driven/tino rangatiratanga§ §Everyday lives in everyday places for everyone§ §The Right Person for This Role:§ § §Has proven experience with working in the mental health support sector§ §Can develop trusting and productive relationships with people using the service§ §Takes a non-judgmental approach§ §Proactively links people to opportunities which support them to work towards and achieve their personal aspirations§ §Has experience in helping people:§ § §Improve participation in community life;§ §Develop and maintain skills and routines;§ §Increase stability of their lifestyle§ §Increase social ‘connectedness’ and sense of belonging§ §Enable self-expression in arts and creative/recreational pursuits.§ §If this is you, then you:§ § §Can demonstrate an understanding of mental health issues, stigma, discrimination and how they impact on a person’s quality of life§ §Have a positive attitude and respect toward all people§ §Understand the three principles of Te Tiriti O Waitangi§ §Are computer literate (Office 365 and a client management system)§ §Have a current driver’s license and first aid certificate§ §Have Level 4, NZ Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (Mental Health and Addictions) or equivalent and/or proven track record and willing to study.§ §By joining our team, you will find yourself working with people to ensure they have real choices, can plan their own futures with tailored tools and have the skills to navigate their own road maps to create brighter futures for themselves, their whanau and their communities.§  §Ideally, we’re looking for someone who reflects our values. Your ability to maintain confidentiality, discretion and make sound judgement calls will be a given. §  §We will provide you with a supportive, fully resourced yet flexible working environment filled with the passionate people, we proudly call our team. §  §If you have the relevant experience, a flexible approach, thrive on the responsibility of a self-managed role, have high performance standards and a great sense of humour, §please e-mail us (§admin@progresstohealth.org.nz§) in the first instance, your CV and a covering letter detailing why you are made for this role.  Applications close Friday, 16th October.§  §For more information phone Patty on 027 685 3565 or to simply find out about what makes Progress to Health such a great place to work log on to www.progresstohealth.co.nz.§  § §  §NOTE: All new appointees into Progress to Health require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this Act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Community Support Volunteer Coordinator Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
advertiser: Manawatu Prisoners Aid and Rehabilitation Society
experience: Manawatu PARS has been supporting the reintegration of ex-offenders in the community for over sixty years
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50695916.txt	§Community Support Volunteer Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Support Volunteer Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Manawatu Prisoners Aid and Rehabilitation Society§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Salary§§$21.50 hour plus carpark.§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Volunteer Coordination & Support§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Manawatu PARS has been supporting the reintegration of ex-offenders in the community for over sixty years.  Our  re-orientated service in Hawkes Bay now has a focus of providing community based social support through a team of volunteers.  Positive relationships in supportive environments can make the world of difference to someone who is trying to rebuild their life and create a different future for themselves.§ § § §About the role§ § § §Are you willing and able to recruit, support, motivate, develop and celebrate volunteers within our organization, ensuring a caring, positive environment?§ §We are looking for an enthusiastic and attentive Community Support Volunteer Coordinator to help set up and develop our expanding volunteer programme.  This is a paid position for 12 hours a week.§ §The ideal candidate will build relationships with volunteers, keeping them engaged, supported and fulfilled, while we undertake our mission together.§ §The Volunteer Coordinator is responsible for training volunteers, allocating assignments, gathering feed back and updating the client database.    They will also maintain positive relationships with probation services in the region.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Once appointed, the Community Support Volunteer Coordinator will be provided with intensive training in role.  This may require overnight stays in Palmerston North, but will be negotiated with the successful candidate. § §As this is a new role, the appointee will then be supported to recruit a small team of volunteers (6-8)  through a range of channels to build a volunteer team that they are comfortable with in terms of capability and accountability.  Manawatu PARS has a Volunteer Management Strategy which will guide the process of recruiting, inducting and maintaining volunteer involvement.§ §There are existing processes in place which will guide and support the Community Support Volunteer Coordinator, help is always at hand.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You will need to be a people-person who is passionate and caring.  You will need to be able to build relationships and engage with people from diverse cultural and social backgrounds.§ §You will need to be able to effectively allocate assignments to volunteers, gather information from volunteers on their activities and enter information into our client database.§ §You will need a comprehensive knowledge (or ability to develop one) about the range of services available in your community.§ §You will need to be able to work independently, taking responsibility and working proactively.§ §You will have an advantage if you have worked in a volunteer-centred environment previously.  You will also have an advantage if you have worked in the criminal justice sector previously.§ §This role can be office based or home based (although our office has the best views in the Bay), is for 12 hours a week and pays $21.50 an hour.§ §Please apply by sending you CV and covering letter, explaining your interest in the role.  Applications close on Monday 25th October 2020§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience working in the not-for-profit sector?§§§

jobTitle: Community Activator Job in Gisborne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665286.txt	§Community Activator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Activator§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Red Cross§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Community Activator§§We are seeking to employ a Community Activator to join our energetic Humanitarian Development team.§§About the Role§§The Community Activator will be a key local team member in supporting and growing New Zealand Red Cross humanitarian impact in the community through local partnerships and empowering members and volunteers.§Utilising a proactive community engagement approach, the Community Activator will facilitate and support communities, members and volunteers to develop and/or deliver humanitarian action that is aligned with the mission, strategic priorities and fundamental principles of New Zealand Red Cross. This is an exciting entry level role into the humanitarian sector.§§You will have responsibility for:§§Working with communities to build connectedness and resilience which will enable communities to feel more united and prepared to respond to and recover from disasters and emergencies.§ §Supporting members, volunteers and communities to take leadership in developing local solutions to local needs.§ §Empowering the wider community to become humanitarians in their own backyards to support vulnerable people in Aotearoa.§ §Inspiring young people to undertake humanitarian action.§ §Upholding best practice in child protection and promoting this with our volunteers and members action.§§You will have (some of) these strengths listed below:§§Experience in any combination of the following; volunteer management, community engagement, youth development, disaster risk management, civil defence.§ §Empathy and a strong passion for humanitarian causes.§ §A passion for working with volunteers.§ §People skills: good communication with individuals, groups and people from diverse backgrounds.§ §Relationship building skills (internally and externally).§ §Demonstrated experience of being a “self-starter”, showing initiative, creating opportunities proactively.§ §Understanding and experience of using community engagement approaches in the humanitarian field.§ §Confidence to work respectfully and effectively within multicultural contexts, and include people of all abilities, gender identities and ages.§§About New Zealand Red Cross (NZRC) and our culture:§§We have begun a journey towards delivering stronger community impact with our new 10-year strategy (Strategy 2030). This is your opportunity to contribute to long lasting positive change in New Zealand.§NZRC is a member of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement. Our work is guided by seven fundamental principles; humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality. We play a vital role in providing assistance to vulnerable people in New Zealand and overseas.§We are an organisation with 10,000+ volunteers and 500 plus staff. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce and adhere to best practice equal employment opportunity principles in all aspects of our recruitment and our ways of working.§§Benefits you can expect:§§Full training and ongoing support will be provided including ongoing professional development opportunities§ §Become part of a passionate local team of humanitarians and be supported by your colleagues (staff and volunteer members)§ §Enjoy working for a well-respected humanitarian organisation.§New Zealand Red Cross is an equal opportunities employer and values diversity. jobText: TXT/50686377.txt	§Housing Case Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Housing Case Worker§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Summary§LinkPeople works with the most vulnerable members of our communities to provide access to safe, affordable accommodation and link them to the health and social services they need to return to independent living. We’re working together with a number of key organisations as part of a community-wide approach to end homelessness in Auckland. This role is at the heart of our bold strategy, giving you the opportunity to think outside the square and create transformational opportunities for the people you support.§The Role§This is a full time role, working 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday between the hours of 8:30am and 5:00pm.§Joining a highly skilled and passionate team that shares a strong sense of social justice. The purpose of this role is to provide support to people who are at risk of losing their tenancies, and to also provide support around sourcing permanent accommodation and housing solutions. You will work alongside people and families to develop creative solutions and plans to maintain their tenancies, while advocating for their needs and aspirations. This role involves working in partnership with other government agencies, including Housing NZ and the Ministry of Social Development (MSD). You will have relevant experience in supporting people and families with high and complex needs. You will be culturally attuned, thinking outside of the square and creating opportunities for people you support.§This will involve managing the complexity associated with working with people and families with high and complex needs, often living with intergenerational challenges including poor social support, health, addictions and trauma issues as well as financial hardship.§You§We’d love to hear from registered health professionals with a range of experience in the mental health and social sectors, particularly (but not necessarily) with experience in housing and residential recovery services. Ideally you will have:§Level 4 tertiary qualification in a health or related field.§Strong communication and relationship building skills, you’ll quickly build credibility while showcasing your sound problem solving and conflict resolution skills.§An ability to work at pace and flourish under pressure will be complemented by excellent attention to detail and proficiency in record keeping.§Knowledge of and demonstrate utmost commitment to the Treaty of Waitangi principles and working with Māori.§A full New Zealand driving license is also essential. §§The Benefits§In this role, you can look forward to flexible work arrangements, extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its’ purpose. Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued, and new solutions are the norm!§If you’re keen to be part of real social change? Then apply now.§Closing Date: Monday 19th October 2020.§ PLEASE NOTE we will be shortlisting as we go, therefore, this advert may close when a suitable candidate has been found.§Position Description:§ To view a full position description, please copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/uploads/files/position-descriptions/LP_HousingcaseworkerAuckland.pdf§Contact:§ Belinda Heta, Team Lead on §09 261 3403§ if you have any questions.§For further information, visit our websites www.linkpeople.co.nz§**All new appointees require background checking. Under the requirements of the Vulnerable Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50645945.txt	§Rangatahi Mentor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Rangatahi Mentor§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§§Rangatahi Mentor§Permanent, full-time, Whakatakapokai, Auckland§About us - Mō mātou§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki§ first§We believe §Aroha§ is vital§We respect the §Mana§ of people§We are §Tika§ and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga§ is a journey§About the Residence - E pa ana ki te Kāenga§Our Youth Justice Residences provide a safe, secure and supportive environment where rangatahi in our care can make changes to get their lives back on track. Whakatakapokai is one of five Youth Justice Residences operating across Aotearoa that operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week providing residential placements and programmes for rangatahi aged 13 to 19 years who have been charged with or convicted of an offence.§Our vision at Whakatakapokai is to create a unique, culturally focused, therapeutic, safe and restorative care environment that enables rangatahi to strengthen their connection with whānau, hapū, iwi and their culture; and develop the skills to make positive decisions to support them to flourish and transform their lives, reducing the risk of reoffending.§About the role - Mō te tūnga§The purpose of this role is to deliver a care service to ensure the day to day care, wellbeing, therapeutic and cultural needs of rangatahi are assessed, planned for and addressed through the support and interventions provided to them. This will be achieved by providing mentoring and being a positive role model to rangatahi and by delivering a structured approach to ensure that interventions, programmes and plans are put in place for each rangatahi that effectively addresses needs across the wellbeing domains, offending needs and cultural needs; and effects a successful transition from the residence and a reduction in the risk of reoffending.§You will also be working with a collaborative team who is passionate about Oranga Tamariki's vision, purpose and values. You will be playing a part in building positive cultural and community connection. Whakatakapokai is strongly focused on achieving positive change in rangatahi through education, skill development, vocational programmes, and therapeutic and cultural interventions using a Māori world centric view (Te Ao Māori). Our overall goal is that rangatahi who come into our care are positively integrated back into their community and reduce the risk of reoffending with their mana restored.§The role will involve the following:§Mentoring - one on one work with rangatahi, whānau to assist them to achieve their identified goals§Regular face to face contact with rangatahi and whānau§Maintaining and building stakeholder relationships in the community§Supporting rangatahi with their educational aspirations§Keeping our rangatahi and whānau connected to their wider whānau, iwi and hapu§Flexibility to work in different workplace settings e.g. marae, school or field trips§Transporting of rangatahi and whānau to and from activities or appointments§About you - Mōu§To apply for this role, you must demonstrate the following qualifications and experience:§An undergraduate degree level qualification in psychology, education, social work, nursing (including mental health); or another related field§Twelve months minimum practice and therapeutic experience coordinating work in a multi-disciplinary setting with tamariki and rangatahi to address complex behavioural issues§A current, full, clean New Zealand driver's licence§Experience caring for or mentoring youth§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Resilience with the ability to work under pressure§Strong cultural awareness and understanding of Te Ao Māori me ona Tikanga§Ability to quickly establish relationships with stakeholders and maintain those relationships§Experience with developing appropriate programmes and initiatives that would best suit our rangatahi, whānau, stakeholders and community§The right to work in New Zealand§How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§Apply online with your CV. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Naomi.Houston@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Monday, 19 October 2020.§If you are interested in an information pack or session, please send an email to Naomi.Houston@ot.govt.nz with your name and contact details.§Vetting Hotline§Candidates applying for roles at Oranga Tamariki Ministry for Children must complete a mandatory Police check as part of the Children's Act 2014. We want to do all we can to support candidates through our recruitment process. We realise the prospect of police vetting may be daunting to candidates who have previous convictions. If you would like to have a confidential chat about our vetting process, please contact our Recruitment Vetting Hotline on 027 207 0262.§The vetting hotline will be active 11am - 1pm, Monday to Friday. If you are unavailable during these times, please leave a message and one of the advisors will call you back.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Service§§Advertiser: §Whangarei Budgeting Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§The Whangarei Budgeting Service has been empowering whanau to succeed and gain financial independence for over 30 years.  The Service currently delivers mentoring and educational services in the greater Whangarei area.   Mentoring services are delivered free to the majority of whanau through contracts with the Ministry of Social Development and a number of grants.   Educational sessions are delivered on a fee for service basis to individuals and companies in the region. §  §The WBS Team Values:§ § §Whanau§ – Protecting the whanau unit by ensuring they have money for basic essentials needed in the home.§ §Empowerment§ – Acknowledging the clients’ strengths and working with these to create positive change and encourage financial stability.§ §Education§ – We believe this is the key that empowers tangata achieve financial independence.§ §Non-Judgmental§ – Working together with empathy and providing a safe space for our clients to be open and honest.§ §The Board is seeking a dynamic person to lead the small Team of highly skilled financial mentors.   Reporting to the Board Chairperson the Manager will work closely with Social Services providers in the greater Whangarei area to make a real difference to the lives of vulnerable people in a challenging environment.§  §The position is responsible for the oversight and delivery of financial mentoring services, supervision of Financial Mentors and the reception/admin role and will also carry a small client caseload.§  §The Manager will work using a strengths based approach to drive positive outcomes for clients.   Working to the Governance Board, the role will also contribute to develop Strategic and Business plans to continue to grow the business.§  §The ideal candidate will ideally have had experience of delivering financial mentoring services and have§ § §An understanding of the obligations expected under the Treaty of Waitangi and a commitment to delivering services in a culturally safe manner;§ §Demonstrated  experience of managing a small team in a social services setting§ §Experience in working and reporting to a Governance Board§ §A relevant qualification such as being a NZ Qualified Social Worker and/or a Qualified Financial Mentor (Certificate of Competency in Budgeting level 4)§ §A commitment to ongoing learning and development§ §Excellent communication skills§ §A full driver’s license and must have full work rights in New Zealand §§§§

jobText: TXT/50624009.txt	§Māori Community Engagement Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Māori Community Engagement Officer§§Advertiser: §Malaghan Institute of Medical Research§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Fundraising§§§§§§The Malaghan Institute of Medical Research is Aotearoa New Zealand’s leading independent biomedical research institute, with a focus on breakthrough discoveries in immunology and immunotherapy. Our key areas of research and discovery include cancer, asthma and allergy, infectious diseases, gut health and brain health. Our value lies in being an independent research organisation backed by our hapori.  §  §The Institute is committed to Vision Mātauranga and supports Māori health advancement in partnership with Te Urungi Māori, our Māori advisory group. Our goal is to be a leading example for independent biomedical researchers, demonstrating how investment in understanding Māori worldviews and values will build Māori research capacity and leadership.§  §We are seeking a proactive Māori Community Engagement Officer to assist us in growing sustainable relationships with existing and potential Māori stakeholders, research organisations, community groups and iwi partnerships who have a vested interest in biomedical research. As our new Māori Community Engagement Officer you will apply your Māori perspective to initiate and nurture these relationships and effective partnerships. You will establish and prepare itineraries, reports and communications on behalf of Te Urungi. You will be responsible for sustaining our Māori Engagement Programme, initiated in 2018, to ensure that it aligns with our vision. §  §This exciting opportunity is designed for someone proficient in te Reo Māori and tikanga, with excellent written and oral communication. You will successfully apply a range of skills to connect and engage across a variety of situations and audiences.§  §This is a part-time (20 hours per week), permanent position that requires some domestic travel. Applicants will need a full driver’s licence.§  §Experience and skills§ § §Prior experience in a comparable engagement or advisory role.§ §Proven written and oral communication/presentation skills.§ §Proficiency in te Reo Māori.§ §A lived experience and deep understanding of tikanga Māori and kawa.§ §Desired traits§ § §A cooperative and friendly team member.§ §A natural communicator, networker and relationship builder.§ §Effective time management.§ §Key responsibilities§ § §Oversee interactions, presentations and hui in conjunction with our Māori Engagement Programme.§ §Provide cultural guidance and advice to the Management Team.§ §Advise on staff training and development needs, and facilitate staff training where appropriate.§ §Facilitate appropriate cultural responsiveness at local and national levels.§ §Establish a cultural standing within iwi, with Māori / iwi and community Māori service provider networks.§ §Build on and maintain relationships and activities with Capital Coast DHB Māori Advisory Group and Kia Ora Hauora Programme.§ §Attend meetings and events connected with the Institute’s Māori development and profile-raising efforts.§ §Implement and maintain a structure of KPIs, targets and other performance metrics to monitor the effectiveness of Te Urungi. § §Manage the budget for Te Urungi. § §Benefits§ § §Opportunities to contribute to ground-breaking biomedical research.§ §A supportive team culture.§ §Exposure to a unique research environment working with highly driven scientists and support staff.§ §Training and development opportunities to support you in your career with us, with potential for career progression.§ §Employee Assistance Programme – confidential, professional services which can support and guide you through your personal or work challenges.§ §An excellent location, with great offices at Victoria University in Kelburn offering a great choice of cafes and other amenities.§ §Access to a range of services from Victoria University’s Research library.§ §Base salary from $37,500 (for 0.5 FTE), negotiable depending on experience.§ §If you think you’d be a valuable addition to our Malaghan whānau, apply now by sending both your cover letter and CV to this link:§  §https://malaghannz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=45§  §Applications close §Thursday 22 October 4pm§ for a start date as soon as possible. Interviews may be held immediately should the right candidates apply, so don’t wait, apply today!§  §Applicants must have the legal right to work in New Zealand. §  §The Malaghan Institute is an equal opportunity employer, and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.§  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50648818.txt	§Counsellor, Crisis Support - (1 FTE or equivalent for 2 roles) Whakatane§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Counsellor, Crisis Support - (1 FTE or equivalent for 2 roles) Whakatane§§Advertiser: §Tautokomai Sexual Harm support§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§At Tautoko Mai Sexual Harm Support, o§ur purpose is: supporting all people and communities affected by sexual harm towards wellbeing through healing, education and prevention.§ §For the right candidate (or candidates!), this position may be divided into two separate roles, so if you are excited about this opportunity, and we think you are a good fit for our team, then we would be happy to speak with you about your hours.§ §Our Vision§ §Our Vision is a society free from sexual violence and harm. § §Purpose of this position§ §The purpose of the Crisis Counsellor role is to work directly with clients and their whanau, in collaboration with other Tautoko Mai staff and clinicians, to provide the services needed from a crisis counselling perspective.§ §The Crisis Counsellor is to provide a safe, supportive environment for each client, utilising their professional knowledge and skills to assist people who have experienced recent and/or historic sexual harm to work towards recovery. This will include: initial post trauma counselling, and crisis counselling support, and may involve consultation with relevant Tautoko Mai staff to ensure the most appropriate support for each client.§ §This role is responsible for initiating a pathway to recovery for a caseload of clients, using a collaborative approach to ensure that clients receive the appropriate support needed in order to heal.§ §Tautoko Mai Crisis Counsellors are encouraged to network inside and outside the Tautoko Mai Sexual Harm Support organisation to facilitate the most appropriate means of support for clients and their whanau.§ §Required;§ § §Sound working knowledge of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§ §Qualified Counsellor – Minimum 5 years relevant experience working with high risk, vulnerable/traumatised clients and whanau§ §Member of NZAC or equivalent§ §Strong local knowledge and networks§ §Clean and current driving licence§ §Satisfactory Police Vetting§ §If you have the required skills and experience and feel you would like to hold this position within the Tautoko Mai team, we welcome your application.  § §For a full Position Description, please request one by emailing: §admin@tautokomai.co.nz§ or phone §07 577 0512§ §**APPLICATIONS THROUGH SEEK ONLY PLEASE**§ §Applications close:§ 8.30am, Monday 19th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50679957.txt	§Advisor and Senior Advisor role in our Mai World Team§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advisor and Senior Advisor role in our Mai World Team§§Advertiser: §Office of the Children's Commissioner§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Advisor and Senior Advisor roles – Children and young people’s participation and rights§ §Do you want your mahi to make a real difference for children and young people and their whānau in Aotearoa? We have a variety of Advisor and Senior Advisor positions available that will offer flexible working options to suit your circumstances – from part to full time, with permanent and fixed-term roles available.§ §Do you have some of these key skills that you could bring to our team? § § §Experience supporting children and young people to participate and have their views heard§ §Strong understanding of child and youth development and rights§ §Knowledge and networks in child and youth engagement§ §Fluent te reo Māori spoken and written skills§ §Strong knowledge of tikanga Māori§ §Quantitative and qualitative research skills§ §Understanding of kaupapa Māori research and indigenous rights§ §IT knowledge and expertise§ §Content, resource and report design § §Strong writing and communication skills§ §Knowledge of government and community sector§ §We are recruiting for a range of skill sets and experience to join our team. The responsibilities, skills and attributes listed are desirable but not all necessary for every role. It will be a combination of people who hold some of these skills that will build the best team.§ §Our team:§ §The Children’s Commissioner has a statutory obligation to ensure “the views of children are taken into account in the exercise or performance of the Commissioner’s functions”. We support this function through our Mai World team.§ §Mai World demonstrates how children and young people can be supported to exercise their right to have a say in decisions that affect them. Enabling children’s participation in decision making upholds their right to have a say and be heard and advances their best interests and leads to better decision-making overall. § §We demonstrate best practice engagement and give advice to other agencies and groups about how they can support children and young people’s participation. We engage with children and young people in a range of ways, including surveys, interviews and group activities. We are keen to increase our online engagement.§ §The Mai World team sits within the Strategy, Rights and Advice team, and provides support and advice on children’s rights, including their right to participate and be heard.§ §Experience:§ §We are seeking skilled practitioners and professionals who have at least 2 years’ experience in relevant fields, including: Youth work, teaching, policy, psychology, social work, community work and researchers.§ § § §For more information and to submit your application for this role contact:§ §Sarah King, children@occ.org.nz§ §https://www.occ.org.nz/assets/Uploads/Senior-and-Advisor-Children-and-Young-Peoples-Participation-rights-JD.docx§ §Closing date: 18th October 5pm§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

They deserve to feel safe have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau and community.§We have an exciting new opportunity available at our Rotorua site for a permanent, full-time Kairaranga ā-whānau.§The purpose of this role is to promote and support tamariki and rangatahi to be well connected to their whānau, hapū and iwi.§This role works in collaboration with social workers and FGC coordinators to enable good decision making for the safety and wellbeing of tamariki and rangatahi by identifying key people in the wider whānau, hapū and iwi who will actively contribute to the decision making and be part of the plan.§Kairaranga ā-whānau have an important role in supporting Oranga Tamariki in meeting the requirements of section 7AA 2 (b) of the Oranga Tamariki Act.§What you will bring?§Leadership skills and the ability to be part of the site's leadership team§The ability to quickly build rapport with tamariki and rangatahi§A good and practical understanding and knowledge of te reo me ona tikanga and other cultural constructs of Te Ao Māori§The ability to positively engage with whānau and confidently facilitate the hui ā-whānau process with a focus on plans that address the needs and issues of te tamaiti§Skills in whānau search and whakapapa research§Established relationships and networks with local iwi, marae and community§Excellent communication and engagement skills§Ability to meet our pre-employment checks aligning with Children's Act 2014§A full, clean, current driver's licence§If you think you can make a difference, have what it takes and are dedicated to achieving positive change for tamariki, rangatahi and their whānau, then we want to hear from you.§What's on offer?§A positive work environment where you get to directly make a difference to the lives of tamariki and rangatahi in their community§Salary ranging from $63,884 - $89,662 (based on skills and experience)§A challenging, fascinating and rewarding career§On-going training and regular supervision§Who are we?§Oranga Tamariki put tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of everything we do and focus on improving the wellbeing and positive long-term outcomes of children and young people. The voices of children and young people underpin the design and operation of our services.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Sravani Peddibhotla on §Sravani.peddibhotla@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as applications close Wednesday, 28 October 2020.§To see more about this exciting role, check out the position description below:§http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/kairaranga-a-whanau-position-description-august-2019-002-.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50646061.txt	§Live-In Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Live-In Assistant§§Advertiser: §L'Arche Kapiti§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Salary§§$23 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§L'Arche Kapiti is searching for a new Live-in Assistant (Personal Support Worker) to start in November 2020. § §The Assistant role is a live-in role in one of the homes of the L’Arche Kapiti Community. Each Assistant is responsible to help create and foster a safe and home-like atmosphere with those with intellectual disabilities (hereafter known as “Core Members”) to live in. This Assistant works with a team of other assistants (two of whom also live in the house) and a Leadership team (based out of the office). The focus for these two teams is the well-being of Core Members and Assistants in the home, and to ensure that the home is living out the L’Arche International Mission and Identity statements to the best of its ability. In the L’Arche philosophy and tradition, people with and without intellectual disabilities share life together and support one another to lead full and complete lives. § §Essential Qualifications and Qualities:§• An appreciation for the gifts and contributions that adults with intellectual disability bring to society, and a desire and openness to learn from one another. §• Good communicator and team player§• Willingness to live and work in a unique environment§• Flexibility§• Secondary School diploma (at the very minimum); university diploma preferred§ §Recommended Qualifications: §• Prior experience living in a L’Arche community, or having close interactions with a L’Arche community§• Training and work experience as a personal support worker (ideally having a Level 3 qualification or higher in the Personal Support Work field)§• Current first aid/CPR certificate (training will be provided for those who do not have this qualification)§ §Interested Applicants: §Ensure that you are eligible to legally work in NZ (are a citizen or permanent resident). Please only apply via email. To learn more about our community check out our Instagram account, or Youtube channel @LarcheKapiti§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§

jobText: TXT/50686654.txt	§Residential Youth Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Residential Youth Worker§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Te Awe, Lower Hutt §Are you passionate in making a real and positive difference to New Zealand’s tamariki and rangatahi? We currently have an opportunity for Residential Youth Worker to join our Te Awe specialist Group Home.§Te Awe specialist Group Home is a 24 hours, seven days per week operation that provides services through a Te Ao Maori lens to New Zealand's most challenging and at risk tamariki and rangatahi. We have four beds in our whare. We work to keep our young people connected to the positive influences in their lives - mentors, whānau, work and community-based programmes.§About us - Mō mātou§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki§ first§We believe §Aroha§ is vital§We respect the §Mana§ of people§We are §Tika§ and §Pono§  §We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga §is a journey §About you - Mōu §We are looking for candidates that demonstrate the following:§A full, clean, valid driver's licence§Meet the Children's Act safety checking and our vetting requirements§A valid visa - New Zealand residency or citizenship§Resilience, initiative and a proactive approach with a positive outlook§Empathy, patience and ability to see past what someone may be struggling with§A tertiary education within psychology, social sciences, social work, sports, music, arts or teaching would be an advantage§Flexibility to work different shifts - mornings, evenings, weekends and public holidays§Experience working with rangatahi§Physically able to keep up with 10 teenagers§Sound judgement with the ability to manage risk and make tough decisions§Life experience and understanding of what rangatahi may be going through§Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to adapt to your audience§Understanding and confidence in tikanga Māori and te reo Māori would be a definite advantage§About the role - Mō te tūnga§This is a permanent, full-time position. Hours of work are on a three weekly roster and require weekend work.§Our Residential Youth Workers have an important role to play. They provide care and support to the rangatahi in our care and encourage and motivate them to make positive choices. This is a real opportunity to positively influence rangatahi, help them grow and successfully transition back into the community. §This includes: §Coaching rangatahi through our structured day and through all life necessities§Overseeing the delivery of the therapeutic model and facilitating strong relationships with specialist providers, community groups and other stakeholders§Participating in physical activity with our young people by playing sports and taking part in gym activities§Supporting our rangatahi by helping them with their studies, teaching them life skills such as cooking, art, music and cultural programmes§Building rapport with rangatahi who have experienced trauma and assist with redirecting behaviour§We offer:§a challenging, fascinating and gratifying career§on-going training and professional development§a cohesive and supportive team environment§commitment to the highest standards of strengths-based social work§discounts on Southern Cross Health insurance§access to a government banking package with Westpac - special offers and rates.§How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§Please apply online with your CV and cover letter. In your cover letter, please outline your motivation for applying and the skills and relevant experience you can bring to the role.§Only applications made online will be accepted.§For internal Oranga Tamariki employees please apply online through your MyHR careers portal at work.§If you have any questions about the role, please contact §roxana.anderson@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Sunday, 18 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50639262.txt	§Peer support specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Peer support specialist§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§ §Fixed term role available in Christchurch§24 hrs per week, Thursday to Saturday 7.00am to 3.30pm§Join us and bring your personality, commitment, compassion and great ideas!§We’re looking for someone with a good understanding and commitment to the principles of recovery. A real ‘people person’ who can engage with anyone!§ § §Summary§ Are you the Peer Support Specialist we are looking for? Someone who is passionate about helping people on their recovery journeys? Do you have your own experience of mental health and/or addictions? If so, then keep reading.§ § §We have a fixed term opportunity to provide cover for parental leave until 28 January 2021. You will be working in our Peer Acute Alternative service. This role is 24 hours per week working Thursday, Friday and Saturday from 7.00am to 3.30pm.§ § As a Peer Support Specialist, you might be kept busy supporting people with budgeting and independent daily living skills or attending appointments and advocating for people. You might be assisting people to connect with their communities. You’ll need to be prepared to do whatever it takes - cleaning, cooking, gardening, personal care or helping out with everyday household tasks.§ § §Pathways§ Transforming mental health and addictions through fostering strong, compassionate, self-supporting communities.§ § §The Team§ You’ll be reporting to the Team Coach and joining our Peer Acute Alternative Service. This is a service delivery model that provides an alternative to a hospital admission, working in a team of 24 peer support specialists - all with a common purpose to support people experiencing mental illness.§ § §You§ We are interested to hear from people who have a caring nature and work in a recovery focused way. You will be able to provide medication support for our people and have impeccable attention to detail.§ § §You’ll also have:§Applicants must hold the New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (NZCHW) or a recognised equivalent or be currently studying towards this qualification or a recognised equivalent.§You’ll have Intentional Peer Support training§A full New Zealand drivers licence§You must hold a current first aid certificate or be willing to obtain one.§You’re a great listener the sort of person who will listen deeply to the people who use our services§You’re a fresh thinker, using curiosity and imagination to generate new ideas§You’re energising, inspiring others with enthusiasm and a take action approach§You’re a communicator - the sort of positive person who loves working with people§The Benefits§ In this role, you can look forward to a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its’ purpose. Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§ § Ready to take a closer look at Pathways? Then apply now.§ § §Closing date:§ Sunday 18 October 2020. PLEASE NOTE this advert may close if suitable candidates are found prior to the closing date.§ § §Position description:§ https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/uploads/files/position-descriptions/PW_PSS.pdf§ § §Contact:§ Melanie Elder, Team Coach on 027 702 9830§ § §For further information, visit our website www.pathways.co.nz§ § **All new appointees into Pathways require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50684213.txt	§Support Workers - Disability Support Services - Blenheim§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Workers - Disability Support Services - Blenheim§§Advertiser: §Nelson Marlborough Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§§Provide support services to people with respect, courtesy and dignity§Ensure quality of life outcomes for the people we support§Bring your good social skills and ability to relate well to others§Mission: Supporting people to live the best possible life§Ā mātou rōpū (About our team)§At Disability Support Services (DSS) we provide support to people who have disabilities to live lives that reflect their personal aspirations and choices.§In residential and work environments we support each person to manage their day to day lives in ways and at times that work for them. The people we support have a wide range of abilities. Some people need support with their personal care and taking care of household tasks; some need support to participate in their local communities, and some need communication and behavioural support. We actively encourage people to pursue their dreams and try out new experiences, and can guarantee that no two days working at DSS are ever the same.§N.B. Disability Support Services are part of Nelson Marlborough Health, however, we are not a medical/clinical service. We are a community based disability support service focused on quality of life outcomes and the Enabling Good Lives Principles.§Ngā mōhiohio e pā ana ki tēnei mahi (About this position)§DSS are working in collaboration with Oranga Tamariki to set up bespoke services for young people in our community.§We have the following Support Worker positions available:§Position 1: §Permanent 0.4FTE working 32 hrs a fortnight. §Shift: 7.00AM to 3.30PM every Saturday and Sunday.§Positoin 2: §Perm 0.73FTE working 63 hrs a fortnight.§Awake nights 10.00PM - 7.00PM.§Week 1: Wed, Thurs.§Week 2§:§ Tues, Thurs, Fri, Sat, Sun.§Position 3: C§asual positions§ covering staff leave across a range of shifts§Important§: Please indicate which positions you wish to be considered for in your covering letter.§We welcome applicants with experience in support work. However, we're also interested in people with a variety of backgrounds and experience who may be looking for a career change.§Ko wai he kaitono tōtika? (Who is an appropriate applicant?)§You will have a can-do attitude and the skills to work with young people as part of a proactive support team. You will follow individual plans and understand the importance of consistency and maintaining boundaries with the aim to assist these people towards achieving their goals and dreams for their future.§Our ideal applicants will have the following:§Energy, enthusiasm and a sense of humour§Good social skills and the ability to relate well to others§The ability to be resilient in the face of challenges§Good problem solving skills and be solution focused§The ability to maintain confidentiality, be tactful and sensitive in dealing with people§Ability to manage emotions and cope with work stress§The ability to maintain firm professional boundaries§A current full driver's licence (preferably to drive both automatic and manual vehicles)§Good English language ability (written and spoken)§Basic maths and computing skills§Your hourly rate will be $20.50 to $25.50 dependent upon your qualifications as recognised under the Care and Support Workers (Pay Equity) Settlement Act 2017.§Applicants must be NZ or Australian Citizens, or have NZ Permanent Residency, or a valid NZ work visa at the time of applying. Appointment and ongoing employment will be conditional upon criminal record/police checks.§Me pēhea ahau e tono ai? (How do I apply?)§For general enquiries please contact our recruitment team on §vacancies@nmdhb.govt.nz§ or §03 546 1274§. For role related enquiries please contact Jemma Low - Group Leader on §Jemma.Low@nmdhb.govt.nz§Keen to apply now, it's easy. Please complete our online application form.§https://nmdhb.careercentre.net.nz/Job§You will receive further information about the information evening once we receive your application§W20-177.§Closing date: Thursday, 22October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50608958.txt	§Community Engagement and Mental Health Promotion Team Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Engagement and Mental Health Promotion Team Lead§§Advertiser: §Mental Health Foundation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Community Engagement and Mental Health Promotion Team Lead §      §        §          §Is it time for you to step up and show your leadership skills in a community engagement health promotion team lead position?§          §Do you excel at gathering community insights to inform the development of useful and relevant resources and materials that honour the voices and perspectives of those you have heard? §          §Are you a natural at developing relationships with Māori communities, organisations and leaders?§          §Are you confident in spreading key mental health promotion messages to a wide variety of people and communities?§        §        §If this sounds like you, we need you here at the Mental Health Foundation (MHF) in one of two new team lead roles in our Community Engagement and Health Promotion team.  You’ll be responsible for leading several suicide prevention resources for Māori, as well as working with the Community Engagement/Health Promotion Manager to support your team to complete their own suicide prevention projects.  These resources will be communicating key messages to a variety of audiences such as Māori and Pacific communities, rangatahi, takatāpui, suicide bereaved and those experiencing mental distress. A key part of the role will be developing and maintaining relationships with these groups, as well as with government agencies and the NGO sector. You’ll be managing and delivering projects with multiple priorities, while also supporting your team to manage theirs.  To do this well you will need to collaborate closely with MHF’s Communications and Marketing team and ensure all MHF teams feel connected to our community engagement/health promotion work, so you’ll need to be an excellent communicator who likes meeting deadlines and thrives on working in a team.§        §To be successful in this role you will:§        §          §Have over 5 years’ experience working with Māori communities, and have an in-depth understanding of Te Ao Māori§          §Be able to work with a range of Māori leaders to ensure our resources are reflective of community insights§          §Be able to apply health promotion frameworks and processes§          §Ideally have leadership experience§          §Ideally hold experience in suicide prevention§          §Be experienced in the process of resource development  §          §Value collaborative approaches and achieving shared outcomes. §          §Strong time management and communication skills§          §Strong relationship management skills §        §        §          §Excellent oral and written presentation skills§          §Demonstrate an understanding of how to support team wellbeing§          §Have great planning and budgeting skills  §          §Understands why some groups are disproportionately impacted by negative mental health.§        §        §If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.§        §This is a new role reporting to the Community Engagement/Health Promotion Manager.§        §The salary will be commensurate to the successful candidate's skills and experience for the role.§        §The Mental Health Foundation actively promotes the articles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.  We value the expertise of people with experience of mental illness - tangata whai ora - and we are an EEO employer. §        §This role is based in our Mt Eden office.§        §Please apply with a cover letter and CV over at our applicant tracking system: https://mhfnz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=25§        §Applications close Tuesday 20th October 2020§        §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. §        §PLEASE DO NOT CLICK “APPLY NOW.” Head over to our website §https://mhfnz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=25§You will also find the job description and person specification there.§      §      §      §    §  §§§ §Is it time for you to step up and show your leadership skills in a community engagement health promotion team lead position?§ §Do you excel at gathering community insights to inform the development of useful and relevant resources and materials that honour the voices and perspectives of those you have heard? § §Are you a natural at developing relationships with Māori communities, organisations and leaders?§ §Are you confident in spreading key mental health promotion messages to a wide variety of people and communities?§ §If this sounds like you, we need you here at the Mental Health Foundation (MHF) in one of two new team lead roles in our Community Engagement and Health Promotion team.  You’ll be responsible for leading several suicide prevention resources for Māori, as well as working with the Community Engagement/Health Promotion Manager to support your team to complete their own suicide prevention projects.  These resources will be communicating key messages to a variety of audiences such as Māori and Pacific communities, rangatahi, takatāpui, suicide bereaved and those experiencing mental distress. A key part of the role will be developing and maintaining relationships with these groups, as well as with government agencies and the NGO sector. You’ll be managing and delivering projects with multiple priorities, while also supporting your team to manage theirs.  To do this well you will need to collaborate closely with MHF’s Communications and Marketing team and ensure all MHF teams feel connected to our community engagement/health promotion work, so you’ll need to be an excellent communicator who likes meeting deadlines and thrives on working in a team.§ §To be successful in this role you will:§ § §Have over 5 years’ experience working with Māori communities, and have an in-depth understanding of Te Ao Māori§ §Be able to work with a range of Māori leaders to ensure our resources are reflective of community insights§ §Be able to apply health promotion frameworks and processes§ §Ideally have leadership experience§ §Ideally hold experience in suicide prevention§ §Be experienced in the process of resource development  § §Value collaborative approaches and achieving shared outcomes. § §Strong time management and communication skills§ §Strong relationship management skills § §Excellent oral and written presentation skills§ §Demonstrate an understanding of how to support team wellbeing§ §Have great planning and budgeting skills  § §Understands why some groups are disproportionately impacted by negative mental health.§ §If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.§ §This is a new role reporting to the Community Engagement/Health Promotion Manager.§ §The salary will be commensurate to the successful candidate's skills and experience for the role.§ §The Mental Health Foundation actively promotes the articles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.  We value the expertise of people with experience of mental illness - tangata whai ora - and we are an EEO employer. § §This role is based in our Mt Eden office.§ §Please apply with a cover letter and CV over at our applicant tracking system: https://mhfnz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=25§ §Applications close Tuesday 20th October 2020§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. § §PLEASE DO NOT CLICK “APPLY NOW.” Head over to our website §https://mhfnz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=25§You will also find the job description and person specification there.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50664943.txt	§Counsellor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Counsellor§§Advertiser: §Presbyterian Support Central§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Counsellor§  §We value our staff as much as our clients§Are you passionate about your work as a Counsellor and keen on working with the community?§Are you someone who can work with a wide range of client s and adapt well to different situations? §Can you work from a multi agency and multidisciplinary approach?§§About Us§Family Works is one of New Zealand's largest NGOs providing integrated social services for the whole community. We are dedicated to enhancing the lives of children and whanau. We provide a range of services to families and communities, including social work, counselling, mediation, mentoring and parenting support.§Family Works programmes include social work; support with families experiencing family violence; ongoing counselling support to adults, couples, youth, children and families; group and individual programmes for tamariki and wāhine who have experienced trauma; parenting programmes; family dispute resolution as well as clinical supervision for other professionals§§About the Role§We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Counsellor who has a good understanding of family and child context. In this role you’ll deliver counselling and related support to families and whanau. We offer a great training package, professional support, and colleagues who are just as dedicated to promoting children’s wellbeing as you are!§The role is permanent, full time role (32 hours per week)§§About You§You will be a passionate, energetic person with the ability to connect to children and their families. §You will be knowledgeable, organised and have excellent communication skills. Your approach to your work will be with kindness, logic and above all, the drive to do right by the child.§In addition to being a passionate counsellor, you will also have:§  §Experience working with vulnerable individuals, couples, whanau, youth and children§  §Membership to a professional body§  §A relevant professional tertiary qualification§  §Flexible, safe and creative approaches in supporting vulnerable people.§  §Experience working with family violence and child protection§  §A positive approach and ability to work in a collaborative team.§§How to apply§To apply or for more information visit our website: https://psc.qjumpersjobs.co/ §If you would like further information, please contact Dianne Te Tau  §0272452815§ or get in touch at §recruit@psc.org.nz§ §Only those with the legal right to work in NZ may apply. §Candidates should expect to undergo police vetting for these roles and Family Works may need to contact our key stakeholders such as Ministry of Social Development or Ministry of Justice to ensure that there is no conflict of interest between the candidate and the organisation. §Applications close: 18 October 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Counsellor---PD.doc§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
