jobText: TXT/50702681.txt	§WWF-New Zealand, Corporate Partnerships Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§WWF-New Zealand, Corporate Partnerships Manager§§Advertiser: §WWF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Fundraising§§§§§§WWF-New Zealand, Corporate Partnerships Manager§ § WWF-New Zealand is looking for an optimistic and determined Corporate Partnerships Manager.  You’ll have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, and previous experience building strong external relationships. You’ll be excited by the opportunity to make a difference with an international environmental organisation and an iconic brand.§ §Your primary responsibility will be to support the Strategic Partnerships Manager to create a successful Whale Tales 2022 event by bringing in sponsors and partners to fund the programme. You’ll be responsible for identifying and cultivating prospective sponsors, preparing high quality external communications documents, including sponsorship marketing materials as required. § §The Corporate Partnerships Manager will also support the Strategic Partnerships Manager to develop, secure and manage corporate partnership opportunities which provide funding and strategic value to WWF-New Zealand. You will be tasked with conducting due diligence on prospective corporate sponsors, working closely with sponsors to ensure long profitable relationships and overseeing corporate sponsorship initiatives.  § §This role would suit someone with a warm, approachable personality, the ability to build rapport and trust quickly, and who wants to play a key role in working towards a New Zealand where people thrive in harmony with nature. § §An ability to clearly communicate our organisation’s mission, and the objectives of Whale Tales 2022, are key. You will be excited about getting out there and talking to the wonderful people who care about our cause. You’ll use your high level of emotional intelligence to make sponsors feel listened to and valued, negotiate great outcomes and build relationships.§ §Self-motivated and focused, you’ll have good initiative and enjoy working within small, cross-organisational teams to achieve results together. You are comfortable in discussions with high level influencers, but also happy to get stuck in organising the nuts and bolts of the programme.§ §The Corporate Partnerships Manager position is a full-time (37.5 hours a week) fixed-term role for 12 months, linked to the Whale Tales 2022 event, but it may be extended or established as a full-time permanent role at the end of that 12 month period. The position is based in Auckland.§ §How to apply:§ §See our web site for a position description and more details: http://www.wwf.org.nz/about_us/current_vacancies/§ §Please apply by emailing your CV and cover letter (the cover letter should be 2 sides maximum) in a single document to §applytowwfnz@wwf.org.nz§ by §midnight on Monday 26th October 2020.  §Please review the position description carefully and evidence how you meet the skills, experience and personal attributes required in your cover letter.§ §Interviews are planned to occur between 2nd - 5th November 2020.§ §If you have specific questions about the role, you can contact Hannah Prior, Strategic Partnerships Manager, on §applytowwfnz@wwf.org.nz§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience working in the not-for-profit sector?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobTitle: Keyworker - Street to Home Job in Auckland - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50638825.txt	§Keyworker - Street to Home§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Keyworker - Street to Home§§Advertiser: §Auckland City Mission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Our Mission§ §Together we stand with those in desperate need.§ §We provide immediate relief and pathways to enable long term wellbeing.§ § § §Street to Home Programme§ §Auckland City Mission are proud to introduce §Street to Home§, aiming to support people's journey from living on the streets to a sustainable home.§ §Using a strengths-based approach we walk alongside clients, focusing on recovery & wellbeing. Using Te Whare Tapa Wha principles to guide our approach we provide a single source of connection to a range of supports to improve healthcare, mental wellbeing, recovery from addiction, and assistance to reconnect with family, whanau & community.§ §The role of Keyworker§ §As a Keyworker you will engage with people proactively and/or through agency and community referrals. Using your professional experience, you will build trust and rapport, identify people's immediate and long term needs. Working with your clients you will create client focused plans that address long and short term goals, incorporating Te Whare Tapa Wha to connect your clients with services that address their mental, physical, family and spiritual health.§ §To be successful§ you will have natural rapport skills and an ability to connect and relate to people with a range of backgrounds, challenges and needs. Your previous casework experience will include vulnerable people who have a history of poor engagement, high complex needs and culturally diverse populations. You may come from a social work, community, mental health or clinical background and ideally with have an understanding of homelessness in New Zealand or around the world. You will also need to§ § §Have a full clean NZ drivers licence§ §Be physically fit§ §Hold a relevant tertiary qualification§ §If you are looking for a challenging but exceptionally rewarding role in a progressive organisation that changes to meet the needs of its community apply now or contact us to find out more. Pease note that interviews will be held on Friday 14th August only and you must be available for the full day.§ §Our Values§ §Manaakitanga§Manaakitanga is behaviour that acknowledges the mana of others as having equal or greater importance than one's own, through the expression of aroha, hospitality, generosity, and mutual respect.§ §Justice (Manatika)§Committed to equity, and seeking dignity for all we will fearlessly advocate with and for those who are going without.§ §Partnership (Rangapū)§Firstly, the Auckland City Mission recognises the principle of partnership within Te Tiriti O Waitangi.§ §Secondly, our commitment to partnership stems from a belief that manaakitanga, equity and social justice need to be pursued both within partnerships and through them. For us partnership is characterised by mutual trust, integrity, respect, transparency, and commitment.§ §The Auckland City Mission's Street to Home Programme is supported by Auckland Council, The Ministry of Social Development, The Ministry of Housing & Urban Development and a range of grants and donations.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a bachelors degree or a minimum of a Level 4 certificate in a relevant health, community or social field?§Police, criminal, driving and vulnerable persons vetting checks are carried out on successful applicants. You'll need to be able to drive & work with vulnerable persons. Do you agree to these checks being completed if successful?§Do you have any experience with Kaupapa, Tikanga, Te reo, Treaty of Waitangi, or other Maori cultural practices and beliefs?§§§

You will need to have a positive, resilient and respectful attitude with a real knack in building real connections. Ideally, you will have had prior experience supporting the homeless and have a good understanding of culturally appropriate delivery of social housing services. § §About the role:§ § §This role will give you the opportunity to apply the housing first philosophy in practice and work with the most vulnerable people in the community to provide access to safe, affordable accommodation and link them to community resources. This role plays a big part by empowering our people with skills and knowledge that will improve their chances of finding suitable accommodation and maintaining their tenancies and achieve their long -term goals. § §What you will need to have:§ § § §Ability to support and motivate people to achieve their goals § §Practical life skills and knowledge to connect people with community support resources and whanau/family/family of choice. § §Relevant qualification (or working towards one) in Social Services and /or Mental Health and Addictions Support§ §Commitment to Te Tiriti O Waitangi and understanding of tikanga Maori § §All applicants must have New Zealand Residency, a full and clean driver's licence and a clean police record.§ § §As the successful applicant, you will enjoy working within an open, supportive working environment that will offer you further growth and development.§ §About us:§ §Kāhui Tū Kaha is a community mental health and social housing organization under the auspices of Te Rūnanga ō Ngāti Whātua. It is a well-established and innovative provider and characterized by its diversity and commitment to health and social outcomes for everyone.§ §Our values are: Manaakitanga, Rangatiratanga, Whakawhanaungatanga§ §Toitū te kupu, toitū te mana, toitū te whenua. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Have you completed a qualification in community services?§§§

jobText: TXT/50673047.txt	§Services Pastor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Services Pastor§§Advertiser: §Legacy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Are you Legacy Church’s new Services Pastor?§  §Legacy is a growing, dynamic, and innovative church. We run multiple services and a number of significant social impact ministries including the largest non-government social housing service and soup kitchen in the Manawatu. We are also reaching over 100,000 people every week through our media ministry. Legacy is led by an Executive Team that includes our Lead Pastor and four other people who lead pastoral care and discipleship, services, community, and housing.§  §This role is based in Palmerston North and involves working with our Lead Pastor as part of our Executive Team. It is a 20 to 30 hour per week role, depending on the applicant.§  §The successful applicant will be someone who is passionate about creating environments where people can encounter God, grow in their faith, and feel connected to our church family. They will be someone who can take us forward in this area, helping us build our future as the church continues to grow.§  § §  §This role includes but is not limited to:§  §+ Planning worship services§  §+ Promoting worship services§  §+ Ensuring worship services are run in a way that embraces our values and ministry principles§  §+ Developing a sense of family amongst our services volunteers§  §+ Developing ministry leaders and helping them build healthy and high-impact teams§  §+ Overseeing the pastoral care of ministry leaders§  § §  §The successful applicant will have:§  §+ Spiritual maturity§  §+ Vision for worship services§  §+ Proven ability to motivate and develop a team of leaders and volunteers§  §+ Experience in a broad range of ministries§  §+ A large capacity, ability to take initiative and to make things happen§  §+ Ability to work under pressure, meeting deadlines whilst remaining calm§  §+ Ability to communicate well in writing and verbally with all levels of team and the general public§  §+ Ability to work as part of a team§  §+ A servant heart§  §+ A teachable attitude§  §+ Computer skills§  §+ Be active in the life of Legacy Church (or prepared to move to Legacy Church and have been active in your current church)§  § §  §Benefits:§  §Legacy is consistently seeing people saved, healed, and restored. This role is a key role in our organisation and is an opportunity to do something meaningful and make a real difference.§  §Legacy is committed to developing our staff. The successful candidate will have a number of personal development opportunities where they can grow with us.§  § §  §If you wish to apply for this role, please send a covering letter and your CV to jackiec@legacy.net.nz.§§§§

jobTitle: Pou Reo me ōna Tikanga - Cultural Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50671018.txt	§Pou Reo me ōna Tikanga - Cultural Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pou Reo me ōna Tikanga - Cultural Advisor§§Advertiser: §Hutt City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Indigenous & Multicultural Services§§§§§§Ko tō mātou aronga nui i Te Kaunihera o Te Awa Kairangi kia noho mai tēnei tāone hei wāhi pārekareka, whai hua ki hōna tāngata. Kei te mahi tahi ki te ririte hei anamata pai mō hō tātou iwi katoa, ki te hangaia hoki he Kaunihera e waia ana ki te reo me ōna tikanga. Hei taunaki i hēnei wawata, e kimi ana mātou i tētehi Pou Reo me ōna Tikanga ki te whakauru mai ki tō mātou whānau i tētehi tūranga e tūturu ana§Ko te aronga tō tēnei tūranga kia whakawhanaketia ngā ringaringa me ngā waewae o tēnei whare kia tōtika ai ngā mahi a Te Kaunihera ki te whakapakari i te noho rangapū i waenganui i a māua ko mana whenua, otinō, ko te noho ā-Tiriti.§I tēnei tūranga ka whakawhanake, ka kōkiritia ngā whakangungu āheitanga ā-kaunihera e hāngai pū ana ki te ao Māori, ki te reo, ki Te Tiriti o Waitangi, ki ngā tikanga Māori hoki. Waihoki, ka whakahaeretia e koe tētehi pou tarāwaho "Te Ao Mārama" kia whakahaumako ai te mārama a ngā kaimahi i te ao Māori§Kia mahi ngātahi i tō te rōpū pūmanawa tangata taha, ka tautokona te whakawhanake i tētehi Kaunihera e marae ana i ngā ahurea katoa, ka aratakina ngā tikanga Māori, otinō ko ngā pōhiri me ērā atu kātū, ā, ka noho hei pou tikanga.§Ka noho matua tēnei tūranga hei taunaki i te whakawhanake i ngā rangapū hōu, i ngā mahi hoki kei tō te Māori taha, ā, me mārohirohi te kano a tēnei tangata kia whakatupu, kia whakapuāwai i hērā rangapū.§E aro nui ana mātou i tētehi kaitono e pēnei ana tōna kātū:§E matatau ana ki te reo Māori§E tautōhito ana ki te whakamahi i ngā tikanga Māori, i te mātauranga Māori hoki§E mārama pū ana i Te Tiriti o Waitangi, i hōna mātāpono hoki: te hononga, te mahi tahi, me te manaaki tōhau nui§Kua mahi tahi ki tō te rōpū Māori taha, ahakoa he iwi, he marae, he aha atu rānei te kano§Kua whakaako i ngā akomanga e hāngai ana ki ngā tikanga Māori, ki te mātauranga Māori hoki.§Ka ahu mai te āheitanga a Te Kaunihera kia tino pai ai te noho a te tangata e koni ahi ana i Te Awa Kairangi i hō mātou tangata kanorau, i hō mātou tangata pūmanawa hoki - kia kōmiroa, kia whiria ōu muka tangata kia ū, kia roa, kia pītongatonga ai te taura o tēnei pāpori§Mēnā kei a koe ngā pūkenga e kimihia ana e mātou, e hīkaka ana ki te pōhiritia mai tō tāhuhu tangata, nō reira, e pao Tōrea, kei whati te tai§Ka kati ngā tono hei te Rātapu 18 Whiringa-ā-nuku§At Hutt City Council we're committed to ensuring Te Awa Kairangi and its people thrive. We're working to co-create our future with the communities we serve and to build a culturally capable Council. To help do this, we are looking for a Pou Reo me ōna Tikanga (Cultural Advisor) to join our team on a permanent basis.§This role will place an emphasis on the development of our people and the Council's capacity to respond effectively to Māori as a key element in strengthening Council's partnership with mana whenua, and in delivering our services more effectively.§In this role you will be developing and promoting council-wide capability building & training on te ao Māori, te reo, Te Tiriti o Waitangi, and tikanga Māori. You will also develop and implement a "Te Ao Mārama" Framework, to enhance staff understanding of te ao Māori.§Working alongside our People & Capability team you will assist in the development of a culturally inclusive workforce, lead the facilitation of pōhiri other protocol related activity and provide advice and guidance with a cultural lens.§This role is key to supporting the in the development of new partnerships and programmes with Māori and requires someone with the ability to build strong effective relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders.§We are really interested to hear from you if you possess the following background:§Fluency in te reo Māori.§Intrinsic understanding and application of tikanga Māori and mātauranga Māori.§Comprehensive understanding of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and its principles: partnership, participation, and active protection.§Experience working with and/or for mana whenua, marae, or Māori organisations.§Experience in delivering tikanga Māori and mātauranga Māori training.§Our ability to make a meaningful difference will come from us having diverse and talented people in our organisation - and this is your opportunity to be connected to your community.§There's never been a better time to be a part of the team. If this is the opportunity you've been waiting for, we'd love to hear from you.§Applications Close Sunday 18 October 2020§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50597433.txt	§Youth Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Youth Worker§§Advertiser: §Youth Horizons Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Salary§§$20-$25 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Youth Worker (Casual)§Do you have a passion to enhance the lives of young people at risk and experience working with youth from a range of cultures? This is a unique opportunity for those mature individuals studying in social work, psychology or mental health, or for anyone with experience caring for rangatahi/youth.§We are looking for casual youth workers to work across our two foster care services in Hawkes Bay.§With the SCP (Specialist Caregiver Programme) service, you will work with caregivers to assist young people to develop and practice skills including behaviour management, communication, coping and problem-solving skills.§With the THH (Teaching Family Group Home) service, you will be responsible for the day to day household management of the residential home. This will include both therapeutic components and the regular day to day duties such as housework, meal preparation and recreational activities.§Role requirements§Work collaboratively as part of a team, including supporting the other practitioners and caregivers§Assist youths to develop and practice skills including, behaviour management, communication, coping and problem-solving skills.§Support and empower the young people within the home to undertake their daily activities, meet their goals and change their behaviour through the application of the service model.§Assist with our holiday/day programmes§Assist with the day to day running of the home§Ability to work on a casual basis including paid sleepovers and occasional week day trainings/meetings.§About You§Ability to provide nurture and structure and to be a strong positive adult role model§Previous conflict resolution experience and experience in working with young people from a range of cultures§The ability to build strong relationships with peers and stakeholders§Be culturally aware and willing to be a part of a bi-cultural journey§Have a full and clean New Zealand driver's licence§A clear Ministry of Social Development (MSD) and Police vetting check§What We Offer§Full induction and on-going developmental training in the TFM model.§Fun loving family/whanau environment.§24/7 on-call support backed up by the continual support of the programme Practice Leader.§About Youth Horizons§Youth Horizons is a specialised non-profit organisation providing therapeutic services for young people who have complex behaviour and/or mental health needs. Our innovative approach combines evidence-based models of practice along with a focus on our core values of Manaakitanga, Wairuatanga, Aroha and Whanaungatanga. Our national office is in Auckland and we have over 250 staff and caregivers supporting young people and their families and whanau across Northland, greater Auckland, Waikato, Bay of Plenty, Hawkes Bay, Lower North Island and Lower South Island. To find out more about Youth Horizons, visit www.youthorizons.org.nz§Please apply for this role by clicking on '§Apply for this job§' and you will be directed to our careers website to complete the application process. Closing date for applications is §14 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50628674.txt	§Community Engagement Advisor (Part Time 0.25 FTE)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Engagement Advisor (Part Time 0.25 FTE)§§Advertiser: §Parkinson's New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$25 - $34.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Volunteer Coordination & Support§§§§§§Have you always wanted a job where you feel like you are making a real difference to other people's lives?  Are you a people person with great communication skills, service focused and self-managing?  Then we would love to hear from you!§  §The Parkinson’s New Zealand Charitable Trust (Parkinson's New Zealand) is a not-for-profit organisation that provides education, information and support to people living with Parkinsonism conditions, their care givers, families and health professionals. We believe in improving the everyday life of people living with Parkinsonism conditions.§  §The Community Engagement Advisor will be responsible for developing networks and finding opportunities to enhance the presence and performance of Parkinson's New Zealand in their region.  We are looking for someone with fantastic networking and relationship building skills to develop strong relationships with our supporters and volunteers, and to work closely with and provide support to our local Action Groups (volunteer committees).§  §Encouraging and assisting with fundraising within the Southern region will be important, especially coordinating local fundraising efforts and local Action Group events.  You will work with these regional groups to promote and manage the annual spring Tulip Cream Tea campaign and our national Appeal Week in April. Co-ordinating regional Parkinson's seminars and social events is also a core focus of this diverse and exciting role. Never a dull moment, you are a team player who will become a member of our highly motivated team of four regional Community Engagement Advisors, the others being based in Auckland, Napier and Wellington. The four CEA's meet regularly via video conference and work closely together as a National team. You will also be supported by the fundraising and communications team at National Office.  §  §The successful applicant will have the following:§ § §Exceptional communication skills both written and oral§ §The ability to network & build professional relationships§ §Experience at working with volunteers & community groups§ §Confident IT user, including MS Office, email, and video conferencing§ §Experience in organising events and group activities§ §Excellent administration and organisation skills§ §Experience in a service delivery organisation§ §Previous experience in fundraising an advantage§ §A current drivers licence§ §Our ideal candidate will be positive, energetic, and able to work well unsupervised.§  §The position reports directly to the Operations Manager who is based at our Wellington National Office.  This role will require travel from time to time.§  §Candidates from anywhere within the region will be equally considered.§ The Southern Region covers Otago and South Canterbury.§  §We offer the opportunity to make a real difference to other people’s lives and the opportunity to use your great communication and organisational skills to connect with people and provide a great service.§  §For a copy of the job description and application form please contact Laurence Milton, Operations Manager §operations@parkinsons.org.nz§ §  §A covering letter and CV are to be sent to:  Laurence Milton at §operations@parkinsons.org.nz§  §Applications close 16 October 2020§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50628533.txt	§Facilitator (Wellington)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilitator (Wellington)§§Advertiser: §IHC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$24.04 - $31.25ph§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§An exciting and rewarding opportunity is currently available within the Choices NZ team as a Facilitator located in Wellington.§As a §Facilitator§, you will be responsible for helping and coaching people with disabilities or long-term health conditions to gain and maintain employment, support young people in the transition from school process, and provide assistance and advice to people receiving ACC support to live independently.§This role would suit someone who is genuinely passionate about working in the disability sector, and the drive to provide coaching services to those in our community, with the ability to:§build strong and trusting relationships with those we support, their families and friends, and the wider community,§understand and create a picture of the individual life journey and goals,§identify local, natural and funded community support,§encourage the learning of new skills, and grow someone's confidence,§understand and advise if someone can manage their ACC Funding, or require assistance,§continue to drive to establish connections, and meet desired results,§work together with a like-minded and achievement focused team located across NZ.§This position will be offered on a Fixed-Term Full-Time basis for 3-6 months (§with a possibility of extension§). Due to the nature of the services we provide, flexibility of working hours is essential.§Requirements§Minimum Level 5 NZQA Approved Qualification§Empathy for others, and a passion to support people with a disability or health need is essential§Demonstrated ability to identify new opportunities, and the initiative to develop effective relationships with employers, and community support networks.§Effective written and verbal communication skills to support engagement, rapport building, and advocacy.§Ability to self-direct, motivate and work independently.§Resilience to continue to establish desired outcomes.§Clean NZ Full Drivers License, access to a reliable vehicle, and the ability to travel as required.§Benefits§A collaborative and inclusive culture with a focus on our people's wellbeing.§Warm and welcoming team environment with approachable and supportive management.§Competitive remuneration and employee benefits including attractive discounts with leading retailers/fitness centres, eyecare and insurance benefits.§About Choices NZ§Choices NZ facilitates flexible support relationships and access to community services to help people with all disabilities and health-related conditions achieve their goals.§We provide a range of services including employment, transition from school, learning new things and becoming an active part of the local community.§Choices NZ is a proud member of the IHC Group. The IHC Group is made up of our charitable programmes and three wholly-owned subsidiaries, committed to supporting people with intellectual disabilities to lead satisfying lives in the community and to providing housing and tenancy services to people in need.§The IHC Group is committed to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and actively seek a diverse applicant pool. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. We welcome all kinds of diversity and the different perspectives such diversity brings to our work.§Applicants must have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50605703.txt	§Youth Workers-Maori Cultural Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Youth Workers-Maori Cultural Support§§Advertiser: §Youth Horizons Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Youth Workers-Maori Cultural Support§E ngā reo, e ngā mana, huri noa I te motu, tēnā koutou katoa.§He turanga tēnei e wātea ana ki roto o Kia Puāwai§Make a difference with some of our most at-risk and vulnerable rangatahi§Be part of a professional team working together to change lives§The Role§We are seeking passionate and dedicated youth centred workers for our Kai Kōkiri role. You will work closely with rangatahi who are either journeying in foster/residential care or who are care experienced. These rangatahi have navigated many difficult life experiences and are often disconnected from their whānau . In your role as Kai Kōkiri you will walk alongside them to make meaningful connections with their whānau, hāpu, iwi, and culture.§Two roles are available: one is based in Mt, Wellington, Auckland and includes regular travel to Whangarei (permanent full time). The other is based in New Lynn Auckland at our Youth Service West office (full time 2 year fixed term role).§As Kai Kōkiri you will:§Conduct cultural assessments with rangatahi in care placements§Arrange for rangatahi to learn and understand their culture§Facilitate opportunities for rangatahi to visit or attend marae and important whānau and cultural events§Assist rangatahi to learn about their culture, connect with places relevant to their culture, and to access resources to learn their language (e.g. te reo)§Provide cultural training and advice to care service staff and caregivers through face-to-face training delivery and other resources§About You§You will hold as a minimum a level 4 qualification in Youth Work, Tikanga Māori, Te Reo Māori or similar field.§Fluency and in depth understanding of Te Reo Māori.§Deep commitment and understanding of Te Ao Māori, traditions and protocols.§Established whānau, hāpu, iwi networks.§Experience in working within a range of cultures.§Experience in dealing with conflict resolution, relationship and behavioural issues.§Effective communication, group presentation and interpersonal skills§Contributing to harmonious and effective bi-cultural working environments.§Excellent relationship management skills with people at all levels.§Full and clean NZ drivers licence.§Youth Horizons Offers§Values based organisation that's making a real difference in the lives of young people and their families.§Competitive remuneration to match the skills and experience needed for this role.§Fun-loving whanau/family environment.§Career progression opportunities across a national organisation.§Cultural support and development.§Paid birthday leave§About Youth Horizons | Kia Puawai§Youth Horizons is a specialised non-profit organisation providing therapeutic services for over 20 years for young people who have complex behaviour and/or mental health needs. We take an evidence-based approach with our programmes sourcing international models along with a focus on our core values:§Manaakitanga, Wairuatanga, Aroha and Whanaungatanga.§To find out more about Youth Horizons, visit www.youthorizons.org.nz§Applications close 11th October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50576347.txt	§Community Disability Advocate /Fieldworker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Disability Advocate /Fieldworker§§Advertiser: §Muscular Dystrophy Association of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§ §Great opportunity to be involved in a member-led disabled persons’ organisation§ §Make a real difference to people’s lives, part time hours§ §Package includes a vehicle, laptop and cell phone.§ §Muscular Dystrophy Association of NZ (MDANZ) is a member-led disabled persons’ organisation with a sixty-year history representing and supporting people with over 70 neuromuscular conditions across Aotearoa New Zealand.  §  §MDANZ is looking for an energetic and supportive Fieldworker for our Upper South Island Region. The role provides community-based outreach information, advocacy, and support to individuals and families living with a neuromuscular condition, assisting them to have access to opportunities and achieve their full potential.  In this role, you’ll provide support to our 400+ members across the Upper South Island.  You will also co-ordinate the community and liaise with the health and social sectors to raise awareness of neuromuscular conditions with stakeholders and the general public.  §  §What you’ll bring -  § § §Experience working with disabled people, their families, and whanau; jobText: TXT/50615407.txt	§Maternal Mental Health Support Worker / Group Facilitator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Maternal Mental Health Support Worker / Group Facilitator§§Advertiser: §Dayspring Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Salary§§$25.5 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§About Us§ §Dayspring believes that we all need to have a hope for the future and a vision to inspire.§ §As a community organisation, we want to positively influence the pathways for women and their families/whanau. The wellbeing of the mother means families can flourish and grow and ultimately affects the health of the communities we live in.§ §Our Values§ § §Respect – Having respect for ourselves and for others.§ §Compassion – Putting compassion into action.§ §Hope – Standing together, speaking encouragement, and building hope.§ §Support – Supporting those wanting change and growth§ §The Role§ §As a Mental Health Support Worker - no 2 days will be the same.  We are looking for someone who cares about making a difference in the community and is committed to helping our clients reach their goals through provision of a range of high quality, outcomes focused support services, working in partnership with mothers and their babies/young children experiencing moderate to severe post-natal depression or an ongoing mental illness. You will promote healthy mother/baby attachment relationships (we teach the Circle of Security model) , with the inclusion of whanau and dads, to ensure parents are empowered to continue their journey of healthy and positive relationships with the wider family/whanau, and local community.§ §We are a small but passionate team working within school hours mainly. The roll would be 23 hours per week split between Support work and group facilitation.  This is over 4 days between 9am - 3pm. § §For our groups, you will be responsible for co-facilitating the activities for each term and be available at each meeting to support the clients. We currently run 2 groups a week - Health & Wellbeing and Crafty Mums. § §The Benefits§ §Flexible hours, ongoing support & training, and a lovely group of people to work with - Plus work closer to home!§ §What we are looking for§ §We are looking for someone who is positive, flexible, vibrant, dependable, confident and compassionate to work in our service and can bring a sense of humour.§ §You'll naturally be a problem solver, quick thinker and enjoy connecting with the community. jobText: TXT/50682380.txt	§Support Workers - Physical Disability Support Services, Blenheim§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Workers - Physical Disability Support Services, Blenheim§§Advertiser: §Nelson Marlborough Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§§Mission: Supporting people to live the best possible life§Ā mātou rōpū (About our team)§At Disability Support Services (DSS) we provide support to people who have disabilities to live lives that reflect their personal aspirations and choices. DSS provides support to over 250 people in a variety of residential settings across the Marlborough and Nelson/Tasman regions.§In residential and work environments we support each person to manage their day to day lives in ways and at times that work for them. The people we support have a wide range of abilities. Some people need support with their personal care and taking care of household tasks; some need support to participate in their local communities and some need communication and behavioural support. We also work to provide family/whanau time to re-energise and spend time with other important people, while their child stays in one of our respite houses. We actively encourage people to pursue their dreams and try out new experiences, and can guarantee that no two days working at DSS are ever the same.§We also work collaboratively and in partnership with Mental Health and Addictions, Youth Justice, Oranga Tamariki, and other community organisations to meet the needs of people we support.§N.B. Disability Support Services are part of Nelson Marlborough Health, we are not however a medical/clinical service. We are a community based disability support service focused on quality of life outcomes and the Enabling Good Lives Principles.§Ngā mōhiohio e pā ana ki ēnei mahi (About these positions)§We have the following permanent part-time positions available:§Position 1: §7.00AM to 3.30PM Saturday and Sunday every second weekend§ (16 hrs/fortnight).§Position 2: §3.30PM to 10.00PM every Thursday, Friday and Saturday §(39 hrs/fortnight).§Position 3: §7.00AM to 3.30PM every Thursday, Friday and Saturday§ (48 hrs/fortnight).§Position 4: §Awake nights 10.00PM to 7.00AM §(63 hrs/fortnight). Week 1§:§ Wed, Thurs. Week 2: Tues, Thurs, Fri, Sat, Sun.§Position 5: §Working 40 flexi hours a fortnight§ covering staff leave and providing support as required across three houses and all shifts including: morning, afternoon, evening, weekend and overnight. It will be important that you are adaptable and able to work with a wide variety of people.§Position 6: §Casual employment§ with the flexibility to work across a range on shifts. It will be important that you are adaptable and able to work with a wide variety of people.§N.B.§ there are no fixed hours associated with casual employment.§*Please indicate which position/s are of interest to you in your covering letter.§Ko wai he kaitono tōtika? (Who is an appropriate applicant?)§We are looking for people with a can-do attitude who can work with children and adults, as part of a proactive support team, in residential and respite homes. You will follow individual plans and understand the importance of consistency in assisting people to achieve a great life.§Our ideal applicants will have the following:§A sense of humour§Good social skills and the ability to relate well to others§The ability to work with people who present with challenging behaviours§Diversity to work with a range of people with differing levels of support needs§The ability to maintain confidentiality, be tactful and sensitive in dealing with people§Commitment to professional development§An ability to work actively as part of a team and individually to ensure service quality§A current full driver's licence (preferably to drive both automatic and manual vehicles)§Good English language ability (written and spoken)§Basic maths and computing skills§Confidence in assisting with personal cares§Energy and enthusiasm§Your hourly rate will be $20.50 to $25.50 dependent upon your qualifications as recognised under the Care and Support Workers (Pay Equity) Settlement Act 2017.§This positions are classified by Immigration as ANZSCO 423111 and applicants for this position must be NZ or Australian Citizens, or have NZ Permanent Residency, or a valid NZ work visa.§Appointment and ongoing employment will be conditional upon criminal record/police checks - you must declare any convictions and/or pending charges on your application form. This will include checks under the Vulnerable Children Act 2014.§Me pēhea ahau e tono ai? (How do I apply?)§For general enquiries please contact our recruitment team on §vacancies@nmdhb.govt.nz§ or §03 546 1274§.§For role related enquiries please contact Jemma Low - Group Leader on §Jemma.Low@nmdhb.govt.nz§Keen to apply now, it's easy. Please complete our online application form.§https://nmdhb.careercentre.net.nz/Job§W20-178.§Applications close: Wednesday, 4 November (unless filled prior).§Applications will be reviewed as they are received so we encourage you to apply as early as possible.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The aim of the Tai Tokerau Attendance Service is to improve the engagement and ultimately the achievement of individual learners, and also the number of learners attending school.§  § §  §Ngāpuhi Iwi Social Services (on behalf of the Tai Tokerau Iwi Consortium) is contracted by the Ministry of Education (MoE) to: § § §Support schools in the management of persistent unjustified absence, after the school has made all reasonable attempts to engage the learner, and§ §Locate learners who have been absent from school for more than 20 consecutive days without a justified reason, and where appropriate facilitate enrollment in a school or another legal learning environment.§ § §  §To be successful in this position, the ideal applicant should have:§ § §Experience of managing a regional team working from a number of locations.§ §Understanding of school enrolment and absence procedures, and MoE expulsion and exclusion guidelines.§ §Recognized commitment to the promotion of Tikanga Ngāpuhi.§ §Successful experience in managing key stakeholder groups.§ §Demonstrated experience in management and leadership roles.§ §NZ residency and a Full Driver's License§ §To apply: §  §“Apply online” §and attach your CV and Cover Letter. Applications close §5pm, Monday 12 October 2020§. §  §A job-description will be emailed to you. §  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50623898.txt	§Service Manager - Hawera§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Service Manager - Hawera§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §Rest of Taranaki§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Service Manager - Hawera §      §        § §Service Manager - Hawera§        §          §Great leadership opportunity§          §Based in Hawera§          §Play an active role in delivering our Hōkai Rangi outcomes§        §        §Hōkai Rangi [link removed] is Ara Poutama Aotearoa's organisational strategy for the next 5 years. It recognises and builds on the good work we are already doing, however, it also looks to find new and alternative ways to achieve better outcomes for the people in our care and their whānau which will result in reduced reoffending.§        §A key focus of Hōkai Rangi is the humanising and healing of those people in our care and management.  Ara Poutama Aotearoa staff will focus on having relationships with these people, and their whānau, that are based on manaaki and contribute positively to their wellbeing.§        §Mō te tūnga | §About the role§        §As a Service Manager your role is pivotal to delivering upon this promise.  These roles offer you the opportunity to showcase your ability to achieve outcomes through others, to live the values of Ara Poutama Aotearoa, to prove your capability as a true leader and to show determination to strive for high performance in line with our organisational strategies.  In other words, be a driver of success for Hōkai Rangi, which has a foundation of success of a values-led organisation.§ § With rehabilitation of people in our care being our main focus, a "One Team" approach is paramount to ensure those people in the management of Ara Poutama Aotearoa remain at the centre of our efforts and victims at the centre of our concern. By providing professional leadership in all aspects of practice, legislation and offender management, you will maintain quality standards and ensure statutory obligations in line with Department policy.§  §        §Mōu | §About you §        §To achieve this you will need to;§        §          §Be a strong and visible leader who engages and motivates staff. §          §Foster best practice in case management§          §Build strong internal and external relationships and make good decisions.§        §        §If you are an experienced people manager or have the communication skills, initiative and leadership qualities to move into a management role then apply now.§ § We will give you the training and support you need to lead your team. § § This is a challenging and rewarding choice; managing a team to make change that matters to individuals, their families and their communities.§        § The salary band for this role is $93,793 - $110,344.§        §Mō mātou | §About us§§        §Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential.  Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities. §        § §        §Tono ināianei | Apply Now§        §To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama Aotearoa and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role.  §        §It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§        §For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§      §      §      §    §  §§§ §Service Manager - Hawera§§Great leadership opportunity§§Based in Hawera§§Play an active role in delivering our Hōkai Rangi outcomes§§Hōkai Rangi [link removed] is Ara Poutama Aotearoa's organisational strategy for the next 5 years. It recognises and builds on the good work we are already doing, however, it also looks to find new and alternative ways to achieve better outcomes for the people in our care and their whānau which will result in reduced reoffending.§A key focus of Hōkai Rangi is the humanising and healing of those people in our care and management.  Ara Poutama Aotearoa staff will focus on having relationships with these people, and their whānau, that are based on manaaki and contribute positively to their wellbeing.§Mō te tūnga | §About the role§§As a Service Manager your role is pivotal to delivering upon this promise.  These roles offer you the opportunity to showcase your ability to achieve outcomes through others, to live the values of Ara Poutama Aotearoa, to prove your capability as a true leader and to show determination to strive for high performance in line with our organisational strategies.  In other words, be a driver of success for Hōkai Rangi, which has a foundation of success of a values-led organisation.§ § With rehabilitation of people in our care being our main focus, a "One Team" approach is paramount to ensure those people in the management of Ara Poutama Aotearoa remain at the centre of our efforts and victims at the centre of our concern. By providing professional leadership in all aspects of practice, legislation and offender management, you will maintain quality standards and ensure statutory obligations in line with Department policy.§  §Mōu | §About you §§To achieve this you will need to;§§Be a strong and visible leader who engages and motivates staff. §Foster best practice in case management§Build strong internal and external relationships and make good decisions.§§If you are an experienced people manager or have the communication skills, initiative and leadership qualities to move into a management role then apply now.§ § We will give you the training and support you need to lead your team. § § This is a challenging and rewarding choice; managing a team to make change that matters to individuals, their families and their communities.§ The salary band for this role is $93,793 - $110,344.§§Mō mātou | §About us§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential.  Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities. § §Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama Aotearoa and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role.  §It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. jobText: TXT/50621387.txt	§Healthy Homes Assessor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Healthy Homes Assessor§§Advertiser: §Sustainability Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$47,000 - $53,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Sustainability Trust is a Wellington-based community enterprise warming up Wellington homes and reducing the environmental footprint of homes and businesses across the region. We do this by assessing and installing insulation, heating and ventilation in residential homes, providing community education workshops, running school programmes, and supporting vulnerable households – especially those experiencing energy hardship and housing-related health issues.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We recognise that warm, dry housing is a fundamental human right and that health and social inequities are borne disproportionately by groups such as Māori and Pasifika. This role will focus on delivery of home assessments to facilitate positive health and social outcomes with predominantly Māori and Pasifika whānau and will involve promoting the Well Homes programmes via relationship building with health and social referral organisations§ §The Well Homes programme is part of the Ministry of Health's Healthy Homes Initiative and in Wellington is delivered by a partnership consisting of Regional Public Health, Tu Kotahi Māori Asthma Trust, Otago University and Sustainability Trust. The successful candidate will work closely with staff at the Trust and other assessors in the partner organisations to achieve effective, and appropriate outcomes for at-risk whānau.§ §The position is a 0.8 to full-time role and will be based at the Trust's central Wellington office with travel throughout the region. Some work out of hours may be required to support promotional activities and meet with whānau. A full, clean drivers licence is required.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Sustainability Trust is proud to be Living Wage Accredited and an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to cultivating a safe, inclusive and multicultural workforce and workplace. Got kids? No worries, so do we. If they take a trip and you need to bolt, we get it. We've been there. We're big fans of the work-life balance.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §We are seeking a stand-out candidate to join our team to provide front-line support and promotion services to whānau in our Well Homes programme. The role includes conducting energy efficiency, social and health assessments in eligible households.§ §We are seeking someone ideally with a social or health background who can deliver our service to whānau in Wellington City, Porirua and Kapiti areas. As the majority of our clients are Māori or Pasifika, experience in working in a kaupapa Māori environment or Pasifika focus would be advantageous.§ §Māori and Pasifika candidates are strongly encouraged to apply for this role, regardless of whether you have the key selection criteria.  We are keen to get the right person for this role and support and training will be provided to ensure you excel in the position.§ §Please refer to https://sustaintrust.org.nz/work-with-us for a full job description. Interested applicants should apply by Friday 16 October, 2020.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Support Worker Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629122.txt	§Support Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Worker§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§ §Full time working in our Mobile Team§Based in Masterton§Join us and bring your personality, commitment, compassion and great ideas!§We’re looking for someone with a good understanding and commitment to the principles of recovery. A real ‘people person’ who can engage with anyone!§ § §Summary§ Are you the support worker we are looking for? Someone who is passionate about supporting people on their recovery journey? If so, then keep reading.§ §We have a position available working full time in our Masterton Mobile Team. You will be working on rotating weeks. Week 1: Sun - Mon from 7.00am to 3.30pm; and Tues - Thurs from 1.30pm to 10.00pm. Week 2: Sun - Mon from 7.00am to 3.30pm; and Tues - Thurs from 10.00am to 6.30pm.§As a mobile support worker, you’ll work as part of a team, visiting people in their homes. You might be kept busy supporting people with budgeting and daily living skills, or attending appointments and advocating for people. You might be assisting people to connect with their communities. You’ll need to be prepared to do whatever it takes.§ § §Pathways§ Transforming mental health and addictions through fostering strong, compassionate self-supporting communities.§ § §You§You must hold a current full driver’s licence and a current first aid certificate, or be willing to obtain one.§Applicants must hold the New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (NZCHW) or a recognised equivalent. Alternatively, you will commence study towards this within six months of starting your employment with Pathways. This needs to be completed within two years of commencement. Pathways offers significant support for support workers to complete this study.§You’re a great listener, the sort of person who will listen deeply to the people who use our services§You’re a fresh thinker, using curiosity, imagination and creativity to generate new ideas§You’re energising, inspiring and able to motivate others with enthusiasm and a joyful, take action approach§You will have willingness to learn about, and work in, a trauma informed way§The Benefits§ In this role, you can look forward to extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its’ purpose. Pathways has a strong Being Well focus. Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§ § Ready to take a closer look at Pathways? Then apply now.§ § §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Sunday 11 October 2020. Please note, this advert may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found.§ § §Position description:§ please copy and paste the following link into your browser:§ https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/uploads/files/position-descriptions/PW_SW.pdf§ § §Contact:§ Hayley Kumar, Team Coach on §0272881219§ if you have any questions.§ § §For further information, visit our website www.pathways.co.nz§ § Pathways is committed to healthy lifestyles and actively supports a smoke free environment. We encourage people with experience of mental illness to apply.§ §**All new appointees into Pathways require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process§.§§§§

jobTitle: Advisor and Senior Advisor - Employment Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670842.txt	§Advisor and Senior Advisor - Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advisor and Senior Advisor - Employment§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Employment Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §Advisor and Senior Advisor - Employment §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35125§        §          §New roles to provide high quality operational advice while working as part of a dynamic team§          §Contribute and support the delivery of key Employment action plans to enhance client experience and outcomes§          §Fixed Term / Secondment roles to June 2021, Wellington based§        §        §Due to the success of the initial pilot programme, the Employment Business Group has been established on a permanent basis. We now further Fixed Term and Secondment opportunities for Advisors and Senior Advisors to join this dynamic team focussed on key employment issues. Working alongside the Directors and the wider Service Delivery Group you will provide technical, operational and analytical advice and support on key employment issues.§        §These roles are highly collaborative, and you will need the confidence and proven ability to develop and manage relationships at all levels across the Ministry and with key stakeholders. You will demonstrate the ability to work at pace to deliver smart solutions to complex problems and provide pragmatic and effective advice.  §        §For these roles you will:§        §          §Have an understanding and keen interest in the key issues facing the Ministry and Government regarding employment.§          §Have proven ability to work collaboratively and responsively in a high-profile sector.§          §Contribute and support work programmes on a broad range of issues to deliver government employment initiatives.§          §Provide high quality advice and subject matter expertise.§          §Have a proven ability to successfully implement policy.§          §Have great relationship management skills, with the ability to engage and influence at all levels.§          §Provide input to identifying issues that may impact on work programmes and delivery.§          §Have proven experience delivering quality work to tight deadlines.§          §Have excellent communication skills including the ability to present clear, concise documentation.§          §Have highly developed analytical skills with the ability to provide robust recommendations.§        §        §If you have a passion for employment issues and wish to help New Zealanders be safe, strong and independent and want to share your knowledge and experience, we’d like to hear from you.§        §How to apply§        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.  All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§        §Applications close 5.00pm Thursday 15th October 2020§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-service-delivery/employment/advisor-employment-jul-20.docx§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-service-delivery/employment/senior-advisor-employment-jul-20.docx§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35125§ § §New roles to provide high quality operational advice while working as part of a dynamic team§ §Contribute and support the delivery of key Employment action plans to enhance client experience and outcomes§ §Fixed Term / Secondment roles to June 2021, Wellington based§ §Due to the success of the initial pilot programme, the Employment Business Group has been established on a permanent basis. We now further Fixed Term and Secondment opportunities for Advisors and Senior Advisors to join this dynamic team focussed on key employment issues. Working alongside the Directors and the wider Service Delivery Group you will provide technical, operational and analytical advice and support on key employment issues.§ §These roles are highly collaborative, and you will need the confidence and proven ability to develop and manage relationships at all levels across the Ministry and with key stakeholders. You will demonstrate the ability to work at pace to deliver smart solutions to complex problems and provide pragmatic and effective advice.  § §For these roles you will:§ § §Have an understanding and keen interest in the key issues facing the Ministry and Government regarding employment.§ §Have proven ability to work collaboratively and responsively in a high-profile sector.§ §Contribute and support work programmes on a broad range of issues to deliver government employment initiatives.§ §Provide high quality advice and subject matter expertise.§ §Have a proven ability to successfully implement policy.§ §Have great relationship management skills, with the ability to engage and influence at all levels.§ §Provide input to identifying issues that may impact on work programmes and delivery.§ §Have proven experience delivering quality work to tight deadlines.§ §Have excellent communication skills including the ability to present clear, concise documentation.§ §Have highly developed analytical skills with the ability to provide robust recommendations.§ §If you have a passion for employment issues and wish to help New Zealanders be safe, strong and independent and want to share your knowledge and experience, we’d like to hear from you.§ §How to apply§ §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.  All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§ §Applications close 5.00pm Thursday 15th October 2020§ §Position Description§ §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-service-delivery/employment/advisor-employment-jul-20.docx§ §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-service-delivery/employment/senior-advisor-employment-jul-20.docx§ §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

(The perfect candidate will be given training)§ §A desire to work alongside whānau and their tamariki.§ §Strong administration skills and computer literacy.§ §Be motivated, well organised and have excellent communication skills (written and oral)§ §Ability to demonstrate the values of Te Tiriti o Waitangi when engaging and working with Māori and high needs whānau.§ §To be committed to ensuring our tamariki get the best possible start in life.§ §A full New Zealand driver’s licence.§ §Your own vehicle.§ §Te Hononga o Tamaki me Hoturoa offers:§ § §Full induction and on-going professional development§ §First Aid training§ §Support and education around Māori protocol/Tikanga Māori§ §A supportive, close-knit team environment§ §Support in personal wellness and further education§ §Competitive NGO remuneration in line with qualifications and experience§ §If you believe you are the right fit for this role, apply now!§ §A copy of the position description and application form can be obtained by emailing §joannas@tehononga.org.nz§.  For further information regarding the roles please phone Rebecca 022 618 7811§ §Completed applications, accompanied by a CV and cover letter marked “Private & Confidential” can be forwarded to:§ §Te Hononga o Tāmaki me Hoturoa§ §c/- Joanna Singh§ §PO Box 22588 Otahuhu 1640§ §The closing date for applications is 10th October 2020§ §Te Hononga O Tamaki Me Hoturoa is an Equal Opportunity Employer§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a support worker?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50640268.txt	§Quit Coach - Pasifika§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Quit Coach - Pasifika§§Advertiser: §Aidmax Recruiting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§ §Recruit, coach and support § §Achieve great outcomes § §The Fono's Stop Smoking Service§ §About the role § §This is a multi-faceted role.  You are the representative of the Ready Steady Quit ProCare/The Fono Stop Smoking Service with Pacific peoples across the ADHB and WDHB regions.  Looking to connect and engage with Pasifika males (particularly Samoan male).  As a recruiter (Seeker) you will use the Ready Steady Quit central referral service leads, health networks, community involvements and activities to actively seek out people who wish to stop smoking.§ §The second phase for a Seeker is to take referrals and direct contacts with people who smoke and wish to stop and encourage them to enter a stepped, supported programme (one on one or Group) to quit.   The Seeker then becomes the Quit Coach. A service delivery practitioner delivering stop smoking outcomes as provided for in the Regional / Local Stop Smoking Contract from the Ministry of Health. § §Quit Coaches work with smokers and support them through their quit journey using evidence based face to face and group based treatment.  Where appropriate this is in partnership with their family (whanau/aiga) and, community organisations and employers who will also support them in their attempt to be smoke free. There is full support within The Fono Community Services Team and through the wider ProCare / The Fono Stop Smoking Service (Ready Steady Quit)§ §About you§ § §A genuine desire to assist people stop smoking and have New Zealand achieve Smokefree 2025§ §Ability to "sell" The Fono stop smoking service message to Fono colleagues, health and community network partners§ §Pacific peoples focus – a Samoan language capability may be an advantage§ §NTS Stop Smoking Practitioner qualified / enrolled or will enrol in the course§ §Group behavioural therapy (GBT) training will be required as targets can only be met if a substantial number of clients stop smoking via GBT sessions§ §Work flexibility – being available when our target smokers need us§ §Drivers licence necessary§ §Non-smoker (of course)§ §Find out more / apply:§ §For an application form, job description or further details contact Anthony 027 272 3388 or text RSQ to §0212713333§ with your email or respond to this advertisement and send your details – §recruiter@aidmax.co.nz§ §putting RSQ in the subject line.§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50606432.txt	§Kaitiaki / House Support: Awhina House§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaitiaki / House Support: Awhina House§§Advertiser: §Awhina House§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Salary§§$22.10 per hour: Living Wage position§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Awhina House is an 11-bed transitional housing residence offering temporary accommodation and support for homeless women in Tauranga who would like to eventually secure and maintain a tenancy of their own.§Awhina House is founded on the values of Awhi (care), Aroha (love), Manaakitanga (hospitality), Rangatiratanga (self-determination) and Whanau (family)§As Kaitiaki / House Support Person you will work alongside our transitional housing residents who are all women who have experienced homelessness. You will supervise and support the day-to-day running of the house. Duties include assistance with meal preparation and evening tasks and general Housekeeping duties.§Your work hours will cover Thursday and Friday split shifts and weekend day shifts. Additional shifts may be offered as and when available.§As a key part of the Awhina House team you will ensure that the values and tikanga of Awhina is understood and respected by all residents. You will be a flexible team player who is well-organised with the ability to connect with people from diverse backgrounds.§No two days will be the same! This is a challenging and rewarding role and you have the opportunity to be part of a team bringing real change to women's lives.§You will:§Build positive and honest relationships with individuals living with long-term, complex issues§Ensure that health and safety standards are adhered to§Ensure that Awhina house is run in accordance with the policies in place§About you:§You are a flexible team player§You are unflappable and have the confidence to work in a group situation§You lead by example and demonstrate leadership qualities§You are non-judgemental of people regardless of their background§You may have had some experience of working with homeless and/or vulnerable people§You possess a mature, sensible, positive and calm approach to life§You have life experience with an ability to read a situation and react accordingly§You are well organised and willing to pitch in when necessary§Preferred candidates would have had some experience in de-escalation in a work or voluntary setting§Good cultural awareness and an understanding of Te Ao Maori me Tikanga§NZ citizen or permanent resident§Key tasks:§Supervising morning and evening routines and supporting dinner preparation§Housekeeping duties, ensuring the House is clean and well-maintained§Supporting rostered volunteers§Maintaining a cooperative and respectful home environment§Communicating the tikanga and values of Awhina house in a respectful way to all who enter§Informing the appropriate person/s of issues that may arise in a prompt and timely fashion§Remaining vigilant about the rights of the women staying at Awhina house to confidentiality and privacy§Communicating with team members around resident needs§Engaging in feedback and evaluation§Encouraging meal-planning and role modelling cooking skills§Abiding by all Awhina House policies & procedures§Monitoring of self-administered medications§Ensuring the safe storage of medication§Hours of work:§Minimum 26 hours per week§Thursday and Friday split shift 7am - 9.30am and 4.15pm - 7.45pm§Saturday and Sunday 7am - 2.30pm§Additional shifts may be offered as and when available§Required skills:§Excellent administration and computer skills§An understanding of the Privacy Act, 1993§Ability to incorporate the principles of The Treaty of Waitangi into practice§Mental health and/ or addictions training in harm reduction desirable§Experience of working with people in crisis and/or have experienced trauma desirable§Current First Aid Certificate - training can be provided for the right candidate§De-escalation skills - if you are the right person we are prepared to provide training§Full NZ Drivers Licence§Awhina House is a Smokefree Workplace.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§
