jobText: TXT/50616935.txt	§Kaiarahi§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaiarahi§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§§Four permanent, full-time roles, Whakatakapokai, Auckland§About us - Mō mātou§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do.§In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:§We put Tamariki first§We believe Aroha is vital§We respect the Mana of people§We are Tika and Pono§We value Whakapapa§We recognise that Oranga is a journey§About the residence - E pa ana ki te Kāenga§Our Youth Justice Residences provide a safe, secure and supportive environment where rangatahi in our care can make changes to get their lives back on track. Whakatakapokai is one of five Youth Justice Residences operating across Aotearoa that operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week providing residential placements and programmes for rangatahi aged 13 to 19 years who have been charged with or convicted of an offence.§Our vision at Whakatakapokai is to create a unique, culturally focused, therapeutic, safe and restorative care environment that enables rangatahi to strengthen their connection with whānau, hapū, iwi and their culture; and develop the skills to make positive decisions to support them to flourish and transform their lives, reducing the risk of reoffending.§Whakatakapokai is strongly focused on achieving positive change in rangatahi through education, skill development, vocational programmes, and therapeutic and cultural interventions using a Māori world centric view (Te Ao Māori). Our overall goal is that rangatahi who come into our care are positively integrated back into their community and reduce the risk of reoffending with their mana restored.§About the role - Mō te tūnga§The role of the Kaiārahi is to lead and inspire a team of dedicated professional staff to ensure rangatahi receive quality youth justice services, that help them take responsibility for their actions with the aim of reducing reoffending.§The Kaiārahi will manage the operational team on the floor, including risk mitigation in relation to the rangatahi in care, planning shifts for the team, arranging resources and allocating tasks. Their responsibility will also include ensuring that structured days are stimulating and purposeful to meet the individual needs of rangatahi. This role will provide a continuous learning and coaching function of youth workers to ensure that appropriate models of behaviour are demonstrated by acknowledging the positive personal influence each interaction can have on the life and outcomes of rangatahi.§The role will involve:§§providing team management and leadership in a supportive Te Ao Māori environment§fostering people development through coaching and mentoring§building a culturally competent and effective team through ongoing cultural development and support§providing leadership to the team on Whakamana Tangata§developing new and creative solutions to operational challenges and practice gaps within a secure Residence§ensuring a strong focus on outcomes for all rangatahi§the ability to work on rostered shifts which include, weekends, nights and public holidays.§About you - Mōu§To apply for this role, you must demonstrate the following qualifications and experience:§Have worked in one of the fields below§Youth or criminal justice, law, psychology, sociology, criminology, management, te reo and kaupapa Māori§Youth work, or teaching and learning support, childcare and parenting services§Social work - counselling, mental health, substance misuse, working with vulnerable people§Therapeutic practice, mental health, nursing and healthcare§Coaching, sport, health, fitness§Risk management experience within a complex regulatory environment, including interpretation and application of legislation and statutory powers§A full, clean driver's licence§We are looking for candidates who demonstrate the following skills and behaviours:§Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal§Aptitude to provide leadership, coaching, mentoring, and enhancing capability in people§Strong relationship management skills including engaging with a wide range of stakeholders including iwi and whānau§The ability to collaborate with others and work as one team§A commitment to Oranga Tamariki's Māori cultural framework§§Click here to view the role description§§How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please contact §kristianne.hoey@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50657008.txt	§Team Leader Kairaranga-ā-whānau - Tāmaki Makaurau (South)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Leader Kairaranga-ā-whānau - Tāmaki Makaurau (South)§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Maranga Mai! You will work to challenge and promote opportunities for your team, so that they can bridge the Kairaranga ā-Whānau team's mahi with iwi, hapū and whanau. You will be responsible for providing development and supervision to your team and driving continuous improvement to ensure a high standard of Māori centred practice across Oranga Tamariki.§In this role you will be working across the following areas:§People Leadership§Cultural Competence from a Te Ao Māori Perspective§Partnering with mana whenua, whakapapa iwi and service partners§Development/Continuous Improvement§Relationship/Stakeholder Engagement§Risk Management§Mōu - About you§We are looking for candidates who are passionate about making a difference for tamariki Māori.§If you demonstrate the following skills/experience, we would love for you to apply:§A sound understanding of the whānau dynamic within Te Ao Māori context§Ability to participate confidently and competently in situations that involve Mātauranga Māori and Te Reo Māori§Strong leadership experience across different locations§Support of mana whenua, broader iwi and Māori focussed approaches§Experience developing capability through coaching and mentoring§Experience building and maintaining relationships with Iwi, hapū, whanau, and community groups§Ability to identify and effectively manage risk§Demonstrated relevant experience in similar role or practice background§Click here to view the role description§§Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to apply§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal.For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site, please do not email through applications and/or CVs.If you have any questions about the role, please contact §naomi.houston@ot.govt.nz§Applications close on Tuesday, 13 October 2020§ but get your application in as soon as possible as we are wanting to move quickly.§Position description§http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/team-leader-kairaranga-wh-nau.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50622584.txt	§Whānau Ora Navigator  – Te Tuapapa o te Ora§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Whānau Ora Navigator  – Te Tuapapa o te Ora§§Advertiser: §Raukawa Charitable Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Whānau Ora Navigator – Te Tuapapa o te Ora §      §        §The Whānau Ora Navigator (Kaiārahi) – Te Tuapapa o te Ora role is a full time, fixed term position.§        §Are you inspired by working with whānau, and empowering them as they make positive changes to their lives?§        §The Raukawa Charitable Trust (RCT) has been a provider of quality community initiatives throughout the South Waikato since 1987, and we are proud to deliver a wide range of iwi-led initiatives in health, social, treaty, cultural, and environmental sectors, to the communities that we serve.§        §The Whānau Ora Navigator (Kaiārahi) – Te Tuapapa o te Ora roles have been funded for a short term period to focus on addressing essential needs of whānau, with a specific focus on kai – preparation, cooking healthy and nutritious meals, menu planning and buying within a budget. Our Kaiarahi will  also work with whānau to ensure they have sufficient cooking utensils; and to prepare, plant and grow a kai garden. The aim is to assist whānau to improve their knowledge and practice in healthy eating and physical activity.§        §The Whānau Ora Navigator (Kaiārahi) – Te Tuapapa o te Ora role will provide whānau with support, mentoring and coaching in order to develop and implement plans to meet their essential needs. Whānau Ora plans assist whānau by providing focus, direction and opportunities using an all of whānau approach to family growth, development and wellbeing. Plans include educational, social, health, cultural and economic advancement that is self-directed, empowering and strongly whānau centred. §        §We offer:§        §          §Ongoing development and training opportunities §          §Christmas holidays each year due to a Christmas close-down§          §Monday to Friday business hours, supportive of employee friendly work-life balance§          §A dynamic team environment§          §Friendly team culture§          §Fun organisation-wide events planned throughout the year to recognise staff members and their contributions§          §Use of a vehicle whilst on duty, plus mobile phone§          §Health Insurance for all eligible employees.§        §        §The successful candidates will possess:§        §          §Experience in a role that provides support either to an individual or to whānau§          §Budgeting experience§          §Experience with preparing, planting and growing kai / gardens§          §The ability to confidently utilise service providers to fully benefit our clients§          §The ability to coach, support and mentor and assess the needs of our clients§          §The ability to write aspirational plans and regularly evaluate and review them.§        §        §Applicants must hold a valid and full Class 1 drivers licence, and be prepared to undergo Police vetting.§        §Please include a CV in chronological order, and a cover letter with your application.  Applications close Friday 9 October 2020.§        §Raukawa Charitable Trust operates under a Smoke-free Environment policy. For more info about the Raukawa Charitable Trust visit §www.raukawa.org.nz §        §For a copy of the Job Description visit §2008-PD-Whanau-Ora-Navigator-Kaiarahi---Te-Tuapapa-full-time.pdf§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Whānau Ora Navigator (Kaiārahi) – Te Tuapapa o te Ora role is a full time, fixed term position.§Are you inspired by working with whānau, and empowering them as they make positive changes to their lives?§The Raukawa Charitable Trust (RCT) has been a provider of quality community initiatives throughout the South Waikato since 1987, and we are proud to deliver a wide range of iwi-led initiatives in health, social, treaty, cultural, and environmental sectors, to the communities that we serve.§The Whānau Ora Navigator (Kaiārahi) – Te Tuapapa o te Ora roles have been funded for a short term period to focus on addressing essential needs of whānau, with a specific focus on kai – preparation, cooking healthy and nutritious meals, menu planning and buying within a budget. Our Kaiarahi will  also work with whānau to ensure they have sufficient cooking utensils; and to prepare, plant and grow a kai garden. The aim is to assist whānau to improve their knowledge and practice in healthy eating and physical activity.§The Whānau Ora Navigator (Kaiārahi) – Te Tuapapa o te Ora role will provide whānau with support, mentoring and coaching in order to develop and implement plans to meet their essential needs. Whānau Ora plans assist whānau by providing focus, direction and opportunities using an all of whānau approach to family growth, development and wellbeing. Plans include educational, social, health, cultural and economic advancement that is self-directed, empowering and strongly whānau centred. §We offer:§  §Ongoing development and training opportunities §  §Christmas holidays each year due to a Christmas close-down§  §Monday to Friday business hours, supportive of employee friendly work-life balance§  §A dynamic team environment§  §Friendly team culture§  §Fun organisation-wide events planned throughout the year to recognise staff members and their contributions§  §Use of a vehicle whilst on duty, plus mobile phone§  §Health Insurance for all eligible employees.§The successful candidates will possess:§  §Experience in a role that provides support either to an individual or to whānau§  §Budgeting experience§  §Experience with preparing, planting and growing kai / gardens§  §The ability to confidently utilise service providers to fully benefit our clients§  §The ability to coach, support and mentor and assess the needs of our clients§  §The ability to write aspirational plans and regularly evaluate and review them.§Applicants must hold a valid and full Class 1 drivers licence, and be prepared to undergo Police vetting.§Please include a CV in chronological order, and a cover letter with your application.  Applications close Friday 9 October 2020.§Raukawa Charitable Trust operates under a Smoke-free Environment policy. You will enjoy developing your team and making a real difference with your work. §  §The role is part time, up to 30 hours per week.§  § §  §The Organisation§  §Dwell Housing Trust is a community housing provider that provides quality affordable and social housing to people in need in the Wellington region.  We are more than a landlord and we want our tenants to “live well, be well, do well – with Dwell”.§  § §  §Skills and Experience§  §The successful applicant will have:§ § §Proven management experience§ §Experience in tenancy or property management or a related field§ §Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancies Act§ §Excellent communication and relationship skills§ §Highly developed organisation skills, able to juggle multiple demands on their time§ §Great problem solving ability, looks beyond the obvious and doesn't stop at the first answers if needed.§ § §  §To get the position description and to find out more about Dwell please go to our website www.dwell.org.nz If you want to know more please email §work@dwell.org.nz§ §  §If you wish to apply please send us your CV and a cover letter. Applications close at 9am on Monday 12 October 2020.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How many hours are you available to work per week?§§§

Our aim is to reach out and disciple people of all ages and nationalities and to see them becoming fruitful Christians.The Youth Pastor position is for 20 hours (negotiable) and the Young Adults Pastor’s position is for 10 hours (negotiable). jobTitle: Casual Support Worker Job in Marlborough - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649129.txt	§Casual Support Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Casual Support Worker§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Casual Support Worker roles available in Blenheim§Unique opportunity to join a highly regarded national mental health provider§Supportive work environment, generous benefits, values-based organisation§We’re looking for casual support workers to join our team, supporting our 24-hour, 7 day a week services.§ § §Summary§ Hi! We’re Pathways, and we’ve been delivering community-based mental health and wellbeing services in the Marlborough region, with a base in Blenheim since 1 February 2020.§ § Our staff are our greatest asset. So, one of our top priorities is to recruit an incredible local team of people who are as passionate as we are about supporting people experiencing mental illness to live well in the Marlborough community.§ § §The role§ We’re looking for casual support workers to work in our Marlborough teams, based in Blenheim.§ § Casual roles provide cover for permanent Support Workers - the hours of work are not regular and are offered when they become available, so we need people who can be flexible and available for varying shifts. We operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week with a mixture of morning shifts, afternoon shifts and awake night shifts. The hours vary slightly depending on the needs of each service. These roles will all report to their relevant Team Coach.§ § As a casual support worker you will always have variety in your work. You will need to be prepared to do whatever it takes for the people we support - cleaning, cooking, gardening, personal care or helping out with everyday household tasks. On a given shift you might be supporting with budgeting and independent daily living skills, attending appointments and advocating for people, or you might be assisting people to connect with their communities.§ § §About you§ You’ll have a caring nature and the ability to work with people from a person-centered approach. You’ll always work in a recovery focused way and have impeccable attention to detail, and you’ll definitely hold a full New Zealand driver’s licence.§ § You will either hold the New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (or a recognised equivalent) or be willing to commence study towards this qualification within six months of starting with us. We offer our staff significant support to complete this study. To work in our respite services you will need to hold the New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (or a recognised equivalent), or be currently studying towards this.§ § Words we use to describe our attributes as an organisation include courageous, curious, optimistic, compassionate, joyful, tenacious, creative and connectors. You’ll relate whole heartedly to this list and share our people-focused values.§ § §About us§ At Pathways we're passionate about supporting people with experience of mental illness or addictions - we’ve been dedicated to it for 30 years. We provide community-based mental health, addiction and wellbeing services throughout New Zealand, supporting around 6000 adults and young people in communities all through New Zealand each year to live well in the communities of their choice.§ § §The Benefits§ In this role, you’ll attract the new pay rates introduced as part of the pay equity settlement and have a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its purpose.§ § Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§ § Ready to take a closer look at Pathways? Then apply now.§ § §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ 11 October 2020. Please note, this advert may close early if a suitable candidates are found.§ § §Position description:§ please copy and paste the following link into your browser:§ https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/uploads/files/position-descriptions/PW_CSW.pdf§ § §Contact:§ Anne Barnes on 027 243 1274 if you have any questions.§ § §For further information, visit our website www.pathways.co.nz§ § Pathways is committed to healthy lifestyles and actively supports a smoke free environment. We encourage people with experience of mental illness to apply.§ § **All new appointees into Pathways require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§§§§§

You will need to provide leadership and professional supervision to Social Workers. You will need to meet all reporting requirements and ensure full compliance of recording. But most importantly, you will be mentoring and assisting your team to continuously improve the services they provide.  You will also be given opportunities to gain new experience and grow in this role.§To be a good fit for this role you will need:§ §Qualification in Social Work, recognised by the Social Work Registration Board (SWRB)§SWRB Registration with a current APC §Proven experience managing and supervising a team (Certificate in Clinical Supervision would be desirable)§A high degree of both verbal and written communication skills§Ability to build and nurture relationships§Previous training and experience in trauma informed practice§Applicants require New Zealand citizenship or residency § §If you are ready to mentor, supervise and support an amazing team of Social Workers that make a difference in our communities then please apply now!§§§§

jobTitle: Service Manager Job in Canterbury - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50608227.txt	§Service Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Service Manager§§Advertiser: §Brackenridge§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Brackenridge is a not for profit organisation that provides support to children, young people and adults with intellectual disabilities and/or autism in Canterbury.  At the core of our practice philosophy is our belief in all people and the rights of all to live in and be part of the community, and to exercise citizenship.  We have over 350 staff in a variety of roles that provide support services for people across a wide age range.  §  §We are growing and are looking for another Service Manager to join the team.§  §This role is an exciting opportunity to establish a new service.  We have been working with Oranga Tamariki to provide an intensive service to young people with high and complex support needs.  This role presents the opportunity to develop this service from the ground up.  This role will be dynamic and challenging with the potential to offer a great sense of reward working with some of our most vulnerable young people in our community.§  §Apart from standing up a new service the key aspect of the role will be responding to emerging change in the sector to ensure our clients have access to quality service, provided in the way that is right for them.§  §The role requires the management of team leaders and community support workers who provide support to our clients and also the business management of a group of homes in the community to ensure their ongoing viability.  §  §We are looking for someone with demonstrated leadership and management experience and the ability to understand and work with the people we support to meet their full potential. The successful person will need to be resilient, flexible, open to thinking innovatively and have a strong customer focus.§  §This position would best suit someone with a health or social service-related qualification.  While knowledge of the intellectual disability sector or the youth sector is preferred it is not essential.  §  §We are looking for someone with demonstrated leadership and management experience and the ability to understand and work with the people we support to meet their full potential. Flexibility and openness to think innovatively and act quickly and with a strong customer focus is highly desirable.§  §If you would like to be considered for this role apply directly on line with your cover letter and CV via the Application portal.§  §Applications close at 5pm 6 October 2020§  §Applicants for this position must have the right to work in New Zealand.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

We are seeking an organised confident communicator who can enthusiastically share our vision and mission.§ §This is a part-time role with some flexibility for the successful candidate. Functioning as a part of a small office team the role encompasses a mixture of "donor contact” communications responsibilities, data entry and processing and coordinating grant applications. The successful candidate will have strengths in computer literacy, communication skills and attention to detail.§ §ICHC is dedicated to providing Chaplaincy (Spiritual Care) services within Aotearoa New Zealand’s healthcare environment. We are committed to principles of partnership expressed in the Treaty of Waitangi.§ §We are purposeful in promoting, maintaining and developing relevant and flexible Chaplaincy services to all those within Aotearoa New Zealand’s Public Hospitals regardless of religious affiliation, faith orientation, belief system, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation. § §ICHC comprises a broad composition of Churches and the primary purpose of our ministry is to offer Spiritual Care that is patient and whānau centred. jobText: TXT/50704058.txt	§Search and Rescue Supervisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Search and Rescue Supervisor§§Advertiser: §Surf Life Saving Northern Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§Surf Life Saving Northern Region (SLSNR) is the lead provider of aquatic rescue and education services from Raglan to Kaitaia. Our high profile services are delivered through the regions 17 Surf Lifesaving Clubs, volunteers and paid staff in the areas of beach safety, education and sporting activities.§  § §  §Preventing injury and drowning through the provision of a regional 'integrated Lifeguard service' provided by volunteer and paid Lifeguards, underpinned by a Regional Support Service team, is at the heart of what we do. It is an exciting, challenging and rewarding role, being responsible for the Surf Life Saving Northern Region Search and Rescue service and radio network.  SLSNR is seeking a Search and Rescue Supervisor who will support the lifesaving team and provide a valuable service.§  §The core responsibilities include, but are not limited to;§ § §Manage and train Club Emergency Call Out Squads to ensure all squads are rescue ready.§ §Represent SLSNR at National SAR training and meetings§ §Travel to SLSNR Surf Clubs to administer training, assist with incident debriefing were required and to engage with SLSNR lifesaving patrols.§ §SLSNR staff lead for active critical incidents and management of staff critical incident roster§ §Be part of the Staff Duty Officer roster§ §Management of SurfCom operations including managing and overseeing the training of SurfCom operators§ §Digital response assets such as the St John MDT§ §Search and Rescue liaison person for SLSNZ, NZ Police, St John and other emergency partners§ §Work with Lifesaving Manager and Patrol Operations Supervisor to develop standard operating procedures§ §Manage the Duty Officers (both paid and volunteer) including training and rostering§ §Manage the roster and functionality of the Peer Support§ §Maintain radio network functionality to support all SLSNR Search and Rescue functions.§ §Be the media lead for all SLSNR search and rescue incidents and activities.§ §Develop and enhance compliance of HSWA, SLSNZ/SLSNR policies and procedures.§ §To monitor communication equipment including radio network and camera network to ensure high risk areas along the coastline are identified and monitored with a target of 100% compliance with Standard operating procedures at all time§ §To complete ad hoc projects as requested by the Lifesaving Manager.§ §Conduct investigations into incidents, communicating ‘lessons learned’ to the Lifesaving Manager.§ §Oversee the review and implementation of the annual Service Agreements with Police Search and Rescue§ § §Training§  § §Consult with SLSNZ, SLSNR Regional Lifeguard Management and Clubs to ensure Search and Rescue training meets the needs of the clubs, members and external customer(s) § §To oversee recruitment, training and development of new staff and volunteer SurfCom Operators§ §To §promote §a continuous improvement atmosphere§ §To §raise §issues and/or concerns with the Lifesaving manager.  § §Undertake and participate in a training needs analysis, developing and revising qualifications and training programmes as required § §All activities undertaken are completed are in line with the SLSNR Strategic and operations plans.§ §Ensure the training provided by SLSNR is ‘fit for purpose’ and to a high calibre, benchmarked against industry standards § §Ensure the training provided by SLSNR clubs is provided to a uniform standard § § §General§  § §Liaise with finance team to ensure quotations, invoicing, payroll activities are You will be part of a team who makes bold and courageous decisions to protect our tamariki and rangatahi. As a Supervisor you will also uphold best practices and adhere to providing the best possible care and delivery of services. You will also need to portray a strong professional ethics and a holistic approach that is client-centered and strengths-based.§With a well-developed leadership skill, you will be supporting the team to work creatively and constructively with our clients and stakeholders to address individual and social needs. jobTitle: HIPPY Coordinator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50600237.txt	§HIPPY Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HIPPY Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Greenstone Doors Charitable Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Salary§§$55,000 - $60,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§About us§Greenstone Doors Charitable Trust supports families through difficult times in their lives, working in the community to provide practical and emotional support.  §Services include free counselling, support groups such as Wellbeing for Women and Young Parents Programme, Tane Talks and Great Fathers, free baby clothing and HIPPY.  §HIPPY is a home based early education programme working in 40 low income communities around NZ. HIPPPY serves families from diverse ethnic and geographic groups across the country, particularly those most at risk because of poverty, parents limited education and social isolation. Two generations  benefit through HIPPY's contribution to both early childhood education and parenting education an support resulting in: Improving skills, confidence and educational outcomes of children; increasing parents' participation in their children's education and wider communities; supporting parents into further education and employment.  §§Qualifications & experience§§A tertiary qualification in education, social sciences or human services, and experience in teaching, social work, psychology or community work.§Experience with young children§Experience in adult education or counselling§Experience coordinating school or community based projects§Knowledge of the lives and living conditions of the target population. Commitment and sensitivity to working wit lower income and multi-cultural communities. §Strong leadership qualities.§Administrative ability.§Strong verbal and written skills and ability to interact comfortably in the community§Ability to promote inter-agency liaison in support of the programme.§Ability to work under the guidance of a local advisory group§§§Tasks & responsibilities§§As the HIPPY Coordinator, you will have primary responsibility for all aspects of local programme implementation and management.§Ensure the planned number of families are recruited for each years intake. Conduct the initial interview and enroll the parent in their home.§Interview and select tutors from amongst the target families. Provide weekly training sessions, individual delivery updates, and regular home visit supervisions. Provide professional development for tutors leading to future employment or study. §Deal with specific problems concerning the implementation of the programme in the homes.§Plan and guide group meetings and coordinate with various community elements involved in the programme.§Report regularly to HIPPY NZ at Greenstone Doors which provides ongoing instruction and advice and support. §Participate in national meeting and workshops for coordinators.§Plan and facilitate  workshops for tutors at Regional Training§Be responsible for administration and accountability connected with the local operation of the programme.§§§§§

We have an exciting new opportunity for an experienced Team Leader to join our Care Services team at Kaahui Whetuu, in the role of Team Leader Clinical Programmes. Kaahui Whetuu provides residential care to tamariki and rangatahi in a community setting. We work to keep our young people connected to the positive influences in their lives - mentors, whānau, work and community-based programmes.§A key focus of this role is to ensure the care team around each young person have appropriate clinical advice and support to ensure therapeutic services are tailored in line with a consistent therapeutic approach that encompasses the stories and needs of our young people as individuals.§What you will do?§Ensure that interventions, programmes and steps are put in place for each tamariki and rangatahi that effectively addresses underlying trauma, health, leadership, support, supervision, skills and knowledge§Provide oversight to ensure accurate documentation of clinical assessments, plans and interventions§Develop local and regional relationships with for example  our room booking system, Health and Safety, Volunteers group administration§If you are organised, enjoy getting the details right to support everyone in your team, have good computer skills, great energy, enjoy interacting with everyone from the community while also getting tasks done, we would love to hear from you §§§Tasks & responsibilities§§To support the work of the South Dunedin Community Network by providing high quality, day to day administration, with attention to detail and care for our people. §Running the behind the scenes administration of our network, involving for example: managing room booking calendars, Health and safety and maintenance tasks, organising the logistics of sessions such as volunteer training sessions or any other activity for the network, §Interacting and connecting with any and every member of our community depending on what is required on the day, either through email, social media updates, visitors to our community rooms, meetings. §being an involved team member within the Community Network team, pitching in and helping to get the job done! this might mean helping on a sausage sizzle one day, and taking minutes for a local network meeting the next. §§§Benefits§§Be part of a team that we are building to grow, celebrate and connect the South Dunedin community§Learn and be part of Community Led Development§Car Parking available §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50653859.txt	§National Coordinator - Donor Relationship Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Coordinator - Donor Relationship Management§§Advertiser: §CCS Disability Action§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Fundraising§§§§§§CCS Disability Action's vision is to see every disabled person included in the life of their family and community.§ §We have been working with disabled people and their families since 1935 and are now at the forefront of service provision, advocacy and information sharing in the disability sector New Zealand-wide. Our people are professional, innovative, dedicated and knowledgeable. We hold ourselves to the highest possible ethical and professional standards and are known for our partnership approach to support.§ §An exciting new position is available to join our team as our National Coordinator – Donor Relationship Management.  In this role you will work to ensure our donor relationship management programme (including regular supporters) is carried out efficiently and effectively and that our relationships with donors (current and future) and other financial supporters are of the highest quality. § §Our ideal candidate will have:§ § §Experience in direct marketing, Face2Face, donor relationship management and development;§ §Database analysis and segmentation experience;§ §Major donor relationship building and bequests knowledge;§ §Outstanding written, electronic and in-person communication skills;§ §Experience in a service delivery, community-based organisation;§ §Understanding of the disability sector and ability to relate to disabled people in a positive affirming manner;§ §Innovative thinking, with proven ability to find new approaches and solutions;§ §A strong focus on planning for deliverables and results;§ §Capability in meeting financial targets in a fundraising or related environment;§ §Excellent relationship management and presentation skills;§ §Knowledge of the not for profit sector;§ §A tertiary qualification or management experience to an equivalent level; and§ §Experience in being part of a performance-focused team.§ §CCS Disability Action builds our work around three core documents; UN Convention of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, Te Tiriti o Waitangi and the NZ Disability Strategy.§ §We work within a Human Rights framework and are committed to equal opportunity in all our employment policies and procedures. We welcome enquiries from everyone and value diversity in our workforce. This position offers you flexibility in how you manage the role and we openly encourage people with lived experience of disability to apply§ §To view the job description and request an application form please contact Vanessa Palmer on §Vanessa.Palmer@ccsDisabilityAction.org.nz§ §Applications (including CV and cover letter) need to be received by 5pm, Friday 16th October 2020.§§§§

jobTitle: Community Activities and Fun Times Caregiver Extraordinaire Job in Auckland - SEEK
advertiser: Try the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.
jobText: TXT/50620994.txt	§Community Activities and Fun Times Caregiver Extraordinaire§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Activities and Fun Times Caregiver Extraordinaire§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$25 - $33 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Overview: §The carer will support a young man with intellectual disability to participate safely in outdoor and community activities, and enjoy a full life. § §About the role: §The role is to support Ben across three key areas: respite care, which includes support with daily activities and general ‘looking after’; personal cares, which includes assistance with showering and toileting; and household management, which includes support with household chores. Our preference is for one person to be employed across all three functions, providing them with more potential hours of work and supporting the relationship development between Ben and his caregiver. § §The role is fortnightly, every other week as Ben has other care arrangements every second week. While specific hours and days will be negotiated with the right candidate, our preference is for the caregiver to start by working 3 days per week (fortnightly) for at least 6 hours per day. We anticipate that these hours/days may increase once Ben and his caregiver develop rapport and relationship.§ §There will be planned and set activities for each day, which will include home-based days (housework, swimming in the pool, farm chores, or walking to local parks/beaches); local outings (e.g., day trips to Parakai, the zoo, the Auckland domain etc); regional outings (e.g., day trips to Waiheke, Goat Island, Tawharanui etc). All costs including kai will be prepaid (or reimbursed) and all mileage will be reimbursed.§ §About the client: §The client Ben is an active, energetic young man with severe Autism. He is mostly non-verbal. Once you can interpret his gestures/language he is able to communicate his personal wants and needs at a minimal level. Ben is non-violent, however he does have some challenging behaviours and requires constant supervision to ensure his safety. § §Ben thrives when there is routine and predictability, but also enjoys a wide variety of activities. He is very energetic and loves plenty of outside time – walks, swims, hikes. He also is a wanderer at heart – so he loves trips in the car, bussing, training, and boating. § §Ben needs support to manage his safety while out and about and at home. Ben has no road safety awareness and needs support to cross roads and negotiate his space around cars. He also has some additional challenging behaviours such as §PICA§.§ §Salary and contract expectations: §The role will have regular hours and as such will be classified as fixed-term, part time. The fixed-term nature of the contract is due to the funding renewal process. The salary will be between $25 and $33 per hour, depending on experience and fit, and will be re-negotiated after 6 months.§ §About the caregiver: §We are looking for someone ready to muck in, learn, and be active in this role. We hope to find someone that will be excited about the opportunity to empower a young, disabled, and very sweet man to enjoy and participate fully in his life. They will need to know how to exert authority when needed (they need have a good outside voice) and will need to develop some level of mental telepathy! The role also requires someone with a reasonable level of personal fitness in order to keep up with Ben while out and about. The successful candidate must also have a full clean drivers’ licence and access to own vehicle.§ §The role could potentially suit a variety of candidates from a range of backgrounds. What we are looking for in an ideal candidate is someone that is responsible, genuine, fun, outdoorsy, and kind, that will take the lead in supporting Ben's daily activities during their shifts. We know that the right person might have any background or level of experience. It’s all about finding the right fit!§ §To apply: §click 'apply now' - please include a cover letter detailing why you are interested in the position and what you would bring to the role, and a copy of your CV.§ §Note: The role is based in Muriwai, Auckland§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Perpetrator Outreach Services / Youth Mentoring Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50591929.txt	§Perpetrator Outreach Services / Youth Mentoring§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Perpetrator Outreach Services / Youth Mentoring§§Advertiser: §Caps Hauraki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Thames & Coromandel§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Perpetrator Outreach Services / Youth Mentoring§ §CAPS Hauraki (child abuse prevention services) multidisciplinary team work together to make a difference in the lives of families within our local communities. § §Are you passionate about creating change, supporting families to live free from violence, fear and abuse whilst working constructively and creatively?§ §This dual role will predominantly focus on providing perpetrator outreach support and programmes for adults who use violence within a family violence context.  Alongside this, a small caseload of youth clients needing your support to achieve their potential will make for a varied and stimulating role.  Services are provided within Thames-Coromandel and Hauraki Regions. § §The key skills required for this role are:§ § §Knowledge of the dynamics of family violence, including the gendered nature of violence, the power and control analysis and the impacts of abuse on adult/child victims;  § §Ability to advocate for male or female perpetrators whilst avoiding collusion or minimising the impact of the violent behaviour on their partners, children and whanau§ §Proven ability to assess and manage risk (in collaboration with colleagues) and plan for safety;§ §Ability to establish and maintain positive and professional relationships with youth, adults and whanau§ §Facilitation and coordination skills that allow you to effectively deliver programmes to individuals/groups§ §A relevant qualification or readily transferable skills and experience§ §Excellent computer and administration skills§ §Knowledge of relevant legislation and policy;§ §Cross cultural skills and an awareness of and commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi§ §Have good work and personal ethics and a commitment to a violence free lifestyle§ §A full and clean Drivers Licence§ §You will be required to undergo and pass relevant NZ Police vetting as per the Vulnerable children’s Act§ §Check out our website: www.capshauraki.co.nz to see the range of services you could be part of providing should you choose to join our dedicated, professional and fun loving team.§ §For a job description please email us or visit our website§. http://www.capshauraki.co.nz/vacancies.html§ §TO APPLY: Click apply or email us your CV and Covering Letter to the address below:§ §CAPS Hauraki Inc.§PO Box 552 or 732B Queen Street, Thames§Phone: §07 868-8644§ | Email: §job@capshauraki.co.nz§ §If you wish to discuss this position further, please call 07-868-8644.§ §Closing date for applications:  Thursday 1st of October 5pm§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657951.txt	§Social Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker§§Advertiser: §Youth Horizons Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Salary§§$57,000-$67,000§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Social Worker (part-time permanent 28 hours)§Make a difference with some of our most at-risk and vulnerable young people§Lead and be part of a professional team working together to change lives§The Role§If you are a registered social worker with a heart for our vulnerable youth and want to work at an amazing organisation then keep reading!§You will be part of our team in our boys group home, Te Whare Tumanako O Kia Puawai, based in Manurewa. Our home uses the Teaching Family Model (TFM) to help young people reach their potential and equip them with the skills they need to be successful at school and within the wider community (full training will be provided).§Our home supports up to five boys on long term placements with Care and Protection needs. If you have the passion and drive to support boys with complex and challenging behaviour, this role is for you.§What you will do:§Undertake individual meetings with young people and develop and/or maintain their life story book.§Promote the young person's voice at professionals meetings and assess client risk and behaviour.§Maintain clinical documentation and support the young person's transition into and out of the programme.§Participate in the development and implementation of treatment plans, self-regulation plans and risk management plans ensuring consistency to the Teaching-Family Model.§Promote family/whānau participation in the care of their child (where appropriate).§About You§You will hold a Bachelors/Masters level qualification in Social Work and a NZ Social Worker Registration.§Ability to build strong relationships with peers and stakeholders.§Be culturally aware and willing to be a part of a bi-cultural journey.§Have a full and clean New Zealand driver's licence.§Experience achieving positive outcomes working with youth.§A basic knowledge of child and adolescent development.§Availability to be on call.§Youth Horizons Offers§Career progression opportunities.§Fun loving family/whanau environment.§Full training in TFM model.§24/7 senior leadership support.§Competitive remuneration to match the skills and experience needed for this role.§About Youth Horizons§Youth Horizons is a national charitable trust working to improve the lives of children and young people who are dealing with behavioural, emotional, mental health or development issues. We have over 250 staff and caregivers supporting young people and their families and whānau across New Zealand.§To find out more about Youth Horizons, visit www.youthorizons.org.nz§Applications close on 21 October 2020.§If you have any questions regarding the role, please call Natasha Tamiano (Practice Leader) on §021533039§.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50665533.txt	§Team Leader - Disability Support Services, Blenheim§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Leader - Disability Support Services, Blenheim§§Advertiser: §Nelson Marlborough Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§§Mission: Supporting people to live the best possible life§Permanent, full-time position (averaging 40 hrs a week)§Bring your inspiring leadership skills to supporting people with a disability§Great opportunity to make a real difference§Ā mātou rōpū (About our team)§At Disability Support Services (DSS) we support people with disabilities to live great lives that reflect their personal aspirations and choices. DSS provides support to over 250 people in a variety of residential settings across the Nelson/Tasman and Marlborough regions.§In residential and work environments we support each person to manage their day to day lives in ways and at times that work for them. The people we support have a wide range of abilities. Some people need support with their personal care and taking care of household tasks; some need support to participate in their local communities and some need communication and behavioural support. We actively encourage people to pursue their dreams and try out new experiences, and can guarantee that no two days working at DSS are ever the same.§We also work collaboratively and in partnership with Mental Health, Youth Justice, Addictions and Oranga Tamariki to meet the needs of people we support.§N.B. Disability Support Services are part of Nelson Marlborough Health, we are not however a medical/clinical service. We are a community based disability support service focused on quality of life outcomes and the Enabling Good Lives Principles.§Ngā mōhiohio e pā ana ki tēnei mahi (About this position)§We are looking to appoint an §off-roster Team Leader§ to supervise and lead support workers across two residential houses, providing support to young people in our community. You will be an integral part of the team, providing support and leadership that enables the people you support to live safely and be actively involved in their community.§Your hours of work will be 80 hours per fortnight working Monday-Friday 8.00AM to 4.30PM (some flexibility will be required in order to meet service requirements). There is also a requirement to take part in the on-call roster.§Ko wai he kaitono tōtika? (Who is an appropriate applicant?)§You will have inspiring leadership skills and a strong commitment to the principles of person-centred support. You will also hold a certificate in Human Services, or an equivalent health or disability related qualification, and will have a sound knowledge of Person Centred support as well as good time management skills. Experience working in the field of disability and/or youth work would be advantageous.§This role is classified by Immigration as ANZSCO 423111 and applicants for this position must be NZ or Australian Citizens, or have NZ Permanent Residency, or a valid NZ work visa.§Me pēhea ahau e tono ai? (How do I apply?)§For general enquiries please contact our recruitment team on §vacancies@nmdhb.govt.nz§ or §03 546 1274§. For role specific enquiries contact Jemma Low on j§Jemma.Low@nmdhb.govt.nz§Keen to apply now, it's easy. Please complete our online application form.§www.nmdhb.govt.nz/careers§W20-139 §Applications close:§ §Open until filled.§ (Applications will be reviewed as they are received. We therefore encourage you to apply as early as possible.)§Nelson Marlborough Health strongly endorses Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§We believe that to achieve equity in health outcomes for Māori we need a workforce reflective of the population it serves. We strongly encourage applications from candidates who identify as Māori and we recruit for cultural competence.§He waka eke noa. We are all in this together.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50649393.txt	§Social Worker - Youth Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker - Youth Justice§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$55k - 100k§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§§Full-time, fixed-term (or secondment) - Hamilton§Do you want direct and meaningful relationship with tamariki and rangatahi, supporting them to move beyond the criminal justice system.§Join our high functioning team committed to getting the best outcomes for rangatahi and tamariki through preventative measures.§About us: Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for children work with the most at risk tamariki and rangatahi in New Zealand. Oranga Tamariki works to advance the wellbeing and positive long-term outcomes of children and young people. In everything we do, the wellbeing and best-interests of children are paramount. The voices of tamariki and rangatahi underpin the design and operation of our services§Our Youth Justice Social Workers are the key people who work with young people, their whānau, police, youth advocates and essential government and community support services when a young person has committed a serious offence.§We are looking for an enthusiastic, qualified Social Worker who can help us by positively influencing rangatahi to accept responsibility and to change their behaviours. You will be someone who can ensure their voices are heard and empower whānau to engage in family group conferences and court proceedings. Part of your role to achieve these outcomes will be by completing assessments, working with our rangatahi to create plans and by partnering with other agencies and stakeholders to get wrap around support in place for them.§We can offer you:§A competitive social worker salary§A cohesive and supportive team environment§The ability to make long lasting relationships within the community§Regular supervision, training and career development opportunities§Discounts on Southern Cross and Westpac Insurances and employment benefits of working for Oranga Tamariki§A fixed-term or secondment up to 12 months (parental leave)§To be successful, you will need the following:§A qualification in social work recognised by the Social Work Registration Board (SWRB)§Continuation of SWRB registration with a current APC§Excellent relationship building skills§A high degree of both verbal and written communication skills (you will need to write court reports)§A commitment to bi-cultural practice and a culturally responsive approach (a good understanding of Tikanga Māori advantageous)§A full clean valid driver's licence§If you think you have what it takes and are dedicated to achieving positive change for children, young people and their families in the community, then we want to hear from you.§Apply now as applications close on Monday, 12 October 2020.§How to apply§Apply online by clicking 'Apply Now' please include your CV, cover letter, and include your social worker qualification and SWRB details, §Oranga Tamariki employees, please apply through your myHR portal. §If you have any queries, please contact Andrew Howard at §andrew.howard@ot.govt.nz§Position description and video§https://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/social-worker-position-description.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50697014.txt	§Social Worker - Hamilton South§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker - Hamilton South§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Do you want to make a genuine, positive impact on the lives of tamariki, rangatahi and whānau? Join a supportive team who has each other's backs every step of the way by using the latest strengths-based tools and assessment frameworks in this Social Worker role at our Hamilton South site.§What you will do?§Be the first port of call when we get urgent crisis and unplanned calls§Work predominantly in triage and referrals we receive on a daily basis§Gather and collate information about the triage or referral to understand whether it's Oranga Tamariki business or not§Decide what the next steps of the process will be and get in touch with the right people§Work alongside partners in our community, non-government organisations and state sector agencies§Make assessments regarding the safety and wellbeing of the tamariki and rangatahi§Work with various cultural groups and people from different backgrounds§Become an expert and specialise in triage and referrals§What you will bring?§A tertiary social work qualification§A full, clean, valid driver's licence§An experience working within the care and protection sector in a social work capacity§Registration with the Social Work Registration Board§Strong knowledge and experience of what Oranga Tamariki does and how we work§Resilience, initiative and a proactive approach§Empathy, patience and ability to see past what someone may be struggling with§Sound judgement, time management and organisational skills§The ability to manage risk and make tough decisions§Cultural awareness and confidence to back yourself§Flexibility with ability to adapt to change§Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to adapt to your audience§Knowledge of Te Reo would be a plus§A positive outlook and supporting nature§What's on offer?§A salary range between $55,000 - $100,000§Flexible work opportunities and compensation for overtime hours worked§A team who enjoy working hard and having fun§Support to achieve your goals through tailored training and career development opportunities§Reimbursement for your annual practicing fee§Access to a generous Southern Cross health plan and banking package with Westpac§Rewarding and challenging work that truly makes a difference to the community§Opportunities to work alongside various cultural groups, build your network and strengthen community relationships§Who are we?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work practice that is child-centred, trauma informed and effective for all cultures.§What team you will work with?§Our Hamilton South team are constantly raising the bar with the work they do together. Our site is the one of the busiest sites in New Zealand and we regularly recognise our people's hard work by sharing success stories over lunch and giving out nice awards. Our Social Workers have a great opportunity to work in an area of social work that they enjoy or would like to get exposure on and become specialists doing it. This means you are never over run or overlapping your work and have more time to do your job effectively. Being a high Māori demography in Hamilton, we are learning as much as we can about the culture and why it's so important. Support will be given to those who want to develop or learn Te Reo along with any other relevant training to help you excel as a Social Worker.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details.§If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you are applying from overseas, you will be required to provide a copy of your IELTS certificate.§All applications must be submitted online.§If you have any questions about the role, please contact Sravani Peddibhotla on §Sravani.peddibhotla@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as applications close Wednesday, 21 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50625793.txt	§Kiwi Can Do - Wellington Area Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kiwi Can Do - Wellington Area Manager§§Advertiser: §Kiwi Can Do§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Salary§§$70,000 - $79,999, Company Car, Phone and Laptop§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Kiwi Can Do runs training programmes for young people keen to learn new skills in the construction industry and transition from the Benefit into work.  The Wellington Training programme is located at Naenae and covers the lower North Island.  Trainees from the local regions (Whanganui, Kapiti Coast, Waiarapa) reside at the Wesley Haven, Naenae (Monday through Thursday nights). Other more local trainees (Wellington, Porirua, Hutt Valley) come to the site daily.§ §We are looking for a highly motivated Area Manager to lead our Wellington programme, based in Naenae.   § §The successful candidate will oversee Kiwi Can Do’s training programmes operating in Wellington and to ensure that they produce ‘work ready’ trainees. Ensure that the structure and content of the training programmes remains relevant and effective.§ §The Area Manager will ensure that the resources needed to make the programme work are in place. Effective liaison with other managers and staff is essential.§ §The culture at Kiwi Can Do is a vital part of the way we work with the trainees.  It’s about mutual respect so the atmosphere at the residential facility and in the workshop programmes is like a large family. § §Key Requirements§ § §Understands industry sectors where Kiwi Can Do (KCD) offers training as well as other possible industries for trainees to move in to§ §Understands training processes and training theory and knows how to design and facilitate training programmes for relevant industry sectors.§ §Is technically competent in industry sector trades (especially construction) and understands the operational and technical issues that may arise and that may need to be addressed. Picks up technical issues quickly§ §Has business acumen and is commercially aware§ §Has the ability to assess the effectiveness of KCD’s training programmes and determine whether to modify/evolve them§ §Has the ability to select tradie tutors/mentors who are capable of teaching and coaching KCD’s trainees§ §Can solve problems, especially when there is time pressure and limited information. Has the ability to learn from problem solving situations§ §Is an effective decision maker, and has good judgement, especially where there is limited information and situations are ambiguous§ §Can develop and maintain professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders§ §Is an effective leader§ §Hours of work: 40 hours per week§ §All applicants must have the legal right to live and work permanently in New Zealand§ §Applications close on Friday 9 October 2020. § §For an initial conversation about the role, please call Dan Ryan on 027 344 8097.§ §To apply, please submit applications via seek or by emailing Dan Ryan (National HR Manager) on §dan@kiwi-can-do.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50645914.txt	§Residential Youth Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Residential Youth Worker§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§§Residential Youth Worker§Permanent, full-time, Whakatakapokai, Auckland§About us - Mō mātou§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki§ first§We believe §Aroha§ is vital§We respect the §Mana§ of people§We are §Tika§ and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga§ is a journey§About the Residence - E pa ana ki te Kāenga§Our Youth Justice Residences provide a safe, secure and supportive environment where rangatahi in our care can make changes to get their lives back on track. Whakatakapokai is one of five Youth Justice Residences operating across Aotearoa that operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week providing residential placements and programmes for rangatahi aged 13 to 19 years who have been charged with or convicted of an offence. Our vision at Whakatakapokai is to create a unique, culturally focused, therapeutic, safe and restorative care environment that enables rangatahi to strengthen their connection with whānau, hapū, iwi and their culture; and develop the skills to make positive decisions to support them to flourish and transform their lives, reducing the risk of reoffending.§About the role - Mō te tūnga§As a Youth Worker, you will be engaging with and providing professional support to our rangatahi. You will be assisting in the facilitation of care and support to our rangatahi through demonstrating positive behaviours and acknowledging personal influence on the life of our youth.§You will also be working with a collaborative team who is passionate about Oranga Tamariki's vision, purpose and values. You will be playing a part in building positive cultural and community connection. Whakatakapokai is strongly focused on achieving positive change in rangatahi through education, skill development, vocational programmes, and therapeutic and cultural interventions using a Māori world centric view (Te Ao Māori). Our overall goal is that rangatahi who come into our care are positively integrated back into their community and reduce the risk of reoffending with their mana restored.§The role will involve the following:§Regular face to face contact with rangatahi and whānau§Maintaining and building stakeholder relationships in the community§Mentoring- one on one work with rangatahi, whānau to assist them to achieve their identified goals§Supporting rangatahi with their educational aspirations§Keeping our rangatahi and whānau connected to their wider whānau, iwi and hapu§Flexibility to work in different workplace settings e.g. marae, school or field trips§Transporting of rangatahi and whānau to and from activities or appointments§Minding - looking after rangatahi§About you - Mōu§To apply for this role, you must demonstrate the following qualifications and experience:§Experience caring for or mentoring youth§A current, full, clean New Zealand driver's licence§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Resilience with the ability to work under pressure§Strong cultural awareness and Understanding of Te Ao Māori me ona Tikanga§Ability to quickly establish relationships with stakeholders and maintain those relationships§Experience with developing appropriate programmes and initiatives that would best suit our rangatahi, whānau, stakeholders and community§The right to work in New Zealand§Ability to work Saturday and Sundays with flexible weekday hours§How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§Apply online with your CV. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please contact §Naomi.Houston@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Monday, 19 October 2020.§If you are interested in an information pack or session, please send an email to §Naomi.Houston@ot.govt.nz§ with your name and contact details.§Vetting Hotline§Candidates applying for roles at Oranga Tamariki Ministry for Children must complete a mandatory Police check as part of the Children's Act 2014. We want to do all we can to support candidates through our recruitment process. We realise the prospect of police vetting may be daunting to candidates who have previous convictions. If you would like to have a confidential chat about our vetting process, please contact our Recruitment Vetting Hotline on 027 207 0262.§The vetting hotline will be active 11am - 1pm, Monday to Friday. If you are unavailable during these times, please leave your name and contact details for one our advisors to call you back.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Food Security Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50615902.txt	§Food Security Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Food Security Manager§§Advertiser: §Auckland City Mission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Our Mission§  §Together we stand with those in desperate need.§  §We provide immediate relief and pathways to enable long term wellbeing.§  §Food Security Service §  §Auckland City Mission has provided food support through our Food Bank Services since the mid 1980s, one of the first of its kind in the country. Demand has grown exponentially over the last few years and we need to both respond to this need, forge new ways forward that consistently seek to challenge and disrupt the systems that are keeping people food insecure. §  §We are proud to introduce the newly named §Food Security Service§, aiming to deliver our vision of an Aotearoa that is food secure for all.§  §Our service seeks to provide support for those accessing food, ensuring dignity is upheld and shame eliminated. A key function of this role is to be advocating for change  to reduce the need for such a service. §  § §  §Your role of Food Security Manager §  §Working with the General Manager of Health & Social Services, your role will be to define and implement the direction, goals, and objectives of the Food Security Service in line with Mission vision and values.  This will include the provision of food and support services through our own services and with our partners, the procurement of food across the Mission  and  large scale events such as the Pre-Christmas services.§  §Leading the Service you will work to forge strong regional, national, and international relationships with all those involved in the food system.  This includes growers, suppliers, distributors, Council, Government, iwi and community partners and food advocacy/governance bodies especially the New Zealand Food Network, the Aotearoa Food Rescue Alliance and Kore Hiakai.§  §In addition, you will spearhead ongoing research for the service implementing opportunities for improvement and change as necessary ensuring we are simply doing the best we can in response to the need that is present, whilst challenging the systems that are both creating and maintaining this reality.§  § §  §To be successful §in this role you will most importantly have a heart for people.  You will have a good sense of the drivers of food insecurity and how we might respond and be excellent at building relationships, influencing others and finding a way through a path that has yet to be laid.§  §You will demonstrate ability to design, establish and deliver frameworks & objectives relevant to service and contractual goals. You will have excellent management skills having worked across multi-discipline teams and a range of internal & external stakeholders to bring unity and meet desired outcomes.§  §Your previous experience within the health & social services field will enable you to truly understand the complexities of responding to the reality of food insecurity providing a base to continually review and improve the service.  You will also need;§ § §A relevant tertiary level qualification in health, social services, or other relevant field§ §10+ years practice experience in a related health or social service setting§ §Competence and confidence in Te Ao Maori§ §This isn’t a role for the faint hearted, we offer a challenging but exceptionally rewarding opportunity to drive real change to our community in Aotearoa.  §  §Apply now with your CV and cover letter or to find out more contact Viki on §021465004§  § §  §Our Values§  §Manaakitanga§Manaakitanga is behaviour that acknowledges the mana of others as having equal or greater importance than one's own, through the expression of aroha, hospitality, generosity, and mutual respect.§  §Justice (Manatika)§Committed to equity, and seeking dignity for all we will fearlessly advocate with and for those who are going without.§  §Partnership (Rangapū)§Firstly, the Auckland City Mission recognises the principle of partnership within Te Tiriti O Waitangi.§  §Secondly, our commitment to partnership stems from a belief that manaakitanga, equity and social justice need to be pursued both within partnerships and through them. For us partnership is characterised by mutual trust, integrity, respect, transparency, and commitment.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§Are you comfortable and competent in Te Ao Maori? §Do you have a tertiary level qualification in health, social services, or other relevant field?§§§
