jobTitle: Whariki Knowledge Broker - Maori Ringa Kohikohi Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50616189.txt	§Whariki Knowledge Broker - Maori Ringa Kohikohi§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Whariki Knowledge Broker - Maori Ringa Kohikohi§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Summary§ §We are looking for a multi-skilled, dynamic person to co-lead and pioneer the development of a Network (Wariki) dedicated to connecting sector leaders from all areas of mental health and addiction so they can share knowledge, learn and innovate together, to transform services.§Wāriki will be a Te Tiriti-based and sector-owned initiative specifically designed to improve the mental health and wellbeing of New Zealanders through the facilitation of knowledge sharing and experience about what works. It will include a dedicated focus on learning about Māori models of health and wellbeing and the actions that address equity for Māori.§This position will partner with the other Ringa KohiKohi role to lead the support team who will be responsible for developing and expanding Wāriki which will be supported via a technology platform.§This is a fixed-term role until July 2021, we will consider all applications, both part-time and full-time applications welcome.§About Te Pou§ §Te Pou is a national centre for information and workforce development for mental health, addiction and disability. For information, visit www.tepou.co.nz.§You§ §Our Ringa Kohikohi will be a highly adept communicator with a proven ability to build trusting relationships. You will be a natural connector with an infectious energy to pioneer the development of the Network. You will also be;§Knowledgeable and familiar with upholding tikanga Māori§Astute operational managers who know how to work with others to build an inclusive effective team who take action§Known for your capacity to make an impactful difference and demonstrate Te Tiriti in action§Experienced in working in a Māori health domain.§Ideally our Ringa Kohikohi will also have;§A post-graduate tertiary qualification within the health sector§Understanding of research and evaluation methods§Experience in leading networks and collaborations§A understanding of systems and how to change them§The Benefits§Flexible work arrangements, extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a knowledgeable and supportive team around you every day. Be part of a work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued, and new solutions are the norm! These roles are§Excited about this opportunity to make a difference? Then apply now.§Closing Date: Tuesday 6th October 2020.§ Please note, this advert may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found prior to the closing date.§Position Description:§ To view the full position description please copy and paste the below link into your browser - https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Knowledge-Broker-Maori-Position-Description.pdf§Contact:§ Richard Woodcock- Manager - Data, Information, and Research, on 027 598 8170, if you have any questions.§For further information on Te Pou, please visit our website www.tepou.org.nz§ §§§§

jobTitle: Executive Director Job in Taranaki - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50638710.txt	§Executive Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Director§§Advertiser: §Mentoring Foundation of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§We are looking for a talented and dynamic Executive Director with proven leadership experience.  §Reporting to the board, this is a strategic role that comes at a milestone time for this motivated not-for-profit trust.  The Mentoring Foundation works in partnership with a range of regional and national stakeholders, dedicated to supporting leaders in their roles throughout Aotearoa.§It's an outstanding opportunity to bring your honed organisational and relationship management skills,  passion for mentoring and love of the community sector together.§Ideally you will be located in either Taranaki or Auckland but candidates from outside these regions will be considered.§This part-time, fixed term position gives the successful applicant flexibility in the structure of their working week and a direction to bring fresh, innovative thinking to the organisation. Act fast, as all applications will be considered as they are received.§ §Key Attributes§The successful candidate will be:§Able to develop and manage relationships.§A strong communicator.§Passionate about mentoring and leadership development.§An entrepreneurial thinker with strong leadership skills.§Good at project planning, marketing, and financial management with an understanding of evaluation.§ §Mentoring Foundation of New Zealand §The Mentoring Foundation builds the capability of the community sector by helping leaders with professional development through connection with experienced mentors. Mentoring helps leaders become more effective, more confident and better-connected to a wider network.§Within this role we work in partnership or through collaboration with a range of regional and national stakeholders. The foundation has a proven mentoring model with programmes operating in four regions around NZ and this appointment is to manage and grow the potential for the trust.§ §Applications and Enquiries§To apply and for all application enquiries including obtaining the Job Description, please email: §Leighton Littlewood, §leighton@mentoringfoundation.org.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50598914.txt	§Support Worker - Part Time and Casual - Wellington WW029§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Worker - Part Time and Casual - Wellington WW029§§Advertiser: §Community Connections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§About the role§ § §Helping people live their daily lives and fully participate in their communities, live the life they want and achieve their goals§ §As these positions involve short shifts including early morning and dinner/bedtime it would be beneficial to have your own transport.§ §This specific vacancy involves personal care including showering, toileting and dressing, as well as food preparation and household tasks. There is opportunity for supporting the individuals to attend work and social events, which may include overnight trips for holidays and time away on a negotiated basis, so flexibility is needed. The work is usually in short shifts throughout the day § §It is preferable for support workers to be able to do a full lift of the individual (approx 50kg) – please include why you consider yourself as potentially able to manage this in your application.§ §Skills and experience § §The ideal candidate will§ § §Be a people person, able to build trusting and respectful relationships§ §Be open and adaptable with strong communication skills.§ §Have good community knowledge and be able to develop networks§ §Have a level 3 qualification in Health and Wellbeing and a current first aid certificate (although training can be provided for the right person)§ §Have an understanding of bi-cultural practice in Aotearoa New Zealand§ §Be comfortable with technology – Community Connections has a cloud-based database and rostering system that staff need to access with their mobile devices§ §Preferably, have a full licence§ §Be physically fit with no health conditions which impact their ability to do manual handling or increase risk of injury.§ §Have experience in personal cares support and hoist use or a willingness to learn.§ §Benefits§ § §Pay rate is between $20.50 and $25.50 depending on qualifications and experience.§ §Flexible working options§ §Ongoing professional development§ §Supportive team environment§ §Making positive differences in people’s lives and in the community§ §How to apply§ §All applications must go through our website -  https://www.ccslt.org.nz/job/wellington-pt-casual-sw-ww029/§Click on the “Apply for Job” tab, fill in the online form, and attach your CV and cover letter.§ §For further information, contact Esther Gillam, §esther.gillam@ccslt.org.nz§ 021 741 018§ §About Community Connections§ §We are a community based disability support provider that operates across much of the North Island. Our vision is of an inclusive New Zealand where people with disabilities are embraced as fully participating citizens, where barriers to inclusion are removed, and where all people are respected and valued for who they are.§ §We believe that people with disabilities can and should live the life they choose, on their own terms and within the community of their choice.§ §Community Connections is a member of the Equal Employment Opportunities Trust and actively encourages people with lived experience of disability to apply.§ § §§§§

No 2 days will be the same.§WHO WE ARE - KO WAI MATOU §Te Whanau O Waipareira Trust is an urban Maori-proud community that has been serving the West Auckland community for over 35 years, creating positive outcomes for whanau.  We are one of the largest NGOs in New Zealand, with over 200 staff, with continued growth and expansion. §ABOUT THE ROLE - HE KORERO WHAKAMARAMA MO TENEI TURANGA §The Senior Project Coordinator will support the Director and Management Team to provide effective communication and positive engagement with internal and external partners, including Te Whanau o Waipareira, Te Pae Herenga O Tamaki, Whanau Ora Commissioning Agency and other stakeholders.§This role will also provide project and administrative support across multiple key programmes to ensure management systems and processes are implemented and maintained and will ensure reporting is delivered on time for both internal and external stakeholders.§WHAT YOU WILL BRING - NGA TOHUNGATANAG O TENEI TURANGA § § §University degree or equivalent qualification is required in relevant field§ §Minimum three years’ experience working as a personal / executive assistant§ §Minimum three years’ experience managing and coordinating programmes§ §Understanding Te Reo Maori me ona tikanga and application to a Maori organisation and its workforce§ §Excellent writing and communication skills§ §Ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timeliness through analytical and problem-solving capabilities§ §Ability to effectively prioritise and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial;§ §Demonstrate assessment, analytical and conceptual skills§ §Proficient IT skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office suite§ §Commitment to working collaboratively and in a whanau ora approach.§ §Ability to adapt to shifting priorities, demands and timelines to execute tasks in a dynamic and high-pressure environment.§ §Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and offering sound solutions.§ §Ability to maintain positive relationships with internal and external partners, offering high quality customer service.§ §THE GOOD THINGS ABOUT THIS ORGANISATION - NGA PAINGA O TENEI WHARE §We can offer an awesome team and working culture in modern premises in the heart of West Auckland Henderson township.  Just a 2 minute walk from rail/bus transport hub and large-scale malls, stores and eateries.  We provide 5 weeks annual leave, 4% Kiwisaver Employer contributions, promote a work life balance and are committed to providing ongoing professional development.§If you have the right skills, experience and a passion to support the community – please APPLY today.§Resumes or assistance will not be accepted from Recruitment Agencies§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a project coordinator?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§Do you have native or bilingual proficiency in any languages other than English?§§§

The focus is providing tamariki/ rangatahi centred, strengths based services that encourage youth and whānau to make positive life style choices, while ensuring tamariki/rangatahi have the best possible start in life. § §This is an exciting opportunity for a caring, compassionate individual who has great listening skills, and who wants to make a difference in their community and the lives of others. We are looking for a mature person who is respectful of others, and who is culturally sensitive.§ §If you have experience working with whanau specifically at risk tamariki/rangatahi programme delivery then we want to hear from you. § §You will be required to hold a current full NZ drivers license and have the ability to work flexible hours as this is not a 9 to 5 role.   § § § § §Skills and experience§ § §Essential Skills:§ §A good understanding of Te Reo Me Ona Tikanga Maori or a willingness to learn§Good understanding/working knowledge of local communities§Good understanding/working knowledge with youth in both individual and in group programme setting§Excellent oral and written communication skills§Computer literate§Current Full Driver's License§ §Desired Requirements:§ §Proven experience working with whānau  and tamariki /rangatahi with high needs§Proven experience  of  working with youth who have experienced  family harm§A passion for working with whānau , tamariki and rangatahi§Can engage confidently with whanau and community agencies§Has an understanding of practice from a Kaupapa perspective or is open to learning.§Have knowledge with care and protection would be an advantage but not compulsory.§ §In addition, experience and understanding of working with Māori and with a diverse range of cultures is a requirement of the position.§For a Position Description and Application Form please contact: §recruitment@temanutoroa.org.nz§ §Closing Date: 28 September 2020§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobTitle: Live-in House Parent/s (Kaiarahi) Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50621147.txt	§Live-in House Parent/s (Kaiarahi)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Live-in House Parent/s (Kaiarahi)§§Advertiser: §PARS Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§PARS Inc is a leading provider of re-integrative services.  We employ staff that empower and support prisoners, released prisoners, deportees and at-risk youth and their whanau, to address any underlying needs with essential services. We deliver supported transitional and emergency accommodation, re-integrative services, supported employment and at-risk youth services in the Northern and Auckland Regions.§ §PARS are firstly looking to recruit a live in Kaiarahi (house Parent) as well as build up the capacity of our casual relief staff.§ §The Kaiarahi are an integral part of our kaupapa Māori whare (homes) as they act as role models for the tangata (clients) and are facilitators of harmonious relationships within the whare by creating a positive environment for the self-development of the kaupapa whānau.  The Kaiarahi facilitate a whakatau (informal welcome) at the whare upon a tangata’s entry, which connects the tangata to the whare as their ‘home’, and to their kaupapa whānau in the whare. § § § §Both positions are for our community based whare / homes in Auckland.  You will need to display a high level of empathy and a non-judgemental attitude toward the tangata you will be supporting.  Ideally, you will be a seasoned practitioner, whose life experiences have led you to apply to this position in the hope of giving back. You will have proven experience working with people at risk and possess an understanding of the day to day challenges they face.  § §Permanent position:§ §Live in House Parent (Kaiarahi); lives on the premises supporting clients with living skills (such as cooking, shopping, cleaning responsibilities).§ §A typical day for a Kaiarahi will see you:§ §•         Role model positive interactions with and between tangata living in the whare. § §•          Co-ordinating the day to day functioning of the whare / home/s including shopping and meal preparation with tangata in the whare. § §•          Responding to emergency or incident situations in the whare / home/s under the guidance of the Reintegration Services Manager.§ § §Ensure the kawa (rules and expectations) of the whare are adhered to.§ §Casual relief position:§ §Relief staff for live in Kaiarahi required to stay overnight.§ §Key to the success of a Kaiarahi is your ability to motivate and influence those living in our community homes while working as part of a team. In addition, your ability to maintain clear and professional boundaries at all times, provide practical solutions to day to day issues, manage risk and effectively communicate with people at all levels is essential to the success of the role. § §If you pride yourself on your ability to provide a high standard of care, have solid experience supporting individuals with challenging and complex needs and wanting to make a difference to the reintegration of prisoners released to community then we want to hear from you.§ §Minimum Qualifications:§ §A minimum requirement of a level 4 certificate in community services/whanau ora/education/mental health/social services or similar is required.§ §All applications will be treated in confidence and for successful candidate’s police vetting and drug testing will form part of the process.  Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit.  § § § §For more information or a confidential chat, please contact Rachael Ngatai on §(09) 6300862§ or email rachaeln@pars.co.nz.  § § § §Applications close on Thursday 8 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§Have you completed a qualification in community services?§§§

Join a caring, supportive team who use the latest strengths-based tools and assessment frameworks at our site in these fixed-term and permanent Social Worker roles at the National Contact Centre.§What you will bring?§Full registration with New Zealand's Social Work Registration Board (SWRB) at time of application§A social worker qualification recognised by the SWRB§Commitment to getting things right for outcomes for tamariki and rangatahi§The ability to have a systems/technical understanding of computer systems§Proven high standard of decision making and written communication§Excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt to your audience§Current legal right to work in New Zealand§Positive can do attitude§Ability to work within a fast paced change environment and be resolution focused§Sound judgement skills and organisational skills§The ability to analyse and prepare social work assessments and calling notifiers around concerns§The ability to manage risk and make tough decisions§What you will do?§Hear tamariki and rangatahi voices and support them or their whānau to make positive changes§Work alongside various cultural groups and people from different backgrounds§Complete initial safety checks and assessments on the child, young person and family§Be involved in planning what social work, to maintain tamariki and rangatahi within their whanau,is required to be delivered for better outcomes§Work alongside partners in our community, non-government organisations and state sector agencies§Be an advocate on behalf of tamariki to ensure they have the support and resources needed to reach their full potential§What's on offer?§A salary range between $55,000 - $100,000§Flexible work opportunities§A great, respectful team environment who celebrate each other's successes§Rewarding and challenging work that truly makes a difference to the community§Opportunities to work alongside various cultural groups, build your network and strengthen community relationships§Full induction and training§Coaching and development§Once reaching optimum levels and knowledge of NCC work, the ability to be developed in other areas of the NCC and organisational roles§Access to a generous Southern Cross health plan and banking package with Westpac§Who are we?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work practice that is child-centred, trauma informed and effective for all cultures.§About the team§We are currently the only contact centre that provides a national service across Oranga Tamariki. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a team who skills are developed at this national level.§The National contact centre creates the foundation of knowledge of the Ministry as a whole. It is proud to provide, across the organisation, highly skilled and developed social workers who are not only extremely practice focused but also have a wide breath of skills across technical systems used throughout the organisation.§We operate in a fast-paced busy environment, 24 hours a day, 7 days per week. We focus on tamariki and rangatahi who are at significant risk of harm. We have the ability with our service to be highly flexible and responsive to needs across this national service. This means that the work that you do will not only be highly valuable to outcomes for children, but also has the ability to develop your skills across a wide variety of areas.§As a Contact Centre Social Worker, you will receive reports of concern and field enquires regarding child abuse, neglect and wellbeing. You will take calls and resolve issues over the phone and by email. You will also facilitate and manage after hours case work, in coordination with local sites and stakeholders across our national service.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee; please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any queries, please contact Sravani Peddibhotla on §sravani.peddibhotla@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as applications close Thursday, 22 October 2020.§Please do not apply for this vacancy if you are not registered with the Social Work Registration Board (SWRB). Instead please follow the below links to be considered accordingly:§If you are a student studying social work or a social work graduate, please copy and paste the following link and apply here: §https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareerpvt?jobId=34785&company=ministryofP&st=429319EDA83F55C02D6F1F2A71578B1674157946§If you are an experienced social worker who hasn't registered or is waiting to hear back regarding their application for registration, please copy and paste the following link and apply here: §https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareerpvt?jobId=34786&company=ministryofP&st=46B9ED700ECE606853CB9B79672703587A506E2A§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

A core expectation of this role is to uphold the mana of Te Whanau o Waipareira, build and maintain robust, positive relationships with volunteers and with whanau who come to receive services.§WHAT YOU WILL BRING - NGA TOHUNGATANAG O TENEI TURANGA§ § §Excellent leadership skills, able to effectively motivate a team§ §Demonstrated knowledge of community and service networks in the Waitakere region§ §Experience implementing and maintaining high level food safety standards required§ §Prior experience with a Food Bank or Non-Profit organization desirable§ §Problem solving experience§ §Experience with using Microsoft applications§ §Well-developed written and oral communication skills§ §Excellent interpersonal skills and able to work as part of a team§ §Strong work ethic, demonstration by a high level of integrity, reliability, efficiency, and self-management§ §Fast learner with excellent attention to detail§ §Able to handle sensitive and confidential information§ §A commitment to Te Reo me nga Tikanga Maori§ §Ability to speak Te Reo Maori is preferred§ §Familiar with the Whanau Ora outcomes framework§ §A full clean New Zealand driver’s licence.§ §THE GOOD THINGS ABOUT THIS ORGANISATION - NGA PAINGA O TENEI WHARE§We can offer an awesome team and working culture in modern premises in the heart of West Auckland Henderson township.  Just a 2 minute walk from rail/bus transport hub and large-scale malls, stores and eateries.  We provide 5 weeks annual leave, 4% Kiwisaver Employer contributions, promote a work life balance and are committed to providing ongoing professional development.§If you have the right skills, experience and a passion to support the community – please §APPLY §today.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§ § § § § §Resumes or assistance will not be accepted from Recruitment Agencies§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

He is keen on adventures and forging relationships in his community. We would also like you to look out for and support our super capable daughter. § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §We live in the paradise that is Wanaka, New Zealand. We are lucky to have a beautiful home, with an exceptional garden, and only a 2 mins stroll to the lake with breathtaking views of the mountains.  We are a 9 minute drive to town. This role is initially 2 days a week but there is also an opportunity for this to grow to more days and to take on nightshifts if you are interested. We also are part of a Charitable Trust, that is forging great lives for children with intellectual disability in this region. There may be opportunities to get involved with that organisation too.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Key Skills§Strong Communication skills§Ability to use visual schedules§Abillity to think outside the box§High levels of initiative§Ability to Listen§ §Key Strengths§Empathy, patience§Sense of fun§Ability to juggle tasks§Has respect for individuals with intellectual disability§Strong imagination § §Experience§Knowing or working with a person with a disability§Experience providing support with personal cares§Working with kids§Teaching or Teacher Aiding§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

Apply today.§Join the Emerge Aotearoa whānau; we're inclusive and we celebrate diversity as an organisation§Realising potential - Tautokohia te mana tangata§§§§

jobText: TXT/50633590.txt	§WYS START KAIARAHI Fixed Term Contract§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§WYS START KAIARAHI Fixed Term Contract§§Advertiser: §Whangarei Youth Space§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§We are looking for :§ § §An experienced Social Worker / Youth Worker §who can be innovative and agile in their approach to supporting a young person to success§ §You will be joining the WYS START team. This is a programme funded through the He Poutama Rangatahi initiative launched in Whangarei by the Minister for Employment Hon. Willie Jackson, “§Empowering taitamariki to be actively involved in their community and society is one of the most important investments we can make.”§ §You will be mentoring and providing pastoral care support for the taimaraiki and working alongside a young person on their journey. You will be an outstanding advocate for them on their journey to employment and staying in employment.§ §About Us§ §Whangarei Youth Space is a ‘one stop shop’ for young people aged 12-24 and is based on youth / adult partnerships. It provides a place to belong, with easy access to support, development opportunities and youth specific health services. Our wraparound model of care allows us to address health needs while also addressing social and developmental issues which are often the underlying determinants of ill health and poor outcomes for young people.  Whangarei Youth Space is a charitable organisation and is unique in that young people are a key part of the service development and leadership, a youth service truly with young people at its core.  Our youth development model emphasises the importance of young people’s connections to their communities, whanau, schools and peers, and has a focus on fostering resilience and supporting young people to make positive decisions.§ § § §The successful applicant/s will have§ § §A passion for young people succeeding§ §2+ years of professional Social Work / Youth Work experience§ §A Commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi§ §The ability to work sensitively and appropriately from a cross-cultural perspective§ §Experience in facilitating groups &  programmes for young adults and whanau§ §Excellent communication (oral, written and listening) and interpersonal skills§ §Excellent organisational and time management skills§ §Positive evidence of autonomous practice§ §Excellent administrative skills and competency on standard Microsoft office applications and databases§ §Full driver’s license is a must§ § § §If you are interested in the Team Coordinator role its all of the above plus planning, strategy and budgeting experience.  The Team Coordinator role does carry a case load.§ §How to apply§ §We're a diverse, friendly and welcoming bunch of people who work hard and are passionate about young people and if you think you have the right stuff we'd love to have you join us.§ § § §If you think you have what it takes, please apply by§ § §sending us your CV and Cover Letter outlining your relevant skills and experience. § §If you are shortlisted you need to be available for an interview on the week of the 12th of October 2020.§ §Applications close October 9th 2020.§ §You must be a New Zealand resident to apply for this position with a valid New Zealand driver’s license.§ §This position is subject to the requirements of the Vulnerable Children’s Act and therefore robust recruitment checks will be undertaken including full police vetting and reference checks.  § § § §For all the details, a job description please contact Bailey at §bailey@youthspace.co.nz§ or call us on §09 972 7248§. § § §§§§

Arohata Prison §      §        § §Assistant Prison Director - Arohata Prison§        § §        §Nau mai, Haere mai, we welcome you to join our whānau.§        §          §Newly created senior leadership role at Arohata Women's Prison§          §Be part in implementing our Hōkai Rangi Strategy§          §Play a key role in delivering our Women's Strategy outcomes for the women in our care§        §        § §        §Bring your passion and commitment to changing lives to Arohata Prison where we are making Ara Poutama Aotearoa's Hōkai Rangi vision a reality.   Through the Hōkai Rangi strategy and the Hōkai Nuku change programme we are endeavouring to deliver to better outcomes for the people in our care.  §        §Mō te tūnga | §About the role§        §The Assistant Prison Director role is a newly created key site leadership role responsible for leading and managing the development and delivery of services related to rehabilitation, learning and employment services and opportunities for the women in our care.  You'll have responsibility for delivering services which include our industry and education initiatives as well as our case management function. §        §The position is expected to support the Prison Director by leading an integrated and unified approach to service delivery across the range of services we provide to achieve the outcomes of reducing re-offending and safer communities.  You will manage a diverse group of people across different areas of the prison so it is important that you have proven staff leadership skills as well as the ability to manage people through periods of organisational change.§        §Key to this role is the role you will play in the delivery of our Hōkai Rangi Strategy and supporting Ara Poutama Aotearoa's Women's Strategy work at Arohata.§        § §        §Mōu | §About you §        §          §Are you an experienced frontline manager, who prides themselves on their proven ability to lead, mentor and support staff? We are looking for someone who is passionate about working to improve the lives of those in our care.§        §Please upload a covering letter outlining your skills and experience in relationship to the key focus areas outlined in the Job Description attached and a current CV.§        § §        §Please note the salary band for this position is $112,294 - $132,110.§        § §        §Mō mātou | §About us§§        §Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us and is our commitment to improving the oranga and safety of the people in our care, whānau, and that of the communities we serve across the motu.  As a values-led organisation, we use the principles of rangatira (leadership), manaaki (respect), wairua (spirituality), kaitiaki (guardianship) and whānau (relationships) to inform how we work and deliver the outcomes outlined in our strategy - Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5).§        §It is an exciting time to join us and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§        § §        §Tono ināianei | Apply Now§        §To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role. §        §For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§.§      §      §      §    §  §§§ §Assistant Prison Director - Arohata Prison§ §Nau mai, Haere mai, we welcome you to join our whānau.§§Newly created programme we are endeavouring to deliver to better outcomes for the people in our care.  §Mō te tūnga | §About the role§§The Assistant Prison Director role is a newly created key site leadership role Do you want to be a part of that? If so, look no further we have the role for you!§To be successful in this rewarding position, you will need the following:§Full registration with New Zealand's Social Work Registration Board (SWRB) or able to register§A social worker qualification recognised by the SWRB§Excellent written and oral communication skills§Demonstrated resilience, problem solving techniques and flexibility§Great time management and organisational skills§Strong PC and Microsoft Office Suite skills§Excellent report writing and written communication skills§A full, current, clean driver's licence§About the opportunity for you§At our Teaotahi site in Whangarei, we work alongside our community partners to bring about positive outcomes for our children, young people and their whānau. Our Social Workers at Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children manage a variety of tasks using the latest assessment frameworks; you will work hard to get quality outcomes for mokopuna and whānau. A big part of your day will be working with children and young people to ensure their voices are heard. You will complete assessments, reports and formal Family Court documents, create plans, complete referrals, participate in Family Group Conferences and partner with other agencies, stakeholders and the community to get the best outcomes for our tamariki. Your ability to overcome barriers and skill to drive positive outcomes will put you in good stead for this challenging and hugely rewarding role.§We can offer you:§A competitive market salary between $55,000 - $100,000§A challenging, fascinating and rewarding career§On-going training and regular supervision§Commitment to the highest standards of strengths-based social work§Access to generous Southern Cross health plan§About us§At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that all tamariki are in loving whānau and communities, and we want you to come on this journey with us. Our vision is that New Zealand values the wellbeing of tamariki above all else. We believe that in the right environment, with the right people surrounding and nurturing them, any child can, and should flourish.§How to apply§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. Oranga Tamariki employees - please apply through your myHR portal. For further information please contact Claire Burnton on §claire.burnton@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Tuesday, 20 October 2020.§Please do not apply for this vacancy if you are not registered with the Social Work Registration Board (SWRB). Instead please follow the below links to be considered accordingly:§If you are a student studying social work or a social work graduate, please copy and paste the following link and apply here: §https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareerpvt?jobId=34785&company=ministryofP&st=429319EDA83F55C02D6F1F2A71578B1674157946§If you are an experienced social worker who hasn't registered or is waiting to hear back regarding their application for registration, please copy and paste the following link and apply here: §https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareerpvt?jobId=34786&company=ministryofP&st=46B9ED700ECE606853CB9B79672703587A506E2A§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The work you will do does make a difference.§ §Our aim is to provide safety for women and tamariki. We support and educate women and tamariki through strength-based principles and practices to that they can achieve their goals to a safer life and independence from violence. Your work does make a difference and gives our whanau a voice.§ §You will be delivering high-level evidence based and quality social work services where you will be working in partnership with tamariki, their whanau, external agencies and communities to ensure a collaborative approach to improved outcomes.§ §This role requires a passion and understanding of how domestic violence affects women, tamariki and the wider whanau, that the consequences of whanau violence can be life-long and how best to support women and tamariki.§ §Key attributes to be considered but not limited to, will include:§ § §A recognised Social Work qualification.§ §Police Vetting§ §Problem solving skills that demonstrate: § §innovative and lateral thinking,§ §ability to be creative and think on your feet,§ §a good communicator,§ §resilience and ability to manage reasonable stress levels of the role,§ §negotiation skills§ § § §Understanding of diversity and culture§ §Having a good understanding of relevant legislation i.e. Family Violence Act 2018§ §Well-developed written and verbal communication skills§ §A valid and clean New Zealand's driver's licence.§ § § §What we are offering§ § §A competitive salary§ §A strong commitment to the strengths-based social work empowerment§ §Professional development§ §A workplace that values team members and puts welfare of all concerned first.§ §Must have NZ Residency or a valid work visa§ § § §How to apply? Some weekend and evening work may be required§ §Have an interest in art§ §Be able to assist the group with their card making micro-business§ §Be able to assist the group with their fundraising projects§ §Be able to build trusting and respectful relationships§ §Be able to work creatively and problem-solve§ §Be a good communicator – with the groups members, their families, and other members of the team§ §Have good community knowledge and be able to develop networks§ Have a level 3 qualification in Health and Wellbeing and a current first aid certificate (although training can be provided for the right person)§ §Have an understanding of bi-cultural practice in Aotearoa New Zealand§ §Be comfortable with technology – Community Connections has a cloud-based database and rostering system that staff need to access with their mobile devices§ §Benefits§ § §Pay rate is between $20.50 and $25.50 depending on qualifications and experience.§ §Flexible working options§ §Ongoing professional development§ §Supportive team environment§ §Making positive differences in people’s lives and in the community§ §How to apply§  §All applications must go through our website.  Head to https://www.ccslt.org.nz/job/pn-pt-network-facilitator-plk007/ §Click on the “Apply for Job” button, fill in the online form, and attach your CV and cover letter.§  §For further information, contact §matt.sang@ccslt.org.nz§  §About Community Connections§  §We are a community based disability support provider that operates across much of the North Island. Do you want to make a genuine, positive impact on the lives of tamariki, rangatahi and whānau? Then look no further, Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children have got you covered with this great opportunity!§About us - mō mātou§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki §first§We believe §Aroha §is vital§We respect the §Mana §of people§We are §Tika §and §Pono §We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that§ Oranga§ is a journey§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work service that is child-centred, trauma informed and effective for all cultures.§About the role - mō te tūnga§In this role, you will be part of making a difference to the lives of our children, young people and their family by:§Co-working (building up to key working) cases with tamariki or rangatahi to hear their voices and support them and their whānau to make positive changes§Working alongside various cultural groups and people from different backgrounds§Complete initial safety checks and assessments on the child, young person and their family§Being involved in planning interventions to be delivered to maintain wellbeing of tamariki and rangatahi§Working alongside partners in our community, non-government organisations and state sector agencies§Transitioning children and young people back to their families or into their forever home§Being an advocate on behalf of tamariki and rangatahi to ensure they have the support and resources needed to reach their full potential§About you - mōu§We are looking for candidates that demonstrate the following:§A full, clean, valid New Zealand driver's licence§Provisional registration with New Zealand's Social Work Registration Board (SWRB)§A social worker qualification recognised by the SWRB§Eagerness to learn, be proactive and demonstrate tika and pono§Good written skills as you will need to write court reports and case notes§Sound judgement and organisational skills§Excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt to your audience§Empathy, patience and ability to see past what someone may be struggling with§A positive outlook and supportive nature§What we offer - tāu e tuku nei:§A salary of $55,000 - $60,000 depending on experience§Payment of your provisional registration and Practicing Certificate fees with the SWRB§Regular learning forums about our core fundamental social work processes and practice§A great, supportive team environment§Flexible work opportunities§A chance to have your say on how we continue to make our grad programme the best it can possibly be§Access to a generous Southern Cross health plan and banking package with Westpac§Rewarding and challenging work that truly makes a difference to the community§Opportunities to work alongside various cultural groups, build your network and strengthen community relationships§How to apply - me pēhea te tuku tono§Apply online with your CV. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site, please do not email through applications and/or CVs. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Terri Telford on §terri.telford@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as applications close on Friday, 23 October 2020.§To see more about this exciting role, check out the position description below:§http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/social-worker-position-description.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50657539.txt	§Economic Development Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Economic Development Project Manager§§Advertiser: §Dunedin City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Dunedin is an amazing place to live and work, and if you were to ask anyone living here, they'll tell you that there's something indescribably special about our city. It's small enough to feel like you're part of a community, but big enough to ensure that there's always something going on. From the great outdoors to arts, culture and education, all within 10 minutes of the city centre. Dunedin has so much to offer, so why not come and feel just how special it is?§      §Economic Development Project Manager §      §        §          §Oversee the delivery of multi-faceted economic development projects§          §Utilise your leadership skills and experience to support a dynamic and driven team§          §Excel in maximising stakeholder engagement to encourage economic growth§        §        §Reporting to the Economic Development Manager, you will provide tactical leadership, professional expertise and day-to-day support to the core Economic Development Team (currently four direct reports).§        §The Economic Development Project Manager is a unique role.§        §Salary Range: $88,934 - $104,628§        §There has never been a stronger call to action to support the economic and social wellbeing of Dunedin city. You will have the chance to make a meaningful difference in supporting the city through the challenges presented by COVID-19 as well respond to future opportunities.§        §We are looking for an outcome driven individual with experience in planning, implementing and monitoring public sector activities and projects. Your leadership experience and strong interpersonal skills will enable you to engage and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders to facilitate economic growth. You will be an excellent communicator with an understanding of local government decision making. Ideally, you will have experience of economic development, together with an understanding of Dunedin's economic environment and knowledge.§        §You should have a relevant tertiary qualification,§        §You will join a high performing team committed to delivering the best outcomes  for the Dunedin and Otago region. If you are open-minded and show respect towards others, we would like to hear from you.§        §Applications close: 19 October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Oversee the delivery of multi-faceted economic development projects§ §Utilise your leadership skills and experience to support a dynamic and driven team§ §Excel in maximising stakeholder engagement to encourage economic growth§ §Reporting to the Economic Development Manager, you will provide tactical leadership, professional expertise and day-to-day support to the core Economic Development Team (currently four direct reports).§  §The Economic Development Project Manager is a unique role.§  §Salary Range: $88,934 - $104,628§  §There has never been a stronger call to action to support the economic and social wellbeing of Dunedin city. You will have the chance to make a meaningful difference in supporting the city through the challenges presented by COVID-19 as well respond to future opportunities.§  §We are looking for an outcome driven individual with experience in planning, implementing and monitoring public sector activities and projects. Your leadership experience and strong interpersonal skills will enable you to engage and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders to facilitate economic growth. You will be an excellent communicator with an understanding of local government decision making. Ideally, you will have experience of economic development, together with an understanding of Dunedin's economic environment and knowledge.§  §You should have a relevant tertiary qualification,§  §You will join a high performing team committed to delivering the best outcomes  for the Dunedin and Otago region. jobText: TXT/50630408.txt	§Kairaranga ā Whānau - Full-Time, Permanent - Whakātane§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kairaranga ā Whānau - Full-Time, Permanent - Whakātane§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Kairaranga ā Whānau - full-time, permanent - Whakātane§Maranga Mai! Marewa Ake!§Kua whakaritengia e te Manatū Oranga Tamariki ki Whakatāne tēnei tūranga rangatira. Mēnā kei a koe ngā pukenga, me te ngākaunui mō ēnei momo mahi, me tukua mai tou tono inaianei tonu.§Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of tamariki, rangatahi, taiohi?§Are you passionate about reunification of tamariki, rangatahi, taiohi with their whakapapa, with their whānau?§Promote the protection and wellbeing of tamariki, rangatahi, taiohi§Join a team that considers themselves whānau§Who are we?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work practice that is child-centred, trauma informed and effective for all cultures. Everything we do is underpinned by the principles of Mana Tamaiti, Whakapapa and Whakawhanaungatanga§What you will do?§The purpose of this role is to support our staff to identify whānau, hapū and iwi relationships and ensure that tamariki and whānau stay well connected.§This role will also provide support to Social Workers (or Coordinators) to enable good decision making for the safety and well-being of tamariki and rangatahi by identifying key people in the wider whānau/hapū/iwi who will actively contribute to the decision making. Where appropriate, Kairaranga ā-Whānau will support whānau to identify those within the whānau, hapū or iwi who may be able to offer care to tamariki and rangatahi.§Kairaranga ā-Whānau have an important role in supporting Oranga Tamariki in meeting the requirements of Section 7 AA 2 (b). Section 7 AA 2 (b): the policies, practices, and services of the department have regard to mana tamaiti (tamariki) and the whakapapa of Māori children and young persons and the whanaungatanga responsibilities of their whānau, hapū, and iwi.§What you will bring?§The ability to quickly build rapport with tamariki and rangatahi§A good understanding and knowledge of te reo me ona tikanga§The ability to engage whānau and facilitate a Hui ā-whānau process with a focus on safe plans for tamariki§Established relationships and networks with local Iwi, Marae and community§Excellent communication (written and verbal) and engagement skills§A clean, current NZ driver's licence is essential§What's on offer?§A salary range between $63,885 - $89,663§Flexible work opportunities and full compensation for any overtime hours worked§A great, supportive team environment who will welcome you with open arms§A rewarding career where you will work in a values-based role which is truly making a difference§Regular supervision, training and career development opportunities§Colleagues who are committed to the highest standards of strengths-based social work practice§Practical experience to coach and mentor staff§Access to a generous Southern Cross health plan and banking package with Westpac§What team you will work with?§The Whakatāne site is values-driven and we support each other professionally and personally. We enjoy doing things together such as lunch time walks, morning teas and lunches and getting involved in our community. Honesty and respect comes naturally in our team, it's a big part of who we are and how we work as one.§How to apply§Internal Oranga Tamariki Employees - please apply through your MyHR portal at work. This will ensure that your MyHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate. All external applicants including Ministry of Social Development employees please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system. Please note all applications must be made online.§If you have any questions about the role please contactSravani Peddibhotla on §Sravani.peddibhotla@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as application close on Friday, 9 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The team is expanding, and they are looking to hire a Case Manager/Field Officer in Auckland.§ §Reporting to the Senior Case Manager, the Case Manager will support workers who are struggling and connect them to appropriate help. This is done by assessing workers needs and issues and develop a plan with the worker to address such needs and issues, referring workers to the services which can assist them using a brief intervention model.§ §This role walks alongside individuals and /or worksites to engage and build rapport, to initiate conversation, and to identify and address concerns relating to mental health and/or suicide thoughts or suicide grief. jobText: TXT/50680140.txt	§Senior Social Worker-Caregiver Recruitment §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Social Worker-Caregiver Recruitment §§Advertiser: §Youth Horizons Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$70,000-$80,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Senior Social Worker - Caregiver Recruitment §Unique opportunity for a senior social worker to step into the recruitment space§Supportive and values-based team environment§Auckland or Hamilton based role§This is a unique opportunity for a registered Social Worker to step into the recruitment space. You will use your clinical expertise and skills to assess potential foster carers who are a safe and good match for the needs of rangatahi who are in care.§Our organisation provides short-term care interventions. Our goal is for rangatahi to return to their whānau/family at the earliest safe opportunity.§In partnership with foster care practice leaders, you will contribute to the identification of candidates' strengths, learning areas, and risk factors and apply best practice social work interview processes to assess candidate suitability.§Our marketing team will support you to creatively attract potential caregivers, while an administration person will support you to ensure the recruitment process is conducted in a timely and seamless manner.§If you have been considering a new career path and would like to step back from frontline work yet still utilise your social work experience and expertise, this may be the exciting opportunity you've been seeking. To put the cherry on top, you can take a new direction in your career without a huge pay cut. Opportunities like this do not come often, so don't delay and apply now.§What You Will Deliver§Build positive, approachable, warm and responsive relationships with caregiver candidates.§Conduct high quality caregiver assessment interviews.§Produce recruitment recommendations informed by relevant analytics and comprehensive recruitment information.§Recruit a strong network of caregivers who have the cultural, interpersonal and parenting skills to meet the diverse needs of rangatahi in care.§The role is office based however frequent local and regional travel is required to visit office sites and caregivers. Occasional flexibility in working hours needed to fulfil the role.§About You§A degree in Social Work and Social Worker registration.§Five years' or more experience in social work.§Ideally experience in foster care work.§Excellent assessment skills with a good understanding of parenting risk profiles and social work risk management.§An understanding of the impacts of trauma on child development and the intergenerational impacts of colonisation on Māori.§Excellent administrative and organisational skills and a structured and detail orientated approach.§Some experience in recruitment and marketing (not essential but desired)§Full driver's licence.§About Youth Horizons | Kia Puāwai§Youth Horizons | Kia Puāwai is a non-profit organisation providing therapeutic services for young people who have complex behaviour and/or mental health needs. Our innovative approach combines evidence-based models of practice along with a focus on our core values of Manaakitanga, Wairuatanga, Aroha and Whanaungatanga.§Our national office is in Auckland and we have over 250 staff and caregivers supporting young people and their families and whanau across the North and lower South Islands.§To find out more about Youth Horizons | Kia Puāwai, visit www.youthorizons.org.nz§It's a unique opportunity to make a difference so apply now! §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

All applications will be managed by People Plus on behalf of Wairoa Young Achievers Trust.§  §Applications close Monday 12th of October.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Casual Assistant (Personal Support Worker) Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50646102.txt	§Casual Assistant (Personal Support Worker)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Casual Assistant (Personal Support Worker)§§Advertiser: §L'Arche Kapiti§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Salary§§$20 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§General Outline of Role § §The live-out Assistant role is one that supports the Core Members (those with intellectual disabilities) in a L’Arche home and provides extra support to the live-in Assistant Team. One may have full-time hours in this role, or part-time hours, depending on the needs and schedules of the L’Arche homes. One may also be a Casual Assistant, where an individual is called to support L’Arche on an “as needed” basis. Typically, a live-out Assistant supports the L’Arche home either in the mornings with breakfast, personal care routines, cleaning and medication, or in the afternoons/evenings, for dinner preparation, personal routines, social outings, house prayer, etc. Many times, live-out Assistants are asked to support the home both in the morning and the evening—on a given day—to add to the stability of the home. Live-out Assistants may also be asked to support our day programme (Aroha Day Activities) from time to time, or to be at one of the L’Arche homes during the day if Core Members are home sick or cannot go to their regular activities.  As L’Arche at times has international live-in Assistants from overseas for a period of time, the goal with live-out, local Assistants is to offer continuity, stability and consistency to the L’Arche home over time. § § § § All Assistants, both live-in and live-out, are responsible to help create and foster a safe and home-like atmosphere for those with intellectual disabilities and other Assistants to live in. The live-out Assistant works primarily with a team of 2-3 other Assistants (most or all of whom live in the L’Arche home). His/her team leader would be the House Leader who is the bridge between the office and home teams. The focus for these two teams is the well-being of Core Members and Assistants in the home, and to ensure that the home is living out the L’Arche International Mission and Identity statements to the best of its ability.§ § § §L’Arche Mission:§ § §  To make known the gifts of people with learning disabilities, revealed through mutually§ §     transforming relationships§ § §  To engage in our diverse cultures, working together toward a more human society§ §  To foster an environment in our community that is inspired by the core values in our founding story and respond to the changing needs of our members§ §   § §L’Arche Identity:§ § §  We are people, with and without learning disabilities, sharing life in communities of faith§ §  Mutual relationships and trust in god are at the heart of our life together§ § We seek to build a world that recognizes the unique value of every person and our need of one another. § § In the L’Arche philosophy and tradition, people with and without intellectual disabilities share life together and support one another to lead full and complete lives. Mutually transforming relationships and trust in God are at the heart of all L’Arche communities. § §  § §The primary duties of a House Assistant include:§ § § §Supporting the high quality of health and wellbeing of Core Members:§ Supporting Core Members in their social outings, hobbies and life goals§ § §Supporting an environment where the value and unique contribution of each member in the house § §     is respected and appreciated.§ § §Supporting growth, autonomy, confidence and a full life for each Core Member. § §Medication administration§ §Supporting individuals in their personal care routines as needed (dressing, showering, etc.)§ §Supporting individuals to be as independent as possible (i.e., cooking, cleaning, making life § §       choices§ § §Supporting people through any behavioural issues (providing positive behaviour support, following       behaviour support plans, tracking behaviour, etc.). Working cooperatively with others in the house to manage changes to physical and emotional needs of Core Members. § §Supporting Core Members to participate in financial planning, banking and spending decisions.§ §At times accompanying Core Members to medical appointments such as dental care or eye check-ups. Ensuring professional relationships with specialists and following up with accurate records, communicating changes and follow-up care. Communicating with the Health Coordinator. § §Communicating and completing accurate paperwork and administration: § § § § §Being a reference person for one Core Member’s LifeStyle Plan (helping them reach their annual goals). Understanding and following these plans as well as contributing to them. § §Keeping paperwork up-to-date and filled-in daily: communication books, health-tracking forms, menu plans, night checks, progress notes etc.§ §Understanding and adhering to the guidelines, policies, and regulations of the L’Arche Community and government bodies. § §Communicating in a timely way and two-way. Oral, written and electronic communication is effective, clear and concise. Actively listening. Striving to understand the different forms of communication used by members of the home. Asking for clarity when directions are unclear. § § § §Working on a team of 2-3 assistants with the House Leader and office team: §Working with the Health Coordinator and House Leader to ensure that each Core Member has the highest quality of health possible. § § §Accepting direction and being accountable to the House Leader. Supporting, collaborating with, and coordinating well with others in the house and community. § §Supporting a safe and trusting environment where everyone feels safe to grow and nurture one another’s growth. § §Listening well to each other and understanding different ways of being in the team (including understanding strengths and weaknesses in team members and encouraging one another towards more growth)§ §Completing household duties: § § §Helping to buy household supplies and food from time, within budget, and as directed by the House Leader. This includes driving.§ §Helping to keep the home clean, tidy and hygienic, according to the cleaning roster. Sharing in responsibility for maintenance of the home, vehicle, furniture and equipment and raising issues in a timely way. § § § §Supporting a strong spiritual life for the community: § § §Understanding the spiritual basis of L’Arche and working to integrate this into a meaningful spiritual life in the home. Participating and supporting house traditions, prayer and personal reflection. § §Supporting and encouraging Core Members on their chosen spiritual journey. Respecting diverse spiritual approaches. Providing day-to-day support for Core Members, taking them to their chosen places of worship and supporting them with prayer or other spiritual practices. Open to seeing and discovering a spiritual meaning in day-to day community life at L’Arche. § §Supporting celebrations in the home that are joyous and creatively tailored to each occasion or person. Being involved in the planning and follow through. § §Learning about and understanding the traditions of L’Arche and of the L’Arche home. § §Supporting and recognizing a comfortable rhythm of life in the home. Including participating in meals and special time of relationship and participating in traditions of the community. § §Supporting a spirit in the home of life-sharing with one another rather than “doing for” others. § § § §Overall, each House Assistant ensures the Core Members are involved with the running of the household, are growing in their ability to take responsibility for their home and actions, and are empowered to make their own choices with support. Each Assistant must have a strong grasp of how the “duty to care” vs. the “dignity of risk” are lived-out in the household. For instance, Core Members (like all individuals), have the right to take reasonable risks, and ideally grow in the learning process.  Finally, each Assistant has a role in supporting Core Members to reach their personal and professional goals, enhance their skills, and to vision and dream for their future (through the Core Members’ “Life Style Plan”). In essence, each Assistant must be a good example of what it means to live the L’Arche Identity and Mission in concrete, loving ways. Assistants are expected to model this for the volunteers. For anyone interested in this role, it is strongly recommended that they research the L’Arche movement to ensure that it’s a good fit for them and their lifestyle. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a support worker?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50629821.txt	§Kaitiriwā Whakahaere Tikaka - Deputy Practice Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaitiriwā Whakahaere Tikaka - Deputy Practice Leader§§Advertiser: §The Methodist Mission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Kaitiriwā Whakahaere  Tikaka – Deputy Practice Leader§ §Methodist Mission Southern is searching for the right person to continue our journey in §meeting our commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi. § §The Mission is an innovative social justice agency headquartered in Dunedin, delivering services through Otago and Southland.   § §The Kaitiriwā Whakahaere Tikaka strongly supports culturally responsive practice throughout the Mission, building relationships within the Māori community, convening our §Nga Hau e Wha §Rōpu, the Methodist Mission Southern Māori network and is a member of the Management Team.§ §You will be responsible for leading initiatives such as implementing and monitoring our internal cultural competency framework and professional development programme. Your influencing and strategic skills will provide frameworks for future programme and product development to ensure its responsiveness to Māori and local mana whenua.  You’ll work alongside our Kaiārahi Tikaka (Practice Leader) to implement training, strategies, plans and tools to strengthen culturally responsive practice alongside driving continuous improvement and best practice generally, and supporting practice development specifically through the use of the Mission’s QualityWorks process.§ §You will have: § § §A strong grounding in Te Ao Māori (essential) and fluency in Te Reo Kai Tahu (desirable)§ §Credibility with key internal and external stakeholders within the Māori community§ §Successful experience in developing and managing Māori stakeholder relationships§ §In depth knowledge and experience of the aspirations and needs of Māori§ §Experience and knowledge in implementing and monitoring programmes of work§ §A background in education or education-related delivery is preferred, otherwise a strong background in community-based, multi-disciplinary social services is required§ §A collaborative and achievement focused approach§ §Current full driver’s license§ §If you wish to discuss the opportunity in more depth, contact the Mission’s Kaihautū (Director) §laurab@mmsouth.org.nz§ or on 027 4664600.§ §An application pack including a Job Description is available from §katrinar@mmsouth.org.nz§ or by phoning Katrina on §03 466 4600§.§ §Please forward your application which must comprise an introductory letter, CV and completed Application for Employment Form to §admin@mmsouth.org.nz§ §Applications close on Friday 9th October.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50629039.txt	§Policy and Practice Manager: Homelessness§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy and Practice Manager: Homelessness§§Advertiser: §Mana Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Policy and Practice Manager - Homelessness§ §The role can be based anywhere in NZ with robust internet service and direct air links to Christchurch, Wellington and Auckland. Travel will likely be required occasionally between the cities and to other community and social housing sites around New Zealand in support of the sector’s communications and stakeholder initiatives.§  §A few years of practical experience with a provider in the NZ community, and looking for a national role as a next step in your career?§ § §Experience working in a housing, homelessness or related service?§ §Small, effective and highly innovative NGO.§ §Newly created position.§ §Community Housing Aotearoa (CHA) is a peak body for New Zealand’s community housing sector. Advocating on the sector’s behalf to Government and others, the organisation builds the reputation of the sector by showcasing its achievements and reinforcing its business and community models. Successfully delivering a responsive housing system, increasing supply of adequate homes and working with quality providers have all attributed to the delivery of better resident and community outcomes CHA is a member driven organisation and is governed by an elected Council representing member providers, with over 110 member organisations including Iwi, Māori and Pasifika  organisations.  CHA works collaboratively with Te Matapihi he Tirohanga mō te Iwi Trust (Te Matapihi) the peak body for Māori housing providers to form an innovative, sustainable and people focused result for the long term.§  §Accountable for identifying and understanding effective practice, the Policy and Practice Manager – Homelessness , will navigate a principles based approach, to support people and their whānau to access permanent housing and to ‘live well’ in communities.  Providing support to the sector, the Manager will work within the sector to provide tools and resources that enable the sector to grow and develop.  Key to the position is the capability to build an effective practice with a set of quality frameworks, which has key focus on supporting the implementation of a tailored structure that is responsive to the needs of Māori.§  §To enable the delivery of key homeless support services, prior experience within the sector and ability to translate complex sector material into capacity building content that will resonate with multiple audiences is critical. Maintaining a broad and deep understanding of the key issues influencing the community housing sector and homeless service providers, you will promote collaboration to ensure housing and support services are adapting, connected, and effective.§  §Skills, experience and knowledge required will include:§ § §Previous experience working in a housing, homelessness or related service.§ §Prior experience working in bi-cultural frameworks.§ §Strong understanding and knowledge of the Treaty of Waitangi and its implications for the housing sector today.§ §Skilled in writing policy and practice guidelines and experienced in report writing for a range of different audiences using dynamic ways of conveying messages.§ §Demonstrated skills working co-operatively with others to solve problems and complete tasks.§ §Experience in development and implementation of practice or quality frameworks.§ §Strong computer literacy including good working knowledge of Microsoft Office and cloud-based computing.§ §A degree level qualification in relevant field or equivalent on the job, ‘lived’ experience is required for this position.§  §Developing toolkits, guidelines and resources to facilitate access to information and consistent quality practice, the position is responsible for effective internal and external stakeholder management, as well as management of information and updates for various communication mediums.  Providing information and advice on evidence-based approaches that yield quality housing and service outcomes, this position will build the capacity of the sector by information exchange, sharing good practice and developing learning opportunities.  As such your personal mana, humility and cultural competency will be well placed, sustained and nurtured.§  §To apply, or to enquire further in confidence call or email please contact Heather Walker for a confidential conversation now on §(09) 632 1108§ or email your up-dated CV and covering letter through to heather@manarecruitment.co.nz§  §Applications close Monday 19th of October 2020 at 5.00pm. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§
