jobText: TXT/50552379.txt	§Communications Manager - Pou Whakapāpā - Te Mātāwai§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Manager - Pou Whakapāpā - Te Mātāwai§§Advertiser: §Te Matawai§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Indigenous & Multicultural Services§§§§§§Kei te hiahia whai kawenga pai koe i te takiwā ki te reo Māori? He hinonga takahi whakamua a Te Mātāwai e para huarahi auaha ana mō tētahi e kohara ana ki ngā mahi whakapāpā, kia whakauru mai ki tō mātou tīma. §  §Ka whai huarahi hoki ki te mahi hāngai tonu ki te Tumu Whakarae, me te tīma whai pūmanawa kakama o Te Mātāwai, tae atu ki te iwi me ngāi Māori. He mahi tēnei mā te ringa raupā, he tūranga whakahaere, e kawea hāngai tonu e koe te āhua o te tuarihia o ngā mahi a Te Mātāwai ki te hunga whānui e whai wāhi mai ana ki ngā mahi. §  §Ka whakahaeretia e koe tētahi mema tautoko i ngā mahi whakapāpā, kei a koe hoki ngā kawenga mō ngā hononga pāpāho katoa, te pāhopori, ngā hononga tūmatanui me ngā mahi whakatairanga, tae atu ki te tuhi i ngā pānui pāpāho, ngā pānui, me te whakautu i ngā pātai a te ao pāpāho. Ka mahi tahi koe, ka tautoko hoki i ngā mahi a ngā tīma mō te kaupapa here, te haumitanga, te rangahau me te tari, i te mahi tahi a Te Mātāwai ki ngā iwi me te Karauna ki te whakarauora i te reo Māori.§  §Heria mai rā ō pūkenga, ō wheako, tō ngākau kohara, to kaha, tō ngākau auaha me tō māia ki te rautaki, me tō taha ringa raupā ki ngā mahi whakapāpā. He mahi tūturu tēnei ka mahia mai ki Te Whanga-nui-a-Tara- nō reira kawea ake te mānuka kua takoto, kia rongo ai koe i te reka o ngā hua. §  §E hono mai ai ki te whānau o Te Mātāwai me mārama koe ki te tikanga Māori, me kōrero Māori, me āhei rānei ki te whakaatu i te ū o tō ngākau ki te ako.§  §Haere ki https://www.tematawai.maori.nz/communications/job-vacancies-maori mō ētahi atu kōrero. §  §Mō ētahi atu kōrero, whakapā mai koa ki a Charmaine Ngarimu, Pou Whakapāpā (takawaenga) §charmaine@tematawai.maori.nz§.§  §Ki te tono mō te tūranga, īmērahia mai tētahi tono kua oti te whakakī mai, tētahi reta uhi, me tō CV ki a §mahi@tematawai.maori.nz§. Ka kati ngā tono hei te 5 i te ahiahi o te 27 o Mahuru. Ka noho matatapu ngā tono me ngā pātai katoa. §  §Ka whakaaetia ko ngā tono a te hunga e whai mana ana ki te mahi ki Aotearoa anahe.§  § §  §Do you want to make a positive impact in the Māori language space? Te Mātāwai is a progressive entity with exciting opportunities for a passionate communications person to join our team.§  §You will have the opportunity to work directly with the Tumu Whakarae and the skilled and enthusiastic Te Mātāwai team as well as iwi and Māori. This is a very hands-on, operational role where you will be in a position to directly influence how the Te Mātāwai activities are shared across our broad range of stakeholders.§  §You will manage a communications support member and be responsible for all media relations, social media, PR and promotions including writing media releases, statements and responding to media enquiries. You will also work alongside and support the work of policy, investment and research teams and the office as Te Mātāwai works with iwi and the Crown to revitalise the Māori language.§  §Bring your skills, experience, passion, energy, innovation and boldness to strategy and the ‘hands on’ side of communications. This is a full-time position based in Wellington – take up the challenge and savour the rewards.§  §To join the Te Mātāwai whānau you should have an understanding of tikanga Māori and either be a Māori language speaker or able to demonstrate a commitment to learn.§  §Visit https://www.tematawai.maori.nz/communications/job-vacancies for more information§  §For information, please contact Charmaine Ngarimu, Communications Manager (acting) §charmaine@tematawai.maori.nz§.§  §To apply, email a completed application form along with a cover letter and CV to §mahi@tematawai.maori.nz§. All applications and questions will be treated in confidence.§  §Applications close on 27 September 2020 and will only be accepted from people with the right to work in Aotearoa.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50688055.txt	§Manager Regional Services - Hamilton, Waikato Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Regional Services - Hamilton, Waikato Region§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §Manager Regional Services - Hamilton, Waikato Region §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35109§        §The Manager Regional Services leads a team of advisory staff to support service delivery to our clients. This role is responsible for identifying and embedding opportunities to maximise regional effectiveness. In this role you work closely with the Regional Director – Waikato to deliver on projects and initiatives that improve outcomes for clients.  You also actively look for ways to improve outcomes for Māori, Pacific and people with disabilities as a priority.§        §About you§        §You are a collaborative, relationship builder who is able to see the big picture and break it down into tangible steps. With your proven ability to manage projects, you are methodical and able to clearly articulate your approach and influence others to adopt it. You are a strong communicator who enjoys maximising people’s strengths and influencing change.   §        §To succeed in this role, you have:§        §          §experience embedding and building on Te Ao Māori within previous leadership roles§          §experience achieving client-centred outcomes in a complex service environment§          §proven performance in creating, implementing and monitoring change programmes§          §a working knowledge of systems thinking and continuous improvement processes§          §the ability to influence change and performance through an evidence-based approach.§        §        §Benefits§        §          §a supportive and collegial environment§          §a diverse and varied work programme§          §the opportunity to contribute to the social outcomes for a region with much diversity, opportunities and challenges§          §coaching and professional development opportunities§          §competitive salary $100k to $120k per annum (dependant on relevant experience, skills and other factors).§        §        §How to apply§        §Apply online with your current CV and a cover letter outlining your suitability for the role. §        §For a further discussion about the role contact Katie McCreesh (EA to Regional Director) on §(07) 957 1535§.§        §Please note: Frequent travel throughout the Waikato region is required in this role.§        §Position Description:  §        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-service-delivery/regional-service-delivery/manager-regional-services-jan20.docx§        §Applications close: Wednesday, 14 October 2020 at 10pm.§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35109§ §The Manager Regional Services leads a team of advisory staff to support service delivery to our clients. This role is responsible for identifying and embedding opportunities to maximise regional effectiveness. In this role you work closely with the Regional Director – Waikato to deliver on projects and initiatives that improve outcomes for clients.  You also actively look for ways to improve outcomes for Māori, Pacific and people with disabilities as a priority.§ §About you§ §You are a collaborative, relationship builder who is able to see the big picture and break it down into tangible steps. With your proven ability to manage projects, you are methodical and able to clearly articulate your approach and influence others to adopt it. You are a strong communicator who enjoys maximising people’s strengths and influencing change.   § §To succeed in this role, you have:§ § §experience embedding and building on Te Ao Māori within previous leadership roles§ §experience achieving client-centred outcomes in a complex service environment§ §proven performance in creating, implementing and monitoring change programmes§ §a working knowledge of systems thinking and continuous improvement processes§ §the ability to influence change and performance through an evidence-based approach.§ §Benefits§ § §a supportive and collegial environment§ §a diverse and varied work programme§ §the opportunity to contribute to the social outcomes for a region with much diversity, opportunities and challenges§ §coaching and professional development opportunities§ §competitive salary $100k to $120k per annum (dependant on relevant experience, skills and other factors).§ §How to apply§ §Apply online with your current CV and a cover letter outlining your suitability for the role. § §For a further discussion about the role contact Katie McCreesh (EA to Regional Director) on §(07) 957 1535§.§ §Please note: Frequent travel throughout the Waikato region is required in this role.§ §Position Description:  § §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-service-delivery/regional-service-delivery/manager-regional-services-jan20.docx§ §Applications close: Wednesday, 14 October 2020 at 10pm.§ §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50686407.txt	§Facilitator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Facilitator§§Advertiser: §Deaf Aotearoa Holdings Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Have you ever thought about working with the Deaf community? This position is to support Deaf people, and to connect with the Deaf community.§ §Deaf Aotearoa provides a workplace which values diversity, and where both New Zealand Sign Language (NZSL) and English are used. Staff members are supported in the development of their NZSL skills and if required we can help them develop their written English as well. We have over a dozen nationalities represented within our staff, and we have an age range from people in their late teens to people in their sixties.§ §We are an equal opportunities employer and we have Deaf-friendly work practices in place. We employ Deaf and hearing people at all levels, NZSL interpreters are provided for all meetings and training courses.§ §We encourage and support professional development and offer flexible, family-friendly work practices.§ §We are strongly committed to following organisation standards that ensure we provide quality systems, work practices and services. We perform service audits and review our policies regularly.§ § § §About the role§ § § §Develop Service Plans with service users which identify personal goals, strengths and support systems§Marketing/Networking to potential employers/community§Provision of Hearing Assistive Technology§Keep the Deaf community up to date through the distribution of written/video updates§Deliver services with due care to the fundamental principles of being person centred; care and protection; privacy; empowerment and non-dependence.§Carry an active caseload as directed by the Team Leader, and ensure all new referrals are managed through the correct process.§Work as an effective member of the front-line service provision team, ensuring that Deaf & hearing people who visit Deaf Aotearoa receive a positive service experience.§Promote the work and interests of Deaf Aotearoa.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Marketing, Networking and Business experience§Relationship building skills §Ongoing commitment to Deaf Aotearoa's Vision and Purpose§Bilingual - New Zealand Sign Language/English§Preferred experience in working with the Deaf Community§Experience in the not-for-profit/community sector §Experience in using variety of IT systems and applications (Microsoft Office)  §Commitment to the Treaty of Waitangi principles §Able to legally drive in New Zealand and have own vehicle § § § §Applications for this position close§ 16th October 2020§This is a full-time, permanent position located in our Waikato office.§ §For a full job description please go to https://www.deaf.org.nz/about/staff/work-for-us/§ §For more information, please contact Anna Foord at §anna.foord@deaf.org.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Do you have experience working in the not-for-profit sector?§§§

jobTitle: Support Coordinators - Cardigan Bay Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50694436.txt	§Support Coordinators - Cardigan Bay§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Coordinators - Cardigan Bay§§Advertiser: §Hohepa Canterbury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 per hour (dependent on quals)§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Our Purpose:§ Our Reason For Being§ §When you work at Hohepa Canterbury, you are part of something very special.  We are a community leader providing services and support for people living with an intellectual disability based on the anthroposophical principles of Rudolf Steiner. We actively engage with the people we support so to empower them to develop to their fullest potential and lead enriched and meaningful lives in a holistic, supportive environment.§ §Our Culture:§ What We Care About§ §What matters to us is putting people at the centre of all we do. We show empathy for and respect towards others, we are accountable for delivering outcomes, we go about our work with integrity in all we do, we have courage to do the right thing, for the people we support and ourselves.§ §The Opportunity:§ What This Role's All About§ §As a Support Coordinator you will be supporting people with disabilities in a range of settings including in their home, out in the community and at our day centres.§ §The people we support have varying levels of need with duties including cooking, cleaning, medication administration, stores purchasing, personal cares, as well as facilitating community participation, recreational activities, and supporting people to achieve their goals. You may also provide person-centred support in homes where routine is critical; following details plans to meet the needs of the people.§ §Rostered hours:§ §Sunday: 4pm to 11pm§ §Monday and Tuesday: 3pm to 11pm§ §Friday: 7am to 3pm§ §Saturday: 8am to 4pm§ §You:§ What Are We Looking For?§ §We are a progressive organisation looking for self-motivated, energetic and flexible people with a high level of initiative. We value teamwork and collaboration.§ §You will be a patient person, with confidence and a willingness to learn and continue to develop your skills as a support worker.  Your enthusiasm and passion for helping others will make a real difference in people’s lives.§ §You will have at least 2 years experience in a similar role and a Health and Wellbeing Certificate. A First Aid Certificate is desirable. Flexibility with shifts is preferred as you may need to assist with covering absences.§ §Applicants must have a full drivers licence and some IT skills.§ §Benefits: §What’s in it for you?§ § §On-going Nationally Accredited Industry training.§ §Hohepa’s positive and progressive team culture§ §A regular roster§ §Flexible working hours§ §Apply now by copying the link below and pasting it into your browser:§ §***PLEASE APPLY VIA THIS LINK ONLY OR YOUR APPLICATION MAY BE MISSED***§ §https://hohepacanterbury.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=92§ §Applicants will be progressed as they apply, so if this sounds like you, please apply now! § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a support coordinator?§Do have experience working with people with autism spectrum disorder?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50701359.txt	§Support Workers §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Workers §§Advertiser: §VisionWest Community Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§ §VisionWest Home HealthCare is an established provider and has over 20 years’ experience providing quality, professional home help support to people, enabling them to live independently within their own homes. Our clients include people of all ages, with varying needs - from a young person living with a complex disability, to an older person requiring home help. We are currently looking for energetic, caring, committed and empathetic people to provide quality in-home care to our clients. VisionWest Home HealthCare has a Vision to see Transformed Lives, Healthy Communities. We provide support from 7.00 am to 9.30 pm 7 days a week and offer variable hours.  §The Role§Our Support Workers assist our clients to live as independently as possible with a range of different tasks: §  §Household tasks - cleaning, vacuuming, laundry etc §  §Meal preparation§  §Personal care - showering, toileting, dressing etc§  §Community living - shopping, exercise etc§  §Medication oversight - prompting/supervising clients with medication§  §Mobility assistance – assisting client’s mobility with walking frames, hoists etc.  §Why work for VisionWest Home Healthcare?§By joining us you will receive quality training, support and all the benefits of working for a well-established and caring organisation. We provide a career pathway for staff by supporting you to achieve a Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (NZQA qualifications), which are fully funded. §APPLY NOW! §Please phone §09 818 0737§ or email §hr@visionwest.org.nz§ §You must have the right to work in New Zealand and a you will be required to undergo police vetting and additional checks in order to be considered for this position.§VisionWest Home Healthcare is a service of VisionWest Community Trust which is an award-winning, not-for-profit organisation with faith-based roots, that provides a range of services to communities in Auckland, Bay of Plenty, Waikato and Christchurch.§ §To find out more visit § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50682529.txt	§Whanau Support Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Whanau Support Worker§§Advertiser: §STRIVE Community Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§STRIVE Community Trust is committed to bringing together key people who have the passion for and commitment to proactively work towards assisting Families/Whanau to "Total Wellbeing"§ §STRIVE Community Trust provides emergency and transitional housing for up to a period of 12 weeks. The Trust will support all aspects of the tenants’ lives by providing a full range of wrap-around services with the purpose to attain sustainable and long term housing solutions.§The position supports tenant’s complex or serious needs by addressing the underlying causes that led to homelessness and thereby leading to better outcomes. This role works within the emergency & transitional housing social service team and other health, education, social sector agencies and community organisations with the purpose to:§ § §Identify longer-term housing solutions ;§ §Assisting in the transition into longer-term accommodation;§ §The kinds of practical support you will offer will depend on what each tenant needs, but could include budgeting advice, help with relationship issues, healthy living plans, life skills coaching, and assistance to help tenants return to education, training or to find stable work.§ §STRIVE Community Trust is seeking dynamic, disciplined and suitably experienced staff. You will be empathetic, have cultural understanding, experience and practices that are appropriate for the local population, be able to coach and empower in a strengths based way, be open-minded and non-judgemental.§ §All STRIVE personnel are screened and police vetted to assess they are a safe person to work with children.§ §Successful candidates will:§ § §Have a minimum three years demonstrated experience working with the client group who will require this service;§ §Excellent advocacy and communication skills;§ §Have proven experience in developing plans for the client group, identifying their needs and ascertaining any risk;§ §Experience with clients with Mental Health needs would be advantageous;§ §Show clear and professional communication in both written and verbal, the ability to goal plan, and problem solving comes naturally to you;§ §Have established links and can demonstrate active development of working partnerships with support services in the community eg, counselling services, alcohol and drug specialists, employment support agencies, education providers, food banks and other social services;§ §Be able to identify cultural needs and facilitate access and provide links for support;§ §Be culturally aware and have knowledge in particular of Maori and Pacific Island cultures and uphold the tenets of Te Tiriti o Waitangi;§ §Highly efficient skills in case management, evaluation and record keeping;§ §Time-management skills are crucial to meet reporting deadlines;§ §Proficient in use of a computer and experience with excel and word and a database system;§ §Have a full clean driver's licence;§ §Closing Date: Friday 23rd October 2020§ §Send your CV and Cover Letter to:§STRIVE Community Trust§Phone:§(09) 9542487§ or§Email: §hr@strive.org.nz§ §Email for a full job description.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50685044.txt	§Suicide Prevention Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Suicide Prevention Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Raukura Hauora O Tainui§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§At Raukura Hauora O Tainui, we provide an extensive range of primary and community health care services within our communities. We offer services for all ages and backgrounds, delivered by qualified and experienced staff.  As a Maaori health organisation, we have a strong tikanga maaori based approach to providing better health solutions for all. § §We are looking for a Co-ordinator to join our Suicide Prevention Team.§ §As our Coordinator, you will be part of a committed  team and you will have the opportunity to make a significant difference in the lives of whaanau. It is both rewarding and challenging.§ §In the role, you will:§ §Promote mental health and wellbeing, and be part of a team that improves the care of whaanau experiencing mental disorders associated with suicidal behaviors. You will also connect and liaise with other local services i.e justice systems, police, local marae to help identify and asses concerns relating to mental health and/or suicide.§ §If you have knowledge and/or experience of Suicide Prevention Coordination, and a passion for supporting whaanau and the community, then this could be the role for you.§ §Ideally you will have:§ § §Degree level qualification in the relevant field.§ §Experience of working in mental health or suicide prevention.§ §Previous experience within the community and/or primary mental health setting.§ §Highly developed communication, interpersonal skills.§ §Proven ability to build relationships in an effective and sensitive manner, particularly whaanau who may be experiencing distress.§ §You must hold a current clean Full Drivers Licence§ §A sound knowledge of Te Reo me ono taikanga would be advantageous.§ §If  this sounds like you, and you would like to be part of our team, please send us your CV, cover letter and any other relevant documents.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Catholic Youth Team - Events Coordinator Job in Canterbury - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50701686.txt	§Catholic Youth Team - Events Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Catholic Youth Team - Events Coordinator§§Advertiser: §The Catholic Diocese of Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§About the business and the role§ § § §Position Available:§ §CYT Events Coordinator – Catholic Diocese of Christchurch§ §Our Organisation§ §The Catholic Youth Team (CYT) is a ministry to the young people of the Diocese of Christchurch and serves on behalf of the Bishop of Christchurch. CYT assists in sharing the Gospel with Young People through a joyful and inspiring ministry, drawing them into the Church's Sacramental Life and preparing and empowering them for Mission as Disciples of Jesus Christ.§ §The Role§ §The CYT Events Coordinator works collaboratively with the CYT manager, and other CYT staff and volunteers to plan, prepare and facilitate the fun, inspiring, high quality CYT events that are open to young people from throughout the Diocese of Christchurch and New Zealand. These events include our major annual events, such as our Antioch Youth Camp and Revolution Youth Camp as well as other shorter events such as our Sports Day, Sports night, Firepower Youth Rally's. They would also support our Parishes with formation and resources to run local/city wide events and assist, as time allows, with other major Catholic events for young people such as World Youth Day. There are more specifics about different events on our website (www.cyt.org.nz ).§ §Hours & wage rate§ §The role is full time and does require some occasional evening, overnight and weeekend commitments. The wage rate will be negotiable depending on experience and qualifications.§ §To be successful in applying for this role the applicant should demonstrate:§ §Experience in organising, promoting and coordinating major Youth and young adult Ministry Events§Skills to manage communications, logistics, budgets§Competency with team and volunteer formation and management§An understanding and commitment to the Roman Catholic Faith§A  fun loving person with a passion for working with young people and their families/whanau§A current unrestricted driver's license would be an advantage§ §Place of Employment:§ §Catholic Youth Team Office, 122 Barbadoes Street, Christchurch, New Zealand.§ §Contact Person:§ §James Bryant, Diocesan Youth and Young Adult Ministry Manager§ §Applications:§ §Applications due before 29th October 2020§ § § § § § § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § § §Follow are some of the key tasks of the role:§ §The events coordinator will have a focus on creating and strengthening effective events for young people in our Diocese as well as building structures and resources to support our parish communities in running their own events programmes.§ §The Coordinator will need to collaborate with other CYT staff and Volunteers to plan, prepare and facilitate our major Diocesan events for the year. These currently include our annual Antioch, and Revolution Youth Camps; Young Adult camp, Sports day and Sports night but may include other events as they arise.§ §We have a large number of volunteers who assist our ministry with all our major events. It is the responsibility of the events coordinator to ensure the care and support of our volunteers as well as recruit and form new volunteers for events.§ §The coordinator will have an openness and flexibility to changes in the role and the event support needs of our local Catholic communities as new visions and structures solidify and become more firmly established. They will work collaboratively with CYT Management and staff as well as the Bishop, other Catholic Parish pastoral leaders to consider the future event support needs of our communities and how we might better engage local community youth groups and leaders in our events.§ §All CYT roles have a collaborative aspect to them and team members will work with other staff to offer various Ministry and Administration tasks as required by the Bishop or Management of the Diocese. These may include but not be limited to assisting with promotional material creation and distribution, appropriate registration processes, budgeting, communications and record keeping.§ § § §For full details of the role please request a copy of the Mission and Outreach Coordinators Role§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §To be successful in applying for this role the applicant should demonstrate:§ §Experience in organising, promoting and coordinating major Youth Ministry Events§Skills to manage communications, logistics, budgets§Competency with volunteer recruitment, formation and management§A Passion, understanding and commitment to the Roman Catholic Faith§A  fun loving person with a passion for working with young people and their families/whanau§A current unrestricted driver's license would be an advantage§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your highest level of education?§§§

We provide support from 7am to 8.30pm, 7 days a week and offer variable hours.§The Role§We are looking for Support Workers who live in Thames/Ngatea/Waihi/Paeroa§Our Support Workers assist our clients to live as independently as possible with a range of different tasks: §·  Household tasks – cleaning, vacuuming, laundry etc§·  Meal Preparation§·  Personal care – showering, toileting, dressing etc§·  Medication oversight – prompting/supervising clients with medication§·  Mobility assistance – assisting client’s mobility with walking frames, hoists etc§Skills and Attributes§·  Good health and fitness§·  Ability to establish rapport with individual clients and relate to their families/whanau§·  Good oral and communication skills§·  Good time management§·  Reliable transport§·  A clean current NZ driver's license §·  Mobile phone§You must have the right to work in New Zealand and you will be required to undergo police vetting and additional checks in order to be considered for this position.§Why work for VisionWest Home Healthcare?§By joining us you will receive quality training, support and all the benefits of working for a well-established, caring organisation. We provide a career pathway for staff by supporting you to achieve a Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (NZQA qualifications), which are fully funded. §To find out more visit www.homecare.org.nz, or call on§ §07 8461890§  §or APPLY NOW.§ §Only those that are shortlisted will be contacted.§ §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Support-Worker-PD---Dec-2018.pdf§§§§

This will contribute to them achieving long term economic independence and so reduce the risk of long-term benefit dependency of this group.§ § § §About the role§ § § §The§ Youth Team Leader§ will ensure that EMS' Youth Service programme meets the legal, ethical, and compliance standards, reflects our core values and strategic plan, and develops a strong youth portfolio in our contracted regions in a sustainable and effective operational manner.§ §By ensuring that our Youth Team understands and follows the technical requirements for implementation and development of the Youth Service programme, the Youth Team Leader helps EMS to achieve the milestones of our Youth Service Contract from the eye of our tauira, their whanau and government agency:§ §Enrolment§Administration and compliance§Learner RoadMap§Staff training, supervision and support§Sustainable operation§Contract measure and milestones§Organisation reputation and its impact on the community§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §EMS offices are located in the centre of the city.§ §You will be working with a team of 4-6 Youth Coaches and Youth Mentors who work together to help our rangatahi to: § § §(a)  be engaged or remain in education, training or work-based learning§ § §(b)  have obtained or working toward at least NCEA level 2 or equivalent§ § §(c)  have an achievable plan for employment, further education or training on§ §exiting the Service§ § §(d)  not be in receipt of a main Work and Income benefit (excluding TXTeeker§ §Support Student Hardship)§ § §(e)  have their well-being improved§ § §(f)  feel supported towards achieving their aspirations§ § §(g)  have a positive experience with the Youth Service.§ § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §QUALIFICATION AND EXPERIENCE§ §A recognised level 5 or above qualification of Youth Development, Psychology, Social Work, Sport and Recreation, Health, Teaching, or other papers providing a theoretical framework for understanding human behaviour§A We have a track record of leading from the heart for 26 years.§ §We provide 24/7 wrap around care to adults living in the community with a range of disabilities.   § §We require additional employees to support our current team of approximately 80 Care and Support Workers.   § §We are looking for individuals that love being around people, are energetic and have great initiative.  However, you will also know when standard policy and procedures must be followed. § §Our ideal candidate will have 3+ years experience in the wider disability sector and have specific skills in supporting young adults with behavioural issues.  A full and current drivers license is a must.     § §As a Care and Support worker you will support those living with physical and/or intellectual disabilities to prepare and eat meals, plan their day and provide support with their weekly shopping.  You will support/provide them with personal cares.  You will accompany them on outings to the movies, the beach, the gym or to visit family or friends.  You will ultimately support them to live life their way.  § §You will be a part of a paid internal professional development programme.§ §You need to be flexible and reliable and you need to be able to work weekdays or weekends.§ § § §“Care. With Heart§. It’s more than a mantra. §It is simply how we do things around here§. It is kind, it is compassionate, it is empathetic. It is values-led and it is professional. It’s our unifying promise across all services.”§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§

jobText: TXT/50640441.txt	§Employment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Consultant§§Advertiser: §In Work NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Employment Services§§§§§§In-Work NZ Limited is a provider of contracted services to the Ministry of Social Development (Work and Income). We are absolutely passionate about helping people to become independent through securing sustainable paid employment.§ §Your new role in Hamilton is to engage with our job-seekers, build relationships with employers and deliver employment outcomes§ §Employment Consultant§What sort of person are we looking for to join our team?  First and foremost, someone that is high energy, positive and committed to helping our clients reach their employment goals. § §The ideal person will be:§100% outcome focused and have the tenacity to deliver results and exceed targets§Previous employment experience and employer links is highly desirable§Able to enthusiastically work with clients to motivate them to take ownership of their job search§Job placement, profiling and calling employers§You will need to provide wrap round case management, 'think laterally' and be confident in initiating courageous conversations with people§Awesome people skills, confident and outgoing with a default setting that is solution focused§Have effective coaching and mentoring skills that get results§Be proficient with Microsoft Office§Have a full drivers licence and able to pass a Ministry of Justice security check§Along with your CV please write to us and tell us what skills you would bring to this role and why you would like to work with us. §Please Send all applications via email to Olly Kubs - §Olly.kubs@inwork.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50588133.txt	§Community Support Worker - Summer Pool§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Support Worker - Summer Pool§§Advertiser: §MASH Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§About MASH:  §MASH Trust is a successful, rapidly expanding organisation within the Healthcare Sector, MASH employs over 550 staff .  Our head office is based in Palmerston North but, MASH provides a wide range of disability support services, Mental Health, Addiction, Community support services, Youth respite and vocational day bases throughout the Lower North Island.  §We believe that:§· §People with disabilities as citizens of New Zealand have the same rights to full community participation.§· §Learning & Development is a lifelong process and that all people possess the ability to learn and develop.§· §Every person can have a valued role in society.§· §Services must be developed to meet the needs of individuals that use them.§· §The needs of people change and services need to be responsive of those changes.§As a Community Support Worker you will be supporting clients by maintaining a high quality of life, a quality home environment, and encouraging full participation in all aspects of community daily life.§What can we offer you?§· An excellent working environment§· Rewarding work§· Excellent overtime allowances and a minimum starting rate of $20.50 per hour.§The Hours:§We have several Summer Pool positions available (both Full Time and Part Time) working within our Mental Health or Disability service. We have positions in Wellington City, Paraparaumu and Lower Hutt.  §You will be working across a number of houses in your location. You must be able to do all shifts (mornings, afternoons, evenings, sleepovers and wakeovers) and be flexible to work any day. You must be able to work Christmas and New Year. This could lead to Permanent work at the end of the fixed term contract.§These positions are fixed term from November 2020 until February 2021, however exact start dates can be negotiated with the successful candidates. §PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PREFERRED LOCATION AND PREFERENCE OF PART TIME, FULL TIME, OR CASUAL IN YOUR ATTACHED COVER LETTER.§You will have/be:§· A relevant qualification and/or experience is desirable, however not essential.§· Comfortable with completing personal cares (on both male and female clients) such as - assisting with showering, dressing and getting our consumers in and out of bed.§· Hold a current full drivers licence and have reliable transport§· Wanting flexibility with hours of work and not interested in a standard nine-to-five.§· The ability to take pride in a healthy home environment – including cleaning, meal preparation and shopping.§· Eligible to work in New Zealand with a minimum of six months on Visa.§· Caring and Kind in nature with integrity that can provide support to those from all walks of life.§*****If you are applying using Seek, upon submitting your application you will receive an email from us asking you to answer some further questions to support your application. Please ensure you complete these questions, as your application may not be considered without it.*****§For a copy of the Job Description visit §JD-CSW-ID-2019.doc§,§JD-CSW-MH-2019.doc§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50559361.txt	§Support Worker, Levin - PLK006§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Worker, Levin - PLK006§§Advertiser: §Community Connections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§About the role§ § §Planning and delivering support to people in their homes and communities§ §Helping people connect with their communities, live the life they want and achieve their goals§ §It’s a 7 days, 8am – 8pm rotating roster with sleepovers. You will be required to work one-on-one.§ §Skills and experience§ §The ideal candidate will:§ § §Be a people person, able to build trusting and respectful relationships§ §Be able to work creatively and problem-solve§ §Have good community knowledge and be able to develop networks§ §Have a level 3 qualification in Health and Wellbeing and a current first aid certificate (although training can be provided for the right person)§ §Have an understanding of bi-cultural practice in Aotearoa New Zealand§ §Be comfortable with technology – Community Connections has a cloud-based database and rostering system that staff need to access with their mobile devices§ §Be available weekends/evenings on a rotating roster§ §Have full driver license§ §Benefits§ § §Pay rate is between $20.50 and $25.50 depending on qualifications and experience§ §Flexible working options§ §Ongoing professional development§ §Supportive team environment§ §Making positive differences in people’s lives and in the community§ §How to apply§ §All applications must be made through our website.  Go to https://www.ccslt.org.nz/job/levin-pt-casual-sw-plk006/ click on the “Apply for Job” button, fill in the online form, and attach your CV and cover letter.§ §For further information, contact Jade, §jade.bufton@ccslt.org.nz§ §About Community Connections§ §We are a community based disability support provider that operates across much of the North Island. Our vision is of an inclusive New Zealand where people with disabilities are embraced as fully participating citizens, where barriers to inclusion are removed, and where all people are respected and valued for who they are.§ §We believe that people with disabilities can and should live the life they choose, on their own terms and within the community of their choice.§ §Community Connections is a member of the Equal Employment Opportunities Trust and actively encourages people with lived experience of disability to apply.§§§§

jobTitle: Specialist Case Manager - Street to Home Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50534875.txt	§Specialist Case Manager - Street to Home§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Specialist Case Manager - Street to Home§§Advertiser: §Auckland City Mission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Our Mission§ §Together we stand with those in desperate need.§ §We provide immediate relief and pathways to enable long term wellbeing§ §Street to Home Programme§ §Auckland City Mission is proud to introduce §Street to Home, §aiming to support people's journey from living on the streets to a sustainable home.§ §Using a strengths-based approach we walk alongside clients, focusing on recovery & wellbeing. Using Te Whare Tapa Wha principles to guide our approach we provide a single source of connection to a range of supports to improve healthcare, mental wellbeing, recovery from addiction, and assistance to reconnect with family, whanau & community.§ §Your role of Specialist Caseworker§ §As a Specialist, you are a senior member of the team. Your skills and experience will come from a number of years in your profession and you will use these to engage complex clients and address their wide-ranging and challenging needs. Working with Keyworkers your casework will include providing an additional, in-depth layer of understanding to client case management. Thoroughly identifying complex needs, challenges and developing client-centred, holistic and culturally appropriate plans.§ §You will work cross-functionally and collaboratively with your colleagues across the service, sharing your expertise to guide others successfully, identifying and unravelling complexities to enable appropriate actions in others and the delivery of your own best practice.§ § § §Your knowledge could be generalist over a range of areas such as homelessness, mental health, addictions, abuse, housing or you could be an expert in your field, honing your skills in a particular area to be the "go-to" person for particular challenges. Whatever it may be, you will have a passion for what you do and be driven to provide the best client-focused service.§ §To be successful§ in this role you will have the ability to work cross-functionally in a multi-disciplinary service, demonstrating a high level of competency in case management and a senior level of understanding. You will show experience in supervising others, have a natural desire to share your knowledge with your colleagues and be proactive in your continuous professional development. This role will require working in an ‘in house' and ‘outreach' capacity, as such you must be flexible, able to work dynamically with ease and also have§ § §A tertiary qualification in Social Services, mental health, community, counselling or family therapy§ §A full clean drivers licence§ §Be physically fit§ §If you are looking for a challenging but exceptionally rewarding role in a progressive organisation that changes to meet the needs of its community apply now or contact us to find out more.§ § § §Our Values§ §Manaakitanga§Manaakitanga is behaviour that acknowledges the mana of others as having equal or greater importance than one's own, through the expression of aroha, hospitality, generosity, and mutual respect.§ §Justice (Manatika)§Committed to equity, and seeking dignity for all we will fearlessly advocate with and for those who are going without.§ §Partnership (Rangapu)§Firstly, the Auckland City Mission recognises the principle of partnership within Te Tiriti O Waitangi.§ §Secondly, our commitment to partnership stems from a belief that manaakitanga, equity and social justice need to be pursued both within partnerships and through them. For us, partnership is characterised by mutual trust, integrity, respect, transparency, and commitment.§ §The Auckland City Mission's Street to Home Programme is supported by Auckland Council, The Ministry of Social Development, The Ministry of Housing & Urban Development and a range of grants and donations.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a bachelors degree or a minimum of a Level 4 certificate in a relevant health, community or social field?§How much experience do you have supervising the practice of others?§How much case management experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50631977.txt	§Financial Mentor/ Putea Kaitohutou§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Financial Mentor/ Putea Kaitohutou§§Advertiser: §The Salvation Army NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Financial Mentor/ Putea Kaitohutou §        §          §Tauranga Corps, Tauranga §          §            §A finance and community development mix§            §Ethical lending knowledge§            §Make a difference§            §Culturally sensitive and effective§          §          §This is a 12-month fixed-term position as part of our Covid-19 response for 20 hours per week, Wednesday - Friday.§          §About The Salvation Army/Te Ope Whakaora§          §The Salvation Army has been transforming lives since 1865. We work in over 130 countries, coordinated by our International Headquarters in London and we are a registered charity under the Charities Act 2005. The Army has over 3,000 officers and employees in New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa and is recognised as a high value employer. The mission of The Salvation Army in New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa is caring for people, transforming lives and reforming society, in God, through Christ by the Holy Spirit’s power.§          §About Community Ministries§          §The Tauranga Salvation Army is a multi-faceted Community Centre. It comprises two main components each with a multitude of sub-ministries. The Corps (church) contains congregations and outreach programmes, while the Community Ministries has a dynamic menu of helping and caring ministries that seeks to support individuals, and families. The Salvation Army Tauranga provides invaluable services to a wide range of people across Tauranga. Services include social work, counselling, advocacy and welfare support as well as spiritual support.§          §About the role§          §This position provides quality budgeting services to clients who come into the Salvation Army Tauranga Community Ministries. The work involves working closely with the clients to educate, guide and support them in financial matters, developing their skills and assisting them to meet agreed goals and outcomes.§          §Candidates will have highly developed communication skills, both written and verbal, and a strong customer service focus. They will appreciate the needs of people on low income and have a strong desire to improve the social and economic wellbeing of these people. Therefore, an ability to build rapport and empathise with clients from diverse backgrounds and complex needs is essential.§          §Ideal candidates will show an ability to identify with and work within the mission and values of The Salvation Army.§          §We require a reliable, team player with a good sense of humour.§          §Key tasks§          §            §Imparting financial management skills and knowledge§            §Applying financial management tools with clients to reach goals§            §Using a strengths-based approach empowering clients to find long-term solutions working Within the Model of Care framework, best practice policies and procedures§            §Making appropriate referrals to further advocacy and support§          §          §Key benefits §          §            §Giving back to the community§            §Work-life balance§            §Free onsite parking§          §          §Person specification§          §            §FinCap Financial Mentor Introductory Training (or equivalent);§            §Experience working in a budget advisory or financial mentoring role§            §Strength-based approach training§            §Motivational interview training/facilitation training§            §A passion for people and a positive attitude§            §Ability to work with difficult clients (i.e. must have emotional stability, patience, maturity of judgement, sense of humour)§            §Strong use and development of building financial capability tools§            §Strong understanding of and commitment to the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§            §The ability to work in a team§            §The ability to facilitate small groups;§            §Sympathy to the aims, mission, principles and hristian ethos of The Salvation Army§            §Has a current and full driver's licence.§          §          §This role reports to the Community Ministries Manager.§          §Contact and application information§          §For more information about this role and for application information please email §Tauranga.cm@salvationarmy.org.nz§          §Applicants for this position will need to have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. All employment offers are subject to the completion of a satisfactory Ministry of Justice clearance/Police Check §(where applicable).§          §Closing date§          §Applications close by Friday, 9 October 2020 at 12pm.§ To see the Job Description file please copy and paste the URL below into your internet browser's address bar https://expressonline.haineslink.co.nz/pdfs/663682_jobdesc.docx§        §        §        §        §The Salvation Army is a worldwide evangelical Christian church and human service provider. It is committed to caring for people, transforming lives and reforming society - all through the love of God shown in Jesus. The successful applicant should therefore show an ability to identify with the mission and values of The Salvation Army.§      §    §  §§§Tauranga Corps, Tauranga §A finance and community development mix§Ethical lending knowledge§Make a difference§Culturally sensitive and effective§This is a 12-month fixed-term position as part of our Covid-19 response for 20 hours per week, Wednesday - Friday.§About The Salvation Army/Te Ope Whakaora§The Salvation Army has been transforming lives since 1865. We work in over 130 countries, coordinated by our International Headquarters in London and we are a registered charity under the Charities Act 2005. The Army has over 3,000 officers and employees in New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa and is recognised as a high value employer. The mission of The Salvation Army in New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa is caring for people, transforming lives and reforming society, in God, through Christ by the Holy Spirit’s power.§About Community Ministries§The Tauranga Salvation Army is a multi-faceted Community Centre. It comprises two main components each with a multitude of sub-ministries. The Corps (church) contains congregations and outreach programmes, while the Community Ministries has a dynamic menu of helping and caring ministries that seeks to support individuals, and families. The Salvation Army Tauranga provides invaluable services to a wide range of people across Tauranga. Services include social work, counselling, advocacy and welfare support as well as spiritual support.§About the role§This position provides quality budgeting services to clients who come into the Salvation Army Tauranga Community Ministries. The work involves working closely with the clients to educate, guide and support them in financial matters, developing their skills and assisting them to meet agreed goals and outcomes.§Candidates will have highly developed communication skills, both written and verbal, and a strong customer service focus. They will appreciate the needs of people on low income and have a strong desire to improve the social and economic wellbeing of these people. Therefore, an ability to build rapport and empathise with clients from diverse backgrounds and complex needs is essential.§Ideal candidates will show an ability to identify with and work within the mission and values of The Salvation Army.§We require a reliable, team player with a good sense of humour.§Key tasks§Imparting financial management skills and knowledge§Applying financial management tools with clients to reach goals§Using a strengths-based approach empowering clients to find long-term solutions working Within the Model of Care framework, best practice policies and procedures§Making appropriate referrals to further advocacy and support§Key benefits §Giving back to the community§Work-life balance§Free onsite parking§Person specification§FinCap Financial Mentor Introductory Training (or equivalent);§Experience working in a budget advisory or financial mentoring role§Strength-based approach training§Motivational interview training/facilitation training§A passion for people and a positive attitude§Ability to work with difficult clients (i.e. must have emotional stability, patience, maturity of judgement, sense of humour)§Strong use and development of building financial capability tools§Strong understanding of and commitment to the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§The ability to work in a team§The ability to facilitate small groups;§Sympathy to the aims, mission, principles and hristian ethos of The Salvation Army§Has a current and full driver's licence.§This role reports to the Community Ministries Manager.§Contact and application information§For more information about this role and for application information please email §Tauranga.cm@salvationarmy.org.nz§Applicants for this position will need to have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. jobText: TXT/50547817.txt	§Support Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Worker§§Advertiser: §VisionWest Community Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§ §About us§VisionWest Home HealthCare is an established provider and has over 20 years’ experience providing quality, professional home help support to people, enabling them to live independently within their own homes. Our clients include people of all ages, with varying needs.We are currently looking for energetic, caring, committed and empathetic people to provide quality in-home care to our clients. VisionWest Home HealthCare has a Vision to see Transformed Lives, Healthy Communities. We provide support from 6am to 9.30pm, 7 days a week and offer variable hours.§The Role§We are looking for Support Workers who live in Katikati.§Our Support Workers assist our clients to live as independently as possible with a range of different tasks: §  §Household tasks – cleaning, vacuuming, laundry etc§  §Meal Preparation§  §Personal care – showering, toileting, dressing etc§  §Community living – shopping, exercise etc§  §Medication oversight – prompting/supervising clients with medication§  §Mobility assistance – assisting client’s mobility with walking frames, hoists etc§Skills and Attributes§  §Good health and fitness§  §Ability to establish rapport with individual clients and relate to their families/whanau§  §Good oral and communication skills§  §Good time management§  §Reliable transport§  §A clean current NZ driver's license §  §Mobile phone§You must have the right to work in New Zealand and you will be required to undergo police vetting and additional checks in order to be considered for this position.§Why work for VisionWest Home Healthcare?§By joining us you will receive quality training, support and all the benefits of working for a well-established, caring organisation. We provide a career pathway for staff by supporting you to achieve a Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (NZQA qualifications), which are fully funded. §To find out more visit www.homecare.org.nz, or call Jodie on §07 571 0086§ or APPLY NOW.§ § §Only those that are shortlisted will be contacted.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50591630.txt	§Client Services Manager (6 Months Maternity Cover)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Services Manager (6 Months Maternity Cover)§§Advertiser: §Healthvision NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§We are looking for an enthusiastic Client Services Manager to cover maternity leave for our existing staff in our committed Homecare team. This is a 6-month Fixed Term position and is based at our Greenlane office. § §The role forms part of a committed multidisciplinary team that provides oversight and coordination to teams of staff who deliver services to our clients in the community. These range from home and personal care support to full nursing care for complex long-term clients.  § §Key responsibilities§:§ § §Matching and rostering of support workers with clients§ §Involvement in the recruitment and retention process of support workers including performance feedback, education, and training§ §Health and Safety assessments of client homes§ §Relationship-building with clients and promotion of the Healthvision brand§ §The work is challenging at times, varied and hugely rewarding as you are helping to make positive changes in people’s lives.  There is a strong emphasis placed, on building relationships with clients and their support workers to ensure positive outcomes. Outstanding customer service skills, being empathetic and a good listener is essential to this role in addition to being able to negotiate competing demands.§ §The role will suit you if you are self-motivated and a fast learner, can remain calm under pressure, have an eye for detail, and approach everything with common sense. Full training and comprehensive induction and orientation package will be provided.§ § § §Skills & Experience:§ § §A health background is preferable (health-related qualification is preferable)§ §Management experience is a must (Coordinator or above level) with proven scheduling and coordination skills§ §Computer literate § §Sound verbal and written communication skills§ §A ‘can do’ attitude and motivation to deliver outstanding service§ §Highly organised with strong time management skills§ §Team player attitude with the ability to work autonomously§ §Ability to relate supportively with others from different socio-economic and cultural backgrounds§ §Full Drivers licence§ § § §About us§ §Healthvision is an award-winning provider of Specialist Homecare, Community Nursing and Rehabilitation services throughout New Zealand.§ §We pride ourselves in working closely with our clients, families, and whānau to best understand their holistic needs, and provide a comprehensive wraparound service to maximise their independence.§ §At Healthvision we love what we do and are passionate about making a positive difference to the lives of others.§ § § §Applicants must have the right to work legally and permanently in New Zealand.§ § § §**If you have the skills for this role, please submit your application through our Bamboo link below:§ §https://healthvisionteam.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=62§ §(Please note that we will not consider any applications submitted via Seek)§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a client services manager?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50580928.txt	§Support workers - Feilding - PLK008§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support workers - Feilding - PLK008§§Advertiser: §Community Connections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§ §Are you a people person able to build trusting and respectful relationships?§ §Are you a solutions focused thinker?§ §Are you enthusiastic, creative, flexible and reliable?§ §If you answered yes to these questions then we would like to talk to you!§ §We are looking for a cheerful and confident support worker to work with a lady in her mid-twenties in her home in Feilding.  You will work with a small team but alone on shift. Tasks will include community participation, home management, mental stimulation with engaging activities and some personal cares.§ §You must be comfortable around dogs, as a lovely black Labrador lives here too.§ §This is an ideal opportunity for someone who is passionate about person-centered support and working with people to enable them to engage meaningfully in their personal, family and community activities.§ §Training will be provided.§ §We currently have the following roles available:§ § §Casual§ §Part-time§ §Full time§ §With all the roles you must be available to work evenings, overnight awake support and weekends, plus be available to take a turn as on-call as part of a team roster. On-call means you need to be available to fill in shifts if people are sick and to answer calls to talk over situations from team members on shift.§ §To be considered for this role, you will:§ § §have experience working with people with disabilities and/or be willing to learn§ §use initiative to provide support§ §ideally have a background in nursing, psychology, social work or caregiving, but this is not a requirement§ §have a full drivers licence or working towards this and have access to a vehicle§ §need to go through a police check.§ §You will be joining a great place to work with a supportive team environment and ongoing professional development.§ §Please direct any enquiries about this role to §sarah.rogers@ccslt.org.nz§.§ §All applications must be made through our website. A large part of our mahi is to commission Whanau Ora Navigators to walk alongside whanau to support, plan and develop and lead them through a process of transformation towards independence.§We are seeking a Navigator Manukura to collaborate and communicate with location specific whanau, navigators, their communities and leaders. The role of the Manukura is to foster best practice between all Navigators based on the seven outcomes in the Whanau Ora Framework§§Whanau are self-managing;§Whanau are leading healthy lifestyles§Whanau are participating fully in society§Whanau are confidently participating in te ao Maori §Whanau are economically secure and successfully involved in wealth creation §Whanau are ongoing source of support for Navigators, creating and growing a network of passionate champions of the community. §Responsibilities include:§ Collaborate and communicate with Navigators, communities, jobText: TXT/50621124.txt	§Healthy Families Hutt Valley - Healthy City Design Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Healthy Families Hutt Valley - Healthy City Design Lead§§Advertiser: §Hutt City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§PROUD TO BE CREATING A HEALTHIER HUTT§Healthy City Design Lead - Healthy Families Hutt Valley§Hutt City Council is looking for a talented Healthy City Design Lead to join their Healthy Families Hutt Valley team. This innovative large scale initiative aims to improve the health and wellbeing of our people in the Hutt Valley by harnessing community leadership and creating health promoting environments where people live, learn, work and play. The work we do is impacting the health and wellbeing of entire communities, both now and for future generations.§We're looking for someone who is:§Passionate about walking, cycling and healthy urban design§Loves to work alongside community to create solutions§Committed to innovative Māori and indigenous environmental centred approaches§An outstanding communicator and relationship builder§Is comfortable with the unknown§Cares about equity§In this role you'll identify opportunities to create change across our active transport and urban design system to support our communities to be more active including through walking and cycling. You'll be the voice of our community, ensuring that we're continually strengthening the connection between people and the places we use every day. This role provides a critical link between the community and those at the forefront of creating urban spaces for us all to enjoy.§You'll work alongside local leaders and champions within the community to design and implement innovative solutions that have a wide and lasting impact on the health and wellbeing of our people. You'll recognise that to bring these solutions to life and really gain momentum; you'll need to build strong and strategic relationships with our Iwi, Māori and Pasifika communities, as well as across environments where we live, learn, work and play. It's likely, as a natural communicator and relationship builder that you'll already have key connections to help us on our journey towards a healthier Hutt.§You'll be a bright and conceptual thinker and certainly not be afraid to challenge the status quo to achieve healthy outcomes for our diverse population. Your natural communication and influencing skills will mean you can manage important relationships both within Council and out in the community with ease. All to achieve the desired end result - a healthier Hutt.§Hutt City Council is the lead provider for Healthy Families Hutt Valley, so you'll enjoy being based within our lively office environment and all of the benefits that come with being a part of the wider Hutt City Council team.§You'll be proud to know that your work makes a real difference by supporting our communities to thrive.§This is a 12-month full time fixed term position§Applications Close 12 October 2020§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

§ § §The Whanau Resource Centre provides culturally appropriate support, advocacy, education and intervention to whanau in crisis, targeting whanau that have dependent children.  Offering a professional social work service and Emergency Housing, on site, using a Wairua Karu approach, "potential for change and growth" and working together building strength and empowerment for sustainability of better living in the home and community.§ §This is an opportunity to work for a not-for-profit organisation providing social service support and emergency housing in the Franklin community.§ § § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § § §We are looking for social workers with a strong commitment to their work, who can face up to the challenges of the role and work together with a small in-house team.§ §Our aim is to provide programmes which will prevent or reduce social problems, and to work in an appropriate way with whanau who are affected by such problems.  By intervening early, social workers are able to work with children, their families/whanau and schools, to help protect vulnerable children and develop plans to improve their safety, wellbeing, health and educational outcomes.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You must be a recognised experienced Social Worker, and be eligible for Social Work Registration and have a clean Driver's License.§ §The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate their experience, successes,  commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and be able to work in a bi-cultural context as well as have local knowledge.§ §This is a part time position, for 30 hours per week.  You will be required to submit to a Police Vetting.§ §The remuneration will reflect the candidates experience.§ § § §Job benefits and perks§ § § §This is a small and committed organisation with a great team and a real focus on making a difference.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have experience working with young people with complex needs?§Have you completed a qualification in community services?§Do you have experience in a community outreach environment?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
