jobText: TXT/50630569.txt	§Debt Coach - Microfinance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Debt Coach - Microfinance§§Advertiser: §Momentum Consulting Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Debt Coach - Microfinance §    §      §About the Company§ Our client, Good Shepherd New Zealand, is a member of a worldwide organisation concerned with creating a more emotionally, economically, and physically safe world for women. Its objective in New Zealand is to support better futures for women, girls and their whanau who are experiencing disadvantage.§ A significant area of focus is on supporting the development of financial inclusion and microfinance programmes for New Zealand families living on limited incomes. Believing it is the right of all to have access to fair and affordable credit, Good Shepherd NZ work with key stakeholders including community-based organisations, corporate partners (including two commercial banks providing loan capital) and government to achieve that goal.§ Domestic microfinance is becoming more recognised in New Zealand as a fair and safe alternative in the small credit market, and Good Shepherd NZ is currently in the process of expanding its microfinance programmes to meet the need that recognition creates.§ § §About the Role§ The Debt Coach is primarily responsible for providing specialist ‘budgeting’ advice and debt advocacy services to clients experiencing financial hardship across New Zealand. This is a telephone-based role. The Debt Coach works across two similar programmes which Good Shepherd NZ is currently delivering.§ The Debt Coach assists clients referred by its community-based Loan Workers and a network of Financial Mentors from around the country. The Debt Coach assists clients with unsustainable existing debt, advising and assisting them in developing and implementing debt reduction plans, which may also include a loan to consolidate and/or refinance their existing debt.§ The Debt Coach reports to the Service Delivery Manager – Microfinance and works closely with Loan Workers and Financial Mentors across the country, and with the wider Good Shepherd NZ team and microfinance partners.§ Based in Good Shepherd NZ’s Central Auckland office alongside other phone-based Debt Coaches, phone-based Loan Workers, and the broader microfinance team, the phone-based debt coaching service currently operates between 8.30am and 6 pm.§ This is a full time fixed-term role until 30 June 2022, however more flexible arrangements could be considered for the right individual.§ § §About You§ To perform well in this role, applicants will point to experience in: §        §          §Working as a financial mentor, loan worker, budget advisor, debt counsellor and/or financial coach§          §Handling casework, referrals and advocacy on behalf of clients with diverse backgrounds and sometimes complex needs§          §Working with diverse cultures and communities and understanding the needs of clients§          §Relevant financial capability and consumer credit legislation and processes (for example, KiwiSaver, Insolvency etc.)§          §Negotiating and working with lenders to reduce client debt§          §Working in a predominantly telephone and email-based role (not seeing clients face to face), with an excellent telephone manner and listening and questioning skills coupled with the ability to identify client needs and establish effective relationships§        § Experience within a Not-For-Profit organisation would be beneficial, but it is not critical. Most importantly, the ideal applicants will have solid budgeting, financial mentoring and debt negotiation experience; and present with a strong customer and service delivery focus.§ § Imperative to a successful expression of interest will be a genuine commitment to social justice values, that are aligned to Good Shepherd NZ.§ § Apply now with your CV and cover letter or for more information call §Sharon Ward Duncan§ on §021 356 777§. §Applications close on Monday 12 October at 9am.§  § **CVs preferred in Word format. Search all our roles here: www.momentum.co.nz/your-next-job§ § §Under the provisions of the Privacy Act 1993, you have the right to access and request the correction of information held by us concerning you.  We will retain all information for future vacancies (permanent or contract).  Should you wish Momentum Consulting to delete this information from our database we shall require written notification to do so, subject to any legal obligations that require us to retain such information.§      §      §Sharon Ward Duncan§021 356 777 §    §    §  §§§About the Company§ Our client, Good Shepherd New Zealand, is a member of a worldwide organisation concerned with creating a more emotionally, economically, and physically safe world for women. Its objective in New Zealand is to support better futures for women, girls and their whanau who are experiencing disadvantage.§ A significant area of focus is on supporting the development of financial inclusion and microfinance programmes for New Zealand families living on limited incomes. Believing it is the right of all to have access to fair and affordable credit, Good Shepherd NZ work with key stakeholders including community-based organisations, corporate partners (including two commercial banks providing loan capital) and government to achieve that goal.§ Domestic microfinance is becoming more recognised in New Zealand as a fair and safe alternative in the small credit market, and Good Shepherd NZ is currently in the process of expanding its microfinance programmes to meet the need that recognition creates.§ § §About the Role§ The Debt Coach is primarily responsible for providing specialist ‘budgeting’ advice and debt advocacy services to clients experiencing financial hardship across New Zealand. This is a telephone-based role. The Debt Coach works across two similar programmes which Good Shepherd NZ is currently delivering.§ The Debt Coach assists clients referred by its community-based Loan Workers and a network of Financial Mentors from around the country. The Debt Coach assists clients with unsustainable existing debt, advising and assisting them in developing and implementing debt reduction plans, which may also include a loan to consolidate and/or refinance their existing debt.§ The Debt Coach reports to the Service Delivery Manager – Microfinance and works closely with Loan Workers and Financial Mentors across the country, and with the wider Good Shepherd NZ team and microfinance partners.§ Based in Good Shepherd NZ’s Central Auckland office alongside other phone-based Debt Coaches, phone-based Loan Workers, and the broader microfinance team, the phone-based debt coaching service currently operates between 8.30am and 6 pm.§ This is a full time fixed-term role until 30 June 2022, however more flexible arrangements could be considered for the right individual.§ § §About You§ To perform well in this role, applicants will point to experience in: § § §Working as a financial mentor, loan worker, budget advisor, debt counsellor and/or financial coach§ §Handling casework, referrals and advocacy on behalf of clients with diverse backgrounds and sometimes complex needs§ §Working with diverse cultures and communities and understanding the needs of clients§ §Relevant financial capability and consumer credit legislation and processes (for example, KiwiSaver, Insolvency etc.)§ §Negotiating and working with lenders to reduce client debt§ §Working in a predominantly telephone and email-based role (not seeing clients face to face), with an excellent telephone manner and listening and questioning skills coupled with the ability to identify client needs and establish effective relationships§ § Experience within a Not-For-Profit organisation would be beneficial, but it is not critical. Most importantly, the ideal applicants will have solid budgeting, financial mentoring and debt negotiation experience; and present with a strong customer and service delivery focus.§ § Imperative to a successful expression of interest will be a genuine commitment to social justice values, that are aligned to Good Shepherd NZ.§ § Apply now with your CV and cover letter or for more information call §Sharon Ward Duncan§ on §021 356 777§. §Applications close on Monday 12 October at 9am.§  § **CVs preferred in Word format. Our services provide holistic trauma informed learning and support for caregivers, children, young people and their family and whānau.§  §We are looking to appoint a full time:§  §Team Manager - South Island§  §Full Time (40 hrs per week)§  §Based in Christchurch§  §Competitive Salary + 4% KiwiSaver + vehicle for personal use§  §About the Role§  §In this role you will be based in Christchurch and covering the Canterbury region. You will drive growth and development within the region, be the key contact with Oranga Tamariki and provide line management, supervision, support and training to Social Workers to ensure that high quality practice is an achievable aim for all Social Workers in line with Key Assets service delivery and Purpose and Pledges.  §  §About you§  §To be successful you will be a strong leader and have a solid understanding and robust skills relating to Foster Care and the care sector. The role will be both office and community based leading the team who provide support to the foster carers.  This includes managing the education of carers and maintaining the safety of te tamaiti in care.§  §We can offer:§ § §Competitive Market Salary§ §Company Vehicle including fuel card§ §Paid On Call Allowance§ §4% Employer KiwiSaver Contribution§ §Flexible working policy and practices§ §Five weeks annual leave after qualifying period§ §On-going Training and Supervision with a clearly articulated practice framework§ §Experience and Skills Required§ § §Must have a  Social Work qualification of all relevant legislation pertaining to children's services and safeguarding of children§ §Be self-motivated, able to work independently and in partnership with other community based organisations.§ §Applicants must reside in New Zealand in order to comply with our recruitment and selection process§ §Successful applicants will be required to undergo statutory and personal checks prior to commencement.§ §Participated in an out of hours support service to foster carers§ § §To apply please forward your cover letter and CV to §hr.nz@keyassets.co.nz§  § For a private and confidential jobText: TXT/50531351.txt	§Extraordinary Support Worker/PA§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Extraordinary Support Worker/PA§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Supporting someone to live a good life is a high calling – and we are looking for that special someone who wants a job doing work that has meaning and makes a difference.  It’s more than a job, it’s sharing your life with another human being so that their life can be better, and they can achieve great things.§ §Our 17 year old son has a physical disability that means he needs support to achieve his goals and life aspirations.  This takes an exceptional team of committed support workers who have that something extra.   § §You’ll be working in his home in Maungatapu alongside the family as well as in the community so you’ll be able to relate well and be aware of the impact you have on others.  You’ll need to enjoy dogs and teenage activities and be able to support and facilitate behaviours that will increase his social interactions, building his networks and achieving his goals.  You don’t need prior experience in a support worker role – in fact it might be better if you don’t because this role is very different from most support work roles – but you will need to be comfortable providing personal cares recognising that all training will be provided.  It's a great role for those who have been in tourism, hospitality or customer service and looking to change career and become an essential worker, or who wants work that supports their nursing, education, IT or health studies.§ §The successful applicant will have high personal standards with police and drug testing being part of the application process, as well as confidence to take the initiative and manage supports.  You'll also value reliability.  Flexibility in the hours you can provide and a full drivers’ licence is required, as is a commitment to the role for at least six months given the level of training and relationship required.  Pay rate will be between $21.50 - $26.00 depending on qualifications and experience.§ §Approximately 15-20 regular hours/week are on offer sharing the shifts of 6.30am - 8am weekday mornings and 2.45 or 3.30pm - 8pm on weekday afternoon/evenings.  At least two morning and two afternoon shifts are required at a minimum. There are longer weekend shifts of between 5 - 12 hours with at least one weekend shift required each week.  Picking up shifts to cover for others and providing additional hours during school holidays is also required.  Immediate start.§ §It’s not an ordinary role and it requires an extra ordinary person who wants their job to make a difference – is that you?§ §Applications to be in writing with a CV and §include information about yourself that specifically addresses the details in this job opportunity§ so we can shortlist the best applicants.   Apply via the SEEK process.§ §Your reward, making a difference in our sons life, being part of a great team and family culture, having reliable 'essential' employment and early a good hourly rate.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50639209.txt	§Senior Advisor Residential and High Needs Services - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor Residential and High Needs Services - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Wellington§A great opportunity has arisen for two experienced and dedicated practitioners to join the High Needs Services team in the Care Services workgroup based at National Office in Wellington.§Both roles will have a focus on the disability sector. The successful applicants will have specialist knowledge and experience of disability and the disability sector, which may also include ACC, Ministry of Health and Ministry of Education.§Both are huge opportunities to be a part of, building and delivering on a centre of excellence and to champion quality disability support services and practice.§About the role§As a Senior Advisor, you will provide expert and specialised advice and guidance to managers and practitioners in relation to specialist care and high needs services and programmes. The purpose of this position is to support practitioners and managers to identify and access specialist placements and services.§What you will do:§Social work assessment, analysis and systems co-ordination to determine access to specialist care and treatment placements and services§Specialist placement, education and transition support, monitoring and risk mitigation§Work with a wide range of colleagues who work directly with a wide range of tamaiti with a wide range of needs. This will include disability, concerning, harmful and/or violent sexualised behaviour, sexual orientation, gender identity and sex characteristics (SOGIESC), Māori within both a cultural and non-cultural context, Pasifika and other migrant communities§Building and maintaining effective and collaborative relationships§Work closely with Oranga Tamariki frontline practitioners and leadership, the Ministry's National Providers and Services and Planning and Reporting teams§Strong strategic and analytical skills, and ability to see the 'big picture' to inform continued improvement§Leadership and national co-ordination of complex care and treatment needs that require specialist care services§Preparing advice and reports for the manager High Needs Services§About you§This is a rare opportunity for someone with considerable disability sector experience, social work knowledge, care partnerships and contracting knowledge who is looking for a unique national role and experience. In this role you will need to bring tenacity, innovation and considerable systems knowledge to deliver well matched and timely specialist responses and support services to tamaiti with high and complex care and therapeutic treatment needs.§What you will bring:§Strong assessment framework and analytical skills, and ability to see the 'big picture'§A strength-based, tamaiti centric and solution-focused approach, with strong problem-solving skills§A commitment to Te Reo Me Ōna tikanga and to uphold the principles of the Te Tiriti O Waitangi (Treaty of Waitangi)§Strong relationship and stakeholder management skills§Ability to build productive relationships with all levels of the organisation§Outstanding communication, collaboration and facilitation skills§Demonstrated ability to be an innovative thinker and self-starter§About us§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children works to advance the wellbeing and positive long-term outcomes of children and young people. With over 4,000 staff, Oranga Tamariki supports families and whānau to provide a safe, stable and loving home for their children. Our guiding belief is that 'in the right environment, with the right people surrounding and nurturing them, any child can, and should flourish'.§At Oranga Tamariki we support flexible working opportunities and are fortunate to have some great new technologies coming our way, making it easier for you to work from where you need to be.§How to apply§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal at work. Do you want to make a genuine, positive impact on the lives of tamariki, rangatahi and whānau? Then look no further, Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children have got you covered with this great opportunity!§About us - mō mātou§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki §first§We believe §Aroha §is vital§We respect the §Mana §of people§We are §Tika §and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga §is a journey§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work service that is child-centred, trauma informed and effective for all cultures.§About the role - mō te tūnga§In this role, you will be part of making a difference to the lives of our children, young people and their family by:§co-working (building up to key working) cases with tamariki or rangatahi to hear their voices and support them and their whānau to make positive changes§working alongside various cultural groups and people from different backgrounds§completing initial safety checks and assessments on the child, young person and their family§being involved in planning interventions to be delivered to maintain wellbeing of tamariki and rangatahi§working alongside partners in our community, non-government organisations and state sector agencies§transitioning children and young people back to their families or into their forever home§being an advocate on behalf of tamariki and rangatahi to ensure they have the support and resources needed to reach their full potential§About you - mōu§We are looking for candidates that demonstrate the following:§A full, clean, valid New Zealand driver’s licence§Provisional registration with New Zealand’s Social Work Registration Board (SWRB)§A social worker qualification recognised by the SWRB§Eagerness to learn, be proactive and demonstrate tika and pono§Good written skills as you will need to write court reports and case notes§Sound judgement and organisational skills§Excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt to your audience§Empathy, patience and ability to see past what someone may be struggling with§A positive outlook and supportive nature§What we offer - jobTitle: Hub & Housing Team Lead - Street to Home Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50575731.txt	§Hub & Housing Team Lead - Street to Home§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Hub & Housing Team Lead - Street to Home§§Advertiser: §Auckland City Mission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Our Mission§ §Together we stand with those in desperate need.§ §We provide immediate relief and pathways to enable long term wellbeing.§ § § §Street to Home Programme§ §Auckland City Mission are proud to introduce §Street to Home§, aiming to support people's journey from living on the streets to a sustainable home.§ §Using a strengths-based approach we walk alongside clients, focusing on recovery & wellbeing. Te Whare Tapa Wha principles guide our approach and we provide a single source of connection to a range of supports to improve healthcare, mental wellbeing, recovery from addiction, and assistance to reconnect with family, whanau & community.§ §Your role of Hub and Housing Team Leader§ §As Hub and Housing Team Leader you will provide management support to the Hub and Housing Keyworkers and contribute to the overall vision of Auckland City Mission's Street to Home Service.  § §Managing a passionate and competent team you will draw from your professional experience to guide and deliver overall safe and effective delivery of specialised case management services for people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. § §You will primarily be responsible for the day to day management of the team, using your knowledge and experience to guide them in their client engagement and delivery.  Identifying opportunities to improve the service and using Street to Homes’  core principles to ensure we are delivering the best and most culturally appropriate support to our clients on their journey.§ §In addition you will work cross functionally across the service with your peers, your knowledge ideas and insights contributing to the overall development of Street to Home and to provide management assistance as required.§ §To be successful§ you will demonstrate the ability working cross functionally in a multicultural environment at a manager level. Your understanding of the principles and frameworks that underpin the Street to Home and Mission objectives will be clear in your work history and ideally you will have experience within the homeless sector.§ §You will show an ability bring multi-disciplinary teams together and guide them with successful outcomes through periods of change.§ §A clear communicator you will build rapport with a range of stakeholders and have excellent organisational, development and facilitation skills, seeking to continuously identify and improve the service you are in. You must also§ § §Hold a relevant tertiary level qualification and/or equivalent employment experience§ §Have a full clean drivers licence§ §5+ years practice experience in a related health or social service setting§ §Management experience§ §If you are looking for a challenging but exceptionally rewarding role in a progressive organisation that changes to meet the needs of its community apply now or contact us to find out more.§ § § §Our Values§ §Manaakitanga§Manaakitanga is behaviour that acknowledges the mana of others as having equal or greater importance than one's own, through the expression of aroha, hospitality, generosity, and mutual respect.§ §Justice (Manatika)§Committed to equity, and seeking dignity for all we will fearlessly advocate with and for those who are going without.§ §Partnership (Rangapū)§Firstly, the Auckland City Mission recognises the principle of partnership within Te Tiriti O Waitangi.§ §Secondly, our commitment to partnership stems from a belief that manaakitanga, equity and social justice need to be pursued both within partnerships and through them. For us partnership is characterised by mutual trust, integrity, respect, transparency, and commitment.§ §The Auckland City Mission's Street to Home Programme is supported by Auckland Council, The Ministry of Social Development, The Ministry of Housing & Urban Development and a range of grants and donations.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a bachelors degree or a minimum of a Level 4 certificate in a relevant health, community or social field?§Do have experience working with adults within the homeless, alcohol & addictions or mental health services?§How much case management experience do you have?§§§

jobTitle: Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50695651.txt	§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki - Timaru Site§Three full-time, permanent role§Be part of a team where relationships are built on mutual trust and respect§Qualified and Registered Social Worker§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, currently have opportunities for Social Workers to join our Timaru Site - where you will be part of a multidisciplinary team who works closely and is passionate in supporting Oranga Tamariki in delivering positive outcomes for tamariki and rangatahi.§Our goal is to establish a multiagency approach to protecting and caring for New Zealand's tamariki and rangatahi. We aim to adapt and improve the lives of tamariki and their whānau through application of our established practice model: You will be expected to operate in a supportive role in order to help achieve this goal.§You will be part of making a difference to the lives of our tamariki and their whānau by utilising the latest strength-based practice tools and assessment framework. By engaging with tamariki and developing, managing and delivering plans it will ensure their voices are heard.§In this role you will be expected to operate in a supportive role in order to help achieve our goals and demonstrate our values as follows:§We put §Tamariki§ first§We believe §Aroha§ is vital§We respect the §Mana§ of people§We are§ Tika§ and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga§ is a journey§You will be delivering high-level evidence based and quality social work services where you will be working in partnership with tamariki, their whanau, external agencies and communities to ensure a collaborative approach to improved outcomes.§This role requires a passion to actively work to keep tamariki at the centre of everything we do. It's more than a job, it's an opportunity to champion tamariki and their whanau with every decision you make.§Key attributes to be considered but not limited to, will include the following:§A recognised Social Work qualification by the Social Worker Registration Board§Registration with New Zealand's Social Worker Registration Board§Demonstrated resilience, critical thinking and problem-solving techniques§Upholding the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and demonstrating this in practice§Having a good understanding of section 7(AA) of The Oranga Tamariki Act§Well-developed written and verbal communication skills§A valid and clean New Zealand driver's licence.§What we are offering:§A competitive salary in line with Oranga Tamariki's remuneration range, between $55,000 - $100,000§Commitment to the highest standards of strengths-based social work practice§On-going professional development§Access to corporate health fund discounts and a banking package with Westpac§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please email Andrew Louis at §andrew.louis@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Monday, 26 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

As a Supervisor you will also uphold best practices and adhere to providing the best possible care and delivery of services. You will also need to portray a strong professional ethics and a holistic approach that is client-centred and strengths-based.§With a well-developed leadership skill, you will be supporting the team to work creatively and constructively with our clients and stakeholders to address individual and social needs. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee, please apply through your myHR portal. This will ensure your application is received internally.§If you want to know more about the role, please contact Andrew Louis at §andrew.louis@ot.govt.nz§Applications closes Tuesday, 13 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

This is a rare opportunity to work for one of Canterbury's most respected funeral homes and become part of an extraordinary team of people.§ §This is a critical role within our team and very important you work as a team player. You must be meticulous with your attention to detail, have the ability to support others and also have the highest level of empathy and respect which are key aspects of this role.§ §This position is a permanent position and will be working on a rostered basis. Our rostered teams of two work 1 in 3 weeks on call so please consider if this kind of environment would work for you.§ §Qualities that we are looking for include the following:§ § §You have genuine compassion for people§ §You possess exceptional people skills, honest, have integrity, are reliable and professional.§ §You can be flexible and are a team player.§ §You are able to self-manage and work unsupervised when required.§ § § §Duties will include the following§ § §Arranging funeral services for grieving families and liaising with appropriate authorities§ §Transfer of deceased from place of death.§ §Driving of removal vehicles, hearses and other vehicles as required.§ §Ensure acceptable Occupational Health and Safety standards are maintained at the Funeral Home.§ §Working with medical staff and other related professional.§ §Other duties as required consistent with the position.§ § § §You will also have a sound overall knowledge with computers, in particular with the Microsoft Suite of products and have experience in photo editing and desktop publishing programmes.§ §You will need to be physically fit and able to manage difficult and heavy lifting at times.§ §If you can meet these requirements we would welcome your application. Applications close on October 9 2020.§ §Please send your covering letter and C.V. to:§ §Rod Latham – Manager§ §P O Box 111-01, Sockburn, Christchurch 8443 or§ §Email: §rlatham@academyfunerals.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

This role is part of the established CDHB Mana Ake ‘Mental Health in School’s’ initiative.  The role is fixed-term until 30 June 2021. §        §The Mana Ake – Stronger for Tomorrow initiative aims to work with and through school communities to support families and whanau with children from years one to eight who are experiencing ongoing challenges that are impacting their wellbeing.§        §As part of this role you will provide practical support and positive strategies to build resilience for children referred to the service and their families through primary schools. This work will often require a multi-level collaboration and/or partnered responses with a variety of support systems within community agencies in order to facilitate good outcomes with our clients.§ §Ideal skills and experience:§ § §Sound working knowledge of the key agencies that work with families in the health, education and community sectors§ §Confident to work both independently and alongside others who are working within school cluster§ §Working knowledge of behavioural and developmental issues relating to families and children§ §Has a working knowledge of CYP&F Act, Children’s Action Plan including Vulnerable Children’s Act and Domestic Violence Act or willingness to train§ §Has experience in liaising with other stakeholder groups, for example, Oranga Tamariki (CYF), Work and Income, schools, other education and health providers, other relevant community agencies§ §Membership to an appropriate professional body§ §Strong  facilitation and relationship building skills§ §Knowledge and understanding and commitment to the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi§ §Highly developed written and verbal communication skills§ §Demonstrated ability to utilise information technology including case management systems§ §Ideally, you will be IT literate and able to work in a busy environment, comfortable managing a caseload while contributing your skills and expertise to the broader team.§ §For an application form and position description, please email §cycss.recruitment@sjog.org.nz§ or phone 03-386 2159, quoting reference §SJG-CYCSS-1110§.§ §Applications close §5pm, 16 October 2020.§ § § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50273690.txt	§Hauraki Family Violence Intervention Network (HFVIN) Co-ordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Hauraki Family Violence Intervention Network (HFVIN) Co-ordinator§§Advertiser: §Caps Hauraki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Thames & Coromandel§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Hauraki Family Violence Intervention Network (HFVIN) Coordinator§  §30 hours per week - Two year fixed term§  §HFVIN is a well-established network of agencies and individuals working towards a shared vision of a Violence Free Hauraki. We are seeking to recruit an enthusiastic and energetic co-ordinator with an in-depth understanding of the dynamics related to family violence and the impacts it has on the individuals, families and communities who experience it.§  §As the HFVIN coordinator you will be responsible for the coordination of people, meetings and events, taking a lead role in the facilitation of collaborative conversations and supporting community led initiatives and needs–based projects focused on the prevention of family violence.§  §As a part of the HFVIN Team you will support the various administrative functions of the network across it’s range of projects and contracts, both as part of your core role or to support cover during staff leave as required.§  §This position is focused on strengthening responses to family violence by improving networking, collaboration, public awareness and service provision at a local level. The role involves facilitation, coordination, education and networking to support local services/groups and communities to build capacity to better respond to and prevent family violence.§  §The key skills required for this role are:§ § §A relevant tertiary qualification and/or extensive job related experience§ §Advanced understanding around the dynamics, impact and prevention of family violence§ §An understanding or primary prevention and community development processes§ §The ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with key stakeholders§ §Excellent coordination and collaborative skills§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §Ability to work autonomously§ §Excellent time management and organisational skills§ §Ability to facilitate collaborative projects§ §A working knowledge of relevant legislation§ §Knoweldge of tikanga Maori that is consistent with local tikanga and kawa§ §Creativity, initiative, good judgement and flexibility§ §Experience designing and delivering primary prevention campaigns§ §A good sense of humour and commitment to safe, respectful and peaceful relationships in Hauraki / Coromandel.§ §You will be required to undergo and pass relevant NZ Police vetting as per the Vulnerable children’s Act§ §If this sounds like you, please contact us to register your interest by sending in your covering letter and C.V. to the address below.§  §HFVIN is hosted by CAPS Hauraki who offer a competitive salary package and a supportive team environment. §  §Please forward applications and queries to:§  §PO Box 552 or 732B Queen Street, Thames§Phone: §07 868-8644§ Fax: §07 868-8685§  §Email: Job§@capshauraki.co.nz§  § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50654066.txt	§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Rest of Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Social Workers - Te Waipounamu - Oranga Tamariki§At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, our goal is to establish a multiagency approach to protecting and caring for New Zealand's tamariki and rangatahi.§We aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki §first§We believe §Aroha §is vital§We respect the §Mana §of people§We are §Tika §and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga §is a journey§If you do practice the same values as we do, we would like to hear from you.§We are establishing a new team of Social Workers that will support sites across Te Waipounamu either virtually or with a physical presence on site, as the need raises. Reporting to a Supervisor Social Worker, we are looking for a high performing team who is creative and innovative that can quickly build local relationships across sites and communities built on mutual trust and respect.§In this role, you will be flexible about your place of work and environment delivering high-level evidence based and quality social work services. Given the virtual nature of this team applications are sort from across Te Waipounamu. Locations will be negotiated with successful applicants.§We aim to adapt and improve the lives of tamariki and their whānau through application of our established practice model. You will be expected to operate in a supportive role in order to help achieve this goal.§This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a virtual team working flexibly at varied locations to support Social Workers and Sites to continually provide high quality social work practice.§If this sounds like you, please click apply!§Key attributes to be considered but not limited to will include:§a recognised Social Worker qualification by the Social Worker Registration Board§full registration with New Zealand's Social Worker Registration Board§the ability to demonstrate resilience, critical thinking and problem-solving techniques§upholding the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi§having a good understanding of section 7(AA) of The Oranga Tamariki Act§a valid and clean New Zealand's driver's licence.§What we are offering:§A salary range between $55,000 - $100,000§Commitment to the highest standards of strengths-based social work§Access to corporate health fund discounts§On-going professional development§How to apply§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you are applying from overseas, you will be required to provide a copy of your IELTS certificate. §If you have any questions about the role, please contact Kylie Adkins, at §kylie.adkins@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Monday, 12 October 2020. §Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50673163.txt	§Supervisor Social Worker - Taumarunui§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Supervisor Social Worker - Taumarunui§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Supervisor Social Worker, Care and Protection - Taumarunui, Bay of Plenty§Maranga Mai! Mārewa Ake!§Kua whakaritengia e te Manatū Oranga Tamariki ki Taumarunui tēnei tūranga rangatira. Mēnā kei a koe ngā pukenga, me te ngākaunui mō ēnei momo mahi, me tukua mai tou tono inaianei tonu.§Do you want to make a genuine, positive impact on the lives of tamariki, rangatahi and whānau? Join a supportive team who has each other's backs every step of the way by using the latest strengths-based tools and assessment frameworks in our Taumarunui site. We have a great opportunity for an experienced Supervisor or Social Worker with recent and relevant acting up supervisor or similar experience to lead a remote team of experienced social workers.§What you will do?§Lead a team of staff, providing quality supervision that grows the professional knowledge, capability and capacity of your team§Mentor, coach and develop Social Workers and Workplace Administrators to help them reach their potential§Help embed all practice tools for your team to make quality assessments§Partner with and manage the workflow of the team to help them reach KPI's§Meet our sites needs as and when required§What you will bring?§A full, clean, valid driver's licence§Full registration with New Zealand's Social Work Registration Board (SWRB)§A social worker qualification recognised by the SWRB§Strong knowledge and experience of what Oranga Tamariki does and how we work§Previous people management and mentoring experience would be an advantage§An ability to build and lead an effective team and be a team player§Resilience, initiative and a proactive approach§Empathy, patience and ability to see past what someone may be struggling with§Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to adapt to your audience§The ability to analyse and prepare social work and financial plans§Sound judgement, time management and organisational skills§The ability to manage risk and make tough decisions§Experience using Microsoft Office Suite§Cultural awareness and confidence to back yourself§Knowledge of Te Reo would be a plus§A positive outlook and supporting nature§What's on offer?§A salary range between $80,215 - $103,603§Flexible work opportunities and full compensation for any overtime hours worked§A team who enjoy working hard and having fun§A rewarding career where you will work in a values-based role which is truly making a difference§Regular supervision, training and career development opportunities§Colleagues who are committed to the highest standards of strengths-based social work practice§Practical experience to coach and mentor staff§Access to a generous Southern Cross health plan and banking package with Westpac§Rewarding and challenging work that truly makes a difference to the community§Opportunities to work alongside various cultural groups, build your network and strengthen community relationships§Taumaranui is a small, close-knit town that sits in the north of the Ruapehu District at the confluence of the Whanganui and Ongarue rivers. The district is landlocked and contains Te Kahui Maunga - the gathering of famous mountains namely Mt Ruapehu, and Mt Ngauruhoe and Tongariro. The majesty of these maunga are the perfect playground for people who enjoy the outdoors. Skiing, hiking and tramping are definitely the order of the day so if you're looking for lifestyle 'nau mai, haere mai!'§Who are we?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work practice that is child-centred, trauma informed and effective for all cultures.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee; please apply through your myHR portal.§If you have any questions about the role, please contact Sravani Peddibhotla on §Sravani.peddibhotla@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as applications close Friday, 23 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50666374.txt	§Social Worker - Waikato Rural North§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker - Waikato Rural North§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Social Worker, Care and Protection - Waikato Rural North§In Waikato Rural North we are working with tamariki and whanau to make positive change in our community. We need people who have knowledge, experience and who are deeply passionate about whanau wellbeing.§We acknowledge that there is much work to do but we are up for it, and we are working in a partnership with Waikato-Tainui to do things differently. If you think you have what it takes, then apply to join our team at Waikato-Rural North. Our Site works hard to do things differently within the foundation of a whanau led approach focused on supporting whanau in mana-enhancing ways. Spaces at our Sites don’t come up often so we encourage you to get in quick.§Our Site is unique and here’s two key reasons why§:§Our team works with independent iwi support advisors who provide kaupapa Maori support and advocacy for whanau. This partnership has proved successful and continues to grow§Leadership is encouraged and supported at all levels, as is innovation and changing practice for the betterment of whanau§What you will do?§In this fast-paced role, you will have the privilege to work in our community, with whanau and closely with other social services, agencies and providers to ensure whanau needs are fully met and that we engage sustainable support that keeps tamariki safe in the care of their whanau first and foremost. If you think you have what it takes, and you are dedicated to supporting whanau with achieving positive change in our community, then we want to hear from you.§What you will bring?§Full registration with New Zealand's Social Work Registration Board (SWRB)§A social worker qualification recognised by the SWRB§A strong and genuine commitment to strength-based practice§A full, clean, current driver's licence§Excellent written and oral communication skills§Demonstrated resilience, problem solving techniques and flexibility§Excellent time management and organisational skills§Strong PC and Microsoft Office Suite skills with excellent report writing skills§An authentic commitment to working alongside whanau is essential§Soft skills, emotional empathy, teamwork and leadership§Excellent oral and written communication skills§What's on offer?§Salary range is between $55,000 - $100,000§A challenging, fascinating and gratifying career§On-going training and regular supervision that supports reflection and learning§A leadership team that has a strong commitment to the care of their staff and support creativity§A cohesive and supportive team environment with impressive staff retention rates§Commitment to the highest standards of strengths-based social work§Discounts on Southern Cross Health insurance§Access to a government banking package with Westpac – special offers and rates§Who are we?§At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we are passionate about caring for tamariki and supporting whanau. Our goal is to establish a multiagency approach to protecting and caring for New Zealand’s most risk children and young people.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. Your cover letter is an important part of the shortlisting process. Please ensure you outline your relevant skills and experience in line with the preferences listed above. §If you have any queries, please contact Sravani Peddibhotla on §sravani.peddibhotla@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as application close on Thursday, 15 October 2020.§Please do not apply for this vacancy if you are not registered with the Social Work Registration Board (SWRB).§Instead please follow the below links to be considered accordingly:§If you are a student studying social work or a social work graduate, please apply here -https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareerpvt?jobId=34785&company=ministryofP&st=429319EDA83F55C02D6F1F2A71578B§1674157946§If you are an experienced social worker who hasn’t registered or is waiting to hear back regarding their application for registration, please apply here -https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareerpvt?jobId=34786&company=ministryofP&st=46B9ED700ECE606853CB9B79672703587A506E2A§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50589880.txt	§Social Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker§§Advertiser: §Springboard Community Works§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§We have a full-time Social Worker position available in our Elevate Family Services Programme which provides early intervention and preventative support for young people and their families.  The role involves working in the community and within a team to meet the obligations of our Oranga Tamariki partnership contract.§ §To be successful in your application you will have all or most of the following:§ § §A NZ Social Work Qualification § §A passion to see positive life change for young people in this community§ §An ability to work effectively with all cultures and demographics§ §Competency in written and verbal communication skills along with strong people skills§ §Ability to deliver and report on outcomes§ §Self-motivation and ability to work independently whilst being a strong team player§ §You will also need a full New Zealand driver’s license and be computer literate.§ §The Springboard team is dynamic and full of passionate people who are dedicated to bringing the best outcomes for our young people. You will need to be able to uphold the values of our organisation, understand the principles that we operate by and work within these. § §Springboard is a faith-based charity, established in 2002 and is situated in Snells Beach. We exist so that every young person and their family have someone in their corner and to provide wrap around support services for young people who need a little extra help along the way.§ §See our website for more details - §www.springboard.org.nz§ §Please send your CV along with a covering letter to §mail@springboard.org.nz§ by Friday 09 October 2020§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§Do you have experience working with young people with complex needs?§§§

jobText: TXT/50613303.txt	§Registered Social Worker or Caseworker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Registered Social Worker or Caseworker§§Advertiser: §The Salvation Army NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Registered Social Worker or Caseworker §        §          §Emergency transitional housing, Hamilton§          §The Salvation Army Transitional Housing team is committed to providing a professional service and care to our community. We are a seeking a qualified Transitional Housing Social Worker/Case Worker to work in Emergency Transitional Housing, based in Hamilton, full-time. You will be working with whanau/families that have lost their homes, and are seeking additional support to move forward. We require someone with respect for the whole person, with reasonable judgement, good boundaries and with effective practice in value based social work. You will be working with a committed, dedicated CEO who has a large workload, so managing your time with them will be crucial to your success.§  §Key tasks:§ § §Coordinate Anxiety NZ communications§ §Data gathered for evaluation§ §Google ads strategy in place§ §Creation of collateral to support marketing and communications§ §Website administration§ §BONUS: If you are experienced in filming and editing short videos for YouTube. Please also signify when you are able to begin the position, how many hours you are hoping for and what days/hours you are available for.§  §For the Marketing Communications Support position, please include links/samples/examples of your previous work. For the Fundraising Officer position please include examples of previous experience, especially with significant grants.§  §Please contact Melissa R at §fundraising@anxiety.org.nz§ with questions if needed. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

$103,603§Flexible work opportunities and full compensation for any overtime hours worked§A team who enjoy working hard and having fun§A rewarding career where you will work in a values-based role which is truly making a difference§Regular supervision, training and career development opportunities§Colleagues who are committed to the highest standards of strengths-based social work practice§Practical experience to coach and mentor staff§Access to a generous Southern Cross health plan and banking package with Westpac§Rewarding and challenging work that truly makes a difference to the community§Opportunities to work alongside various cultural groups, build your network and strengthen community relationships§Who are we?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work practice that is child-centred, trauma informed and effective for all cultures.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee; please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Sravani Peddibhotla on §Sravani.peddibhotla@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as applications close Monday, 19 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50547951.txt	§Social Worker §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker §§Advertiser: §Youth Horizons Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$56,000-$67,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Social Worker| Foster Care Coordinator§Do you want to be part of our journey to create better futures for rangatahi who are impacted by conduct problems?§Are you looking for a rewarding opportunity to make a real difference in the community?§The Role§We are looking for a Social Worker/Care Coordinator to join our Foster Care Service located in Waikato. As part of the Foster Care team you will be responsible for safe, efficient and effective management of caregivers and young people within the service. You will develop individualised care plans, identify risks and implement risk and behaviour management plans and coordinate and advocate for services to best support the needs of caregivers and rangatahi/young people while in YHT care.§Role requirements§You will need to travel around the Waikato region to undertake in home site assessments. So travel is a requirement of this role.§Support and mentor caregivers by regular contact through phone and visits to ensure the placement is maintained and the young person is safe throughout the placement period.§You will be a crucial link between the Oranga Tamariki Social Worker, young person and Caregiver.§You will be involved in training and recruiting of Caregivers.§You will participate in all relevant stakeholder meetings.§Keep records of all clinical interactions with Caregivers to assist in service audit.§Maintain all other administrative processes and coordinate appointments, training sessions, young person calendars and Caregivers respite leave.§Be flexible in how and when we meet with Caregivers and the young people to ensure individual circumstances can be accommodated.§This role has an on-call component.§About You§Qualification in social work, psychology, occupational therapy or other related field.§You are a registered (or interim/provisionally registered) under the HPCA Act or Social Work registration.§Be culturally aware and willing to be a part of a bi-cultural journey.§Be willing to undergo Police and Ministry of Social Development (MSD) vetting process.§Have a full and clean New Zealand driver's licence.§Youth Horizons Offers§Career progression opportunities§Supportive and values-based team environment§24/7 senior leadership support§Competitive remuneration (including a vehicle) to match the skills for this role§Paid birthday leave§About Youth Horizons§Youth Horizons is a specialised non-profit organisation providing therapeutic services for young people who have complex behaviour and/or mental health needs. Our national office is in Auckland and we have over 250 staff and caregivers supporting young people and their families and whanau across New Zealand. To find out more about Youth Horizons, visit www.youthorizons.org.nz§It's an exciting time to join us and you will have the opportunity to make a real impact through your work- so apply now! Please note the official title of the role is §Care Coordinator§.§Please refer to the Position Description for more details about the role (available on our career's site).§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

They deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard, and be surrounded by loving whānau and community.§If these words capture why you became a Social Worker, then you belong on the journey we have begun at Oranga Tamariki. We're looking for a qualified, registered, and experienced Statutory Social Worker who wants to make a difference by putting children and young people at the heart of everything they do.§What will you do?§Our team of social workers are a tight knit group who work closely together, and share our Oranga Tamariki values. We are united in our commitment to improving outcomes for Maori and a collaborative approach with whānau, Hapu (Ngati Waewae and Makaawhio) and Iwi.§We are looking for an experienced statutory Social Worker to work with vulnerable mothers and new-borns. Supporting whanau led decision making to improve outcomes for pepe through Hui-a-whanau and Family Group Conferences. Building strong relationships with our community colleagues and advocating for whanau, Hapu, Iwi.§What's on offer?§A competitive market salary§A challenging, fascinating and rewarding career with many opportunities for professional development and building your network with colleagues in the children's workforce§On-going training and regular supervision to support you in achieving your personal and professional goals§A small case-load§Colleagues who are united in their commitment to the highest standards of strengths-based social work§A place of work on the stunningly beautiful West Coast, one of the fastest growing locations in NZ§What will you bring?§Full registration with New Zealand's Social Work Registration Board (SWRB)§A social worker qualification recognised by the SWRB§Full clean driver's licence§Excellent written and oral communication skills§Demonstrated resilience, problem solving techniques and flexibility§Strong analytical skills and an ability to assess children's changing needs§Excellent time management and organisational skills§Strong PC and Microsoft Office Suite skills§Who are we?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard, and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens.§Our West Coast team loves their location, surrounded by gorgeous natural settings and outdoor activities. If you enjoy a quiet, relaxed lifestyle with no traffic, super low costs of living, and plenty of fresh air, this could be the perfect place for you!§If you genuinely care about providing children with the aroha and support they need early on in life, you'll get immense satisfaction from being able to turn lives around, and seeing the difference your work makes to our youngest Kiwis. So will you join us?§How to apply§Please apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you have any queries, please contact Helen Archer on §Helen.archer@ot.govt.nz§Applications close on Friday, 16 October 2020.§Position description §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/social-worker-position-description.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The Volunteer Resilience Advisor is responsible for supporting the leadership of LandSAR volunteering approach of sustainability, recognition of volunteers and volunteer diversity. At its core, this position is aimed at assisting in the building and maintaining a  strong volunteer workforce and having groups that can meet challenges as they arise and are also able to adapt to changing community needs and organisational expectations. It is responsible for the design and development of an overarching approach and organisational development programmes and initiatives in the areas of volunteer resilience, attraction, and retention, aligned to the Land Search and Rescue Volunteer Strategy. §The Volunteer Resilience Advisor will work to develop relationships in the sector, with Land Search and Rescue volunteers, and other Search and Rescueagencies (Coast Guard, Surf Lifesaving, AREC, MSC etc) , to facilitate the development and implementation of practical, cost-effective 'best practice' organisational wide volunteer support. The Volunteer Resilience Advisor will predominantly report to the Chief Executive but will work closely with the Senior Leadership team to implement the LandSAR Volunteer strategy.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

innovative programme. § §Mana Whānau is an intensive in-home parenting support programme designed to keep children out of foster care.§  §Lifewise is committed to preventing tamariki from entering or remaining in the foster care system by providing an intensive in-home support for whānau.§  §We offer whānau a dedicated social worker/whānau worker to support them in their home and their community to reduce immediate risks, reduce or remove stressors, and support to build parent capability.§  §We are looking for a suitably qualified and experienced social worker/whānau worker to be part of an exciting and rewarding journey working alongside whānau in their homes. You will be working with 1 to 2 whānau at any one time supporting positive change over the 6-month programme.§  §We use a whānau-led approach providing practical and emotional support, mentoring, coaching, resourcing, advocacy and skills-building to help whānau to grow their capability to provide safe, nurturing care for their tamariki.§  §What we are offering:§ § §An opportunity to make a difference using your skills creatively in a supportive environment.§ §A full-time supervisor supporting each team of three social workers/whānau workers§ §To be part of a dedicated, supportive and friendly team§ §Competitive salary§ §Being part of a wider values-based organisation.§ § §Are you the person we are looking for?§ § §A passionate social worker or similar with equivalent experience in related fields.§ §A team player with commitment to work with vulnerable whānau and tamariki.§ §An ability to work in a culturally responsive way and to demonstrate bi-cultural concepts in practice.§ §Experience in raising tamariki/parenting and running a household.§ §Flexibility to work hours that meet the needs of the whānau; this could include early mornings, evenings, weekends§ §Empathy and patience to deliver an empowering strengths-based approach  § §A ‘can do’, ‘whatever it takes’ solutions focused attitude.§ §Excellent oral and written communication skills§ §Full driver's license§ §Computer literacy § §For a Position Description email Jess at §Jessh@lifewise.org.nz§ or call §09 818 0205§  §Apply with CV and cover letter to Jess Hale, Office Administrator by 5pm Friday 2nd October 2020 .§  §Applications must be submitted via our organisation's job portal: §  §https://lifewise.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=116§§§§

jobTitle: Kai Manaaki (Case Support Worker), Mana Tū Diabetes Programme Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50534708.txt	§Kai Manaaki (Case Support Worker), Mana Tū Diabetes Programme§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kai Manaaki (Case Support Worker), Mana Tū Diabetes Programme§§Advertiser: §National Hauora Coalition§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Kai Manaaki (Case Support Worker), Mana Tū Diabetes Programme§About Mana Tū:§Mana Tū is a diabetes self-management support programme led by the National Hauora Coalition. Mana Tū aims improve the impact of clinical and lifestyle interventions for people living with poorly controlled type 2 diabetes. We have an exciting opportunity for a Kai Manaaki/Case Support Worker to support the successful delivery of the programme. §The Kai Manaaki role is the heart of Mana Tū and plays a critical part in delivering the Mana Tū programme. Kai Manaaki will be responsible for supporting Māori and Pacific people living with poorly controlled Type 2 Diabetes in a Mana Whānau, Whānau Ora approach. The Kai Manaaki role provides a holistic model of care that focusses on both health outcomes and the wider social determinants of health. §About the National Hauora Coalition§This role will be based within the Primary Health Services team at the National Hauora Coalition (NHC), and will work across a number of General Practices within the NHC’s Network. The NHC is a Māori-led Primary Health Organisation, with a patient population of approximately 230,000 (42% high-needs). The NHC are also strong advocates for social change, challenging the New Zealand health system to uphold its Treaty of Waitangi obligations. Advocating for social change and keeping the pressure on for equity in the health sector has led us to take a claim to the Waitangi Tribunal. Our claim is centred around the gulf between what the health system currently provides for Māori and what it should deliver.§We are looking for candidates who can actively demonstrate skills and experience in the following areas: §Engagement with Māori and Pacific communities§Knowledge of Type 2 Diabetes and experience delivering diabetes self-management education§A background in community health, social work and/or public health§Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills§Excellent organisational and time-management skills§Thorough understanding of New Zealand cultural contexts and environments§Proficiency in IT and software systems§Ability to work both independently§Ability to employ case management strategies§Genuine motivation to improve local community health outcomes§Ability to think on their feet and provide solutions to problems or barriers§Affinity to working with Māori staff, consumers and whānau§Ability to relate to people from different cultural backgrounds §The ability to speak basic Te Reo or the willingness to learn§Ability to foster strong working relationships with whānau, health providers and external service providers§Competitive salary and benefits offered to the right person. §Closing date for applications is 30 October 2020 however, we may close the advert sooner if the ideal candidates are found. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50653695.txt	§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§West Coast§, §Rest of West Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Care and Protection Social Worker: Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children - West Coast -based in Kawatiri/Westport§The well-being of tamariki and rangatahi is everyone's responsibility. They deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard, and be surrounded by loving whānau and community.§If these words capture why you became a Social Worker, then you belong on the journey we have begun at Oranga Tamariki. We're looking for a qualified, registered, and experienced Statutory Social Worker who wants to make a difference by putting children and young people at the heart of everything they do.§What will you do?§Our team of Social Workers are a tight knit group who work closely together, and share our Oranga Tamariki values. We are united in our commitment to improving outcomes for Maori and a collaborative approach with whānau, Hapu (Ngati Waewae and Makaawhio) and Iwi.§We are looking for an experienced statutory Social Worker to work in the Kawatiri/Westport community of the West Coast. The role will be varied and generic including safety planning and Hui-a-whanau, assessments, Family Group Conference monitoring and working in the care space to achieve permanency for our tamariki. You will be fully supporting by the wider West Coast team and our community whanau colleagues to achieve the optimum for our Kawatiri tamariki and whanau.§What's on offer?§A competitive market salary§A challenging, fascinating and rewarding career with many opportunities for professional development and building your network with colleagues in the children's workforce§On-going training and regular supervision to support you in achieving your personal and professional goals§A work vehicle§Colleagues who are united in their commitment to the highest standards of strengths-based social work§A place of work on the stunningly beautiful West Coast, one of the fastest growing locations in NZ§What will you bring?§Full registration with New Zealand's Social Work Registration Board (SWRB)§A social worker qualification recognised by the SWRB§Full clean driver's licence Excellent written and oral communication skills§Demonstrated resilience, problem solving techniques and flexibility§Strong analytical skills and an ability to assess children's changing needs§Excellent time management and organisational skills§Strong PC and Microsoft Office Suite skills§Who are we?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard, and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens.§Our West Coast team loves their location, surrounded by gorgeous natural settings and outdoor activities. If you enjoy a quiet, relaxed lifestyle with no traffic, super low costs of living, and plenty of fresh air, this could be the perfect place for you!§If you genuinely care about providing children with the aroha and support they need early on in life, you'll get immense satisfaction from being able to turn lives around, and seeing the difference your work makes to our youngest Kiwis. So will you join us?§How to apply§Please apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you are a current Oranga Tamariki employee, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any queries, please contact Helen Archer on §Helen.archer@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Friday, 16 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We are New Zealand's largest provider of services to people with intellectual disabilities and their families. Our services are founded on IHC's utter commitment for people with intellectual disabilities to have a good life and to be valued contributors to and members of their own community.§IDEA Services is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the IHC Group which is made up of our charitable programmes and three wholly-owned subsidiaries, committed to supporting people with intellectual disabilities to lead satisfying lives in the community and to providing housing and tenancy services to people in need.§Here's your opportunity to teach people to grow and achieve greater independence, to live a healthy lifestyle, build and maintain relationships and make sure they learn other skills that support them to be part of their community.§Here are the must haves:§You must be someone with a desire to learn new skills and gain some qualifications while you work§You must be able to work across a 7 day a week 24/7 roster (including weekends, evenings and sleepovers)§You must have legal entitlement to live and work in New Zealand for at least 10 months§You must have your Full NZ drivers licence or be able to gain this within 3 months( Ability to drive a manual vehicle preferred)§You must be able to pass a full New Zealand Police check§You must have a can do, positive attitude and enjoy helping others achieve their goals.§What's on offer?§Opportunities to build your long-term career in the disability sector§Competitive hourly pay rates from $20.50 to $25.50§Support to achieve Level 2 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (a minimum qualification requirement for a Support Worker)§The opportunity to gain further qualifications by enrolling in the Level 3 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing§Generous long-service leave entitlements and Insurance benefit§A generous insurance package that kicks in after two years of service§Attractive staff discounts including an exclusive eyecare packages through a leading optometrist§§Please note as part of our recruitment process, if you are successful you will undertake a video interview with our National Recruitment Team.§IHC Group is committed to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and actively seek a diverse applicant pool. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. We welcome all kinds of diversity and the different perspectives such diversity brings to our work. Applicants must have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§§§§
