In fulfilling its role Ngā Tāngata Tiaki o Whanganui must act on behalf of and in the beneficial interests of Whanganui Iwi to;§ §▪              advance the cultural, social, environmental and economic aspirations of Whanganui Iwi;§ §▪              uphold and protect the mana of Te Awa Tupua; and§ §▪              empower the mana of Whanganui Iwi.§ §NTT is seeking a person to support hapū and to work collaboratively with stakeholders on environmental initiatives and the socialisation of Te Awa Tupua.§ §Reporting to the Operations Manager, this role will support the Kaiwhakahaere Taiao (Environment Manager) working with all communities to ensure excellence in communication, relationship management and that the wellbeing of Te Awa Tupua is maintained. Visibility and engagement with hapū and Iwi through various means will be a core requirement as will be the ability to liaise with multiple parties on complex matters.§ §Being passionate about the environment you will have a desire to meet the required cultural outcomes of Whanganui hapū and Iwi.§ §Your role will be to provide awareness and education on Te Awa Tupua and Tupua te Kawa, representing Ngā Tāngata Tiaki across the Whanganui region as well as ensuring the innate values of Tupua Te Kawa are demonstrated in all relationships§ §Ideally, the successful applicant will have the following skills, knowledge and experience.§ § §Experience in and passion for environmental issues.§ §Knowledge of Te Reo me ona tikanga Māori and an awareness and affinity for the needs and aspirations of Whanganui hapū.§ §Knowledge and understanding of Te Awa Tupua and Tupua te Kawa.§ §Demonstrated ability of establishing, maintaining and enhancing relationships within all communities.§ §A high level of competency in written and verbal communication.§ §The ability to manage an operational process to deliver required strategic outcomes.§ §Experience that supports the scope of the role.§ §Applications including a comprehensive covering letter and CV should be forwarded to §louise@ngatangatatiaki.co.nz§ §Applications close 25th September 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50664954.txt	§Social Worker - Tokoroa, South Waikato§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker - Tokoroa, South Waikato§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Are you ready for your next exciting opportunity?§Make a genuine, positive impact on the lives of tamariki, rangatahi and whanau§Use the latest strengths-based tools and assessment frameworks§Join a close, supportive and fun team who are passionate about their work§What's in it for you?§A salary range between $55,000 - $100,000§Flexible work opportunities§A close-knit team who love to share kai and plan fun group activities§Support to achieve your goals through tailored training and career development opportunities§Annual practicing fee paid for§Rewarding and challenging work that truly makes a difference§Opportunities to work alongside various cultural groups, build your network and strengthen community relationships§The role includes the following:§Meeting with children and young people and ensuring their voices are heard§Assessing the safety and well-being of tamariki, rangatahi and whanau§Planning social work activities to help safeguard children and young people§Supporting whānau to grow their capacity to care for their tamariki and rangatahi§Working closely with stakeholders in the community, schools, Police, non-government organisations and state sector agencies§Transitioning tamariki and rangatahi back to their whānau or into their forever home§Advocating on behalf of children to ensure they have the support and resources needed to reach their full potential§Who is Oranga Tamariki?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard, and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work practice that is child-centred, trauma-informed, and effective for all cultures.§Our team§Our Tokoroa team is caring and supportive of each other. We love sharing home-cooked meals during monthly shared lunches, where we relax and have a bit of a laugh together. We watch out for each other's well-being by reminding each other to take breaks and participating in healthy activities together. We are even thinking about entering the Tough Guy and Tough Girl challenges next year. You will be joining a team that doesn't just talk about doing fun stuff - we DO it!§We want new members of our team to feel comfortable contributing ideas to keep our team healthy, and happy! Some of our favourite aspects of working in Tokoroa are the affordable housing costs, super low traffic, free parking and plenty of lush, green forest to soothe your soul.§What you will bring?§A tertiary social work qualification§Social work registration or working towards this§A full, clean, valid driver's licence§The ability to analyse and prepare social work and safety plans§Good verbal and written skills as you will need to write court reports and case notes§The ability to manage risk and make tough decisions with sound judgment skills§A positive outlook and empathetic, supporting nature§Experience with social services or agencies is a big plus§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. This will ensure your application is received internally.§If you have any queries, please contact §Sravani.Peddibhotla@ot.govt.nz§Hurry as applications close Thursday, 22 October 2020.§Please do not apply for this vacancy if you are not registered with the Social Work Registration Board (SWRB).§Instead please follow the below links to be considered accordingly:§If you are a student studying social work or a social work graduate, please apply here -https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareerpvt?jobId=34785&company=ministryofP&st=429319EDA83F55C02D6F1F2A71578B§1674157946§If you are an experienced social worker who hasn't registered or is waiting to hear back regarding their application for registration, please apply here -https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareerpvt?jobId=34786&company=ministryofP&st=46B9ED700ECE606853CB9B79672703587A506E2A§To see more about this exciting role, check out the position description:§http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/social-worker-position-description.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50657378.txt	§Trees for Survival Fundraising Manager. Environmentalist background§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trees for Survival Fundraising Manager. Environmentalist background§§Advertiser: §Trees for Survival Charitable Trust Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$55,000 - $64,999 + private car km reimbursement§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Fundraising§§§§§§Trees for Survival are looking for a person to head our fundraising efforts to grow our native trees planting programme. There is a high demand for our programme which is well-respected across environmental, education, farming and business sectors.§  §Our Fundraising Manager will be passionate about what we do: restoring New Zealand’s ecology through the planting of native plants along waterways and on erosion prone land – someone who can realise that passion though creating funding relationships with businesses, Councils, environmental groups, Charitable Trusts and donors.§  §The person will be a great over-the-phone and face-to-face communicator. They will be able to present the Trees for Survival story professionally and confidently through superbly written proposals and enthusiastic presentations. §  §Key responsibilities will include§ § §Working on a programme of targeted fund-raising activities based predominantly on written proposals and face to face meetings (no telemarketing or street-collection activities)§ §Meet the fundraising financial target§ §Meet grant application timelines§ §Able to write great funding-request presentations and proposals§ §Support and maintain successful relationships with financial supporters§ §Prepare and submit regular progress reports to the National Manager§ §Assist with PR and communication§ §Skills and Experience Required§ § §A minimum of 3 years in business-to-business sales and marketing experience§ §Ability to relate professionally to senior management§ §Be a well organised person able to meet proposal timelines§ §Able to work well in a small team environment§ §Excellent skills in Microsoft Office suite of programmes and presentations, database look-up, progress tracking of proposals§ §Good commercial sense§ §Exhibit a high level of self-motivation and self-management and the ability to take the initiative to deliver outcomes§ §Understanding of horticulture, native plants, and the health of our natural environment§ §Preference for someone who may already be working in the environmental sector with good contacts§ §Position§ § §Predominantly Auckland based, but some travel may be required to Waikato and BOP regions§ §Fixed term contract 12 months§ §Hours are flexible – quality of work and success is more important than hours on the job§ §Work from home§ §Travel to meetings by private car recompensed though travel cost reimbursement§ §Reports to the National Manager§ §How to apply§  §Please include a current CV and cover letter detailing your skills and experience for this role. Applicants must be eligible to live and work in NZ and be able to successfully pass a Police Vetting Check.§  §Email to the National Manager for Trees for Survival: §dennis@tfsnz.org.nz§  §Applications close: § 12 October 2020 at 4.00pm§  § §  §About Trees for Survival§  §Trees for Survival is an environmental education programme started by the Rotary Organisation in 1991 and involves young people growing and planting native trees to restore natural habitats by helping landowners revegetate erosion prone land, improve stream flow and water quality and increase biodiversity§  §The benefits of the programme are three-fold:§ § §generations of children gain a better understanding of what makes for a healthy environment;§  § §practical activities that create a healthier whenua through the prevention of land erosion, improvement in stream flow and water quality, increased native biodiversity and the generation of long-term native carbon sinks;§  § §creates interests, insights and pathways for senior students who are leaning towards tertiary education in environmental studies or practical career options in horticulture and the environment.§ §Trees for Survival is intended as a nationwide programme. Dominant locations today are Auckland, Waikato and Tauranga/BOP.§  §Trees for Survival is a registered charitable trust (CC28548). Find out more at www.tfsnz.org.nz§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50591168.txt	§Kaitakawaenga Māori / Māori Engagement Advisor, Tohu Whenua§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaitakawaenga Māori / Māori Engagement Advisor, Tohu Whenua§§Advertiser: §Heritage New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Indigenous & Multicultural Services§§§§§§Tohu Whenua is a visitor programme that connects New Zealanders with their heritage and enhances their sense of national identity by promoting significant historical and cultural sites.  The programme is a partnership between Manatū Taonga Ministry for Culture and Heritage, Department of Conservation Te Papa Atawhai and Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga with support from the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment Hīkina Whakatutuki and Te Puni Kokiri Ministry of Māori Development.§ § § §Tohu Whenua is seeking a Kaitakawaenga Māori to advise on iwi/Māori engagement, support regional rollout activity and contribute to the development of marketing and communications material. The part-time (0.5 FTE) role is fixed term for one year and will focus on ensuring Tohu Whenua’s relationships with iwi/Māori are strong, positive and well-managed, and that the Māori perspective is well-represented in the way the programme operates internally and across the country. The role is part of a small team based in Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga and will report to the Kaiwhakahaere Hōtaka Programme Manager, Tohu Whenua.§ §The ideal candidate will have experience working with iwi/Māori, preferably in an advisory, engagement or delivery role; strong knowledge of tikanga, Te Ao Māori and Te Reo Māori; and an understanding of New Zealand heritage including Māori history.§ §Applications close at §5pm§ on §Thursday 8 October 2020. § §For more information about the role an application form and how to apply, please refer to our website:§ §https://www.heritage.org.nz/get-involved/job-vacancies§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50534361.txt	§Keyworker - James Liston Hostel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Keyworker - James Liston Hostel§§Advertiser: §Auckland City Mission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Our Mission:§  §Together we stand with those in desperate need.§  §We provide immediate relief and pathways to enable long term wellbeing.§  §Keyworker - James Liston House§  §The recently refurbished James Liston Hostel is a transitional housing hostel operating 24/7 that supports up to 50 clients who previously were homeless/rough sleeping. The service provides a safe base from which support is offered to access services and aid transition into permanent housing situations.§  §We are now are seeking a positive, resilient, energetic professional to join our James Liston team.§  §As a Keyworker, you will work with clients who have high and complex needs including histories of trauma, sexual and domestic violence, mental health, addiction and challenging behaviours. You will engage with clients to effectively assess, plan and implement interventions that improve their health, well-being and transition them into permanent housing. This will include working cross-functionally with other Auckland City Mission services and external parties.§  §The role requires a client-centred, strengths-based approach, strong professional practice and the ability to work as part of a resilient team.§  §To be successful in this role you will ideally have:§ § §A relevant tertiary qualification.§ §Experience managing your own caseload with positive outcomes.§ §Excellent written and communication skills.§ §Exceptional ability to build rapport with service users.§ §Evidence of working in a culturally diverse environment.§ §An understanding of how to work with vulnerable people and the systems they must engage with.§ §Excellent team-building, collaboration and partnering skills, with an aptitude for getting things done through both formal and informal channels.§ §Please note - §James Liston Hostel runs 24/7 seven days a week and you will  be required to work morning and afternoon shifts in this position.§  §If you are committed to using your skills to help our community, then we would love to hear from you. Auckland City Mission offers broad career opportunities in a supportive environment, including external supervision and opportunities for skill development.§  §Our Values:§  §MANAAKITANGA§  §Manaakitanga is behaviour that acknowledges the mana of others as having equal or greater importance than one's own, through the expression of aroha, hospitality, generosity, and mutual respect.§  §JUSTICE (MANATIKA)§  §Committed to equity, and seeking dignity for all we will fearlessly advocate with and for those who are going without.§  §PARTNERSHIP (RANGAPU)§  §Firstly, the Auckland City Mission recognises the principle of partnership within Te Tiriti O Waitangi.§  §Secondly, our commitment to partnership stems from a belief that manaakitanga, equity and social justice need to be pursued both within partnerships and through them.§  §For us, a partnership is characterised by mutual trust, integrity, respect, transparency, and commitment.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§This role requires you to work morning and afternoon shifts five days out of seven including weekends.  Are you happy to commit to this?§§§

We are seeking a new full-time Senior Pastor, called by God, as a ‘shepherd’ leader in SWBC’s vision:§“§To be a redemptive community,§§sharing the love of Christ in the world, by word, sign and deed;§§helping people become lifelong followers of Jesus Christ.§”§The Senior Pastor will role model the vision of SWBC as a whole-of-life commitment and be, first of all, a follower of Jesus and active discipler of others. jobText: TXT/50565963.txt	§Community Social Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Social Worker§§Advertiser: §Eastern Refuge Society§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§About the business and the role§ § §Eastern Refuge Society is looking for a qualified social worker to join our community team in Counties Manukau South§ §This is a new role, and strong community development skills and networks will be integral to the role. § §The successful applicant will hold a gendered analysis to violence and the safety women and children as paramount to their practice.§ §We require an active team player, with the ability to perform under pressure and engage victims in processes whereby they are kept safe, supported and provided with the very best interventions, information, advocacy and advice.  § §Community Advocates are expected to have a good grasp of basic law surrounding domestic violence and/or family harm and be able to effectively advocate accordingly on behalf of their client/s§ §The successful applicant should have the ability to Effectively work as part of a close team as well as having the ability to be self managing and autonomous in managing an external site and case load and meeting taskings and reporting deadlines.§ §A continuing commitment to Te Tiriti O Waitangi, Parallel Development and cultural models of practice, as well as professional development within these contexts, should be actively demonstrated and is essential to the role. § §The ability to speak Te Reo Maori is of benefit, but not essential. § § § § § § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § §We are looking for a warm, empathetic practitioner who can reserve judgement in their practice. The successful applicant will have a solid theoretical framework, as well as learned skills and have excellent written and oratory skills. § §The position will increase Refuge based community work inline with policies and protocols of Eastern Refuge and all social work/advocacy undertaken within the role will be of the highest standard.§ §Working with victims of domestic violence comes with the knowledge that the process for change takes time. Models of practice will be employed that enhance the self determination of women and children and this will be actively demonstrated. § §Advocates are expected to have a strong voice on behalf of their client groups and have skills to navigate and often challenge, difficult situations in a respectful and professional manner. § §Interview skills and report writing are essential to the role and require a high level of competence. § §The successfull applicant will have a good grasp of information technology and have the skills necessary to use the Recordbase CMS, as well as excel, word and any other programme necessary for your work, not excluding the internet. § §Participation in case consult hui, management, regional and national hui and any required professional development are essential to the role.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §Applicants should have a social work qualification or similar, with experience working in the domestic violence and/or sexual violence sector. § §Professional registration will be an advantage to the successful applicant.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Have you completed a qualification in community services?§Do you have experience in a community outreach environment?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§About the business§  §Great Potentials Foundation has been assisting and supporting children, young people, and whanau towards brighter futures for 30 years.  We are based in Papakura and Takanini and operate our own Early Learning Centre, HIPPY programmes, Social Services including social work, counselling, Social Work in Schools (SWIS), parenting programmes, and a range of MSD and Oranga Tamariki contracts. §  §Further information is available on our website: include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as a social worker?§§§

We are New Zealand's largest provider of services to people with intellectual disabilities and their families. Our services are founded on IHC's utter commitment for people with intellectual disabilities to have a good life and to be valued contributors to and members of their own community.§IDEA Services is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the IHC Group which is made up of our charitable programmes and three wholly-owned subsidiaries, committed to supporting people with intellectual disabilities to lead satisfying lives in the community and to providing housing and tenancy services to people in need.§Here's your opportunity to teach people to grow and achieve greater independence, to live a healthy lifestyle, build and maintain relationships and make sure they learn other skills that support them to be part of their community.§Here are the must haves:§You must be someone with a desire to learn new skills and gain some qualifications while you work§You must be able to work across a 7 day a week 24/7 roster (including weekends, evenings and sleepovers)§You must have legal entitlement to live opportunity to gain further qualifications by enrolling in the Level 3 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing§Generous long-service leave entitlements and Insurance benefit§A generous insurance package that kicks in after two years of service§Attractive staff discounts including an exclusive eyecare packages through a leading optometrist§§Please note as part of our recruitment process, if you are successful you will undertake a video interview with our National Recruitment Team.§IHC Group is committed to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and actively seek a diverse applicant pool. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. We welcome all kinds of diversity and the different perspectives such diversity brings to our work. Applicants must have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§§§§

$25.50 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§About the role§ § §Planning and delivering support to people in their homes and communities§ §Helping people connect with their communities, live the life they want and achieve their goals§ §Skills and experience§ §The ideal candidate will:§ § §Be a people person, able to build trusting and respectful relationships§ §Be able to work creatively and problem-solve§ §Have good community knowledge and be able to develop networks§ §Have a level 3 qualification in Health and Wellbeing and a current first aid certificate (although training can be provided for the right person)§ §Have an understanding of bi-cultural practice in Aotearoa New Zealand§ §Be comfortable with technology – Community Connections has a cloud-based database and rostering system that staff need to access with their mobile devices§ §Have a full drivers licence§ §Have experience with youth challenging behaviors and autism§ §Benefits§ § §Pay rate is between $20.50 and $25.50 depending on qualifications and experience§ §Flexible working options§ §Ongoing professional development§ §Supportive team environment§ §Making positive differences in people’s lives and in the community§ §How to apply§ §All applications must be through our website.  Please go to https://www.ccslt.org.nz/job/pn-ft-sw-plk005/ click on the “Apply for Job” button, fill in the online form, and attach your CV and cover letter.§ §For further information, contact Heni Owen, §heni.owen@ccslt.org.nz§ §About Community Connections§ §We are a community based disability support provider that operates across much of the North Island. jobText: TXT/50557085.txt	§Permanent Reliever - Support Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Permanent Reliever - Support Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Hohepa Canterbury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Our Purpose:§ Our Reason For Being§ §When you work at Hohepa Canterbury, you are part of something very special.  We are a community leader providing services and support for people living with an intellectual disability based on the anthroposophical principles of Rudolf Steiner. We actively engage with the people we support so to empower them to develop to their fullest potential and lead enriched and meaningful lives in a holistic, supportive environment.§ §Our Culture:§ What We Care About§ §What matters to us is putting people at the centre of all we do. We show empathy for and respect towards others, we are accountable for delivering outcomes, we go about our work with integrity in all we do, we have courage to do the right thing, for the people we support and ourselves.§ §The Opportunity:§ What This Role's All About§ §As a Permanent Reliever you will be rostered to work across any of our houses. Rostering can happen from one months notice to a few hours, with changes made on the hop, therefore you need to be flexible, adaptable and ready to hit the ground running. Morning, afternoon and sleepover shifts required, including weekends. You will be supporting people with disabilities in a range of settings including in their home, out in the community and at our day centres.§ §Available Rosters:§ §Friday to Monday (32 hours / week)§ §Sunday to Thursday (40 hours / week)§ §Tuesday to Saturday (40 hours / week)§ §The people we support have varying levels of need with daily tasks including cooking, cleaning, medication administration, stores purchasing, personal cares, as well as facilitating community participation, recreational activities, and supporting people to achieve their goals. You may also provide person-centred support in homes where routine is critical; following detailed plans to meet the needs of the people.§ §You:§ What Are We Looking For?§ §We are a progressive organisation looking for self-motivated, energetic and flexible people with a high level of initiative. We value teamwork and collaboration.§ §You will  be an experienced Support Worker where your enthusiasm and passion for helping others will make a real difference in people’s lives.§ §Applicants must have a full drivers licence and ability to work in New Zealand.§ §Benefits: §What’s in it for you?§ § §On-going Nationally Accredited Industry training.§ §Hohepa’s positive and progressive team culture§ §A regular roster§ §Flexible working hours§ §Apply now by copying the link below and pasting it into your browser:§ §***PLEASE APPLY VIA THIS LINK OR YOUR APPLICATION MAY BE MISSED***§ §https://hohepacanterbury.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=97§ §Applicants will be progressed as they apply, so if this sounds like you, please apply now! §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a support coordinator?§Have you completed a qualification in disability?§§§

jobText: TXT/50534818.txt	§Management Lead - Whānau Ora§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Management Lead - Whānau Ora§§Advertiser: §Konnect Koncepts Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Kōrure Whānau - “Ensuring That Whānau Are At The Heart Of What We Do”§Are you passionate to make a difference for whānau in your local community?§Are you a dynamic leader who enjoys coaching and mentoring?§Looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity §Enjoy an environment where one day is not like the other§?§ § §KO WAI MĀTOU - WHO WE ARE§ §Te Whānau O Waipareira Trust is an urban Maori-proud community that has been serving the West Auckland community for over 35 years, creating positive outcomes for whānau.  We are one of the largest NGOs in New Zealand, with over 200 staff, with continued growth and expansion. §HE KŌRERO WHĀKAMARAMA MŌ TĒNEI TŪRANGA - ABOUT THE ROLE§The Waipareira whānau are looking for an experienced Management Lead for their frontline integrated services team, known as Kōrure Whānau.  You will be one of four Management Leads, ensuring the efficient and effective delivery of integrated services are aligned to the overarching Whānau Ora framework and philosophy. Working together with the wider team within the West Auckland community, supporting whānau to achieve their self-determined aspirations and wellbeing in the social, health, education and justice areas.§NGA TOHUNGATANAG O TĒNEI TŪRANGA - WHAT YOU WILL BRING§ § §A working and comprehensive knowledge of Whānau Ora and the implementation of this within an organisation§ §Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of Te Āo Māori including Te Reo me ngā Tikanga Maōri§ §Experienced in kaupapa Maōri approaches and an empathy for own and other cultures§ §Bachelors Degree or above in related field§ §Minimum of 5 years in a management role inclusive of business management§ §Experience in personnel management, supervision, recruitment and evaluation§ §Experience in growing organisational capability and capacity§ §Demonstrated ability to work and lead in a proactively diverse and inclusive team§ §Effective problem solving and mediation skills as well as demonstrated ability to multitask and work in a fast paced setting§ §A knowledge and understanding of contract service specifications and required outcomes including negotiating ability § §High level of energy, innovation, self motivation and enthusiasm and excellent interpersonal skills.§ §Proven IT skills that support case management§ §A full clean drivers licence and agree to background checks§ §NGĀ PAINGA O TĒNEI WHARE - THE GOOD THINGS ABOUT THIS ORGANISATION§We can offer an awesome team and working culture in modern premises in the heart of West Auckland Henderson township.  Just a 2 minute walk from rail/bus transport hub and large-scale malls, stores and eateries.  We provide 5 weeks annual leave, 4% Kiwisaver Employer contributions, promote a work life balance and are committed to providing ongoing professional development.§ §If you have the right skills, experience and a passion to support the community – please §APPLY §today.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid work visa.§§Resumes or assistance will not be accepted from Recruitment Agencies§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have native or bilingual proficiency in any languages other than English?§§§

jobTitle: Social Worker (Kaiarahi) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50540164.txt	§Social Worker (Kaiarahi)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker (Kaiarahi)§§Advertiser: §MUMA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§$50,000 - $54,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Manukau Urban Maori Authority (MUMA)§ is a progressive, dynamic community organisation that is driven by its vision, mission and values, as we strive to advance urban Maori aspirations.§ §The 'Kaupapa' that we all embrace here at MUMA Whanau services is §'WHANAU FIRST'§. Our wraparound social services includes supporting and advocating on behalf of Whanau, who are struggling, live in poor conditions and face many challenges on a daily basis with the basic necessities of life including, but not limited to finances, food, housing, education, health, mental health, drug and alcohol issues and general standards of living striving towards a better future, where Whanau are empowered to self-manage, determining their own pathways and taking control of their own lives towards a better standard of living embracing Whanau Ora (Whanau well-being).§ §It is envisaged that candidates will possess a non-judgmental, caring, mana-enhancing attitude towards Whanau and their specific individual needs. Essential to the role is a degree in social work, previous social work experience working particularly with Maori and Pacific Whanau and MUST possess sound computing and written and verbal communication skills. It is also desirable that the candidate holds current Registration and a valid Practising Certificate with the NZ Social Workers Registration Board and has an understanding and knowledge of Te Reo me ona Tikanga Maori.§ §It is recommended that candidates provide a Covering letter, an up-to-date CV and MUST hold a current full NZ driver's licence.§ §Applications CLOSE at 4pm on Fri 25 September 2020.§ §Shortlisted candidates will be advised after the applications close and interviews will be arranged with each successful candidate at a suitable date and time in the week of §28-30 September 2020§ and the successful candidate will be advised by §Fri 2 October 2020§.§ §NB: Please be aware that this position will officially start on Mon 5 October 2020 at MUMA Whanau Ora services based at Nga Whare Waatea Marae, 31 Calthorp Close, Favona, Mangere. § §Any queries please contact:§ §Veronica Henare, General Manager, MUMA Whanau Services Limited§ §Email: §veronica@muma.co.nz§ §Ph: 021 670934§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a social worker?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your highest level of education?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§

jobTitle: Operations Coordinator Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50608358.txt	§Operations Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Anne Aitken§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Volunteer Coordination & Support§§§§§§Bringing wildlife back to Pirongia, one bird at a time§  §Pirongia Te Aroaro o Kahu Restoration Society (PRS) was set up to bring Pirongia maunga back to life through the reintroduction of key native species. The focus of this effort is on translocating birds from other places and protecting them as best we can, through monitoring them and controlling animal and plant pests. Pests are controlled mainly through toxic bait and trapping.§  §The Society has had the privilege of releasing North Island robins and kokako onto the mountain and helping the populations to get established.§  §The work of PRS is done through volunteers but they need a special person to coordinate their activities and to be the central hub for the organisation. This role has a mix of administration, public relations, compliance work and coordinating volunteers. The coordinator will be working closely with the Chairperson, sharing tasks to get the work done so prior experience as a personal assistant or in a similar role will be helpful. Some hours will be worked in the Envirocentre in Pirongia, and some hours may be worked from home. There is a requirement to do some weekend work when working bees are being held. There is no need for the person to do field work.§  §The person needs to:§ § §Be self managing§ §Be competent in the Microsoft suite of products§ §Be competent in basic accounting processes§ §Have good report writing and analytical skills§ §Be skilled in managing social media communications and website§ §Have strong interpersonal skills§ §Have an interest in the Society’s work and environmental matters§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Social Worker Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
xenophobe: Strong empathy and patience with elderly residents
jobText: TXT/50526096.txt	§Social Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker§§Advertiser: §Tuakiri Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Tuakiri Charitable Trust is a Kaupapa Maori Care to Transition Service based in Rotorua. We operate a Transition to Independence Home and programme for young males aged between 13-17 years who are in the Custody of Oranga Tamariki. Our Home operates 24/7, 365 days a year.§ § § §Our Social Worker plays a pivotal role in our organisation, we are looking for a unique and special person who is honest, reliable and has a real and genuine passion for people, a person who has empathy, patience and the want and ability to build rapport with a variety of people. Our Social Worker is someone who has excellent communication skills and a "can do" attitude with the ability to manage risk and the confidence to make tough decisions on a day-day basis.§ § § § §This is a leadership position within our organisation, where you will be expected to role model best practice principles to the wider care team.§ §You will have excellent social work skills to carryout risk assessments, create individual care, activity and transition plans informed by Te Whare Tapa Wha. You will have a sound understanding of assessing and working with challenging behaviour, you will have excellent engagement skills and the ability to communicate with our young people, their whanau, and other professionals.§ §You will have well established networks and professional relationships within the Rotorua - Bay of Plenty region.§ §You will assess all referrals and complete individualised care, activity and transition plans, monitor and review the plan(s) for the duration of the placement.§ §You will engage with whanau and other professionals to ensure the appropriate supports are in place for all young people in our home.§ §You will have the ability to Identify and address the individual, social, educational and cultural needs of each young person that enters our whare.§ §This is a very rewarding position in a unique organisation that has a strong set of guiding values, if you genuinely want to make a positive difference in the lives of some of our most challenging, disadvantaged young people then this is the job for you!§ § § §This position is 40 Hours per week with flexibility of days.§ § § §What you will bring:§ § §Experience and sound understanding of complex behaviours, trauma informed care.§ §Sound judgement and organisational skills.§ §An energetic and resilient outlook§ §The ability to engage and build rapport with challenging, hard to reach young people and their whanau§ §A kind, caring, considerate disposition§ § § §You Must:§ § §Have a Qualification in Social Work§ §SWRB Registration with current APC§ §A minimum of 3 years social work experience§ §Demonstrate initiative and sound judgement with ability to "think on your feet"§ §Have excellent time management skills§ §Resilient and flexible with a positive attitude and good sense of humour§ §Established community networks§ § § §We Offer:§ § § § §A competitive Salary§ §A unique working environment with a specialised service of care§ §A comprehensive Induction training package§ §Opportunities for further training and  professional development§ §A great team environment§ § § §Please apply online or contact Kere Mitai at kere.mitai@tuakiri.nz for job description and further details.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a social worker?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50525024.txt	§Pastor of Engagement and Equipping§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pastor of Engagement and Equipping§§Advertiser: §Windsor Park Baptist Church§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Windsor Park Baptist Church is a large and effective church in the middle of Auckland's North Shore. Over the last 70 years we've developed into a wide faith-based group with speciality ministries in mental heath, the marketplace and in community care. Windsor Park is always changing as we seek to grow in effectiveness in an ever-changing post-Christian society.§ § § §About the role§ § § §This new role is a key pastoral leadership role and comes with all the opportunities key leadership roles have - the ability to implement change, try new ideas, and roll with creativity as you engage and equip people to help them grow in themselves and become active mission-minded participants in our community.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §The leadership team at Windsor Park is always seeking new ways of being effective; you'll be empowered to work purposefully and creatively, and we do all that we can to help enable you to grow and develop.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You'll be someone who has a demonstrated history of being a peoples-person; you'll love engaging with people and you'll have experience at leading teams. Having been part of a dynamic church environment is a distinct advantage, as well as proven effective communication skills.§ § §Tertiary qualifications in theology are definitely preferred, although exceptional circumstances could be discussed; however this would have to be something you would then undertake as part of the role.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have native or bilingual proficiency in any languages other than English?§§§

jobText: TXT/50556231.txt	§Social Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker§§Advertiser: §IOSIS Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§IOSIS operates as a multi-disciplinary, multicultural, Christian, community service provider with a vision to transform family life for good.§  §Do you have a passion to work with vulnerable families in the community of Manurewa and Papakura?§  §We are looking for experienced and committed Social Workers to be part of an exciting and rewarding journey working intensively alongside families in their home. You will work with vulnerable families with high needs to overcome challenges providing support through mentoring, coaching, advocacy, empowering parents and whanau to make the changes needed to ensure the safety and well-being of children.§  §Working from a strengths based perspective, you will have strong assessment skills and an ability to meaningfully engage, often reluctant families in interventions that inspire, motivate and enable change for good.§  §Working collaboratively with Oranga Tamariki and other community agencies you will have knowledge of and competency to work within the Maori and Pacific Island community.  You will have a sound understanding of issues related to family violence, addictions, parenting, attachment and care and protection for children.§  §We offer a supportive multi-cultural team environment with flexible hours, good supervision and excellent professional development opportunities.§  §If you have a Social Work qualification with registration, previous experience in a similar role, a current driver’s license and you are keen to make a difference in the community of South Auckland, please email your CV and cover letter to §recruitment@iosis.org.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a social worker?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Join a supportive & innovative values-based organisation that is committed to looking after its staff.§        §We are looking for an experienced Speech-Language Therapist to join Spectrum Care's Team for a 12 month fixed term contract. Reporting to the Practice Lead Speech-Language Therapy, you will be joining a small but passionate and highly enthusiastic team of SLTs who work closely with other members of the clinical team (Behaviour and Health Advisors). The SLT team is on a mission to develop and deliver sector-changing communication and dysphagia services to people with disabilities and 2021 is shaping up to be a very exciting year.§        §In the role you will provide specialized communication and dysphagia assessment, advice, guidance and training. No two days will be the same: you will be reviewing and updating communication and mealtime plans, visiting houses and individuals, responding to requests, creating eLearning content, providing training and coaching to staff and liaising with external agencies. And you'll have plenty of opportunity to get involved in organisational projects and initiatives.§        §As the role is a mobile role, you will be provided with a car, laptop and phone for work purposes. We're moving towards more flexible working arrangements so talk to us about what that looks like for you.§        §You will have a tertiary qualification in Speech Language Therapy and either be a current member of the NZSTA or eligible for membership.§        §Essential requirements for the role are:§        §• At least 1 years clinical experience§        §• Experience supporting people with intellectual/developmental difficulties§        §• High numeracy and literacy§        §• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§        §• A high level of emotional maturity and person-centeredness§        §• Must be self-motivated and assertive§        §• Full New Zealand driver's licence§        §If you have a passion for working with people and want to make a difference - Click apply now!§        §For any queries call Suzanne on 027 277 8741 quoting the reference number§        §§      §      §Suzanne Morgan§027 277 8741 §    §    §People with disabilities living great lives§  §§§Spectrum Care supports people with disabilities. jobText: TXT/50556239.txt	§Social Worker in Schools§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker in Schools§§Advertiser: §IOSIS Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Iosis  is proud to be a:§ § § §Community based organisation working with families who have complex needs and limited resources§ § § §Working from a strengths based and multi-disciplinary model§ § § §A unique agency culture that is highly supportive and flexible to respond to the needs of children and families in our community.§ § § §Strong local reputation of integrity based on our Christian foundations§ § § § §Come join our team in giving children of our community a better future!§ §This role offers an exciting opportunity to join a team of passionate Social Workers who support one another to affect change in the lives of the children and young people they work with. You will work with the staff and families of the school community to identify issues where families are struggling to best support their children's educational outcomes. Using individual, whanau based and community development approaches, you will respond creatively to those issues, supported by the programmes and experience of the whole agency, with clinical supervision and training.§ §The work will be varied and challenging, and the successful candidate will have a sound understanding of Pacific, Maori and new immigrant cultures.§ §You will also have a Social Work qualification and registration.§ §Apply now by sending your CV and a cover letter by email to: §recruitment@iosis.org.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Social Worker in Schools Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50556236.txt	§Social Worker in Schools§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker in Schools§§Advertiser: §IOSIS Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Iosis  is proud to be a:§ § § §Community based organisation working with families who have complex needs and limited resources§ § § §Working from a strengths based and multi-disciplinary model§ § § §A unique agency culture that is highly supportive and flexible to respond to the needs of children and families in our community.§ § § §Strong local reputation of integrity based on our Christian foundations§ § §Come join our team in giving children of our community a better future!§ §This role offers an exciting opportunity to join a team of passionate Social Workers who support one another to affect change in the lives of the children and young people they work with. You will work with the staff and families of the school community to identify issues where families are struggling to best support their children's educational outcomes. Using individual, whanau based and community development approaches, you will respond creatively to those issues, supported by the programmes and experience of the whole agency, with clinical supervision and training.§ §The work will be varied and challenging, and the successful candidate will have a sound understanding of Pacific, Maori and new immigrant cultures.§ §You will also have a Social Work qualification and registration.§ §Apply now by sending your CV and a cover letter by email to: §recruitment@iosis.org.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50532266.txt	§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Worker - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Social Worker - Permanent - Manawatu Site§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, currently have an opportunity for Social Workers to join our Manawatu site - a team where relationships are built on mutual trust and respect.§Our goal is to establish a multiagency approach to protecting and caring for New Zealand's tamariki and rangatahi. We aim to adapt and improve the lives of tamariki and their whānau through application of our established practice model: You will be expected to operate in a supportive role in order to help achieve this goal.§You will be part of making a difference to the lives of our tamariki and their whānau by utilising the latest strength-based practice tools and assessment framework. By engaging with tamariki and developing, managing and delivering plans it will ensure their voices are heard.§In this role you will be expected to operate in a supportive role in order to help achieve our goals and demonstrate our values as follows:§We put §Tamariki§ first§We believe §Aroha§ is vital§We respect the §Mana§ of people§We are §Tika§ and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga§ is a journey§You will be delivering high-level evidence based and quality social work services where you will be working in partnership with tamariki, their whanau, external agencies and communities to ensure a collaborative approach to improved outcomes.§This role requires a passion to actively work to keep tamariki at the centre of everything we do. It's more than a job, it's an opportunity to champion tamariki and their whanau with every decision you make.§Key attributes to be considered but not limited to, will include:§A recognised Social Work qualification by the Social Worker Registration Boar§Registration with New Zealand's Social Worker Registration Board§Demonstrated resilience, critical thinking and problem-solving techniques§Upholding the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and demonstrating this in practice§Having a good understanding of section 7(AA) of The Oranga Tamariki Act§Well-developed written and verbal communication skills§A valid and clean New Zealand driver's licence§What we are offering:§A competitive salary in line with Oranga Tamariki's remuneration range, between $55,000 - $100,000§Commitment to the highest standards of strengths-based social work practice§On-going professional development§Access to corporate health fund discounts and a banking package with Westpac§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV, cover letter, copy of your social worker qualification and SWRB details. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal.§If you have any questions about the role, please email Andrew Louis at §andrew.louis@ot.govt.nz§Application closes Tuesday, 22 September 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50701100.txt	§Administration Support Customer Information Requests - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Support Customer Information Requests - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Administration Support – Customer Information Requests – Fixed Term Contract – Palmerston North§About us | Mō mātou §Oranga Tamariki—Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values: §•We put Tamariki first§•We believe Aroha is vital§•We respect the Mana of people§•We are Tika and Pono§ •We value Whakapapa§•We recognise that Oranga is a journey §About the role | Mō te tūnga  §We currently have a fixed term role for an experienced Team Administrator to support our Customer Information Requests team in Palmerston North. In this a busy and varied role, you will assist with the day to day tasks associated with the administration functions for the site. §This is a fixed term contract opportunity based in Palmerston North through to June 30, 2021. Initially you will be working from home, so it is important that you have a space in your house where you can complete confidential work, we will provide all the equipment and training you need. Once we have our office/hub set up in Palmerston North your work will change to a mix of some home days and some days based in an office with your team.§ §Why apply for this role:§  §•We offer a collaborative and innovative culture where our people thrive to adhere to best practice while constantly challenging the status quo making each workday interesting. § •We offer comprehensive training, development opportunities and potential for internal career progression.§About you | Mōu §If you have strong organisational skills and good attention to detail, we want to speak with you! We are looking for candidates with: §•Proven experience in office administration and customer service§•Strong relationship building skills and experience dealing with members of the public§•Well-developed written and verbal communication skills§•Effective organisation, planning and time management skills§•Ability to work well as part of a team, use your initiative and a sense of humour!  §Click here to view the role description§§How to Apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§ Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Brigette Burton on §brigette.burton@ot.govt.nz§.§Position Description§ http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/pd-admin-support-july2019-pd.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You will also have experience in supporting staff and have skills in collaborative planning for clients with complex needs and developing service provision based on a strengths model.§          §Comcare’s Community Integration Service (CIS) finds positive, creative solutions for people who are perceived by others, or view themselves to be ‘stuck’ in hospital or residential services, when clinically they do not require that level of care.§          §The service works with people who have complex social or other issues that create barriers for successful community living and supports them to problem-solve a pathway forward to independent living.§          §Comcare provides a supportive and positive team culture that is committed to the ongoing development of its workforce and we would welcome you to be part of our team. §          § §          §“Ko te whakaora, he hīkoi whakāmarama. You will also have experience in supporting staff and have skills in collaborative planning for clients with complex needs and developing service provision based on a strengths model.§ §Comcare’s Community Integration Service (CIS) finds positive, creative solutions for people who are perceived by others, or view themselves to be ‘stuck’ in hospital or residential services, when clinically they do not require that level of care.§ §The service works with people who have complex social or other issues that create barriers for successful community living and supports them to problem-solve a pathway forward to independent living.§ §Comcare provides a supportive and positive team culture that is committed to the ongoing development of its workforce and we would welcome you to be part of our team. § § § §“Ko te whakaora, he hīkoi whakāmarama. jobText: TXT/50703282.txt	§Social impact Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social impact Manager§§Advertiser: §The Cause Collective§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§$110,000 - $119,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Are you 100% committed to teamwork making the dream work and providing coaching and leadership support to those around you?§  §Do you like telling stories using qualitative and quantitative data and have an analytical eye for detail?§  §Do you like to experiment with innovation, and can you pivot at the drop of a hat? §  §Are you looking to make a significant difference with the gifts and talents you have?§  §Are you interested in being part of a social change movement?§  §We are looking for an experienced Social Impact Manager to join our team§  § §  §The Cause Collective is looking for a Social Impact Manager who can lead a team to confidently work on a range of different initiatives across the organisation. The right person for this job will have a passion for storytelling using numbers and people’s stories.  They will be highly motivated to make a difference and to try innovative techniques that support real time insights to drive practice and influence decision making.§  §We are looking for someone who understands the lived experiences of Pacific peoples and South Auckland communities.  Successful candidates will have excellent written and verbal communication skills and will be comfortable with complex problem solving and working in interdisciplinary teams. §  §The Social Impact Manager is responsible for overseeing the development and delivery of funder reporting, case studies, publications, insights, and analytics reports.  This position will lead, coach, and inspire a team of up to five people.  The ideal candidate will love a fast-paced work environment, have a can-do attitude, be purpose-driven, have a hunger to learn, be highly organised, and be comfortable working in innovation teams.§  §To express your interest in finding out more about this role, please contact: §info@thecausecollective.org.nz§ quoting vacancy number IESIM-008§  §Closing date:§ 5:00pm 26 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50684539.txt	§Community Initiatives Manager Regional Partnerships§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Initiatives Manager Regional Partnerships§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§ § §Thriving Pacific community reach and engagement§ §Connecting with Pacific communities and working across government to lead and support the administration of planning, monitoring and developing agreements§ §Empowering and enabling successful Covid-19 Recovery Pacific community-led initiatives and projects§ § Reporting to the Regional Director your primary focus will be to engage across Pacific communities to administer community funding.  Working collaboratively with communities and partner agencies, you will collectively lead the development and maintenance of delivery agreements with Pacific grassroots, emerging and growth initiatives, in partnership with Pacific community leaders, groups, NGOs, Trusts and agencies across your region.§  § §Our Lalanga Fou and Values§  § § The Ministry for Pacific People make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples. We have a key role in developing cross government collaboration and coordination of government’s Pacific investments.§ § §What you will do in this role is:§ § §work with Pacific communities to better understand their requirements and what support can be enabled through funding to ensure better outcomes.§ §partner with providers, community leaders and their groups, NGO’s and Trusts to navigate the development and maintenance of agreements where funding can enable our Lalanga Fou goals.§ §work with community groups and providers to ensure delivery of future focused initiatives-influencing growth and relationships of partnerships.§ §a project mindset that ensures the planning of funding can be monitored and tracked against performance measurements to demonstrate successful outcomes.§ §provide guidance and advice on how best to support and implement successful and sustainable initiatives direction and how to best implement sustainable agreements.§ §opportunities across the region for new initiatives that focus to the future for our Pacific communities – influencing growth and relationships of partnerships.§ § §To be successful in this role you will bring:§ § §a passion for change and better social outcomes to our Pacific communities – understanding how to engage and partner appropriately.§ §commercial experience in how to develop and manage agreements that are funded, and performance based – ensuring that planning and measurements are tracked and reported.§ §solid local network connections across community groups, NGO’s, social service providers, and local government agencies that enable collaboration and focus towards better outcomes for Pacific People.§ §Excellent written communication and verbal skills, with the ability to confidently communicate with a variety of audiences.§ § §Working for us§ § § At Ministry for Pacific People, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, healthcare insurance, flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we recognise that diversity, inclusion, and accessibility is important to our business. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation for our Pacific People and achieve our Lalanga Fou goals. Our culture enables us to create an environment of involvement, respect, and connection with the communities where we work - benefitting individual employees and our Pacific People across New Zealand§  § If you would like more information please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject.  Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required. §  § §Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020§. § If you would like a copy of the position description please click on the link below.§ https://www.mpp.govt.nz/assets/Uploads/Community-Initiatives-Manager-Sept-2020.pdf§  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50662326.txt	§Contract Researcher/Interviewer - NZ Crime and Victims Survey§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contract Researcher/Interviewer - NZ Crime and Victims Survey§§Advertiser: §CBG Health Research§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§Paid on completed surveys plus travel and mileage.§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Contract Researcher/Interviewer - NZ Crime and Victims Survey §      §        §§        §CBG Research provides high quality independent research to managers and policy makers. We are looking for a great people-person to join our industry-leading team of interviewers delivering the New Zealand Crime and Victims Survey. This survey is the only reliable way for the Ministry of Justice to understand the full picture of victimisation in New Zealand as not all crimes are reported to the Police. §        §This is your chance for flexible and rewarding work that influences decisions on how resources are allocated and used. §        §If you want ongoing work as a self-employed interviewer and don't want an office-based, 9-5 role, read on....§        §What we are looking for§        §          §You may be ex-police, have worked with victims of crime or a background dealing with people face to face, for example teaching, direct sales or previous experience in conducting surveys.§          §You can manage your time to meet targets, and love working out in the community.§          §You are confident using IT to deliver the surveys and stay in touch.§          §You can engage with the broad range of people you will be meeting and quickly build their trust.§          §You are available for at least 20 hours a week including regular evenings and weekends.§          §You have your own reliable transport.§          §You understand the importance of the surveys and have a genuine interest in the survey you will be delivering.§        §        §Benefits§        §          §Work as a contractor meeting different people every day and enjoying independence and flexibility in the hours you work. §          §Excellent earning potential.§          §Be provided with equipment, comprehensive training including important health and safety procedures in a COVID-19 environment, and ongoing support from the very best in the business. §          §Join a fun team of expert interviewers, many of whom have been with us for years because of the flexible and rewarding work.§          §Work for an ethical and reputable organisation who are respected industry leaders.§        §        §How to apply§        §Don't miss the opportunity to be part of our great team - apply now via Seek. For further information and a no-obligation chat contact §0800 478 783§ or email  recruitment@cbg.co.nz or visit our website www.cbg.co.nz§        §You can find out more about this survey at https://www.justice.govt.nz/justice-sector-policy/research-data/nzcvs/§        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§CBG Research provides high quality independent research to managers and policy makers. We are looking for a great people-person to join our industry-leading team of interviewers delivering the New Zealand Crime and Victims Survey. This survey is the only reliable way for the Ministry of Justice to understand the full picture of victimisation in New Zealand as not all crimes are reported to the Police. § §This is your chance for flexible and rewarding work that influences decisions on how resources are allocated and used. § §If you want ongoing work as a self-employed interviewer and don't want an office-based, 9-5 role, read on....§ §What we are looking for§ § §You may be ex-police, have worked with victims of crime or a background dealing with people face to face, for example teaching, direct sales or previous experience in conducting surveys.§ §You can manage your time to meet targets, and love working out in the community.§ §You are confident using IT to deliver the surveys and stay in touch.§ §You can engage with the broad range of people you will be meeting and quickly build their trust.§ §You are available for at least 20 hours a week including regular evenings and weekends.§ §You have your own reliable transport.§ §You understand the importance of the surveys and have a genuine interest in the survey you will be delivering.§ §Benefits§ § §Work as a contractor meeting different people every day and enjoying independence and flexibility in the hours you work. § §Excellent earning potential.§ §Be provided with equipment, comprehensive training including important health and safety procedures in a COVID-19 environment, and ongoing support from the very best in the business. § §Join a fun team of expert interviewers, many of whom have been with us for years because of the flexible and rewarding work.§ §Work for an ethical and reputable organisation who are respected industry leaders.§ §How to apply§ §Don't miss the opportunity to be part of our great team - apply now via Seek. For further information and a no-obligation chat contact §0800 478 783§ or email  recruitment@cbg.co.nz or visit our website www.cbg.co.nz§ §You can find out more about this survey at https://www.justice.govt.nz/justice-sector-policy/research-data/nzcvs/§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§How many hours are you available to work per week?§Do you have experience conducting surveys or interviews face to face?§If successful, when could you start work?§§§

jobText: TXT/50664143.txt	§Young Worker Advocate (Fixed-Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Young Worker Advocate (Fixed-Term)§§Advertiser: §Young Workers Resource Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$22.10 - $26.72 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Are you interested in supporting young workers to have positive work experiences and achieve employment justice? §  §We’re looking for an advocate to join our passionate team of activists and educators in our Hamilton office. This is a fixed-term position (0.8 FTE - 32 hours p/w) until July 2021, as the funding is tied to the MBIE Workers and Workers Assistance Fund. We will be seeking additional funding to extend this role if possible.§  §As part of our help centre, the successful candidate will be responsible for providing advocacy and representation to young workers facing employment issues. The goal for this position is to increase access to employment justice for young workers. Our help centre is a new initiative in that we have received funding to expand the scope and breadth of our existing support services offered to young workers. §  §The successful candidate will have an innate sense of justice and fairness, be passionate in fighting for the rights of young workers and will be confident in employment relations arenas where conflict may arise. They will be able to self-manage and also work co-operatively and will have excellent communication skills. The following attributes are desirable:§ § §Passion for supporting young people.§ §Strong understanding of employment legislation.§ §Experience providing advocacy to workers during formal employment relations processes (e.g. disciplinary processes, mediations).§ §Experience providing support and representation to workers experiencing mistreatment in the (e.g. workplace bullying, sexual harassment, discrimination)§ §Well-developed written and oral communication skills, and computer skills.§ §Ability to work autonomously, off-site, and with self-management and prioritising skills.§ §Ability to work collaboratively in a small close-knit team.§ §Well-developed interpersonal skills; ability to relate to people from diverse backgrounds.§ §Cultural competency and an understanding of the Treaty of Waitangi.§ §Young Workers Resource Centre (YWRC) is a not-for-profit organisation that provides employment relations education and advocacy to young people aged 15-35. YWRC is committed to our vision of “a fair and just future for every one” and we aim to realise this by empowering young people with their employment rights and providing access to employment justice.§  §This is an exciting opportunity for a positive, enthusiastic, and politically aware person to join a passionate and progressive community organisation. In your covering letter let us know how you will successfully apply your skills, experience, and attributes to this role.§  §Applications must be received via email by 5pm on Wednesday 21 October 2020, and must include both a cover letter and CV. It is provisionally intended that interviews for this position will take place on Tuesday 27 October 2020. Applications should be addressed to:§  §Tony Stevens§YWRC§34 Harwood St§HAMILTON§  §Any queries about this position or to requests for a full position description may be sought from Tony Stevens by emailing §admin@ywrc.org.nz§ or calling §07 834 7122§.§§§§
