Our approach is based on an understanding of each individual’s disability, needs and potential for future growth.§ §T§he Opportunity: §What This Role’s All About§ §We are looking for energetic and empathetic people to work alongside people with intellectual disability focussing on creating a life of rich and diverse experiences while being able to read situations, problem solve and apply boundaries or offer space.  Daily tasks include supporting with daily routines while encouraging independence to develop skills and personal growth. jobText: TXT/50680567.txt	§Local Area Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Local Area Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Access Ability Charitable Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§About the business §  §At Journey Together we are committed to working with disabled people and their families/whānau to identify what would enable them to live everyday lives in their community. Our inspirational dream is “A community approach where disabled people live well now, can dream big and live the life they have imagined.” § §  §About the role §  §We are currently looking for someone to join our team in a part-time position. (30 hours per week).  §This role will be based in (The Western Bays) Tauranga Region.  § §  §What does a Local Area Coordinator do?§ §  §Local Area Coordinators are agents of change. The main function of a LAC is to assist disabled persons and their family/whānau to identify and articulate what their good life would look like and then engage a range of strategies to assist them to move towards and obtain that good life.  §  §LAC work intensively with a small group of disabled people and their families/whānau. They assist people to plan for the future by becoming clear on what constitutes their good life, supporting people to access the elements that make up their good life (home, work, friends etc.), maximise any community or disability specific funding, develop natural relationships, strengthen and build social roles and the networks that will enable people to lead full and rich lives.  §  §The role of LAC is exciting and rewarding on many levels, not the least of which is being involved in supporting people to achieve tangible outcomes and make measurable improvements. It is also a challenging role that requires people to work at multiple levels, with a wide variety of people and against the invisible forces of discrimination and bias.  § §  §Benefits and perks § § § §Being part of a team where people are passionate about our inspirational dream §  § § §Flexibility regarding hours of work §  § § §The chance to work autonomously in a self-directed manner §  § § §Extensive training, mentoring and support  §  § § §Health and Wellness Subsidy §  § § §Staff Benefit Discount Card §  § § §Employee Assistance Programme §  § §Journey Together is an Equal Opportunities Employer and strives to attract and maintain a diverse workforce. We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity. We would like to encourage applications from people with a lived experience of disability. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process. §  § §  §If you would like to see a job description, please visit our website www.journeytogether.co.nz/jobs. §  §To apply upload your CV and cover letter through Seek.  §  §The closing date for applications is Monday 19th of October at 9am.§  §If you have any questions about this role, please contact either, Angela Te Whaiti on §0274 934 608§email angela.tewhaiti@accessability.org.nz or; §Wendy O’Meara on 027 555 0459 email wendy@journeytogether.co.nz §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Social Connections (Community Development) Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670770.txt	§Social Connections (Community Development) Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Connections (Community Development) Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Age Concern Auckland Inc.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Social Connections (Community Development) Coordinator§  §About Age Concern Auckland§  §Age Concern Auckland operates to meet the needs of people aged 65+ across Auckland region. We are committed to promoting wellbeing, rights, respect, and dignity for older people. Our vision is that older people live a valued life in an inclusive society.§  §Age Concern Auckland is a registered charity, we are part of a nationwide network of 33 Age Concerns.§  §The Team§  §Our Social Connections services provide support for lonely and isolated older adults. Around 20% of those over 65 experience prolonged and severe levels of loneliness and isolation, which can have detrimental effects on their wellbeing, mentally, psychologically, and physically. The Social Connections team provide services and supports that aim to address these issues and support older adults to access opportunities for participation and engagement within their community, these include the Accredited Visiting Service, Total Mobility Scheme, Community Mobilisation and other social activities.§  §We have a full-time (40 hours per week) opportunity based in our Counties Manukau office for an enthusiastic Social Connections Coordinator. This role provides Social Connections support to older adults across the Counties Manukau area.§  §Key Responsibilities§ § §Help coordinate the Accredited Visiting Service (AVS) and other Social Connections activities that promote community engagement for older adults.§ §Identify social engagement opportunities for older people.§ §Work alongside the older person, their family, or carers, to engage and participate in their local communities.§ §Recruit, develop and manage volunteers who can directly engage with and/or are willing to facilitate access for older people to engage with community activities.§ §Provide support to older adults to participate in community events and activities.§ §Develop and maintain mutually beneficial working relationships with agencies, professionals, people in the community, peers, and national advisors.§ §To succeed in this opportunity, you will have§ § §Experience in working in not-for-profit and working with older adults§ §Initiative to solve problems and challenges you may encounter.§ §Ability to work with people from a wide range of backgrounds/cultures.§ §Calm professional demeanour and ability to multi-task.§ §Ability to take a role in planning, developing, and implementing services.§ §Ability to assess information and apply in a relevant manner, seeking clarification where appropriate.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and proficiency in Microsoft Office§ §Full, clean drive licence and a NZ Citizen or Permanent Resident.§ §We offer a thorough induction, training and ongoing professional development opportunities, and a supportive and tight-knit team environment. If you are interested in this role, please apply with your CV and Cover Letter via Seek before 21st October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected hourly rate?§§§

jobText: TXT/50657674.txt	§Youth Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Youth Worker§§Advertiser: §Youth Horizons Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$42,000 - $50,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Youth Worker| Youth Support Worker - Hamilton based role§Is this you?§If you are a mature and confident person with a heart for our vulnerable youth and want to work with an amazing, supportive organisation, then keep reading! If you believe you have the following qualities, then you could be who we are looking for. We need someone with:§High level of resilience.§Pro-active planning, fostering and embracing the mana and tikanga of our whare.§Creative flare and a passion for the arts (recommended but not required).§Have a strong sense of family values.§Passion helping young people strengthen and build on their character and develop sustainable life skills.§You may have worked in residential services, led youth programmes, managed sports teams, led mentorship programs or provided leadership to young boys in a relevant setting.§ If you are a confident and empathetic person who can support boys with complex and challenging behaviours, we are looking for you!§What you will do§You will be part of our dedicated therapeutic residential service team in Hamilton and will build strong relationships with peers and stakeholders. Through the application of the Teaching Family Model (training will be provided) you will help young people reach their potential and equip them with the skills they need to be successful at school and within the wider community.§You will also:§Assist with the day to day running of the home and basic house administration§Carry out sleepovers in the home as needed (allowance will be paid)§Valuing diversity through our commitment to our bi-cultural journey is important in this role. You will have a genuine appreciation for how we integrate Māori and Pasifika kaupapa into our daily working life.§What you need:§You must have a full and clean New Zealand driver's licence and must be able to obtain a clear Ministry of Social Development (MSD) and Police vetting check. Ideally you have or are working towards your Social Work or other relevant qualification and have a long-term career inspiration to work in the industry.§This is a permanent role (32 hours plus sleepovers).§What Youth Horizons offers§Fun-loving whanau/family environment.§Career progression opportunities across a national organisation.§Outstanding training in the Teaching Family Model (TFM) and supervision including cultural support and development.§24/7 senior leadership support.§Competitive remuneration to match your skills and experience.§Paid birthday leave.§About Youth Horizons§Youth Horizons is a specialised non-profit organisation providing therapeutic services for young people who have complex behaviour and/or mental health needs. Our innovative approach combines evidence-based models of practice along with a focus on our core values of Manaakitanga, Wairuatanga, Aroha and Whanaungatanga.§ To find out more about Youth Horizons, visit www.youthorizons.org.nz§It's an exciting time to join us and you will have the opportunity to make a real impact through your work- so apply now! Please note the official title of the role is TFM Practitioner.§Closing date for applications is §20 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50637126.txt	§Navigator - Children's Worker (school based)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Navigator - Children's Worker (school based)§§Advertiser: §I Have a Dream Charitable Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Salary§§$50,000 - $54,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§We are looking for highly passionate people for Navigator roles at I Have a Dream, working out of our partner schools (within the Tikipunga/Otangarei communities of Whangarei) commencing in February 2021.  We have mixed roles available (1 fixed term maternity relief position, and 2 full time positions)§  §We work with Kiwi kids for 15 years, from their first years at school until they move on to tertiary study or employment. We provide wraparound services and do whatever it takes to keep each of our kids (Dreamers) on track – because we know that giving kids access to the support and resources they need will lead to academic and life success.§  §The successful applicant will work alongside their students, connecting the dots between student/family/school/community/business/service providers. You will take personal responsibility around each student's education and social needs to ensure students achieve educational, career and life success.§  §Working as a Navigator, you will be responsible for:§ § § §Delivering programmes for young people, mentoring, guidance, goal setting and academic interventions§  § § §Coordination, monitoring, tracking, and in-depth collaboration with our organisational partners§  § § §Building close and trusting relationships§  § § §Maintain database and records to enable effective monitoring and reporting§  § §You will bring to the role:§ § § §An aspirational view for all young people§  § § §Understanding of at-risk populations and different cultures – especially Maori / Pasifika§  § § §A background and/or qualification in education, social work, human resources, youth work or a related field§  § § §Excellent communication and networking skills that will enable you to engage with stakeholders and to build strong relationships§  § § §Organisation, passion, a team player attitude, empathy, and an open mind§  § §We will provide:§ § § §Competitive salary§  § § §A friendly and exciting work environment§  § § §Meaningful and valued work§  § § §Personal development§  § §This is a wonderful opportunity to make a real difference to people's lives and to improve our community. §  §If you feel that you have the skills for this position then please apply via the link.  Any queries can be made to Lesley at §lesley@ihaveadream.org.nz§  §Applications close Friday 23rd October.§  §Start Date will be the 1st February 2021§  §Applicants for this role must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§  §You can view a full copy of the job description here (copy and paste into your browser):§  § https://ihaveadream.org.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/I-Have-a-Dream-Navigator-Job-Description-1.pdf§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657271.txt	§Youth Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Youth Worker§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Summary§We have an exciting opportunity for someone to join our expanding ‘Real’ community-based youth service in Hamilton. The ideal person will have experience in mentoring and working with complex youth and can demonstrate ability and cultural competence in working with Maori.§The role is 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday, 8.30am - 5.00pm§The Role§As a Youth Worker, you'll apply your skills, creative ideas and expertise to work collaboratively with team members and partner agencies to get the best outcome for taiohi using our services and their families and whanau.§ §You will support young people in the community to develop life skills and resilience, provide support with practical problem solving and daily life skills, supporting community connection and liaising with family/whānau and other providers.§You will be working in collaboration with social and education sectors, community spaces, schools, government organisations including DHB and Oranga Tamariki, non-government health organisations and community health and social services, clinical and support staff, mental health services, primary health providers & GP’s.§You will have:§The New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (NZCHW) or a recognised equivalent or be prepared to study towards this qualification or a recognised equivalent.§An understanding of trauma-informed care and experience in support work, preferably with young people.§A current full New Zealand driver’s licence.§hold a current New Zealand first aid certificate or be prepared to obtain one.§You will be:§A great listener, the sort of person who will listen to the people who use our services.§A fresh thinker, using curiosity and imagination to generate new ideas.§Inspiring others with enthusiasm and a take action approach.§Passionate about mentoring and supporting young people to build confidence, resilience and wellbeing.§You will have a knowledge and understanding of Te Ao Māori, preferably with Te Reo Māori and Tikanga.§Real§Our spirit is ‘loving life’ - that’s what we do and what we help young people do§We provide health and wellbeing services in the community to people aged between 14 and 22. We believe in the importance of community, connection and relationships - and in the ability of young people to shape their own futures.§Find out more about Real at www.real.org.nz§The Team and Service§Our expanding team is be made up of motivated people who live and breathe our purpose, make ordinary things extraordinary and spend their days going above and beyond to help young people to realize their potential.§The Benefits§In this role you can look forward to extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a supportive working environment where you will develop and grow your skill set. All of this while ensuring you are prioritising your wellbeing and having fun.§Ready to take a closer look at Real? Then apply now.§Closing Date:§ Wednesday 14 October. §Please note, this advert may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found.§Position Description:§ https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Real-YW-Waikato-Mobile-2020.pdf§Contact:§ Tracy Eccleston, Service and Relationship Manager, 027 223 2541§Real is supported by Pathways Health Limited, part of the Wise Group. Pathways are committed to healthy lifestyles and actively support a smoke-free environment.§**All new appointees into Pathways require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50695358.txt	§Tenancy Advisors§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tenancy Advisors§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§The City Housing team provides rental housing to low income families or individuals whose needs are not met by the private sector housing market. The team is Council's social housing provider, one of New Zealand's largest landlords and also a lead player in the Council's vision of "All Wellingtonians Well Housed."§We're looking for Tenancy Advisors with amazing customer service and relationship management skills who want to make a difference in the community. Our tenants come from a wide range of backgrounds and some have complex needs. Our focus is on helping them to sustain their tenancy and providing a safe and stable housing environment that allows them to achieve their goals.§No two days are the same for a Tenancy Advisor and you'll need to manage your time well to balance a range of priorities. A single day could include activities as broad as signing up a new tenant, meeting your tenants at their home, representing City Housing at the Tenancy Tribunal and working with tenant volunteers to lead and run activities and events in our community spaces.§This role will suit you if you are;§A positive, respectful and cooperative team member§Proactive in providing exceptional customer service to a diverse range of tenants§Able to build strong relationships with a range of community agencies and support services§Enthusiastic about innovation and problem solving§Flexible, well organised and accurate§Reliable, resilient and enjoy trying new things§Agile and prepared to pitch in to get the job done§In return this is an opportunity for you to join a diverse and talented group of people! We put people at the heart of everything we do. We also offer;§5 weeks annual leave after 2 years of continuous service for permanent staff§Family leave provisions and a generously subsidised kid's school holiday programme§Hit apply now to make an application online and/or to view the position description. All applications must be submitted online. For more information, please feel free to contact David Ensor, Operations Manager, at §david.ensor@wcc.govt.nz§.§Applications will close §21 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Probation Officer - Dunedin Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684310.txt	§Probation Officer - Dunedin§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Probation Officer - Dunedin§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§56,646 - 59,838§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§About the role | Mō te tūnga§As an pihana Matakana (Probation Officer) for Ara Poutama Aotearoa, you will work with people in our care and their whnau to address criminogenic behaviours and reduce reoffending. Using principles of manaaki, kaitiaki, wairua, rangatira, and whanau, you will manage community-based sentences and orders, whilst also preparing reports for the Courts and New Zealand Parole Board.§You will contribute to public safety, viewing this through the lens of manaaki, positive relationships, and the uplifting of wellbeing of people in our care. By focusing on the wellbeing of the person who has come into our care and management, you will help reduce the chances of them returning to the justice system. You will treat those in our care and management with respect, upholding their mana and dignity.§About you | Mōu§We are looking for people who:§§are able to relate to people from a range of cultures and backgrounds§have excellent spoken and written communication skills§can work in a team and motivate others§can remain positive and resilient in difficult situations§are able to think critically and assess information.§§You'll also need Full New Zealand Drivers Licence and a legal right to work in Aotearoa without restriction for a minimum of 24 months.§If you have worked with large caseloads before then this is a distinct advantage.§Being a Probation Officer is an incredibly exciting opportunity to make a real difference in your community. You'll have the chance to connect with people, build strong relationships, and do something which really makes a difference and improves public safety.§This position is 40 hours per week and will be either a Monday - Friday §or §Tuesday - Saturday work profile.§§Mō mātou | §About us§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential.  Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities. §If you are currently a Probation Officer looking to move to Dunedin then there is no need to apply. Simply §fill in the Transfer Expression of Interest§ on Tatou. §Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role.  §It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50686404.txt	§Principal Advisor - Community Engagements§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor - Community Engagements§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§ § §Connecting community engagement to revitalisation of Pacific Languages§ §Passion and linguistic experience to establish relationships with client agencies and community groups§ §Community-based language initiatives and programmes§ § As a seasoned and experienced Principal Advisor, ideally working with Languages and within communities you will provide support and leadership to the languages unit and to deliver high quality, robust community engagement relating to the delivery of language revitalisation.§  § §Our purpose §  § The Ministry for Pacific People make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples. We have a key role in developing cross government collaboration and coordination of government’s Pacific investments.§  § §What you will do in this role is:§ § §Identify opportunities for the introduction or revitalisation of Pacific languages within communities and organisations with a view to incorporate into work programmes.§ §Establishing strong relationships with client agencies, community groups and organisations to influence acceptance and incorporate language revitalisation programmes both locally and internationally.§ §Supporting the delivery of community-based language initiatives and programmes, including reviewing these to ensure alignment with the overall work programme and goals and best evidence and practice on language revitalisation and maintenance.§ §Working with the Manager and Director, Languages to ensure that the Ministry provides professional leadership and direction on languages revitalisation across the sector and in communities.§ §Ensuring the languages programmes incorporate design that meets the needs of agency and/or community culture, values, and operating models.§ §Remaining aware of all elements of the work programme to ensure that the programme enables the establishment and maintenance of technical conventions of Pacific languages.§ §Leading the development of language revitalisation frameworks, templates, and how-to-guides, including for the use of partner agencies, groups, and organisations.§ §Leading and managing the complex operational aspects of the languages work programme that contributes to the strategic language revitalisation projects and priorities.§ § §To be successful in this role you will bring:§ § §Linguistic background and solid experience in languages ideally within an Education background§ §Sound network across government, and across Education sector that enables collaboration and focus on better outcomes for Pacific People around language revitalisation.§ §Excellent written communication and verbal skills, with the ability to confidently communicate with a variety of audiences.§ §Good understanding of the machinery of government and how to navigate it.§ §Strong stakeholder engagement skills and the ability to engage with different audiences.§ §  § §Working for us§  § At Ministry for Pacific People, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, healthcare insurance, flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § At Ministry for Pacific People, we recognise that diversity, inclusion, and accessibility is important to our business. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation for our Pacific People and achieve our Lalanga Fou goals. Our culture enables us to create an environment of involvement, respect, and connection with the communities where we work - benefitting individual employees and our Pacific People across New Zealand§  § If you would like more information or a copy of the position description, please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject.  Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required. §  § §Applications close on Sunday 25 October 2020.  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Youth Worker Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50674145.txt	§Youth Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Youth Worker§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children currently have a Youth Worker opportunity based at our Canterbury Site - a team who is passionate for getting things right for tamariki, rangatahi and the community.§At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, our goal is to establish a multiagency approach to protecting and caring for New Zealand's tamariki and rangatahi. We aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki §first§We believe §Aroha §is vital§We respect the §Mana §of people§We are §Tika §and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga §is a journey§As a Youth Worker, you will be engaging with and providing professional support to our tamariki and rangatahi. You will be assisting in the facilitation of care and support to our tamariki and rangatahi through demonstrating positive behaviours and acknowledging personal influence on the life of our youth.§You will also be working with a collaborative team who is passionate about Oranga Tamariki's vision, purpose and values. You will also be providing and working in partnership with our Social Workers, Supervisors and support team. This role will also see you playing a part in building positive cultural and community connection, self-development and finally Education, Training and Employment focus.§Engaging with whānau and other stakeholders will be part of your role where you will initiate and advocate on behalf of young people. You will also be sharing your experiences with our tamariki and rangatahi and guiding them to achieve their best potential.§To be successful in this position, you will need to portray a strong professional ethics and a holistic approach that is client-centred and strengths-based. You will display a caring, friendly demeanour and be a real team player with an open-minded approach. You will also need to have a real passion and dedication to all aspects of service deliveries and the ability to build positive relationships with our tamariki and rangatahi.§If you are dedicated to being part of this positive change, we would like to hear from you!§What's on offer?§On-going career and professional development§Access to corporate health fund discounts and a banking package§A challenging, fascinating and rewarding position within a team committed to the highest standards of work§How to apply?§If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee, please apply through your myHR portal.§All external applicants including §Ministry of Social Development §employees, please apply through the apply button and upload a copy of your CV and cover letter.§If you have any further questions regarding the role, please contact Andrew Louis at §andrew.louis@ot.govt.nz§Applications closes Friday, 16 October 2020.§Position description§https://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/youth-worker-site-ot.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50705099.txt	§Lead Systems Innovator - Workplace§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Systems Innovator - Workplace§§Advertiser: §The Cause Collective§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§$80,000 - $89,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§Are you interested in being part of a social change movement in South Auckland workplaces that aims to strengthen wellbeing and prevent workplace injuries?§ §Do you have a comprehensive understanding of the lived experiences of South Auckland communities?§ §Would you be confident in managing design challenge teams to create evidence informed prototypes that are focused on creating small changes with big impacts?§ §We are looking for a Lead Systems Innovator (Workplace) to join our team§ §The Cause Collective is looking for a Lead Systems Innovator – Workplace who can join the team to confidently work on a range of different initiatives that will strengthen workplace wellbeing and prevent injuries, with a focus on Pacific peoples, Māori and migrant populations. The right person for this job will be interested in business systems and improving worker engagement and wellbeing.  They will be highly motivated to make a difference and to try innovative techniques that support real time insights gathering to drive health and safety practice.§ §We are looking for someone who understands the lived experiences of South Auckland communities.  Successful candidates will have excellent written and verbal communication skills and will be comfortable with complex problem solving and working in interdisciplinary teams. § §The Lead Systems Innovator – Workplace is responsible for funder reporting, implementing design challenges, writing up case studies, convening worker groups, supporting systems business community of practice thought leadership discussions.  The ideal candidate will love a fast-paced work environment, have a can-do attitude, be purpose-driven, have a hunger to learn, be highly organised, and be comfortable working in innovation teams.§ §To express your interest in finding out more about this role, please contact: §info@thecausecollective.org.nz§ quoting reference PLSI-011§§§§

jobText: TXT/50614725.txt	§Community Facilitator§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Facilitator§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§ § §The Organisation§ §ConneXu is a highly reputable charitable trust offering support to individuals with a disability. We strive to be innovative in the way we support people and to facilitate a good life for them. We are committed to empowering people to become active members of their community and we believe it is through this inclusiveness that our community will be strengthened.  Join our team as we launch into an exciting stage of growth, expanding these support services into the Bay of Plenty and the wider Waikato area.   § §The Role§ §As a Community Facilitator you will be trained to work within a number of diverse teams to be innovative to support and collaborate with the people we support, their family/whanau and others in their lives.  This enables individuals to live as independently as possible, and to access their communities for activities and opportunities that are meaningful to them. A critical component of the Community Facilitator role is the ability to work within different teams to support the implementation of an individual’s plans and goals, and to ensure that supports meet their needs.§ §The Person§ §We are looking for people who are flexible, able to work weekends, evenings, sleepovers and on changing rosters.  You will also have a passion for working in a team environment and in partnership with others. Ideally you will have some experience working with individuals who have an intellectual disability, autism or challenging behaviour, however, we are also open to talking to people who have a commitment to community and a willingness to learn and be challenged.  You will need a full New Zealand driver’s license, first aid certificate and be prepared to work flexible hours.  Computer literacy, attention to detail and the ability to work with others is essential, together with being creative and open to new ideas.If you are interested in a challenging and diverse role, have a passion for people and want to work in an environment where you will be developed, then we would love to hear from you.§ §Please send a CV and covering letter to §careers@connexu.nz§ § § § § § §     § §         § § § § § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50690204.txt	§Support Workers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Workers§§Advertiser: §VisionWest Community Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§ § §About us§VisionWest Home HealthCare is an established provider and has over 20 years’ experience providing quality, professional home help support to people, enabling them to live independently within their own homes. Our clients include people of all ages, with varying needs - from a young person living with a complex disability, to an older person requiring home help. We are currently looking for energetic, caring, committed and empathetic people to provide quality in-home care to our clients. VisionWest Home HealthCare has a Vision to see Transformed Lives, Healthy Communities. We provide support from 6.00 am to 9.30 pm 7 days a week and offer variable hours.  §The Role§Our Support Workers assist our clients to live as independently as possible with a range of different tasks: §  §Household tasks - cleaning, vacuuming, laundry etc §  §Meal preparation§  §Personal care - showering, toileting, dressing etc§  §Community living - shopping, exercise etc§  §Medication oversight - prompting/supervising clients with medication§  §Mobility assistance – assisting client’s mobility with walking frames, hoists etc.  §Why work for VisionWest Home Healthcare?§By joining us you will receive quality training, support and all the benefits of working for a well-established and caring organisation. We provide a career pathway for staff by supporting you to achieve a Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (NZQA qualifications), which are fully funded. §APPLY NOW! §Please phone §09 818 0737§ or email §hr@visionwest.org.nz§§ §You must have the right to work in New Zealand and a you will be required to undergo police vetting and additional checks in order to be considered for this position.§VisionWest Home Healthcare is a service of VisionWest Community Trust which is an award-winning, not-for-profit organisation with faith-based roots, that provides a range of services to communities in Auckland, Bay of Plenty, Waikato and Christchurch.§ §To find out more visit § §§§§

Takes an active approach to ensuring individuals and whānau are able to access the support and services they need to enhance their health and wellbeing, with a focus on returning to work.§  §Facilitate connections and provide support to individuals and whānau§  §Promote the coordination of support services across the sector in West Auckland§  §Establish opportunities for people and their whānau§Skills and Experience§  §3-5 years of community development experience§  §Relevant qualification in a social services sector, discipline or equivalent§  §An understanding of the functions and operations of Work and Income Community Link offices§  §Experience in facilitating community collaborations across multiple providers§  §An understanding of the importance of Kaupapa Māori in the practice of NGO’s working in the social service sector§Benefits§  §Work in West Auckland and avoid the commute §  §Work office hours to achieve a work-life balance§  §Be supported in your growth and development§§VisionWest Community Trust is an award-winning, not-for-profit organisation with faith-based roots, that provides a range of services to communities in Auckland, Bay of Plenty, Waikato and Christchurch.§Aroha (Compassion) §Manaakitanga (Holistic Care) §Mana (Dignity) §Whanaungatanga (Authentic Relationships)§A commitment to the vision, mission and values of VisionWest Community Trust is essential§ §for this position, see www.VisionWest.org.nz/about-us§If this role appeals to you, then please apply now!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Residential Youth Workers, Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684616.txt	§Residential Youth Workers, Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Residential Youth Workers, Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Epuni Care and Protection Residence, Lower Hutt§Our Residential Youth Workers have an important role to play. They provide care and support to the young people in our care and encourage and motivate them to make positive choices. This is a real opportunity to positively influence young people, help them grow and successfully transition back into the community.§This is not a 9 to 5 job, our young people require wrap around support from us which is why our Residential Youth Workers do rostered shifts as the facility provides 24-hours, 7-days per week coverage (including weekends and public holidays).§What you will bring?§A full, clean, valid driver's licence§Meet the Children's Act safety checking and our vetting requirements§New Zealand citizenship or residency§Resilience, initiative and a proactive approach with a positive outlook§Empathy, patience and ability to see past what someone may be struggling with§A tertiary education within psychology, social sciences, social work, sports, music, arts or teaching would be an advantage§Flexibility to work different shifts - mornings, evenings, weekends and public holidays§Experience working with rangatahi§Physically able to keep up with 10 teenagers§Sound judgement with the ability to manage risk and make tough decisions§Life experience and understanding of what rangatahi may be going through§Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to adapt to your audience§Understanding and confidence in tikanga Māori and te reo Māori would be a definite advantage§What you will do?§Coach rangatahi through our structured day and through all life necessities§Participate in physical activity with our young people by playing sports and taking part in gym activities§Support our rangatahi by helping them with their studies, teaching them life skills such as cooking, art, music and cultural programmes and mentor them to make positive life choices§Build rapport with rangatahi who have experienced trauma and assist with redirecting behaviour§Who are we?§Our tamariki and rangatahi deserve to feel safe, have their voices heard, and be surrounded by loving whānau. At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, we're on a journey to ensure that it happens. We are a leading social work practice that is child-centred, trauma-informed, and effective for all cultures. We are a Ministry with a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of everything we do and say.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. For further information, please contact §roxana.anderson@ot.govt.nz§Applications close on Sunday, 18 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Housing First Hawke's Bay Manager Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684956.txt	§Housing First Hawke's Bay Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Housing First Hawke's Bay Manager§§Advertiser: §Whatever It Takes Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Housing First Hawke’s Bay Manager §Whatever It Takes Trust (WIT) is dedicated to work in partnership with their clients, their whanau and community support networks to achieve quality delivery of support services in our community. WIT is leading a collaboration with Te Taiwhenua o Heretaunga to provide the Housing First Programme to Hawke’s Bay in Ahuriri and Heretaunga and require an exceptional manager to lead this service.§Housing First is an internationally recognised approach to working with homeless people, particularly the chronic homeless (people who have lived rough for twelve months or more).  It prioritises immediate access to Permanent Housing, recognising that it is easier for people to address their issues once they are housed.  It then provides support services necessary to address issues.§In working with the Housing First (HF) clients, services must be delivered according to the following principles and cultural values:§Immediate access to housing with no housing readiness conditions;§Consumer choice and self- determination;§A harm reduction and recovery orientation approach;§Individualised and person-driven supports; and§Social and community integration.§Rangatiratanga (self-determination);§Whānaungatanga (positive connections);§Manaakitanga (self-worth and empowerment).§The role:§This key role will be responsible for facilitating the frontline delivery of quality service to clients who are chronically homeless, providing housing and wrap around support services. You will be an integral part of the provision and on-going development of this service as well as supporting future growth plans and developing and maintaining effective relationships with key stakeholders associated with the service’s operations and those working in the homeless space. §What you’ll need to bring: §Excellent organisational skills with the ability to work to deadlines§Good interpersonal skills: ability to communicate to a diverse range of people§Experience in a similar role§A good understanding of the Treaty of Waitangi§A relevant tertiary qualification§An understanding of social housing provision§Experience of working in the community sector§What we offer:§Our organisation provides a working environment with opportunities for self-development and new challenges.  We are a team of professionals who are passionate about people, improving the quality of the lives of those in need of housing and our tenants. This is an opportunity to really make a difference in the Hawkes Bay community. §This is permenant full-time role.§A description is available from rachelwilliams@witservices.co.nz [link removed]. Applications should include a CV and covering letter responding to the skills and attributes required and submitted to rachelwilliams@witservices.co.nz [link removed].§Applications close October 16th at 5pm.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50696828.txt	§Manager - Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - Industries§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Strong people management skills essential§Courage and determination to succeed in a challenging and complex environment§Develop and drive strategic plans to deliver good business results§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a core part of New Zealand's Justice Sector and manages custodial and community-based sentences imposed by the Courts. Our vision is to improve public safety and reduce re-offending through strong leadership, capable staff, a safe working environment and effective partnerships.§ §Mō te tūnga | §About the role§§The Manager Industries is responsible for managing all offender employment activities on site and will support the Assistant Prison Director to embed working prisons into each prison site. Hawkes Bay Regional Prison operates a range of industry focused areas including, Horticulture, Apiculture, Forestry, Joinery, Timber Processing, Catering and Asset Maintenance.   Throughout all these areas and more, the goal is to provide valued training, education and industry relevant skills to those persons within our care. §This role will offer you the opportunity to showcase your capability; to demonstrate visible leadership; and to drive high performance through the motivation and encouragement of your team.§ §Ngā pūkenga me ngā wheako | Skills and experience§ §The key skills we are seeking are:§§Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate an effective team to share a common vision, purpose and to achieve strategic and operational goals. §Highly motivated to enable skill enhancement and qualification attainment for prisoners to obtain employment post release.§Demonstrated ability to manage conflict in a professional manner.§Strong communication and relationship management skills, including a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships with stakeholders (both internal and external).§§This role is challenging and diverse and requires the ability to work effectively with a wide range of individuals and groups.§ §§Mō mātou | §About us§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us and is our commitment to improving the oranga and safety of the people, whānau, and that of the communities we serve across the motu. §As a values-led organisation, we use the principles of rangatira (leadership), manaaki (respect), wairua (spirituality), kaitiaki (guardianship) and whānau (relationships) to shape how we work and deliver the outcomes in our strategy - Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5).§It is an exciting time to join us and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§ §Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role. §For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50703266.txt	§Support Workers - Motueka§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Workers - Motueka§§Advertiser: §IHC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Rest of Tasman§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§About IDEA Services§IDEA Services supports adults of all ages with intellectual disabilities to live in their own homes and enjoy life as part of their communities. We are New Zealand's largest provider of services to people with intellectual disabilities and their families. Our services are founded on IHC's utter commitment for people with intellectual disabilities to have a good life and to be valued contributors to and members of their own community.§IDEA Services is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the IHC Group which is made up of our charitable programmes and three wholly-owned subsidiaries, committed to supporting people with intellectual disabilities to lead satisfying lives in the community and to providing housing and tenancy services to people in need.§Here's your opportunity to teach people to grow and achieve greater independence, to live a healthy lifestyle, build and maintain relationships and make sure they learn other skills that support them to be part of their community.§Here are the must haves:§You must be someone with a desire to learn new skills and gain some qualifications while you work§You must be able to work across a 7 day a week 24/7 roster (including weekends, evenings and sleepovers)§You must have legal entitlement to live and work in New Zealand for at least 10 months§You must have your Full NZ drivers licence or be able to gain this within 3 months( Ability to drive a manual vehicle preferred)§You must be able to pass a full New Zealand Police check§You must have a can do, positive attitude and enjoy helping others achieve their goals.§What's on offer?§Opportunities to build your long-term career in the disability sector§Competitive hourly pay rates from $20.50 to $25.50§Support to achieve Level 2 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (a minimum qualification requirement for a Support Worker)§The opportunity to gain further qualifications by enrolling in the Level 3 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing§Generous long-service leave entitlements and Insurance benefit§A generous insurance package that kicks in after two years of service§Attractive staff discounts including an exclusive eyecare packages through a leading optometrist§Please note as part of our recruitment process, if you are successful you will undertake a video interview with our National Recruitment Team.§IHC Group is committed to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and actively seek a diverse applicant pool. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. We welcome all kinds of diversity and the different perspectives such diversity brings to our work. Applicants must have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50632220.txt	§Community Connector§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Connector§§Advertiser: §The Loft§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§The Loft § §The Loft is a social wellbeing centre comprising of a collaboration of Social Service Agencys based in Eastgate Mall. Our purpose is to enhance outcomes for children, young people families and communities through a co-location and collaboration of social, community and health services.§  §Within The Loft we operate our unique §Social Emergency Response (SER’s) Services.§ This service provides critical and essential assistance to vulnerable, at-risk people and families in crisis.  People who walk into The Loft with the most challenging issues:  family violence, child health and safety, drugs, housing, gambling, financial, employment, alcohol, mental health.  The SER’s service welcomes them, calms them, reduces immediate risks, assesses them, sees them through the crisis, and transfers them successfully to the most appropriate agencies to continue to help them.  §  §KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES§  §The role of a Community Connector will be determined by the needs of the people and whānau they are helping and will include but not be limited to the following activities:§  §Supporting people and whānau § § §Helping people to access online services and to fill out forms and applications § §Assessing need and providing support-related information and connection/referral pathways to advisory services to people and whānau or to people of specialised agencies/managed facilities or targeted people via telephone, face to face or web-based mediums § §Supporting the administration of the service (raising community awareness, relieving duties on our front desk, responding to online, telephone and face to face enquiries etc.) § §Maintaining up to date information on local and regional services and developing an understanding of their functions, how they operate and how they are best engaged § §Provide information as required to inform funding applications and contractual reports§ §Supporting communities § § §Coordinating and facilitating access to services including referring people to appropriate agencies and making appointments with service providers § §Networking with a range of providers in the community to respond to peoples’ unique needs (including attending any network and development meetings to raise awareness of the service) § §Being a conduit between the community and agencies by way of linking people in with a range of services according to their needs § §Supporting other providers and stakeholders § § §Collaborating with local community groups, organisations and government agencies on initiatives and community events § §Coordinating, facilitating, or participating in agency meetings which promote services so that they are encouraged and supported to do their work in ways which best meet peoples’ needs § §Establishing regular liaisons with the community, government agencies, district, and councils, local rūnanga and other service provider networks § §Developing and maintaining stakeholder relationships with a foundational understanding of each stakeholder’s role and operations to enable co-ordination of services provided where appropriate.§ §REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, QUALIFICATIONS AND COMPETENCIES§ § §A friendly, welcoming, and non-judgemental personal style and ability to engage§ §Experience of working directly with adults, young people, and children in a social/community services environment§ §Demonstrable ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external partners§ §Excellent relationship management skills§ §Demonstrated administration and data entry skills§ §Alignment with The Loft’s core values and a commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi§ §For more information please contact Kate O'Grady, Loft Manager on §manager@theloftchristchurch.org.nz§ / §03 741 5187§  §Please note this is a Fixed Term position until June 2022§  §Applications close at 5pm on the 9th October 2020§  §https://www.theloftchristchurch.org.nz/ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Support Workers - RIDSAS Auckland( West Auckland and Albany) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701763.txt	§Support Workers - RIDSAS Auckland( West Auckland and Albany)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Workers - RIDSAS Auckland( West Auckland and Albany)§§Advertiser: §IHC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 depending on qualifications §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§§About IDEA Services - RIDSAS§IDEA Services - RIDSAS provides 24/7 community secure, supervised rehabilitation service that offers clinical support, Life skills programmes with vocational opportunities§IDEA Services is New Zealand's largest provider of services to people with intellectual disabilities and their families. Our services are founded on IHC's utter commitment for people with intellectual disabilities to have a good life and to be valued contributors to and members of their own community. IDEA Services is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the IHC Group is made up of our charitable programmes and three wholly-owned subsidiaries, committed to supporting people with intellectual disabilities to lead satisfying lives in the community and to providing housing and tenancy services to people in need.§IDEA Services is contracted by the Ministry of Health to provide rehabilitation services for people with high and complex needs, who may have had contact with the justice system.§Regional Intellectual Disability Supported Accommodation Service (RIDSAS) is a highly specialised service, delivered by a pool of skilled employees, which provides support for people with an intellectual disability, who have high and complex needs, some of whom are referred under the Intellectual Disability Compulsory Care & Rehabilitation Act (IDCC&R) Act 2003. Click here [link removed] to know more.§This is an exciting opportunity for you to work alongside people who are keen to learn, capable and are strong minded. You will support them to learn and achieve greater independence in their everyday living and seek out opportunities that support their future goals. Services are responsive to individual needs and are rehabilitative in nature.§The support you will be providing includes:§Working in partnership with people to identify and work towards future goals§Supporting therapeutic work§Building effective relationships§Being flexible and responsive to the changing needs of people§Engaging in community opportunities and experiences§Exciting / changeable environment§What we offer§Competitive hourly pay rates from $20.50 to $25.50§Support to achieve Level 2 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (a minimum qualification requirement for a Support Worker)§The opportunity to gain further qualifications by enrolling in the Level 3 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing§Generous long-service leave entitlements and Insurance benefit§An insurance package that kicks in after two years of service§Attractive discounts and exclusive eyecare packages through a leading optometrist§Special discounts through leading technology retailers and fitness centres§A collaborative and inclusive culture with flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing§You must have legal entitlement to live and work in New Zealand (work visa must be valid for at least 10 months), possess a Full NZ driver licence or be able to gain this within 3 months and you must be able to pass satisfactory police vetting check.§The IHC Group is committed to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and actively seek a diverse applicant pool. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. We welcome all kinds of diversity and the different perspectives such diversity brings to our work.§§As part of our current recruitment process, if you are successful you will be asked to attend a video interview with the National Recruitment Team.§If you require assistance or support through the application process, please let us know, so that we can accommodate this.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50697338.txt	§Residential Night Attendant - Casual§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Residential Night Attendant - Casual§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$20.55 - $23.00§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§Are you passionate about working with youth and contributing to a safe community?§Our Youth Justice Residence 'Te Puna Wai ō Tuhinapo' in Christchurch provides a safe, secure and supportive environment where rangatahi (young people) who have offended can make changes and get their lives back on track. In addition to maintaining secure facilities, we aim to help rehabilitate young offenders.§Residential Night Attendants understand that the causes of offending are complex, and that successfully dealing with young offenders, demands action beyond simple punitive measures.§About the role§Our Youth Justice Residence operates as a 24/7 residential facility, Night Attendants work overnight shifts on a 3 week rotating roster within the hours of 10.00pm - 6.30am which will include weekends and public holidays.§Commitment to your hours is vital as the team works as one and all depend on each other, this also helps maintain the wellbeing of yourself and your colleagues. You will provide a safe and secure residence throughout the night which can include CCTV monitoring, and reporting on nightly activities.§Please note: all successful appointees will have a three week full-time induction programme (Monday-Friday) before working in the residence.§About you§We are looking for enthusiastic people that want to be part of a team that is instrumental in turning young lives around. As a member of the youth justice residence team, you are responsible for the safety and well-being of rangatahi. You must have a passion for wanting to make a positive difference in their lives.§To be successful you will need:§a high level of honesty and integrity§a good level of computer literacy§excellent verbal and written communication skills§a full, clean driver licence§a genuine interest in making a positive difference in the lives of young people§understanding and appreciation of all cultures§good initiative and the ability to make good, safe decisions quickly§to meet our pre-employment background and vetting requirements.§Click here to view the role description§§How to apply§Please apply online using the 'apply' button, all applications must be made online. It is important to include a CV and Covering Letter.§ §Internal Oranga Tamariki employees please apply online through your MyHR careers portal at work .§Applications close Wednesday, 21 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50686602.txt	§Phone-Based Loan Worker - Microfinance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Phone-Based Loan Worker - Microfinance§§Advertiser: §Momentum Consulting Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Phone-Based Loan Worker - Microfinance §    §      §Our client, Good Shepherd New Zealand, is a member of a worldwide organisation concerned with creating a more emotionally, economically, and physically safe world for women. Its objective in New Zealand is to support better futures for women, girls and their whanau who are experiencing disadvantage.§A significant area of focus is on supporting the development of financial inclusion and microfinance programmes for New Zealand families living on limited incomes. Believing it is the right of all to have access to fair and affordable credit, Good Shepherd NZ work with key stakeholders including community-based organisations, corporate partners (including two commercial banks providing loan capital) and government to achieve that goal.§Domestic microfinance is becoming more recognised in New Zealand as a fair and safe alternative in the small credit market, and Good Shepherd NZ is currently in the process of expanding its microfinance programmes to meet the need that recognition creates.§About the Role§This is a full-time role and Fixed Term Contract to 30 June 2022, where some flexible work/life balance arrangement may be possible, within a wonderful caring team culture. §Primary areas of responsibility for the Phone-Based Loan Worker -Microfinance are as follows:§        §          §Providing Good Loans (NILS & StepUP) services to individuals & family, handling inquiries and conducting financial conversations with clients which add to their financial capabilities.§          §Undertaking loan interviews with clients, including preparing detailed budgets with the clients which assess the client’s ability to afford loan repayments.§          §Processing loan applications, arranging signing of loan documentation, loan drawdowns and repayments.§          §Supporting clients who have difficulties maintaining their repayments.§          §Delivering services in an empathetic, appropriate and competent manner, ensuring every client is valued and respected.§        § §About You§To perform well in this role, applicants will have:§        §          §Demonstrated experience in either microfinance, lending, financial mentoring and/or social services; and, experience in a community services environment is helpful.§          §The ability to work in a phone and email-based role (not seeing clients face to face), excellent phone manner and listening and questioning skills coupled with the ability to identify client needs and establish effective relationships.§          §A strong aptitude for handling financial matters and a knowledge of money management.§          §Demonstrated understanding of the needs of people on low income and knowledge of people struggling financially.§        §   §Most importantly, you will personally share a like-minded commitment to social justice values and have a great head for numbers, along with an empathetic personal style of communicating, and relish the role of delivering a supportive phone-based client service. Full training will be provided, so if you have a heart for working with the community, we look forward to hearing from you.§Apply now or for more information call §Sharon Ward Duncan on 021 356 777§. § §**CVs preferred in Word format. Search all our roles here: www.momentum.co.nz/your-next-job§Under the provisions of the Privacy Act 1993, you have the right to access and request the correction of information held by us concerning you.  We will retain all information for future vacancies (permanent or contract).  Should you wish Momentum Consulting to delete this information from our database we shall require written notification to do so, subject to any legal obligations that require us to retain such information.§      §      §Sharon Ward Duncan§021 356 777 §    §    §  §§§Our client, Good Shepherd New Zealand, is a member of a worldwide organisation concerned with creating a more emotionally, economically, and physically safe world for women. Its objective in New Zealand is to support better futures for women, girls and their whanau who are experiencing disadvantage.§A significant area of focus is on supporting the development of financial inclusion and microfinance programmes for New Zealand families living on limited incomes. Believing it is the right of all to have access to fair and affordable credit, Good Shepherd NZ work with key stakeholders including community-based organisations, corporate partners (including two commercial banks providing loan capital) and government to achieve that goal.§Domestic microfinance is becoming more recognised in New Zealand as a fair and safe alternative in the small credit market, and Good Shepherd NZ is currently in the process of expanding its microfinance programmes to meet the need that recognition creates.§About the Role§This is a full-time role and Fixed Term Contract to 30 June 2022, where some flexible work/life balance arrangement may be possible, within a wonderful caring team culture. §Primary areas of responsibility for the Phone-Based Loan Worker -Microfinance are as follows:§ § §Providing Good Loans (NILS & StepUP) services to individuals & family, handling inquiries and conducting financial conversations with clients which add to their financial capabilities.§ §Undertaking loan interviews with clients, including preparing detailed budgets with the clients which assess the client’s ability to afford loan repayments.§ §Processing loan applications, arranging signing of loan documentation, loan drawdowns and repayments.§ §Supporting clients who have difficulties maintaining their repayments.§ §Delivering services in an empathetic, appropriate and competent manner, ensuring every client is valued and respected.§ § §About You§To perform well in this role, applicants will have:§ § §Demonstrated experience in either microfinance, lending, financial mentoring and/or social services; and, experience in a community services environment is helpful.§ §The ability to work in a phone and email-based role (not seeing clients face to face), excellent phone manner and listening and questioning skills coupled with the ability to identify client needs and establish effective relationships.§ §A strong aptitude for handling financial matters and a knowledge of money management.§ §Demonstrated understanding of the needs of people on low income and knowledge of people struggling financially.§ §   §Most importantly, you will personally share a like-minded commitment to social justice values and have a great head for numbers, along with an empathetic personal style of communicating, and relish the role of delivering a supportive phone-based client service. Full training will be provided, so if you have a heart for working with the community, we look forward to hearing from you.§Apply now or for more information call §Sharon Ward Duncan on 021 356 777§. § §**CVs preferred in Word format. Search all our roles here: www.momentum.co.nz/your-next-job§Under the provisions of the Privacy Act 1993, you have the right to access and request the correction of information held by us concerning you.  We will retain all information for future vacancies (permanent or contract).  Should you wish Momentum Consulting to delete this information from our database we shall require written notification to do so, subject to any legal obligations that require us to retain such information.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50648150.txt	§Community Support Worker - Addictions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Support Worker - Addictions§§Advertiser: §Whatever It Takes Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Community Support Worker - Addictions§Whatever It Takes Trust (WIT) is a mental health and addiction peer support service in Hawkes Bay. Based in Ahuriri, but working across the Hastings and Napier areas; WIT offers a range of services including community support, residential care, advocacy and day centres for consumers of mental health services. §We require a Community Support Worker - Addictions to join our team to support our client community. A lived experience of addiction and mental health services as a consumer, or family/whanau, would be an advantage. §Position purpose§Provide person centered, flexible community-based supports to our clients - people living with addictions and/or mental illness that promotes recovery and independence. §Provide or access services to our clients who require support in relation to family and whanau, community living, education, employment and self-management of their well-being.§The skills and attributes required include: §You will have you a NZ Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (Social and Community Services) [Level 4] with a strand in Mental Health and Addiction Support or equivalent§Your qualification, experience and interests are focused on Addiction Support§Secondary services experience is desirable;§You will have a good understanding of the Treaty of Waitangi and be culturally safe;§You will be energetic, enthusiastic and have a pro-active and flexible approach;§You will have a full driver’s licence.§You will have a strong alignment to the organisation’s values and mission, and you will care for people and be passionate about supporting WIT clients through recovery to independence;§You will have a natural ability to build relationships, relating to and understanding the needs of your clients;§This is a full-time role between the hours of 8am and 430pm, Monday to Friday. §A job description is available from rachelwilliams@witservices.co.nz [link removed]. §Applications should include a CV and covering letter responding to the skills and attributes required and submitted to rachelwilliams@witservices.co.nz [link removed].§Applications close October 9th at 5pm.§§§§
