jobTitle: Principal Adviser Rehabilitation and Learning Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703908.txt	§Principal Adviser Rehabilitation and Learning§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Adviser Rehabilitation and Learning§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Principal Adviser Rehabilitation and Learning§§Based at Hawkes Bay Regional Prison§Make a difference to people's lives§§ The role of Principal Adviser Rehabilitation and Learning is critical to ensuring the rehabilitation needs of prisoners are being met through appropriate interventions and education.§ §Mō te tūnga | §About the role§§The Principal Adviser, Rehabilitation & Learning is responsible to lead a diverse team focused on the planning and co-ordination of programmes, education and treatment across the site for people in our care. This role would also ensure volunteers are fully supported and integrated into the Corrections environment, and volunteer activities are co-ordinated, both in prison and the community to best meet their needs.§This position is critical to ensuring the rehabilitation needs of people in our care are being met through appropriate interventions and education. This role works closely with the Principal Case Managers to proactively plan activities that meet prisoner needs, work collaboratively with managers and staff (at site and regional level), external providers and contracted services to ensure visibility of activities, delivery of education services and monitor all education, treatment and programmes. It is expected the role, through the monitoring of activities would identify gaps and develop strategies/solutions to address those gaps.§ §Mōu | §About you §§Does the following sound like you?§§Proven experience at management level in a role requiring business planning, staff development, consultation, communication, and relationship management skills§You are an experienced people leader§Understanding of the factors impacting on offender rehabilitation and reintegration, coupled with a sound working knowledge of key agencies, both governmental and non-governmental, in the social/justice sectors.  Ideally you will have worked in these sectors in a management/leadership capacity.§Commitment to developing staff to improve performance, contribute to culture change, and build capability§You have a proven ability to develop and maintain strong working relations with external agencies and stakeholder groups, taking account of their strategic goals, pressures and priorities§Be computer literate  and be able to pick up in-house computer systems§Manage a large workflow and prioritise in an efficient manner§§                                                                                                                                                           §Our people are passionate about what they do, united by our desire to make a positive difference to communities. §The salary band for this position is $77,346 - $90,995. § §§Mō mātou | §About us§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us and is our commitment to improving the oranga and safety of the people, whānau, and that of the communities we serve across the motu. §As a values-led organisation, we use the principles of rangatira (leadership), manaaki (respect), wairua (spirituality), kaitiaki (guardianship) and whānau (relationships) to shape how we work and deliver the outcomes in our strategy - Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5).§It is an exciting time to join us and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§ §Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role. §For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50670382.txt	§Navigator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Navigator§§Advertiser: §Emerge Aotearoa§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Navigator §      §        §          §Our vision is Tautokohia te mana tangata, Realising potential§          §Our purpose is whakapakari ngatahi I te whanau kia puawai te hapori, to strengthen whanau together, so that communities thrive§          §Our organisation offers many development opportunities, with values that define all that we do§        §        §Emerge Aotearoa is a social services organisation providing a range of support services throughout Aotearoa, including mental health, addictions, housing, youth and intellectual disability. At Emerge Aotearoa, we refer to everyone as whānau. Whānau is often translated as 'family', but its meaning is more complex. It includes physical, emotional and spiritual dimensions and is based on whakapapa. Whānau can be multi-layered, flexible and dynamic just like our communities and the services we provide. Whānau for Emerge Aotearoa, is our colleagues, our communities and the people who we support.§        §About the role§        §This role is focused on working with whānau to engage or re-engage them with their community and natural supports. There is a focus on supporting whānau to identify goals, collaborating to produce a personalised plan and enabling Whānau to live the life that they want to. This is a role where you can truly make a positive difference.§        §The service delivery side of this role will require you to work and coordinate with the wider community to support Whānau through their journey, providing a safe environment and supporting them with their goals and daily tasks§        §This is a permanent full-time position, 40 hours per week working Monday to Friday, however from time to time you may be required to work outside of those hours.§        §The role is based in Porirua but covers the Wellington area.§        §Who we're looking for§        §Someone who Inspires hope to encourage others to reach their full potential.§        §You will be positive, flexible, vibrant, confident and passionate about working in our service.§        §You will enjoy working creatively and autonomously, be a problem solver, quick thinker and enjoy connecting with the community. You will need to think on your feet, remain calm under pressure and really encourage our clients along their journey. Be part of a passionate team, and be able to communicate easily with a variety of people.§        §What you need:§        §          §It's desirable that you will have a Level 4 or 5 qualification in Mental Health and Addiction but not essential - however you must be willing to work towards this.§          §It's essential that you have a full New Zealand driver's licence§          §Strong computer skills, a 'can-do' attitude and be able to demonstrate strong personal and professional boundaries§        §        §What's in it for you?§        §          §We're serious about professional development - here at Emerge Aotearoa there is so much opportunity to develop, learn and grow, and we have our own team to help people do just that!§          §Join a great team of people who care about supporting and making a difference in the community§          §You'll be rewarded by helping people to reach their goals - in return we'll also help you to reach your potential§          §Expect to be challenged, developed and excited, both personally and professionally§        §        §How to apply§        §Are you up for a challenge? jobText: TXT/50654629.txt	§Housing First Key Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Housing First Key Worker§§Advertiser: §Whatever It Takes Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Housing First Key Worker§Housing First is a collaborative programme established by Whatever it Takes Trust, and Te Taiwhenua O Heretaunga. Housing First provides access to housing and wrap around supports to people in Hawke’s Bay who have been homeless for more than 12 months.§We are looking for an experienced Key Worker who can join our Housing First team, working alongside the most vulnerable members of our community, and share our passion in ending homelessness. The team assist people into permanent housing and provide ongoing support to participants as they establish themselves. You will work in a team that walks alongside people on their recovery journey as they build a sense of wellbeing and strong positive community connections.§We are ideally looking for someone with experience in social housing and the mental health and addiction sectors. You will be empathetic and thrive working in an environment that serves the homeless with high and complex needs in our community You will have a sound understanding of the Treaty of Waitangi and work well in a culturally diverse environment.§Position purpose§To assist people who have experienced chronic homelessness of more than 12 months into permanent housing and to provide ongoing wraparound support as they establish themselves in permanent housing.§To use your experience and knowledge to walk alongside clients to identify their strengths and work towards their goals§To use your interpersonal skills, patience and empathy to build trusting relationships to support clients into and maintain long term housing.§The skills and attributes required include: §A qualification or experience in one of the following fields; social work, mental health, alcohol and other drugs, counselling, social sciences, community development, sociology, support work, peer or consumer advisor§Cultural competencies with knowledge of tikanga and te reo Māori§Experience with managing a small case load of clients with complex needs§Experience in working alongside people with mental health issues, substance abuse and/or trauma§Knowledge or understanding of motivational interviewing, harm reduction and trauma informed care§A full driver’s licence§Being eligible to work in New Zealand.§Positivity, flexibility, confidence and compassion with a non-judgemental attitude§Resilience, with the ability to work in an environment of chaos or unpredictability§Demonstrated ability to maintain professional integrity and self-care§Excellent interpersonal skills (verbal, written and computer literacy)§This is a full-time role between the hours of 8am and 4.30pm, Monday to Friday. §A job description is available from rachelwilliams@witservices.co.nz [link removed]. §Applications should include a CV and covering letter responding to the skills and attributes required and submitted to rachelwilliams@witservices.co.nz [link removed].§Applications close on October 14 at 5pm.    §§§§

It is people, it is people, it is people.§ §Title: Kaiwhakarite Whakamimiti Hara§Department: Ngā Ratonga Whakamātūtū§•    Permanent role based in Wiri, South Auckland / $51,133pa - $53,575§•    Be part of the close-knit and supportive Reducing Reoffending team  §•    Provide administrative support to the rehabilitative process § §§About You:§You have an eye for detail and adherence to process. You are comfortable with the idea of working in an all-male prison where the men come from all walks of life. §You have well-developed communication skills and the ability to create and nurture effective working relationships with your team and external stakeholders and agencies. You also possess good multi-tasking skills, you are ITC-proficient, and comfortable making recommendations to improve systems and processes as you see them, based on sound logic and reasoned argument.§ §You are innovative, dedicated, and enthusiastic about being a part of a team that makes a difference in the lives of others.  § §About the Role:§Reporting to the Process Manager, you will work as part of a passionate and committed team who support the Case Management function within the prison.  § §Key functions include:§ §Documenting case management information within relevant ICT applications§ §Liaise with various agencies to make AVL bookings § §General office duties including filing, stationery supplies§ §Data entry and data assurance § §Supporting the parole process for prisoners§ §Support managing the victim notification register§ §Supporting the referral and interventions process§ § §To be successful in this role you will have:§ § §A high level of integrity and trust with experience on how to handle sensitive information.§ §Strong interpersonal communication and relationship-building skill.§ §A sound background in administration, customer services and relationship management is preferred.§ §Strong computer skills in a range of software packages including Excel, PowerPoint and Word§ §The ability to innovate and make appropriate recommendations to improve systems and processes § §An understanding of the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and te Tiriti o Waitangi, and be committed to providing for better outcomes for Māori§ § §This is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment as an essential selection component for this role.§ § §About Us§Serco opened Kohuora ASCF in Wiri, South Auckland in 2015, extending its portfolio in Asia Pacific. It is a state of the art facility, operated on behalf of the NZ Department of Corrections.  We provide a safe and secure environment for over 900 male prisoners, with a strategic focus on better outcomes for Māori. §At Serco, you’ll be part of a team of more than 50,000 people delivering essential services on behalf of governments and organisations around the world. We apply world's best practice, insights and technology across six key sectors: Citizen Services, Defence, Healthcare, Immigration, Justice and Transport. But no matter your role or where you’re based, we each share the same goal – to bring service to life to make a positive difference every day. §To learn more please visit www.serco.com/aspac§Join Us:§If you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be considered§for this opportunity, please apply now.§ §Serco values of Trust, Care, Innovation and Pride underpin everything we do. We§are curious, creative and collaborative. Our people help in ways that matter.§ §We are committed to diversity and we encourage people to apply from different§backgrounds including Maori and Pasifika. jobText: TXT/50701814.txt	§Support Workers - RIDSAS Wellington( Porirua and Kapiti)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Workers - RIDSAS Wellington( Porirua and Kapiti)§§Advertiser: §IHC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 depending on qualifications §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§§About IDEA Services - RIDSAS§IDEA Services - RIDSAS provides 24/7 community secure, supervised rehabilitation service that offers clinical support, Life skills programmes with vocational opportunities§IDEA Services is New Zealand's largest provider of services to people with intellectual disabilities and their families. Our services are founded on IHC's utter commitment for people with intellectual disabilities to have a good life and to be valued contributors to and members of their own community. IDEA Services is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the IHC Group is made up of our charitable programmes and three wholly-owned subsidiaries, committed to supporting people with intellectual disabilities to lead satisfying lives in the community and to providing housing and tenancy services to people in need.§IDEA Services is contracted by the Ministry of Health to provide rehabilitation services for people with high and complex needs, who may have had contact with the justice system.§Regional Intellectual Disability Supported Accommodation Service (RIDSAS) is a highly specialised service, delivered by a pool of skilled employees, which provides support for people with an intellectual disability, who have high and complex needs, some of whom are referred under the Intellectual Disability Compulsory Care & Rehabilitation Act (IDCC&R) Act 2003. Click here [link removed] to know more.§This is an exciting opportunity for you to work alongside people who are keen to learn, capable and are strong minded. You will support them to learn and achieve greater independence in their everyday living and seek out opportunities that support their future goals. Services are responsive to individual needs and are rehabilitative in nature.§The support you will be providing includes:§Working in partnership with people to identify and work towards future goals§Supporting therapeutic work§Building effective relationships§Being flexible and responsive to the changing needs of people§Engaging in community opportunities and experiences§Exciting / changeable environment§What we offer§Competitive hourly pay rates from $20.50 to $25.50§Support to achieve Level 2 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (a minimum qualification requirement for a Support Worker)§The opportunity to gain further qualifications by enrolling in the Level 3 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing§Generous long-service leave entitlements and Insurance benefit§An insurance package that kicks in after two years of service§Attractive discounts and exclusive eyecare packages through a leading optometrist§Special discounts through leading technology retailers and fitness centres§A collaborative and inclusive culture with flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing§You must have legal entitlement to live and work in New Zealand (work visa must be valid for at least 10 months), possess a Full NZ driver licence or be able to gain this within 3 months and you must be able to pass satisfactory police vetting check.§The IHC Group is committed to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and actively seek a diverse applicant pool. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. We welcome all kinds of diversity and the different perspectives such diversity brings to our work.§§As part of our current recruitment process, if you are successful you will be asked to attend a video interview with the National Recruitment Team.§If you require assistance or support through the application process, please let us know, so that we can accommodate this.§§§§

jobTitle: Services and Outreach Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50695127.txt	§Services and Outreach Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Services and Outreach Manager§§Advertiser: §NZ AIDS Foundation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Are you a passionate health promotion or service manager and want to help us eliminate new HIV transmissions in Aotearoa by 2025? § §This is a rare opportunity to bring your passion for public health or community service to two leading and well-respected health and community centres that have a strong focus on the health needs of gay and bisexual men. Opportunities like this don’t come around often. § §This is a diverse role working with all facets of health promotion and service delivery. One day you will be designing a new service initiative that makes PrEP or testing easier to access, the next you’ll be overseeing education events that help GPs and other health workers better understand the unique needs of our communities. § §We have a lot of satisfaction doing what we do, and your work here will have a real impact that you can be proud of. § §The New Zealand AIDS Foundation (NZAF) has been at the forefront of the community response to HIV in Aotearoa for more than 30 years, a history we’re very proud of.  § §The Services and Outreach Team contributes to NZAF’s work in the areas of developing individual skills, building the strength of communities, and enhancing the capacity of the health workforce to meet the needs of those we serve. The team achieves this through the provision of HIV and STI testing and support, counselling services, peer-led group programmes and education. We deliver programmes and services from our three offices and we also partner with likeminded organisations to maximise the impact of our work.    § §The Services and Outreach Manager will: § § § §Work in partnership with the Auckland-based Services and Outreach Manager to lead the development and delivery of NZAF services and outreach plans across New Zealand  § § § §Actively guide, support, and develop their teams to ensure team members flourish and work achieves tangible outcomes  § § § §Champion client-centred service/programme design and finding new ways of working to achieve greater impact   § § §Work closely with each other and the General Manager to develop and maintain a range of strategic relationships that support NZAFs services and outreach work § §We’re looking for someone who can demonstrate: § § § §A tertiary qualification in at least one of: Health Promotion, Health or Social Care Management, Population/Public Health, Community Work or Community Development. Equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of a tertiary qualification. § § § §Experience managing staff § § § §Experience developing and managing budgets § § § §Experience managing the delivery of a health service or health promotion programme § § § §Experience working with, understanding of, or commitment to, gay and bisexual men § § § §Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain strategic relationships § § § §Ability to work and communicate effectively with the groups most impacted by HIV in New Zealand. § § § §Self-motivated and able equally as effectively in a team environment or independently. § § § §Ability to prioritise work effectively, manage changing and conflicting demands and expectations. § § § §Professional approach to sexuality and sexual issues. § § §While not essential, it would be beneficial to also be able to demonstrate: § § § §Knowledge of HIV, sexual health issues and specific health issues facing men who have sex with men in New Zealand § § § §Lived experience in one or more of NZAF’s priority populations (men who have sex with men, people living with HIV, Māori, people from high HIV prevalence countries) § § § §Previous experience in HIV prevention work § § § §Knowledge and/or experience of the not-for-profit sector § § §There are many, many benefits to this role, including but not limited to: § § § §Flexible working hours and work-life balance § § § §One week of additional paid employer holidays on top of the minimum four weeks annual leave § § § §An endless supply of condoms § § § §A competitive compensation package with a salary between $86,264 - $95,849 per annum § § § §Get to make a real difference to our community § § §To apply, please send the following to §recruitment@nzaf.org.nz§ by 1pm, Friday 23 October 2020 § § § §Cover letter addressed to Joe Rich § § § §CV § § § §NZAF Application Form § § § §Copy of photo ID § § §For the Job Description and NZAF Application Form please visit our website: https://www.nzaf.org.nz/about-us/job-opportunities/   § §If you have any questions about the position, please contact Joe Rich, General Manager, on joe.rich@nzaf.org.nz  § §The NZAF offers the chance to work in a fast-paced, high performing and driven team, is committed to cultural responsiveness and is an equal opportunities employer. The NZAF serves all people regardless of sexual and gender identity, age, background or religious belief. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's the largest size team you have managed?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50684415.txt	§Service Delivery Manager - Mental Health and Youth Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Service Delivery Manager - Mental Health and Youth Services§§Advertiser: §HealthCare NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§Rewarding salary that is negotiable§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Service Delivery Manager - Mental Health and Youth Services §    §    §      §        §          §Who we are§          §HealthCare NZ provides a wide array of health and human services to people throughout New Zealand. Since 1988 we have been empowering people in need to live independently, safely, and well in their community as well as in specialized treatment settings. We help people gain access to needed services, ensuring they receive vital services, are safe, well-cared for, and live as independently as possible§          §What's the role about?§          §As the Service Delivery Manager - Mental Health and Youth Services, you are responsible for the effective day to day management and co-ordination of the Mental Health and Youth Services based in Christchurch. You will ensure we provide a quality of service for people we support, whilst managing staff through effective leadership and promotion of a supportive, collaborative and positive work environment.§          §What you'll be doing:§          §            §Deliver appropriate quality service, reintegration plans, and support within the requirements of the contractual obligations for the people we support§            §Build and maintain an engaged, cohesive and high performing team across the services you lead§            §Actively manage services to ensure we maintain and grow market share while also retaining current contracts§            §Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, proactively seeking to grow services for the business§            §Ensure the balanced management of funding contracts in your area, to ensure both customer needs and financial requirements are met§            §Apply and implement the Disability and Social Services Strategy to the provision of services that you lead§          §          §We are looking for people with the following skills:§          §            §Solid experience in a service delivery or operations role, preferably within the disability/community services sector§            §A background in Social Work would be highly regarded§            §Previous leadership experience, with a passion for working collaboratively and developing skills in others§            §Financial and budget management experience§            §Excellent interpersonal, communication and influencing skills, and highly developed emotional intelligence§            §An understanding of the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and how these can be applied§          §          §Why us?§          §At Healthcare NZ, we're passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity, reflecting the communities we serve. If you would like to work in a role that is rewarding, challenging, with no two days that are the same, then we would like to hear from you!§          §Mena he tangata ngakaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i nga momo tangata, tena pea, kei konei he turanga mou. Tukua mai to tono ki Healthcare NZ.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Who we are§HealthCare NZ provides a wide array of health and human services to people throughout New Zealand. Since 1988 we have been empowering people in need to live independently, safely, and well in their community as well as in specialized treatment settings. We help people gain access to needed services, ensuring they receive vital services, are safe, well-cared for, and live as independently as possible§What's the role about?§As the Service Delivery Manager - Mental Health and Youth Services, you are responsible for the effective day to day management and co-ordination of the Mental Health and Youth Services based in Christchurch. You will ensure we provide a quality of service for people we support, whilst managing staff through effective leadership and promotion of a supportive, collaborative and positive work environment.§What you'll be doing:§Deliver appropriate quality service, reintegration plans, and support within the requirements of the contractual obligations for the people we support§Build and maintain an engaged, cohesive and high performing team across the services you lead§Actively manage services to ensure we maintain and grow market share while also retaining current contracts§Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, proactively seeking to grow services for the business§Ensure the balanced management of funding contracts in your area, to ensure both customer needs and financial requirements are met§Apply and implement the Disability and Social Services Strategy to the provision of services that you lead§We are looking for people with the following skills:§Solid experience in a service delivery or operations role, preferably within the disability/community services sector§A background in Social Work would be highly regarded§Previous leadership experience, with a passion for working collaboratively and developing skills in others§Financial and budget management experience§Excellent interpersonal, communication and influencing skills, and highly developed emotional intelligence§An understanding of the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and how these can be applied§Why us?§At Healthcare NZ, we're passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity, reflecting the communities we serve. Tukua mai to tono ki Healthcare NZ.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Residential Youth Worker - Casual Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697016.txt	§Residential Youth Worker - Casual§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Residential Youth Worker - Casual§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$20.55 - $23.00§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Other§§§§§§Are you passionate about working with youth and contributing to a safe community§Our Youth Justice Residence 'Te Puna Wai ō Tuhinapo' in Christchurch provides a safe, secure and supportive environment where rangatahi (young people) who have offended can make changes and get their lives back on track. In addition to maintaining secure facilities, we aim to help rehabilitate young offenders.§Residential Youth Workers understand that the causes of offending are complex, and that successfully dealing with young offenders, demands action beyond simple punitive measures.§About the role§Residential Youth Workers provide rangatahi with the confidence and skills to become positive contributors to their whānau and communities.§Guiding a behavioural change is a massive task and means our residential youth workers have many responsibilities, including:§ensuring that a safe and secure environment is maintained for the benefit of the rangatahi, staff and the community§supporting young offenders in their personal growth and rehabilitation with a focus on health, education, training and employment§working with rangatahi to help them build and strengthen relationships with their whānau and communities and encouraging them to act on referrals to services.§About you§We are looking for enthusiastic people that want to be part of a team that is instrumental in turning young lives around. As a member of the youth justice residence team, you are working all day with rangatahi. You must have a passion for wanting to make a positive difference in their lives.§To excel in this role a tertiary qualification in sport, health, education or youth work would be useful but life skills such as carpentry, IT, culture and arts and sport skills are invaluable.§Our residence runs a 24/7 operation with staff working various shift times. The shifts are; morning shift (6.30am-3.00pm) and afternoon shift (1.30pm-10.00pm) which also involves working weekends and public holidays when available on an on-call casual basis.§How to apply§All applications must be made online via the 'apply' button, a copy of your CV and cover letter is required, all applications are subject to police vetting.§Internal applicants please apply online via your myHR login on the careers page. For enquiries or assistance please contact §andrew.howard@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Wednesday, 21 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Resource Mobilisation & Partnership Lead Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696012.txt	§Resource Mobilisation & Partnership Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Resource Mobilisation & Partnership Lead§§Advertiser: §The Fred Hollows Foundation NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§ §Join us and help eliminate avoidable blindness in the Pacific§ §Be part of a great team doing great things§ §Central city location, great culture, health insurance and free gym!§ §Flexible working options§ §The Fred Hollows Foundation NZ carries on the work of the late New Zealander Professor Fred Hollows (1929-1993). We work in the Pacific to restore sight to the needlessly blind and train local eye health specialists to provide eye care services in their own communities. To find out more visit our website: www.hollows.org.nz§ §The role:§ §This key role supports the advancement of our programme activities across the Pacific Region through ensuring effective resource mobilisation and strong, impactful partnerships.§ §The Resource Mobilisation & Partnership Lead plays a key role in the development of resource-based partnerships with institutional donors to support FHFNZ's vital work. Working closely with our teams, partners and key stakeholders, you will lead the process to successfully identify, apply for and capture strategic funding opportunities. You will also play a key role in managing these partnerships moving forwards including leading fulfilment of due diligence, high-quality reporting and ongoing communications and engagement.§ §All of FHFNZ's work is underpinned by strong partnerships. This includes our host governments, key institutions, civil society and the private sector stakeholders. You will play a key role in identifying, fostering, establishing, developing and building strategic partnerships to enhance our impact region-wide. Working closely with colleagues, you will help to establish partnership principles, effective agreements, strong communications and engagement to maintain partnerships that promote synergy and mutual success.§ §Responsibilities include:§ § §Establish effective and clear processes for early capture of opportunities and management of resource mobilisation§ §Develop excellent proposals for resource-based partnerships§ §Cultivate strong donor partnerships by fostering regular communication and meetings§ §Conduct research on changing donor environments and produce strategies for effective influencing of donors§ §Review and complete contracts ensuring compliance with key contractual requirements§ §Collaborate with Relationship Managers on private donor partnerships§ §Work with programme colleagues to ensure successful management of strategic partnerships§ §Skills and experience required:§ § §Minimum five years' experience managing large multiyear grants ideally related to international development or humanitarian programming§ §Knowledge and proven track record of successful working relations with a variety of donors, particularly large institutional donors, multilateral and bilateral aid agencies and large NZ Trusts/Foundations§ §A proven track record in resource mobilisation including the development of high-quality proposals for institutional donors§ §Experience in managing donor requirements and reporting systems§ §Experience and understanding of contracts and agreements including negotiation, drafting and compliance§ §Experience of managing partnerships according to agreed principles and clearly defined objectives§ §Excellent team player with strong leadership, coordination and collaboration skills, and the ability to build rapport and network effectively§ §Familiarity with/experience in working with Pacific communities§ §Strong skills in writing, finance and risk management§ §Ability to work to tight deadlines and time-manage effectively while maintain high-quality outputs§ §For a copy of the Position Description, or if you have any questions about this role, please do not hesitate to contact our friendly recruitment team via email at braine@hollows.nz§ §Applications will close at midnight §Wednesday 21 October§. If you think you are the right person for this role, then please apply now and help us bring an end to avoidable blindness in the Pacific.§ § § §To apply for this job go to: fredhollows.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5238164. § §Applications close 21 October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Practice Leader -Social Work Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685806.txt	§Practice Leader -Social Work§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practice Leader -Social Work§§Advertiser: §Youth Horizons Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$70,000-$85,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Practice Leader-Social Work§E ngā reo, e ngā mana, huri noa I te motu, tēnā koutou katoa.§He turanga tēnei e wātea ana ki roto o Kia Puāwai§We're looking for an experienced and passionate person to lead one of our Foster Care teams based in Auckland. If you are a registered social worker or health professional, have experience leading a clinical team and are looking for a challenging and rewarding career, we'd love to hear from you!§Our Foster Care teams provides care-based services for at-risk young people with severe and complex behavioural problems. The purpose of the role is to increase engagement in education, training or employment. In the near future, as part of your role you will be helping implement an evidence-based model for this service.§As team leader, you will be responsible for ensuring your team delivers effective and timely services for young people in a programme that is proven to work. Your main areas of responsibility will be to, provide clinical supervision and cultivate a supportive and passionate team culture and recruit and train Foster Carers.§About You§Registered health professional under the HPCA Act or Social Work registration§Availability to be on call§Proven experience in leading, managing and supervising a clinical team§Bachelors/Master's degree in psychology, psychotherapy, social work, or other related mental health field§Current full NZ driver's license§Youth Horizons Offers§Fun-loving whanau/family environment.§Career progression opportunities across a national organisation.§Outstanding training and supervision including cultural support and development.§24/7 senior leadership support.§Competitive remuneration (including a vehicle) to match your skills and experience.§Paid birthday leave§About Youth Horizons§Youth Horizons is a specialised non-profit organisation providing therapeutic services for young people who have complex behaviour and/or mental health needs. Our innovative approach combines evidence-based models of practice along with a focus on our core values of Manaakitanga, Wairuatanga, Aroha and Whanaungatanga.§Our National office is in Auckland and we have over 250 staff and caregivers supporting young people and their families and whanau across the North and lower South Islands.§It's an exciting time to join us and you will have the opportunity to make a real impact through your work- so apply now!§If you have any questions regarding the role please contact Paula Norman (Operations Manager Auckland) on 029 771 3834.§To find out more about us, visit§ §www.youthorizons.org.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Support Coordinators - Kahu Service Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50650369.txt	§Support Coordinators - Kahu Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Coordinators - Kahu Service§§Advertiser: §Hohepa Canterbury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 per hour (dependent on quals)§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Our Purpose:§ Our Reason For Being§ §When you work at Hohepa Canterbury, you are part of something very special.  We are a community leader providing services and support for people living with an intellectual disability to live their best lives and find a valued place in our society.§ §Inspired by Dr Rudolf Steiner’s principles of anthroposophy we actively engage with the people we support so to empower them to develop to their fullest potential and lead enriched and meaningful lives in a holistic, supportive environment.§ §We are currently looking for energetic, and proactive Support Coordinators to create a new team.  § §Our Culture:§ What We Care About§ §What matters to us is putting people at the centre of all we do. We show empathy for and respect towards others, we are accountable for delivering outcomes, we go about our work with integrity in all we do, we have courage to do the right thing, for the people we support and ourselves.§ §The Opportunity:§ What This Role's All About§ §Our individualised support services provide dedicated support to people with complex needs so that they can reach their full potential. We are looking to employ someone to support a young person with an intellectual disability. You will be energetic, empathetic and able to work alongside this person focussing on creating a life of rich and diverse experiences while being able to read situations, problem solve and apply boundaries or offer space.  Daily tasks include supporting with daily routines while encouraging independence to develop skills and personal growth. You will have the confidence to support personal cares, cooking, medication administration, and household tasks. You will be passionate about supporting and extending people’s ability to access and be part of their wider community. If you are looking for a new challenge this could be the opportunity for you.§ §You:§ §What Are We Looking For?§ §We are looking for someone who enjoys working with young people. This young person is very social, enjoys wrestling and attends school.  Consistency and routine are important but we also value the possibility for the people we support to have choice and encourage independence. We are looking for someone that can support decision making and help set boundaries with kindness while developing creative strategies to support this. You will be supporting this person to learn and try new things by creating opportunities for this to happen.  Our goal is to support an independent future for this young person, you will be focussed on supporting skill development and personal growth. Experience with working with young people, mental health and/or autism or and understanding of the function of behaviour and replacement behaviours would be advantageous but not essential.§ §Successful applicants are required to have a full drivers licence and the ability to work in New Zealand. KO WAI MĀTOU§  §Te Whānau O Waipareira Trust is an urban Maori-proud community that has been serving the West Auckland community for over 35 years, creating positive outcomes for whānau.  We are one of the largest NGOs in New Zealand, with over 200 staff, with continued growth and expansion. § §  §ABOUT THE ROLE - HE KŌRERO WHĀKAMARAMA MŌ TĒNEI TŪRANGA§  §We are seeking Kaiārahi that will assess the wellbeing of whānau to address immediate health and social needs, plan a way forward and provide free guidance and training for their long-term development.§Where appropriate, develop outcome plans and goals and link whānau to integrated internal and external wrap-around services within the community.§Dependent on your team you may complete a variety of duties which may include customer service, project support, referral management, whānau ora navigation, risk management, reporting & administration.§  §WHAT YOU WILL BRING - jobTitle: Principal Adviser - Rehabilitation and Learning Job in Wellington - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50682093.txt	§Principal Adviser - Rehabilitation and Learning§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Adviser - Rehabilitation and Learning§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Volunteer Coordination & Support§§§§§§ §Principal Adviser Rehabilitation and Learning§§Based at Rimutaka Prison§Make a difference to people's lives§§ §The role of Principal Adviser Rehabilitation and Learning is critical to ensuring the rehabilitation needs of prisoners are being met through appropriate interventions and education.§ §Mō te tūnga | §About the role§§The Principal Adviser, Rehabilitation & Learning is responsible for the planning and co-ordination of programmes, education and treatment across the site for people in our care. This role would also ensure volunteers are fully supported and integrated into the Corrections environment, and volunteer activities are co-ordinated, both in prison and the community to best meet their needs.§This position is critical to ensuring the rehabilitation needs of people in our care are being met through appropriate interventions and education. This role works closely with the Principal Case Managers to proactively plan activities that meet prisoner needs, work collaboratively with managers and staff (at site and regional level) to ensure visibility of activities, delivery of education services and monitor all education, treatment and programmes. It is expected the role, through the monitoring of activities would identify gaps and develop strategies/solutions to address those gaps.§ §Mōu | §About you §§Does the following sound like you?§§Proven experience at management level in a role requiring business planning, staff development, consultation, communication, and relationship management skills§You are an experienced people leader§Understanding of the factors impacting on offender rehabilitation and reintegration, coupled with a sound working knowledge of key agencies, both governmental and non-governmental, in the social/justice sectors.  Ideally you will have worked in these sectors in a management/leadership capacity.§Commitment to developing staff to improve performance, contribute to culture change, and build capability§You have a proven ability to develop and maintain strong working relations with external agencies and stakeholder groups, taking account of their strategic goals, pressures and priorities§Be computer literate  and be able to pick up in-house computer systems§Manage a large workflow and prioritise in an efficient manner§§ §Our people are passionate about what they do, united by our desire to make a positive difference to communities. §The salary band for this position is $77,346 - $90,995.§ §§Mō mātou | §About us§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us and is our commitment to improving the oranga and safety of the people in our care, whānau, and that of the communities we serve across the motu.  As a values-led organisation, we use the principles of rangatira (leadership), manaaki (respect), wairua (spirituality), kaitiaki (guardianship) and whānau (relationships) to inform how we work and deliver the outcomes outlined in our strategy - Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5).§It is an exciting time to join us and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§ §Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role. §For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50647844.txt	§Foster Carers Tauranga/Bay of Plenty§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Foster Carers Tauranga/Bay of Plenty§§Advertiser: §Youth Horizons§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§E nga reo, e nga mana, huri noa I te motu, tena koutou katoa. He turanga tenei e watea ana ki roto o Kia Puawai.§  §We are currently looking for Foster Carers in Tauranga/Bay of Plenty areas to support a critical part of our therapeutic programme and bring about change in a young person’s life. We will provide you with extensive support to implement the programme with a challenging young person, while they live in your home for up to a year. §  §This role would be ideal for you if you:§ § §Have experience in caring for young people as a parent, grandparent or working with youth§ §Are passionate about making a difference in the lives of young people§ §Have no young children living permanently at home§ §Have a spare bedroom§ §Have a full drivers License§ §As a foster carer with Youth Horizons, we will provide you with the following support:§ § §Regular group support sessions with other foster carers§ §Weekly visits and regular phone contact as required§ §24/7 on-call support with our team§ §Respite foster carers to ensure you have valuable days off and holiday breaks§ §Financial payments to cover costs of having a young person living in your home§ §Provide you with comprehensive training including training in the international, evidence-based §Teaching Family Model§ § §  §Contact our team to find out more about this programme proven to help support young people and families in your community. For more information about Youth Horizons, visit: www.youthorizons.org.nz§  §Mena e ngakaunui ana koe ki tenei mahi, whakapamai mo ngetehi atu korero ki raro nei. §  § §  §Contact – Jenna Ormsby – Administrator §§Youth Horizons BOP§§PH §075752639§§Email §§Jenna.ormsby@youthorizons.org.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50589480.txt	§Truancy/Family worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Truancy/Family worker§§Advertiser: §The Bream Bay Community Support Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Salary§§$20 - $26.99 §§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Looking for a rewarding opportunity assisting our young people gaining education? §The Bream Bay Community Support Trust require someone to join their whanau.§You will be working with young people and their families to identify and reduce barriers to people attending school. You will be working closely with the education sector in the Bream Bay area to ensure there is a sound working environment to further motivate our tamariki in gaining education. §This position requires someone who has an enthusiastic approach, who is willing to work in a holistic way and be considerate of cultural requirements in the Bream Bay area. §This exciting role requires your experience and innovation to find what works best for the tamariki and their whanau. This position will be for at least 20 hours per week (during school terms), with the contract being considered for between 6 and 12 months duration. §The Bream Bay Community Support Trust have been in the area for over 25 years offering support for the community. Our main goal is to support the people in the community gaining autonomy, which in turn better enables and motivates whanau to thrive in a safe environment. §It is desirable that you are:§Committed to the community§Ready to lead, contribute, and make a difference§A team player§Open to working outside standard working hours, holidays, weekends§Able to prepare and present accurate and reliable reports§Cultural awareness, understanding and willingness to learn§Good time management and organisational skills§Flexibility to adapt to a multitude of different tasks§Resilience, awareness of own needs, self-care strategies in place§Sense of humour and fun§If you think you have what it takes, please apply by§§sending your CV and Cover Letter outlining your relevant skills and experience.§You must be a New Zealand resident to apply for this position with a valid New Zealand driver’s license.§This position is subject to the requirements of the Vulnerable Children’s Act and therefore robust recruitment checks will be undertaken including full police vetting and reference checks.  §Applications close 9 October at 4.pm. If you are shortlisted, please be prepared for an interview on the week of 19 October. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50684649.txt	§Tupu Aotearoa National Programme Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tupu Aotearoa National Programme Manager§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Employment Services§§§§§§ § §Helping Pacific people find employment, complete further training or study§ §National focus with strong Pacific community connections through leadership § §Enable prosperous Pacific people to thrive and build their resilient communities§ § Our role at the Ministry for Pacific Peoples is to assist Pacific people to achieve sustainable employment and undertake further training to increase their skills and qualifications.   As National Programme Manager for the Tupu Aotearoa programme – you will lead and manage a team of passionate, dedicated Managers partnering with providers to support communities into work or study through engagement and contractual agreements to ensure they bring the best outcomes for our Pacific communities. § § §Exciting time to join us§ § § The Ministry for Pacific Peoples make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into the fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples. We have a key role in developing cross government collaboration and coordination of government’s Pacific investments.§ What you will do in this role is: § §manage the Tupu Aotearoa programme and support your team to manage contracts, including monitoring all associated activities and ensuring all parties meet their obligations§ §initiate new, and ensure existing contracts and memorandum of understandings meet the obligations of all parties§ §guide and support the team to ensure the development and implementation of effective programme delivery is implementation across all areas§ §accountable for managing programme risks, mitigations, and controls§ §take a programme improvement lens to offer effectiveness and efficiency of programme deliverables§ §ensure effective financial management of the programme § §ensuring that the planning, monitoring and reporting process requirements of the programme are met in accordance with agreed timeframes and standards§ §providing timely progress reporting of the programme to the Director, National Programmes and any programme-specific advisory groups§ § § § §What you will bring to the role is§: § §solid working experience within an Education, Business, or community-based sector that had partnerships / commercial agreements§ §experience in financial reporting, contract management and a strong understanding of the employment and education frameworks in New Zealand § §strong experience working with service providers and the management of contracts§ §strong relationships across local, regional Pacific communities demonstrating working connections§ §solid project management / programme management experience and demonstration of working and delivering programmes of work§ §strong people leader experience§ §alignment to our Pacific Aotearoa Lalanga Fou which brings strong values-based focus on culture and growth § §excellent written communication and verbal skills, with the ability to confidently communicate with a variety of audiences.§ § §Working for us§ § § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, flexible working arrangements. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § If you would like more information please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject.  Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required. §  § §Applications close on Sunday 11 October 2020.§ § Please click on the link below to obtain a copy of the position description.§ https://www.mpp.govt.nz/assets/Uploads/National-Programme-Manager-Tupu-Aotearoa-Sept-2020.pdf§  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Team Coach Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50656284.txt	§Team Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Coach§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Summary§Our service is in a state of growth, and so now you will have the chance to develop this already amazing team further. We are now at the stage to be able to recruit a Team Coach for our expanding ‘Real’ community-based youth service in Hamilton. The ideal person will have both experience in leadership, with an understanding of trauma informed care, mental illness and working with youth.§The role is 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday, 8.30am - 5.00pm § §The Role§ §As a Team Coach, you will be part of the local leadership team, attend regular meetings and Team Coach trainings. You will also be part of the rostered after-hours service on a rotating basis.§Skills essential for this role include:§Experience of working with taiohi, and their whanau with an understanding of trauma-informed care.§Great leadership and people skills, you will be a confident communicator with an ability to inspire and motivate.§Experience of working with government organisations including the DHB, Youth Justice, Disability Support Link, and Oranga Tamariki.§Knowledge and understanding of non-government organisations, schools, community health and social services.§Passion about supporting young people to build confidence, resilience and wellbeing.§Coaching and developing teams to be the best they can be.§For this role you will need:§A minimum of a level 4 certificate in mental health or youth work or equivalent.§A current full New Zealand driver’s license. §A current New Zealand first aid certificate or be prepared to obtain one. §An understanding of what you need for your own wellbeing. §Knowledge and understanding of Te Ao Māori, preferably with Te Reo Māori and Tikanga.§Real§ §Our spirit is ‘loving life’ - that’s what we do and what we help young people do.§ §We provide health and wellbeing services for youth aged between 14 and 22. We believe in the importance of community, connection and relationships - and in the ability of young people to shape their own futures. §REAL teams consist of motivated people who live and breathe our purpose, make ordinary things extraordinary and spend their days going above and beyond to help young people to realize their potential. § §Find out more about Real at www.real.org.nz § §The Benefits§ §Here at Pathways we value our employee’s and we like to show how much we value you by offering outstanding benefits. Some of the benefits include providing extra annual leave, income protection insurance, flexible working arrangements, and subsidies for school holiday children’s programmes. Pathways is a supportive work environment where work life balance is encouraged, people are valued, and new solutions are the norm!§Ready to take a closer look at Real? Then apply now.§Closing Date:§ Tuesday 20 October 2020. Please note, this advert may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found prior to the closing date.§Position Description:§ https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Real-Waikato-Mobile-TC-2020.pdf§Contact:§ Tracy Eccleston, Service and Relationship Manager, 027 223 2541§Real is supported by Pathways Health Limited, part of the Wise Group. Pathways are committed to healthy lifestyles and actively support a smoke-free environment.§**All new appointees into Pathways require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§§§§§

jobTitle: Toloa Aotearoa National Programme Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685665.txt	§Toloa Aotearoa National Programme Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Toloa Aotearoa National Programme Manager§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Wellington or Auckland (travel required) - Permanent§ § §Building STEM capability through programmes that help Pacific people find employment, complete further training or study§ §National focus with strong Pacific community connections through leading STEM initiatives§ §Enable prosperous Pacific people to thrive and build their resilient communities§ § Toloa is a programme designed to increase Pacific Peoples access to education, employment and business opportunities in STEM related sectors. Toloa focuses on supporting Pacific Peoples transition into STEM employment and enterprise, encourages young people to pursue studies in STEM subjects, increasing number of Pacific Peoples employed in STEM careers.§  § Toloa programme provides a pathway approach for Pacific communities to participate more in STEM related activities, informs and encourages Pacific young people uptake of STEM subjects and careers, provides tertiary scholarships and internships, and development of a new digital incubator and physical platforms to engage Pacific Peoples in STEM.§  § The Toloa National Programme Manager will support and provide guidance and advice to community groups, to access community funding opportunities available through the Ministry, and other government agencies, to support capability, capacity and governance, developing emerging STEM initiatives to assist Pacific people to achieve sustainable employment As National Programme Manager Toloa programme - you will lead and manage a team of passionate, dedicated Managers partnering with providers to support communities into work or study through engagement and contractual agreements to ensure they bring the best outcomes for our Pacific communities.§  § §Exciting time to join us§  § The Ministry for Pacific Peoples make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into the fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples. We have a key role in developing cross government collaboration and coordination of government's Pacific investments.§  § §What you will do in this role is to:§ § §manage and support the team to ensure the Toloa programme has strong visibility, capacity and support around STEM initiatives to our Pacific communities§ §partner with the Ministry's Policy, Research and Evaluation and Languages team to ensure policy development and influence can be included in STEM related programme initiatives§ §manage contracts, including monitoring all associated activities and ensuring all parties meet their obligations§ §initiate new and ensure existing contracts and memorandum of understandings meet the obligations to increase access to STEM programmes§ §guide and support the team to ensure the development and implementation of effective programme delivery is implemented across all areas§ §accountable for managing programme risks, mitigations, and controls§ §take a programme improvement lens to offer effectiveness and efficiency of programme deliverables§ §ensure effective financial management of the programme§ §ensuring that the planning, monitoring and reporting process requirements of the programme are met in accordance with agreed timeframes and standards§ §providing timely progress reporting of the programme to the Director National Programmes and any programme-specific advisory groups.§ § §What you will bring to the role is:§ § §working experience managing funds across STEM programmes bringing science, technology, engineering and mathematics to a community-based sector through partnerships/commercial agreements§ §strong experience working with service providers and the management of contracts§ §strong understanding of STEM through employment and/or education in New Zealand§ §strong relationships across local, regional Pacific communities demonstrating working connections§ §solid project management/programme management experience and demonstration of working and delivering programmes of work§ §experience in financial reporting and contract management.§ §strong people leader experience§ §alignment to our Pacific Aotearoa Lalanga Fou which brings strong values-based focus on culture and growth§ §excellent written communication and verbal skills, with the ability to confidently communicate with a variety of audiences.§ § §Working for us§  § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § If you would like more information please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject. Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required.§  § §Applications close at 11.59pm on Sunday, 18 October 2020.§ Click on the link below to obtain a copy of the position description.§ https://www.mpp.govt.nz/assets/Uploads/National-Programme-Manager-Tolua-Sept-2020.pdf§  § §All applications must be made through our careers page. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Kaiawhina Hauora - Support Worker Job in Wellington - SEEK
advertiser: What Ever it Takes HBR Ltd

jobText: TXT/50684987.txt	§Kaiawhina Hauora - Support Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaiawhina Hauora - Support Worker§§Advertiser: §What Ever it Takes HBR Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Aim high and make a difference§Rewarding and challenging role§Wellington§Newlands§Upper Hutt§Porirua§Wairarapa§Paraparaumu§§What Ever It Takes is a Kaupapa Māori service provider who apply a comprehensive support structure through their distinctive model to empower; whānau and local communities to act as the facilitator as well as the ‘fixer’ of services. Working within a Kaupapa Māori service is highly desirable; however full training will be provided to successful applicants.§Naturally, you will be passionate; integrity valued and an integral part of the team.  You will be open to adopting our clients values and join their mission to work in partnership with their clients affected by serious injury; and their whānau members to empower them to achieve their unique goals of well-being by providing quality care and support in a safe and nurturing environment on their road to recovery, making life as close to normal as possible.§Due to recent growth, What Ever It Takes are seeking to employ, support, train and retain a unique talent pool of Kaiawhina Hauora (Support Co-ordinator); to provide care and support to their Clients (Traumatic Brain and Spinal Injury) and their whānau.§Kaiawhina Hauora (Support Co-ordinator)§The people you will support require around the clock care (including Attendant care, Home help, Child care, Rehabilitation support, Community connection); so you will be required to work shifts.§Please feel free to register your interest if you:§Are studying towards or possess a relevant qualification in the field of medical, social services or health and disability.§Have experience working within the Health Sector and/or in a similar role would be advantageous.§Have an appreciation of tikanga Māori and the importance of whānau being actively involved in the decisions for their whānau member; on their journey to recovery.§Can demonstrate the ability to develop and establish effective relationships with clinicians, family members and relevant support networks and groups.§Full drivers licence preferred.§Have a clear Ministry of Justice check.§Are able to work rostered shifts (including weekends)§Your passion for breaking down barriers that prevent people from living life to the fullest and inspiring others will be rewarded by training, a competitive hourly rate and the opportunity to work within a supportive, values driven and collaborative team.§This role at times will be both challenging and emotionally charged, so you will need to tap into your kete of resilience and compassion; but in return you will be rewarded with the knowledge you are making a real difference to the lives of clients and their whānau.§If you would like to know more or are interested in applying for this position, please contact Murray Gardiner, General Manager on Ph: §(09) 818 3070§ or 0800 WHATEVER. To apply, please send a detailed cover letter and your updated CV to hr@whateverittakes.co.nz [link removed] §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a support worker?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobTitle: Support Coordinators - Sloss Job in Canterbury - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50657305.txt	§Support Coordinators - Sloss§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Coordinators - Sloss§§Advertiser: §Hohepa Canterbury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$20.50 - $25.50 per hour (dependent on quals)§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Our Purpose:§ Our Reason For Being§  §When you work at Hohepa Canterbury, you are part of something very special.  We are a community leader providing services and support for people living with an intellectual disability based on the anthroposophical principles of Rudolf Steiner. We actively engage with the people we support so to empower them to develop to their fullest potential and lead enriched and meaningful lives in a holistic, supportive environment.§  §Our Culture:§ What We Care About§  §What matters to us is putting people at the centre of all we do. We show empathy for and respect towards others, we are accountable for delivering outcomes, we go about our work with integrity in all we do, we have courage to do the right thing, for the people we support and ourselves.§  §The Opportunity:§ What This Role's All About§  §As a Support Coordinator at Sloss, you will be supporting people who have varying levels of independence.  They all do things in their own time so we are looking for someone that is flexible, patient and understands that plans may change.§  §The people we support have varying levels of need, and daily tasks will include cooking, cleaning, medication administration, stores purchasing, personal cares, as well as facilitating community participation, recreational activities, and supporting people to achieve their goals. You may also provide person-centred support in homes where routine is critical; following details plans to meet the needs of the people.§  §Roster§  §Week 1§  §Sunday: 8am-7pm§  §Monday: 4pm-9.30pm + SO§  §Tuesday: 6.30am - 9am§  §Friday: 4pm-9.30pm + SO§  §Saturday: 4pm-9.30pm + SO§  §Week 2§  §Sunday: 8am-11am§  §Monday: 3.30pm - 7pm§  §Wednesday: 4pm-9.30pm + SO§  §Thursday: 6.30am - 9am§  §You:§ What Are We Looking For?§  §We are a progressive organisation looking for self-motivated, energetic and flexible people with a high level of initiative. We value teamwork and collaboration.§  §You will be a patient person, with confidence and a willingness to learn and continue to develop your skills as a support worker.  We have a variety of part-time & full time positions available where flexibility to be able to work weekends and sleepovers is essential.§  §You will either be experienced Support Worker looking for a change or you are simply looking for a career where your enthusiasm and passion for helping others will make a real difference in people’s lives.§  §Applicants must have a full drivers licence and ability to work in New Zealand.§  §Benefits: §What’s in it for you?§ § §On-going Nationally Accredited Industry training.§ §Hohepa’s positive and progressive team culture§ §A regular roster§ §Flexible working hours§ §Apply now by copying the link below and pasting it into your browser:§  §***PLEASE APPLY VIA THIS LINK OR YOUR APPLICATION MAY BE MISSED***§  §https://hohepacanterbury.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=97§  §Applicants will be progressed as they apply, so if this sounds like you, please apply now! §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a support coordinator?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§
