jobText: TXT/50656756.txt	§Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Housing & Homelessness Services§§§§§§Summary§LinkPeople works with the most vulnerable members of our communities to access permanent, safe and affordable housing and link them to the health and social services they need to live well. As part of the Auckland Housing First Collective, we’re working together with key organisations as part of a community-wide approach to ending homelessness. We are looking for a great people manager with a passion for supporting and leading a dedicated team in a complex environment.§The Role§This role is 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday working from our Auckland office.§This is a people-focused role where your approachability, responsiveness and genuinely caring personality will shine. You’ll work in partnership with other agencies, including our partner organisations in the health and social services space, to develop supportive peer relationships and collaborative service delivery. Our dedicated team will thrive under your leadership, as you harness their talents in linking people to housing and other support options that meet their needs. This may include accessing entitlements, setting up a house and budgeting as well as linking them with supports to maintain their mental wellbeing.§You’ll seek opportunities to engage staff through effective coaching and ongoing development while creating a team culture where achievements are celebrated, and fun occurs spontaneously.§You§We’re looking for an exceptional people leader with a relevant qualification in mental health, leadership or similar preferred. Proven skills and experience in leading successful projects or initiatives preferred. Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite and a full New Zealand driver’s licence is also essential.§The selection criteria for this role will include:§Level 4 MH&A certificate in Health and Wellbeing or equivalent. While it isn’t essential, you might also be a Registered Health Professional with a current registration as an occupational therapist, social worker or nurse with the ability to work within the mental health field§Previous leadership or management experience§An understanding of the mental health system and sector within Auckland and the Waikato region§Established relationships and connections§An understanding of treatment paradigms and mental health interventions§The Benefits§In this role, you can look forward to flexible work arrangements, extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its purpose. Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§Ready to lead the team that’s going to change lives for the better? Then apply now.§Closing Date: Wednesday 14th October 2020.§ Please note this advert may close if a suitable candidate is found prior to the closing date.§Position Description:§ To view a full position description, please copy and paste the following link into your browser - https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Team-leader-PD-2020.pdf§Contact:§ Tom Caukwell - Regional Manager on 027 889 3264 if you have any questions.§For further information, visit our website www.linkpeople.co.nz §§§§

jobText: TXT/50672727.txt	§Regional Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Manager§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Management§§§§§§Summary§With social housing under increasing pressure and public scrutiny, this is a unique opportunity for a strong, savvy and inspirational individual to shine while delivering transformational change. We are seeking an experienced and effective leader in our Waikato and surrounding regions, based out of our Hamilton East office. Reporting directly to the Chief Executive, you will be a key member of our dynamic national executive team. If you’re a confident go-getter that likes to get stuck in and create something magical - we want to hear from you.§This position is Monday to Friday from 8.30am to 5.00pm based in the Hamilton East office, with travel as required.§LinkPeople§At LinkPeople, we believe that housing is a fundamental human right, not a reward. We recognise that housing instability and homelessness are highly complex issues that require a community-wide approach to support people to access and retain housing. LinkPeople links people to healthy and affordable homes, and the right support services for their health and wellbeing needs. We help people to be contributing members of their communities, good tenants and great neighbours.§LinkPeople has an element of complexity given our work spans housing and health sectors.§The Role§We’re after a regional manager who can implement LinkPeople’s priorities, aspirations and strategies, including creating and managing key local relationships to achieve transformational outcomes for the people we work with. You’ll take the lead role in ensuring their region is performing at an optimal level, with staff professional and personal development, engagement and well-being a prime focus.§The regional manager is responsible for operational service delivery and delivering on our contracts including ensuring safe, effective and best practice processes and procedures guide day-to-day service provision.§You will identify relevant opportunities, such as increasing social housing supply, new contracts or partnerships, and will work to ensure that they manage their business to budgetary expectations. Play a key role in contributing to the leadership of LinkPeople by feeding into strategy development at a national level, ensuring a dialogue between national and regional perspectives and enabling consistency of practice across LinkPeople where possible.§You§We’re looking for an exceptional leader with proven experience managing teams and complexity, ideally in the housing sector or health/social services. You’ll have a broad understanding of the Waikato and surrounding areas health sector and social services, in particular the NGO and community sectors. Our ideal candidate will have experience within the DHB and mental health sector.§Implementing and leading successful projects or initiatives is something you’re familiar with, while providing structured management for the team. Developing and sustaining positive relationships is second nature to you.§A clear strategic thinker and creative problem solver, you’ll also be proficient in the Microsoft Office suite and possessing a full New Zealand driver’s licence is also essential.§You’ll also have:§Relevant qualification in health, management or related. Ideally you will have a post graduate qualification in leadership.§Strong written and verbal communication skills§Proven background in effectively building teams and managing staff§Excellent ability to build and maintain strong networks and partnerships within the sector§Proven success with managing and delivering projects, programmes and outcomes§Experience working in mental health, addictions and/or social services, with a particular focus on housing and navigation.§Knowledge of Treaty of Waitangi principles§The Benefits§In this role, you can look forward to flexible work arrangements, extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its’ purpose. Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§Applications close:§ Sunday 25 October 2020. §Please note, this advert may close early if a suitable candidate is found.§Position description:§ please copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/LP-Regional-Manager-October-2020.pdf§Contact:§ Fiona Hamilton, Chief Executive, on 027 559 1100 if you have any questions.§For further information, visit our websites www.linkpeople.co.nz§**All new appointees require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50673020.txt	§Welfare Interviewer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Welfare Interviewer§§Advertiser: §The Salvation Army NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Welfare Interviewer §        §          §Waitakere Central Corps, Henderson, Auckland§          §            §Come and work with the team here at Waitakere Central Corps - The Faith Factory in a role with The Salvation Army in West Auckland - in which you can make a real difference for people who need support§            §The successful applicant will be an integral part of the Faith Factory team. We operate with a strong sense of whanau together as we serve in our community§            §The successful applicant will build strong relationships with the people they work with, the team here, and within the community§            §Use your outstanding social practice and relationship skills as a part of our mission in West Auckland§            §This is 20 hours per week, fixed-term for two years.§          §          §About The Salvation Army§          §The Salvation Army has been transforming lives since 1865. We work in over 130 countries, coordinated by our International Headquarters in London and we are a registered charity under the Charities Act 2005. The Army has over 3,000 officers and employees in New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa and is recognised as a high value employer. The mission of The Salvation Army in New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa is caring for people, transforming lives and reforming society.§          §About Waitakere Central Corps§          §We are The Salvation Army based in Henderson and are a Community Ministries hub for West Auckland. We provide a wide range of services to the community which include our food bank, financial mentoring, social work, rough sleeper outreach, community youth work, community finance, and more.§          §About the role§          §To provide Welfare Assessment for people seeking support from our centre for food parcels and other practical assistance. To welcome people in a warm and engaging manner with a view to providing Manaakitanga to all.§          §Also, to provide internal referrals to other services/programmes at the Waitakere Community Ministries.§          §Person specification§          §The ideal applicant will have:§          §            §effective communication and listening skills§            §a focus on the needs of people§            §relationship building skills§            §a high level of empathy§            §a high level of personal integrity§            §an ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment§            §a proactive (high level of initiative), problem solving attitude§            §the ability to work well within a team and/or alone using appropriate management consultation§            §an eye for detail and ability to meet deadlines.§          §          §Contact information§          §For more information about this role please contact Jason Dilger, Mission Operations Manager by email §jason.dilger@salvationarmy.org.nz§          §Applications§          §To apply please send your cover letter, CV (including referee details) and completed application form to §jason.dilger@salvationarmy.org.nz§          §Our application form can be downloaded and needs to be included as part of your application.§          §https://www.salvationarmy.org.nz/sites/default/files/uploads/§20160808§staff_2form.pdf§          §Applicants for this position will need to have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. All employment offers are subject to the completion of a satisfactory Ministry of Justice clearance/police check §(where applicable).§          §Closing date§          §Applications close 12pm Friday, 16 October 2020.§        §        §        §        §The Salvation Army is a worldwide evangelical Christian church and human service provider. It is committed to caring for people, transforming lives and reforming society - all through the love of God shown in Jesus. The successful applicant should therefore show an ability to identify with the mission and values of The Salvation Army.§      §    §  §§§Waitakere Central Corps, Henderson, Auckland§Come and work with the team here at Waitakere Central Corps - The Faith Factory in a role with The Salvation Army in West Auckland - in which you can make a real difference for people who need support§The successful applicant will be an integral part of the Faith Factory team. We operate with a strong sense of whanau together as we serve in our community§The successful applicant will build strong relationships with the people they work with, the team here, and within the community§Use your outstanding social practice and relationship skills as a part of our mission in West Auckland§This is 20 hours per week, fixed-term for two years.§About The Salvation Army§The Salvation Army has been transforming lives since 1865. We work in over 130 countries, coordinated by our International Headquarters in London and we are a registered charity under the Charities Act 2005. The Army has over 3,000 officers and employees in New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa and is recognised as a high value employer. The mission of The Salvation Army in New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga and Samoa is caring for people, transforming lives and reforming society.§About Waitakere Central Corps§We are The Salvation Army based in Henderson and are a Community Ministries hub for West Auckland. We provide a wide range of services to the community which include our food bank, financial mentoring, social work, rough sleeper outreach, community youth work, community finance, and more.§About the role§To provide Welfare Assessment for people seeking support from our centre for food parcels and other practical assistance. To welcome people in a warm and engaging manner with a view to providing Manaakitanga to all.§Also, to provide internal referrals to other services/programmes at the Waitakere Community Ministries.§Person specification§The ideal applicant will have:§effective communication and listening skills§a focus on the needs of people§relationship building skills§a high level of empathy§a high level of personal integrity§an ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment§a proactive (high level of initiative), problem solving attitude§the ability to work well within a team and/or alone using appropriate management consultation§an eye for detail and ability to meet deadlines.§Contact information§For more information about this role please contact Jason Dilger, Mission Operations Manager by email §jason.dilger@salvationarmy.org.nz§Applications§To apply please send your cover letter, CV (including referee details) and completed application form to §jason.dilger@salvationarmy.org.nz§Our application form can be downloaded and needs to be included as part of your application.§https://www.salvationarmy.org.nz/sites/default/files/uploads/§20160808§staff_2form.pdf§Applicants for this position will need to have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. All employment offers are subject to the completion of a satisfactory Ministry of Justice clearance/police check §(where applicable).§Closing date§Applications close 12pm Friday, 16 October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50643358.txt	§Community Reintegration Professional§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Reintegration Professional§§Advertiser: §Goodwood Park Healthcare Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§The Goodwood Park Healthcare Group is a well-established, innovative, and leading provider of community and residential social services for people who have recently been released from Prison or experience Mental Illness or Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI).  We consistently strive to ensure our clients are receiving services that promote better health, wellbeing and reintegration skills with an emphasis on living the best life possible.§ §With an increasing focus on rehabilitation and reintegration programs for Offenders, Goodwood Park Healthcare Group has a vacancy for a Reintegration Professional in its Out of Gate Service.§ §The Out of the Gate service works with short term offenders due to be released from prison to help them to reintegrate successfully into the community as valued citizens by identifying their needs (e.g. employment, housing, education, health, life skills, social relationships) and supporting them to access the services required to meet those goals.§ §We are looking for Reintegration Professionals across the Waikato and Bay of Plenty area to work with Offenders to develop individual plans that best support their successful reintegration.  These meetings usually take place within the central region prisons (Springhill and Waikeria).§ §The role will involve meeting with Corrections and Probations officers, the Offenders themselves and liaising with external agencies and family/ whānau to develop these plans. There is an expectation that some of the role will also involve directly supporting Ex-Offenders upon their release to follow through on the plan actions.§ §Another aspect of this role is participation in the running of group programmes for offenders within Springhill and Waikeria, to equip them with skills and knowledge to support their successful reintegration into the community after release.§ §To be successful in this role, you will be:§ § §Empathetic and be able to build rapport quickly with people from very diverse backgrounds.§ §Experience in Corrections, addictions, brain injury and mental health with a Level 7 qualification in a related field, for example Social Work, DPAANZ, Mental Health nursing, RN, OT§ §An exceptionally high standard and awareness of professional boundaries and ethics§ §High level of computer literacy§ §Past social integration experience§ §An understanding of the challenges and barriers that ex-Offenders face§ §And understanding of Te Reo Maori me ona Tikanga and be able to reflect this in working with Maori clients/whānau would be beneficial§ §Team oriented and a great communicator§ §A full NZ drivers licence§ §Proficient computer literacy – Microsoft suite§ §NZ residency/valid NZ working visa§ §Part of this role will involve entry to the prison and therefore staff will undergo drivers licence checks, criminal conviction checks and Drug and Alcohol testing procedures.§We are an organisation that values high performance and can offer: § § §Competitive remuneration§ §Unique learning opportunities with a strong emphasis on growing the skill and knowledge base of staff§ §Clinical/Educational leadership§ §Maintenance of your registration§ §Access to professional supervision and peer support§ §If you are interested in this role and the opportunity to grow and be a part of an innovative team, apply now with your CV and cover letter. We look forward to hearing from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§

jobText: TXT/50653626.txt	§Kairaranga ā-whānau - Tāmaki Makaurau (South)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kairaranga ā-whānau - Tāmaki Makaurau (South)§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§Maranga Mai! Marewa Ake!§Kua whakaritengia e te Manatū Oranga Tamariki ō Tāmaki Makaurau tēnei tūranga rangatira. Mēnā kei a koe ngā pukenga, me te ngākaunui mō ēnei momo mahi, me tukua mai tou tono inaianei tonu.§Mō mātou - About us§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:§We value §Whakapapa§We are §Tika§ and §Pono§We respect the §Mana§ of people§We put §Tamariki§ first§We believe §Aroha§ is vital§We recognise that §Oranga§ is a journey§Mō te tūranga - About the role§The wellbeing of tamariki is everyone's responsibility. They deserve to feel safe have their voices heard and be surrounded by loving whānau and community.§We have an exciting new opportunity available across Tāmaki Makaurau for a number of full-time Kairaranga ā-whānau.§The purpose of this role is to promote and support tamariki and rangatahi to be well connected to their whānau, hapū and iwi.§This role works in collaboration with social workers and FGC coordinators to enable good decision making for the safety and wellbeing of tamariki and rangatahi by identifying key people in the wider whānau, hapū and iwi who will actively contribute to the decision making and be part of the plan.§Kairaranga ā-whānau have an important role in supporting Oranga Tamariki in meeting the requirements of section 7AA 2 (b) of the Oranga Tamariki Act.§He Tukuna Mahi - What's on offer?§A positive work environment where you get to directly make a difference to the lives of tamariki and rangatahi in their community§Salary ranging from $63,884 - $89,662 (based on skills and experience)§A challenging, fascinating and rewarding career§On-going training and regular supervision§Mōu - About you§We are looking for candidates who are passionate about making a difference for tamariki Māori. If you demonstrate the following skills/experience, we would love for you to apply:§A sound understanding of the whānau dynamic within Te Ao Māori context§Ability to participate confidently and competently in situations that involve Mātauranga Māori and Te Reo Māori§Leadership skills and the ability to be part of the site's leadership team§The ability to quickly build rapport with whānau, tamariki and rangatahi§The ability to positively engage with whānau and confidently facilitate the hui ā-whānau process with a focus on plans that address the needs and issues of te tamaiti§Skills in whānau search and whakapapa research§Established relationships and networks with mana whenua, whakapapa iwi, marae and wider Māori community§Excellent communication and engagement skills§Ability to meet our pre-employment checks aligning with Children's Act 2014§A full, clean, current driver's licence§If you think you can make a difference, have what it takes and are dedicated to achieving positive change for tamariki, rangatahi and their whānau, then we want to hear from you.§Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to apply§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about the role, please contact us at §naomi.houston@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Tuesday, 13 October but get your application in as soon as possible as we are wanting to move quickly.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50662944.txt	§Community Support Worker - Kapiti§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Support Worker - Kapiti§§Advertiser: §MASH Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§What can we offer you?§  §An excellent working environment· §  §Rewarding work and knowing you have made a positive difference in the lives of the people we support§  §Extensive ongoing training opportunities        §  §Medication Training        §  §First Aid Course and other learning and development opportunities in your chosen field§  §Excellent overtime allowances & a starting rate of a minimum of $20.50 per hour §  §Career growth and advancement§§The Hours:§We have a number of positions available within our Intellectual Disability Team in Paraparaumu.§We currently have full time positions, part time positions, and casual positions available.§PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR AVAILABILITY AND PREFERENCE OF PART TIME (Weekends), FULL TIME (Pool/Reliever), OR CASUAL IN YOUR ATTACHED COVER LETTER§§You will have/be:§  §A desire to learn and grow within your role.§  §Open to completing 'personal cares' such as - assisting with showering, dressing and getting our consumers in and out of bed.§  §Hold a current full drivers licence and have reliable transport§  §Wanting flexibility with hours of work and not interested in a standard nine-to-five.§  §The ability to take pride in a healthy home environment – including cleaning, meal preparation and shopping.·§  §Eligible to work in New Zealand with a minimum of six months on Visa.§  §Caring and Kind in nature with integrity that can provide support to those from all walks of life.§MASH operates throughout the lower North Island in the Wellington, Kapiti, Horowhenua, Palmerston North and Hawkes Bay regions. We are looking for people with a passion to make a difference in our Paraparaumu Team. This team works across residential and vocational services supporting a range of people with differing needs to live as independently as possible in the community. §MASH provides a wide range of support services for people with Mental Health, Intellectual or Physical Disability or Illness, alcohol and addiction and youth respite care. These services are offered either at the residential homes we support, or people who require support in their own homes, or in the community. The roles we have available are supporting those with Intellectual and Physical disabilities within our local community.§MASH Trust’s Physical & Intellectual Disabilities services provide 24 hour a day staffed supported accommodation, located in an urban setting. Staff are highly trained and our consumers range from 15 to 65 years of age.§ §As a Community Support Worker you will be supporting clients by maintaining a high quality of life, a quality home environment, and encouraging full participation in all aspects of community daily life.  §§We believe that:§· §People with disabilities as citizens of New Zealand have the same rights to full community participation. §· §Learning & Development is a lifelong process and that all people possess the ability to learn and develop. §· §Every person can have a valued role in society.§· §Services must be developed to meet the needs of individuals that use them. §· §The needs of people change and services need to be responsive of those changes.§ §For a copy of the Job Description visit §JD-CSW-ID-2019.doc§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Community Activator Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50568533.txt	§Community Activator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Activator§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Red Cross§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Community Activator§§We are seeking to employ a Community Activator to join our energetic Humanitarian Development team.§§About the Role§§The Community Activator will be a key local team member in supporting and growing New Zealand Red Cross humanitarian impact in the community through local partnerships and empowering members and volunteers.§Utilising a proactive community engagement approach, the Community Activator will facilitate and support communities, members and volunteers to develop and/or deliver humanitarian action that is aligned with the mission, strategic priorities and fundamental principles of New Zealand Red Cross. This is an exciting entry level role into the humanitarian sector.§§You will have responsibility for:§§Working with communities to build connectedness and resilience which will enable communities to feel more united and prepared to respond to and recover from disasters and emergencies.§ §Supporting members, volunteers and communities to take leadership in developing local solutions to local needs.§ §Empowering the wider community to become humanitarians in their own backyards to support vulnerable people in Aotearoa.§ §Inspiring young people to undertake humanitarian action.§ §Upholding best practice in child protection and promoting this with our volunteers and members action.§§You will have (some of) these strengths listed below:§§Experience in any combination of the following; volunteer management, community engagement, youth development, disaster risk management, civil defence.§ §Empathy and a strong passion for humanitarian causes.§ §A passion for working with volunteers.§ §People skills: good communication with individuals, groups and people from diverse backgrounds.§ §Relationship building skills (internally and externally).§ §Demonstrated experience of being a “self-starter”, showing initiative, creating opportunities proactively.§ §Understanding and experience of using community engagement approaches in the humanitarian field.§ §Confidence to work respectfully and effectively within multicultural contexts, and include people of all abilities, gender identities and ages.§§About New Zealand Red Cross (NZRC) and our culture:§§We have begun a journey towards delivering stronger community impact with our new 10-year strategy (Strategy 2030). This is your opportunity to contribute to long lasting positive change in New Zealand.§NZRC is a member of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement. Our work is guided by seven fundamental principles; humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality. We play a vital role in providing assistance to vulnerable people in New Zealand and overseas.§We are an organisation with 10,000+ volunteers and 500 plus staff. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce and adhere to best practice equal employment opportunity principles in all aspects of our recruitment and our ways of working.§§Benefits you can expect:§§Full training and ongoing support will be provided including ongoing professional development opportunities§ §Become part of a passionate local team of humanitarians and be supported by your colleagues (staff and volunteer members)§ §Enjoy working for a well-respected humanitarian organisation.§We are looking for someone who will be passionate about working with communities in the wider Northland/Te Taitokerau region. You would be great for this role if you have prior experience in engaging with communities in Northland/Te Taitokerau. If you have an understanding of, and a commitment to Te Ao Māori and experience in engaging with local iwi and tangata whenua you would also be a good fit for this role.§New Zealand Red Cross is an equal opportunities employer and values diversity. We welcome applications from individuals from diverse backgrounds.§If you wish to discuss this opportunity or for further information, please contact Alina Mancini, at New Zealand Red Cross on §Alina.Mancini@redcross.org.nz§ §Download the linked Job Description to find out more information. Click 'Apply' to do this.§Applications close: 5:00 PM on Sunday,4th October 2020.§ §Community Activator JD [link removed]§§§§§

§Community Development§§§§§§The Goodwood Park Healthcare Group is a well-established, innovative, and leading provider of community and residential social services for people who have recently been reintegration skills with an emphasis on living the best life possible.§ §With an increasing focus on rehabilitation and reintegration programs for Offenders, Goodwood Park Healthcare Group has a vacancy for a Reintegration Navigator in its Out of Gate Service.§ §The Out of the Gate service works with short term offenders due to be released from prison to help them to reintegrate successfully into the community as valued citizens by identifying their needs (e.g. employment, housing, education, health, life skills, social relationships) and supporting them to access the services required to meet those goals.§ §We are looking for Reintegration Navigators across the Waikato and Bay of Plenty area to work with Offenders to directly support Ex-Offenders upon their release to follow through jobText: TXT/50653745.txt	§ACTIVE TRANSPORT INNOVATOR§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§ACTIVE TRANSPORT INNOVATOR§§Advertiser: §Sport Southland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Invercargill§§Salary§§$60,000 - $74,999§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Have you ever dreamed of being at the hub of a cycling movement, of marching at the forefront of a walking revolution?§  §We believe Southland is the perfect place to create a new normal where walking, biking and other forms of active transport are truly celebrated.§  §That’s why Sport Southland's Healthy Families Invercargill team has partnered with the Invercargill City and Southland District Councils to create an Active Transport Innovator role who can help bring this vision to life.§  §The Lockdown period saw families reclaiming our streets on foot and by bike and so we know the potential is there.§  §Our ideal candidate will be a collaborator, a persuader, an innovator, a networker, a strategic thinker and a champion, someone capable of working alongside the community and our key decision makers to co-design solutions which will change the way people think about active transport.§  §If you want to make a difference in the community, email your CV, application form and cover letter to §jobs@sportsouthland.co.nz§  §Any queries regarding the position should be made to Sport Southland Healthy Families Invercargill Lead Systems Innovator Stella O'Connor on §032112150§ or §stella.oconnor@sportsouthland.co.nz§  §Applications close Sunday October 12§§§§

jobTitle: WYS Youth Development Worker - Fixed Term Job in Northland - SEEK
xenophobe: You must have the right to work in New Zealand and you will be required to undergo police vetting and additional checks in order to be considered for this position.
jobText: TXT/50633709.txt	§WYS Youth Development Worker - Fixed Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§WYS Youth Development Worker - Fixed Term§§Advertiser: §Whangarei Youth Space§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§An exciting opportunity to bring a fresh approach to the delivery of strengths-based Youth Development Services at Whangarei Youth Space and within our community.§  §If you are an experienced Youth Worker seeking an opportunity to use your skills in new ways including developing others, then this is the role for you.§  §You will be joining the WYS team as we take a fresh approach to working with our taitamariki. You will take responsibility for the development of the youth programmes and activities within our local community alongside one on one mentoring and group development activities.§  §You will be passionate about supporting success for our taitamariki, be creative in finding new ways of engaging youth participation and decision making, have experience in one on one mentoring, leading others and be competent in managing a case load and associated evaluation reporting and case management.§  §About Us§  §Whangarei Youth Space is a ‘one stop shop’ for young people aged 12-24 and is based on youth / adult partnerships. It provides a place to belong, with easy access to support, development opportunities and youth specific health services.§  §Our wraparound model of care allows us to address health needs while also addressing social and developmental issues which are often the underlying determinants of ill health and poor outcomes for young people.  Whangarei Youth Space is a charitable organisation and is unique in that young people are a key part of the service development and leadership, a youth service truly with young people at its core.  Our youth development model emphasises the importance of young people’s connections to their communities, whanau, schools and peers, and has a focus on fostering resilience and supporting young people to make positive decisions.§  § §  §You will:§ § §Be passionate about Young People§ §Have mentoring experience§ §Be committed to a strengths-based approach§ §Have proven ability to build and maintain positive, productive and collaborative working relationships with Young People and stakeholders§ §Be able to work guided by the Code of Ethics for Youth Work in Aotearoa NZ, (Ara Taiohi)§ §Demonstrate commitment to the WYS vision, mission and values§ §Have a full and clean Driver’s License  § § §  §It is desirable that you:§  § § § §Have a good knowledge of local Whangarei/Northland community and services for Youth§ §Hold a professional qualification in Youth Work§ §Have a minimum of 2+ years’ experience in Youth Work and working with Young People§ §Understanding of local tikanga Maori and Te Reo Maori§ §Experience working with Maori communities and individuals§ §Hold a First Aid Certificate.§ § §  § §  §How to apply§  §We're a diverse, friendly and welcoming bunch of people who work hard and are passionate about young people and if you think you have the right stuff we'd love to have you join us.§  § §  §If you think you have what it takes, please apply by§ § §sending us your CV and Cover Letter outlining your relevant skills and experience. § §Applications for this position will be closed on October 8th 2020. If you are shortlisted, you need to be available for interview in §Whangarei on the week of October 12 2020§  §You must be a New Zealand resident to apply for this position with a valid New Zealand driver’s license.§  §This position is subject to the requirements of the Vulnerable Children’s Act and therefore robust recruitment checks will be under taken including full police vetting and reference checks.  §  §For all the details, Position Description please contact Bailey at §bailey@youthspace.co.nz§ or call us on §09 972 7248§. §  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50680835.txt	§Probation Officer - Eastern Bay of Plenty§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Probation Officer - Eastern Bay of Plenty§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Community Development§§§§§§Are you looking for a challenging role that can have a positive impact on your community?§Do you see yourself as a positive role model and passionate about empowering others?§§ §About the role | Mō te tūnga§As a Probation Officer you'll work closely with offenders to make sure they're meeting the conditions of their sentence or order. You'll assess people and their situations to manage risk, set and maintain boundaries and motivate offenders to make positive changes.§You must work with high integrity and will demonstrate the Departmental and Kaupapa Māori values within your work: Wairua, Whānau, Manaaki, Kaitiaki and Rangatira §You'll be someone who relates to people from all different backgrounds and cultures - you'll need resilience, common sense and maturity. You will also have a positive attitude and be motivated to make a difference. You will also be a strong administrator, who is highly organised and who can meet deadlines.§As an employer, the Department of Corrections offers personal and professional development, clear career progression and job security. We embrace diversity and is committed to an inclusive workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and celebrate the collective talent of all employees.§To learn more about this opportunity from one of our current staff, click here:§https://careers.corrections.govt.nz/home/probation-officer/§About you | Mōu§To be successful in this role you will need to be;§§A strong communicator§Computer literate and have strong written skills§Full clean New Zealand Driver Licence§Legal right to work in New Zealand without restriction for a minimum of 24 months§Relevant skills and experience working with a diverse group of people§A passion for helping others and being a positive role model§§You'll have the chance to connect with people, build strong relationships and do something which really makes a difference and improves public safety.§Please note that if you are currently a Probation Officer wishing to move to a different district then you need to submit a transfer request.§ §About us | Mō mātou§ §Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential.  Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities. §It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§ §§§§

The programme be delivered through the Tihei Tamatea network and Central Hawke’s Bay Social Services Forum.§        §About you:§        §You may be coming to the end of your career and looking for opportunities to provide a lasting legacy project to the people of Tamatea or alternatively be looking to take the next step up or move sideways in your career.§        §Already recognised as an emerging leader or rockstar in your related discipline, dealing with complex Whānau matters in a work environment may be new to you, however you’ll be able to utilise your lived experience with Whānau and apply your wide range of post-qualification or work experience to translate challenges into transformational opportunities for Whānau.§        §Described by your peers as confident in the face of adversity, you’ll have examples of the challenges you have faced and will have demonstrated your steadfast resilience through these events.  These examples, along with your unique understandings of the local challenges facing tangata whenua will set you apart from other candidates. §        §Specifically, you will also have:§        §          §Experience dealing with highly complex, challenging You will be part of a team who makes bold and courageous decisions to protect our tamariki and rangatahi. As a Supervisor you will also uphold best practices and adhere to providing the best possible care and delivery of services. You will also need to portray a strong professional ethics and a holistic approach that is client-centered and strengths-based.§With a well-developed leadership skill, you will be supporting the team to work creatively and constructively with our clients and stakeholders to address individual and social needs. Working through complex information to ensure trusted decisions are made will also be part of your responsibilities in which will support our tamariki and rangatahi to reach their best potential.§To be successful in this position, you will need to display a caring, friendly demeanour and be a real team player with an open-minded approach.§Are you a dynamic Practitioner who enjoys coaching and mentoring? jobText: TXT/50709178.txt	§Foster Parents Needed Urgently§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Foster Parents Needed Urgently§§Advertiser: §Wesley Community Action§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Child Welfare, Youth & Family Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Foster Parents Needed Urgently §      §        §          §Full and part-time§          §Wellington wide - (singles/couples) §        §        §We desperately need foster parents who are open to caring for an individual child or young person between the age of 9 and 16 years in your own home either full-time or part-time on the weekends for up to a year, sometimes longer.§        §This is rewarding and very demanding work. Our incredible team of foster parents and social workers support children and young people who do best in one on one intensive foster care. Our young ones have had extensive histories of being in care and bring with them experiences of trauma that has meant life has been very difficult for them and it can mean it is hard for those who care for them. Our team is passionate about the care and protection of children and young people and passionate about the support of our foster parents who welcome those young people into their home. You must genuinely have a heart for this work, as it will be your heart for it that keeps you sustained.§        §You will receive the following:§        §          §Salary, training, and professional supervision§          §24-hour support§          §Regular paid time off§        §        §You will:§        §          §be living in the Wellington region and have stable accommodation and a spare room§          §be free of dependent children living with you§          §have full NZ driver's licence, own car and be a confident driver§          §have a comfortable, clean, and safe home environment§          §have a high standard of personal health and well-being§          §have excellent communication skills§          §be open minded and non judgemental to the differences you might experience.§        §        §For application pack please go to our website www.wesleyca.org.nz or email§        §Isabel Macdonald§        §04 805 0875§        §imacdonald@wesleyca.org.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Full and part-time§Wellington wide - (singles/couples) §We desperately need foster parents who are open to caring for an individual child or young person between the age of 9 and 16 years in your own home either full-time or part-time on the weekends for up to a year, sometimes longer.§This is rewarding and very demanding work. Our incredible team of foster parents and social workers support children and young people who do best in one on one intensive foster care. Our young ones have had extensive histories of being in care and bring with them experiences of trauma that has meant life has been very difficult for them and it can mean it is hard for those who care for them. Our team is passionate about the care and protection of children and young people and passionate about the support of our foster parents who welcome those young people into their home. You must genuinely have a heart for this work, as it will be your heart for it that keeps you sustained.§You will receive the following:§Salary, training, and professional supervision§24-hour support§Regular paid time off§You will:§be living in the Wellington region and have stable accommodation and a spare room§be free of dependent children living with you§have full NZ driver's licence, own car and be a confident driver§have a comfortable, clean, and safe home environment§have a high standard of personal health and well-being§have excellent communication skills§be open minded and non judgemental to the differences you might experience.§For application pack please go to our website www.wesleyca.org.nz or email§Isabel Macdonald§04 805 0875§imacdonald@wesleyca.org.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Support Coordinator - Sloss Service Job in Canterbury - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50709799.txt	§Support Coordinator - Sloss Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Coordinator - Sloss Service§§Advertiser: §Hohepa Canterbury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§Minimum of $20.50 to $25.50 (qualified caregivers)§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Community Services & Development§, §Aged & Disability Support§§§§§§Our Purpose:§ Our Reason For Being§ §When you work at Hohepa Canterbury, you are part of something very special.  We are a community leader providing services and support for people living with an intellectual disability based on the anthroposophical principles of Rudolf Steiner. We actively engage with the people we support so to empower them to develop to their fullest potential and lead enriched and meaningful lives in a holistic, supportive environment.§ §Our Culture:§ What We Care About§ §What matters to us is putting people at the centre of all we do. We show empathy for and respect towards others, we are accountable for delivering outcomes, we go about our work with integrity in all we do, we have courage to do the right thing, for the people we support and ourselves.§ §The Opportunity:§ What This Role's All About§ §As a Support Coordinator at Sloss, you will be supporting people who have varying levels of independence.  They all do things in their own time so we are looking for someone that is flexible, patient and understands that plans may change.§ §The people we support have varying levels of need, and daily tasks will include cooking, cleaning, medication administration, stores purchasing, personal cares, as well as facilitating community participation, recreational activities, and supporting people to achieve their goals. You may also provide person-centred support in homes where routine is critical; following details plans to meet the needs of the people.§ §Roster§ §Week 1§ §Sunday: 8am-7pm§ §Monday: 4pm-9.30pm + SO§ §Tuesday: 6.30am - 9am§ §Friday: 4pm-9.30pm + SO§ §Saturday: 4pm-9.30pm + SO§ §Week 2§ §Sunday: 8am-11am§ §Monday: 3.30pm - 7pm§ §Wednesday: 4pm-9.30pm + SO§ §Thursday: 6.30am - 9am§ §You:§ What Are We Looking For?§ §We are a progressive organisation looking for self-motivated, energetic and flexible people with a high level of initiative. We value teamwork and collaboration.§ §You will be a patient person, with confidence and a willingness to learn and continue to develop your skills as a support worker.  § §You will either be experienced Support Worker looking for a change or you are simply looking for a career where your enthusiasm and passion for helping others will make a real difference in people’s lives.§ §Applicants must have a full drivers licence and ability to work in New Zealand.§ §Benefits: §What’s in it for you?§ § §On-going Nationally Accredited Industry training.§ §Hohepa’s positive and progressive team culture§ §A regular roster§ §Flexible working hours§ §Apply now by copying the link below and pasting it into your browser:§ §***PLEASE APPLY VIA THIS LINK ONLY OR YOUR APPLICATION MAY BE MISSED***§ §https://hohepacanterbury.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=92§ §Applicants will be progressed as they apply, so if this sounds like you, please apply now! §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a support coordinator?§Do have experience working with people with autism spectrum disorder?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Have you completed a qualification in disability?§§§
